I'd go elsewhere for a romantic trip with my husband, but for a casual spot, would certainly do Planet Hollywood.  This place is lacking in GOOD restaurants.  The casino is nice, the mall attached is good.

It was our first time staying here and we will definitely be be back! Front desk was very nice and accommodating, bathroom in suite was huge! Bed was comfy, view was amazing, and many great restaurants around! Highly recommend

I had a one bedroom suite and I was surprised to find a jacuzzi hot tub in my bed room!  It also had a wash\/dryer in the bathroom.  I could have lived there.  The room had a projector screen TV, full kitchen and a pull out couch.  Pretty sweet!

The only draw back is the maze that connects you to Planet hollywood and the miracle mile.  Not fun when you're just trying to find your room and get to bed.

stayed here for 2 nights\/3days..

short a star?---well check-in was a bit of a hassle. I understand there are policies and such that employees go by, but c'mon make people lives easier... Check-in is at 3pm...we arrive earlier than that. The agent was telling us that "our room was READY" but we can't go in yet until 3pm or PAY $30.--but our room was ready. Then he offers us to upgrade our room and avoid the early check-in to a $20\/night (=$40 total) becuase the new upgrade room has a "cool vanity".

sounds much of a rip off. So we can't check-in early even though our room was ready BUT if we upgrade and pay more we can NOW check-in?

other than that crappy rip-off event, our room was nice. It had a huge tub in the middle of the bathroom. Bed was comfy.--room was simple.

The main reason i chose to stay here was because it was connected to the miracle shops. It was also located near a Walgreens and ABC store. Oh and of course Earl's Sandwich!

I play Blackjack and noticed the min. is $15 on most nights..get lucky and find a $10.

Stayed in this hotel for a bachelor's party for one of my buddies.  The hotel and casino is very modern and chic.  We rented out one of their larger suites.  The theme of the suite was Indiana Jones, so it had many props from the movie.  This suite had two large bedrooms, a 180 degree view of the strip, a bar, a large living area with a large plasma tv, surround sound, mp3 player, sofas, a dining area, and a tub in the middle of the living area.  Each of the bedroom has its own plasma tv and bathrooms with soaking tubs.  For renting out the suite for the entire weekend, the hotel gave us two large bottles of liquor - Crown Royal (my fave) and Vodka.  So that suite alone was party central.  The suite is majorly pimped out.  At the casino, they have a place called the Pleasure Pit.  While you're gambling, there are dancers (not strippers) on platforms.  This hotel caters to people younger adults like myself.  That's pretty awesome. They also HAD a club upstairs called Prive.  Not sure what's going on with that now.  I think they were slapped with a liquor fine.  They also have many retail stores there in case you need to do some shopping.  I'm giving this place 3 stars because I forgot my cell phone in the suite and only realized it when I was on the road back home.  I called their lost and found and never received a call back.  At least call me and tell me that they didn't find it.  I'm sure the maids took it and went through my pictures and videos and enjoyed all the nakedness in there.  It was purely my fault and I know it slipped out of my pocket.  That or I left it in one of their gift shop counters as I was paying for my merchandise.  Sucks!  If I found a cell phone, I'd return it to their rightful owner.  Other than that, the hotel is cool and that suite is wickedly awesome!  See you again later this month!

This is a tough review to write, please bear with me. 

The best thing about this hotel is the price considering the location. The actual hotel was a bit mediocre. 

The ambiance in the casino is contemporary and cool. It's pretty dark and noisy, making it feel pretty clubbish. The casino floor is small and a bit cramped, making it a little hard to navigate and enhancing that nightclub feel. 

There are six elevators for each tower. We stayed in the South tower and the elevators moved very VERY fast, as in "hold your drink and run if you want to make it in the door" fast. I would not recommend this hotel for people who have children or wheelchairs in tow. It just doesn't feel safe. For example: we were going down and the doors opened to two gentlemen waiting to get on. The first guy boarded and the doors snapped shut. I mashed the "doors open" button, but the square box of doom just started looming down. Seriously, the doors stay open for about 3-5 seconds. 

We got to our room which was evidently the "Beetlejuice Room". There were pictures of grossed out Michael Keaton hung up in the bedroom and over our soaker tub (pretty sure that's the last thing I want to see while I'm getting undressed. There was a weird table that didn't fit in the room showcasing a book prop that was used in the movie. It was lit up and we couldn't find the off switch so we just had to unplug it. And the piece de resistance was the glove prop from the movie that was mounted on the wall. You know the scene when the scary ass shrimp cocktail hands reach up and grab everyone's faces? Yes. That effing glove was hanging over the bed. I swear this hotel room is where nightmares are born. 

It felt like the room was designed by someone who has never stayed in a hotel before. There were large columns that looked like closets but didn't open. I don't know what their purpose was aside from taking up square footage. The weird book display table forced the armchair to sit at the foot of one of the beds, so we had to climb over the chair and around the lamp to open and close the shade. The shade, by the way, is a roman shade so light does flood in through the sides. If you are one of those weirdos like me who likes it dark when you sleep, you might want to bring a sleep mask. 

The A\/C didn't seem to work very well. We had it set at 68 and still found it warm. 

The room lighting was really lame. There was a task lamp on the desk, a table lamp on the blow table (the too-large round table between the beds, complete with mirrored top), the weak floor lamp that required vaulting over the chair to reach, and the entry light that had maybe a 20 watt bulb in it. We spent a lot of time in the bathroom so that we could see anything. The good thing was that the bathroom was pretty spacious so we both could get ready at the double vanity, despite the tub taking over some of the vanity space.

I should give props to the sound. The room was pretty darn quiet. 

Service was lackluster. Staff avoided eye contact as much as possible, except for the housekeepers, they were nice. Not sure why the would give us fresh towels and leave the used ones, though. Maybe I missed a memo.

And just a heads up: despite paying a resort fee, it'll cost $5 to print a boarding pass. Real classy, PH. 

All in all, would I stay here again? Maybe, because the location is really convenient. It wasn't horrible... just disappointing for a newish hotel at the heart of the Strip.

I love Planet Hollywood the casino is 5 stars and the restaurants are great.  Good location on the strip close to everything.  The pool is good but not great like Ceasars  or Rio, but still nice.  The rooms are decorated nicely and overall I love this place.

Stayed here in June 2007. The renovations are nice but I'm not really a fan of the logo or the concept. Don't really get what the identity or message of this place, if that makes sense. 

The rooms are still the same size and quality. I got upgraded to the larger room, deluxe I think, which is always nice (always ask). They changed the shampoo\/soap\/etc with the new theme and that's a GREAT thing. No more funky, spicy shampoo.

Feels like the staff is better too. Hopefully being more formally part of the Starwood family will have a positive impact on service, even if the personnel stays the same. Their service was average at best before the conversion. 

The new 24 hour restaurant called the Dailies looks much better but the breakfast was horrible. They found a way to screw up eggs scrabled with some veggies. The sausage tasted like it was straight from the microwave. Service was pretty darn slow too. Pass on breakfast here.

I like other hotels in Las Vegas much better, but the price is right and you get Starwood points.

I would have likely given them 5 stars if I didn't loose so much money.  I stayed next door and found myself hanging at Planet.
Spacious casino, friendly staff
full but not packed so you can move around
a wide variety of games and many places to eat.

YOU DO NOT WANT TO STAY HERE!! Stayed here in December 2016 with 2 friends. We woke up in the morning to find our wallets that were locked in the safe, empty in the bathroom! Close to $2000 stolen. The scary part is not knowing when someone was in our room. Important for you to know there are no cameras in the hallways. Planet Hollywood hires an outside company to do an investigation and of course they come back to say there is no evidence of wrong doing on Planet Hollywood's part. They will not share any details of the investigation either. It is absolutely disgusting. You are not safe here. There are so many other hotels to choose from. I have read other review on line of break-ins, one where the guest was in the room! They are so flippant about the incident because they know you will not be able to prove anything without an attorney. Very disturbing and scary! I used to love staying here. No more!

So this was probably the worst hotel room at this price level I've ever had. Period. 

I've booked fairly last minute (a day ahead) to spend a weekend with friends in Vegas and PH was the only available hotel close to my friends with a reasonable price (~$100). When I checked in, I ended up with a room on the 22nd floor that looked okay at first glance. Just super dark. Minutes later I knew why: half the lights weren't working anymore. The dresser door was partly unhinged and was missing some of its doors altogether. 

Unable to reach the front desk after spending 15 minutes on the phone, I gave up, telling myself it's just for sleeping and showers, it'll do. 
When I've started filling the bathtub, you could tell it wasn't cleaned in a while. Dust and all kinds of things started floating as the water rushed in. Before it was too dark to see it. 

Worst of all was the so called resort fee. Wifi was really bad and the pools were closed for winter. Yet they keep charging $32 per night even though. 

Never again!!

Literally am staying here currently and we have NO WATER. No water is running in the sink, shower or anything. Never stay here. We haven't gotten any explanation and trying to get one takes 20 minutes. Just... Stay away.

Room Review is for the suite (it's a suite life). :) 

The room was a decent size. Bed was comfy. The purple bath towels...that was interesting. :) I guess it worked with their old theme of Aladdin (former hotel name). My little one was a fan of the round bathtub with a nice view of the city. Bath products were decent, toilet paper was soft (hey that's important too!). Two flat screen panels, one for the sitting area and one for the bedroom. 

And...here's one for the boys: the "Pleasure Zone." 
When you gamble at night (we were there on weekend), there's an area call "pleasure zone." Basically, they have hot dealers practically in bathing suites with nice curves trying to distract you from focusing (and hence more money for them). They also have poles and dancers (obviously dressed for the occasion) dancing in the area. Very smart strategy, isn't it? So, you weigh what's more fun, gambling with pole dancers, or going to a strip club and paying $500-$1000 but being about to touch them. Personally, I don't get distracted so it has no impact on me. I feel sorry for the boys who lose as a result of losing their concentration, but I suppose to some it's worth it. Suckers... :) 

Oh, and their promotion of getting a free bottle of alcohol per visit was nice. They have a quite a few choices--tequila, vodka, bailey, champagne...if you want to go for the most expensive it's Sky Vodka (i'm not a fan). You also get $25 matching table play, which contributed to my winning. All included as part of a $69 room! 

Only negative is parking---unless you valet (which I find hard to trust w\/ my car)...you walk a mile from the parking lot to get to your room! Good exercise I suppose.

My husband and I stayed at Planet Hollywood in early Feb 2015. On the last night of the trip, we came back to find that the deadbolt of the door was out, cracking the door open slightly. This took us by surprise as we know the door closed behind us when leaving that evening (it would take a concentrated effort to turn the deadbolt open before leaving the room which we know neither of us did). We found that strange and then as we entered the room, we checked the safe and found that $600 of cash was stolen. We then realized that my entire backpack was taken (which had a work laptop in it along with a tablet ($2500 value in total) along with my husband's watch that was left on the bathroom counter ($150 value). We contacted security immediately and after 10 minutes of waiting and no one showing up, we called again. 10 minutes later - still no one showed up. Called again and expressed our urgency and finally 5 minutes after that, someone showed up. They had us fill out a report and told us they can check on if anyone entered the room right away. They checked that night and the two security officers argued in front of us whether or not they could tell us the results of that report. They end up telling us the results which was that no one had been in there and we must have left the door open behind us and that they will send the report to Risk Management and we can call back in 5 days to get the results of the report. I call back within 5 days - no answer so I leave a message. A few days after that I get a call from a 3rd party who was investigating the matter telling me that they are still looking into it. In the meantime, I called Planet Hollywood's Risk Management Office several times (4 to be exact) - still no one answers and I leave a message every time but no one ever calls me back. Call the third party to get a status on my report and he tells me that they found Planet Hollywood did not demonstrate gross negligence so there is nothing they can do. What truly disappoints me throughout this whole experience is that Planet Hollywood never once spoke to me about this matter or offered up any type of apology or comp (they could have at least comped one night stay or provided a free meal or something to show that they cared and were sorry about the incident - minimal cost to them that would go a long way in making this experience feel less terrible to the customer). A few things that make me terribly unsettled with this incident: 1.) I have read very similar events happening on other reviews which feels like this may be a trend at this hotel and Planet Hollywood seems to be doing nothing about it. Cameras are only in the elevator banks on floors and due to the number of stories I am hearing from others with this same issue, I cannot believe they do not increase security (perhaps its because this is an inside job??) 2.) Neither Planet Hollywood nor this "third party" (which by the way, is just a firm who works for Planet Hollywood so if they are hired by Planet Hollywood how are they independent and looking out for my interests at all? Answer is they are not. They are there to help out Planet Hollywood) ever explained to me how someone was able to enter my room. They say no one had entered with a key based on their testing (which they could not show me a copy of the report so how am I to believe that?) but they also say the door was functioning properly and closing behind us properly. We 100% know we did not turn that deadbolt prior to leaving. This baffles me. 3.) Planet Hollywood was not very supportive of us calling the Las Vegas police about it. We did end up doing that and the police had us come into the station to file a report as they do not come to the scene for these issues. Speaking the police, it sounds like this is not uncommon for Planet Hollywood.

Overall - awful experience here. Even if I remove this entire incident I still would not recommend staying here. Rooms are average at best, the casinos and bars are nothing to write home about and the customer service is clearly sub-par.

Felt the need to write this review so that you don't go through the same thing. If I read this review prior to staying there, I would absolutely not stay at Planet Hollywood. Its one thing if its an isolated incident but I have read on the internet this EXACT same fact pattern by 3 or 4 other hotel guests. Don't stay here if you want to feel like you personal items are secure. If you do stay here, assume you will be robbed and don't bring anything of value with you.

Stayed at this hotel last year and it was amazing. The hotel is super lively and has a very youthful crowd. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking to stay at a clean, lively, and attractive hotel.

This is an easy choice for our group when we go to Vegas. Central location, a wide range of food choices and shopping. A fun poker room with good perks. Plenty of other gambling tables. Evening entertainment while you're gambling. Decent rates are available even on some weekends. All this adds up to a place where nearly everyone is happy.

I've stayed at Paris, Encore, Imperial Palace, and a few timeshares  called the Marriot and Jockey Club.

Planet Hollywood is one of the better locations to stay due to it proximity on the strip alone! 

I've received countless offers throughout the new year giving me no reason that I should not visit Vegas, besides that I'd gamble hard working money away.

Great deal on the room (if you want to know prices PM me) and we got upgraded for free to a strip view room! GREAT view, which included full view of the new city center and a partial view of the Bellagio fountain show (boyfriends personal fave). We also checked in early.

When we got upgraded, the lady asked us if it would be a problem if the room was near the elevator. No, no that would not be a problem at all. If anything, yes please! Perks to being near the elevator, only one neighboring room and well...close to the elevator! We were room 3617 just in case you're wondering. Also the 'Dragnet' room. I have no idea what show\/movie that was, but you'll have Dan Akroyd and Tom Hanks watch over you as you sleep and bathe. 

The first thing I do when I check into a hotel room...look at the vanity set up. Often hotels will have attached mirrors to the wall or have bad lighting situations, BUT they had a huge makeup mirror that wasn't glued down! I moved it on over near the window to get some natural lighting, +++!!

On top of that, the window had a nice little seating area where you could chill!

Closet space was good (his and hers), television was big, bed was comfy, but we had to ask for more pillows since they were lacking in fluff.

Bathtub was nice and BIG, another +, but the shower was kind of small. The toilet was separated from the rest of the bathroom by a door. The bathroom also had double doors for the entrance...kind of weird....I could do without that. No locks for the double door.

We did run into some troubles with the plumbing. The sinks stopper was stuck, so they sent someone over with a quickness to repair that for us. When I would drain the tub, the sink bubbled up. Kinda gross. (-)

The pool is small, but nice. There's also a hot tub! The layout is kind of wack...the pool is located on the 6th floor. You have to get to the pool early if you want good sunbathing seats actually NEXT to the pool...I know, kind of weird huh? They also have misting seats and cabanas up for renting...but they're ghetto. Haha

Anyways, I would recommend staying here! If anything, for the mere location and the fact that Planet Hollywood houses Earl's Sandwiches and has 5 dollar roulette tables on the weeknights. Also a Sephora (in case you forget any makeup) and an Urban Outiftters (in case you want to pick up a big floppy hat for sun bathing).

Make sure to stop by the customer service booth in the mall to get the coupon book! Oh and they put magazines in the room for you to read! I sure love me some celebrity gossip!


--On a sidenote, on the Mezzanine level they were having an auction for a lot of Michael Jackson's belongings (and others such as Anna Nicole Smith and Cher), they allowed us to look and photograph things. They said not to touch, but I touched. I touched Michael Jackson's couch! Ahhh!!

I stayed at PH my last evening in Vegas when I traveled there 6\/19-6\/24.
I booked a room using my mileage from United Milepage Plus Card.
I accidentally booked smoking and the room smelled horrible.

I went down to switch to a non-smoking room on a different floor than the pool (the smoking room was on the 6th floor). I did like that their pool didn't close until 8pm as the pool at the palms place closed at 6.

The casino was very lively lots of things to do, they have Gordon Ramsey's Burgr bar.
I ate at the Spice Market Buffet Friday afternoon and they did have a lot of selection and there wasn't really a wait during lunch time. I love the fried fish and chicken curry dishes. Their desserts were also amazing tons of selection. They had a pistachio lime or some flavor macaroon that was to die for. I ate 3!
I was there for ICSC.  I had my whole office stay there.  It was very convenient and the service was good.  I would definitely recommend it for the price.

The old Aladdin revamped! We stayed in the Resort Suite w\/ a Jack Nicholson theme. Large enough to room 5 girls - great view of the Bellagio fountains right below, HUGE bathroom, clean, and friendly front desk staff! Conveniently connected to the miracle mile shops. I usually stay at the Venetian but this place is great for those on a budget -. inexpensive room rates if you're a player\/AAA member.

I stayed here over Labor Day Weekend. The price was very reasonable, but I was not happy with the room at all.  My friend and I checked in after we got back from the Dayclub around 6pm, so there should be no reason why the room would be dirty because housekeeping should of tidied up the place hours ago. When we walked in we were greeted by hot cheetos on the floor... and some trash leftover from the party from last night. OVERALL, I WAS NOT A HAPPY CAMPER !
Great central strip location. Fun, young hotel\/casino with modern amenities. I've stayed twice and I will stay again.
Everything was smooth sailing at this hotel. Hotel staff were extremely accommodating and were really friendly. Rooms were clean and beds were extremely comfortable. Will be back soon!
Nice staff. Great restaurants and shopping. Nice casino. Decent rates.

Not impressed with the rooms compared to all the other hotels I've stayed at in Vegas. Unflattering and boring lobby and no fridges or mini bar in any of the rooms. The rooms looked far bigger online than they do in person and the the decor is old. Would not stay here again. The Window in the room is tiny. Bring on Encore or Bellagio any day.

I was attending the Britney Spears concert & chose to stay at PH to make my commute to the venue easier. Valet parking was a breeze & complimentary. Check in had a very long line which was irritating. They had the slowest elevators ever. The rooms were very basic and very out dated. No fridge, no radio. And if you don't get a "strip view" you'll be staring at a ugly industrial view of the back of the hotel. We were walking distance to everything surrounding us which was nice. But the overall vibe was eh. It is not the place to stay if you are looking for luxury. The crowd of people staying here were not attractive nor classy at all. However Britney was amazing!

What happened to "What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas"? Apparently a bunch of snitches work at this Hotel... Johnny Manziel isn't even my QB. I will never stay at this hotel again!!! Apparently their guests privacy means nothing. I may consider returning if those employees get fired!!!

Pros:
-Affordable price
-Convenient location on the strip
-Lots of places to eat and shop at Miracle Mile Shops. There are a lot of affordable food options here...Pin-Up Pizza, Earl of Sandwich, Pink's, La Salsa Cantina (breakfast).
-Free wifi (only on two devices)

Cons:
-Self service parking. It is SO far away from the rooms. Way too long of a walk, especially when you are carrying a bunch of bags full of alcohol, water, shoes, etc. Do valet parking instead. Apparently it's free.
-The line to check in was ridiculously long. There should have been more than 3 people working at the front desk on Thanksgiving.
-Pillows are extremely uncomfortable.
-Towels are really thin and not very soft.

One other thing. We were walking back to the elevators to get to our room around 2am. There was a guy completely passed out, face planted into the floor in the corner. A staff member walked right past him and didn't do anything! He didn't call anyone to help the guy out. He didn't try to wake him up. Horrible! I walked to the lobby and made sure one of the people at the front desk called security. I understand that I'm sure they see this kind of thing a lot with people being drunk and all that. But come on, help the guy out. He's obviously wasted. Get him back to his room. 

I think I would try a different hotel next time I'm in Vegas.

Perfect resort for the average crew of twenty-somethings. I was here for a bachelorette party of ten girls and enjoyed my stay.

1. Fresh, young, hip decor. Lots of pinks, purples, and metallics. 

2. "Eh" about the pool. Too chilly for my taste. And the lounge chairs suck. They got the cheap plastic ones. And the towels are kind of a ratty faded purple with no more fluff to them.

3. Spacy front-desk guy. I booked the hotel online and they somehow screwed up my reservation. I got two rooms and assumed they'd be together, as they were booked together. The guy at the check-in desk somehow forgot that I got two rooms and only checked me in for one. I realized this on the way to the elevators to go up. So I trekked it back to the desk, interrupted his conversation with the next customer (rude, I know, but I meant business), and he tried to fix our reservation. Unfortunately they didn't have rooms next to each other, so we had them on different floors. Oh well.

4. Average room service. They don't give you more shampoo\/conditioner\/toiletries. I guess it's good to be "green".  And no coffee maker! What the?! This is Vegas!

I lost a ton of money here, but that is gambling for you.  I am here to do a review of the basketball hall of fame. For $18.00 it is a big rip off and can go through it within an hour or so easily and that is if you take your time. It is an exhibit full of showing the history of college\/pro basketball behind a huge curtain. You can do clips and memorable moments. They always tend to show the UCLA versus Princeton upset.  Then you can shoot as much as they want and some highlight videos. They have some huge cardboard cut outs as well.

I recently stayed at the Planet Hollywood.  The room I got on the 20th floor was quiet spacious.     The room featured a 40 inch plasma tv, a huge bathroom with a mini jacuzzi sized bathtub.    One soak into the bathtub, can relieve any of the stressed of life.

The room is better then most 4 star hotels.    The beds were very comfortable, and the view of the city landscape was beautiful  .

I must say this is the worst experience I've ever had at Planet Hollywood. So bad that it should be getting a negative 5 review. My friend and I stayed here from 7\/14 and checked out on 7\/16. On Saturday morning 7\/15 my friend and I got back to our room around 4am. We closed our door put our ID, debit card, and room key on the table. We also put our phones charging next to us on the night stand. I get a call from my friend who was staying down the hall on our room phone around 9am. My friend said that she tried calling both our phone and they were dead. To my surprise I look over and my phone wasn't on the nightstand. My friend who shared a room with me woke up and realized her phone wasn't there either. We tore apart the room and realized that our ID's and debit cards were missing also. My other friend ran over and we realized this wasn't a prank. We were literally shaking at the idea that someone had come in to our room while we were SLEEPING and took our things that were right next to us on the night stand. We called hotel security and they came upstairs to write a report. They seemed so nonchalant about the whole situation and was at first trying to make it seem like we were drunk and misplaced it when we came in. We had to repeat our story a million times. Then they finally say we can write a report with their security but since it was a "non emergency situation" we would have to file separately with the police and drive ourselves down there. I was so freaked out knowing that someone had come into the room and the security guy was seriously training a new guy on their procedures -_-. The security guy said after filling out the report that we weren't the only ones who are filling out reports and that others are going through what we are! I was livid. I kept asking what about your cameras and these guys say they don't have any in the hallways. The only cameras were near the elevators. Seriously ? If someone is going to steal our shit they wouldn't take the elevators if they know there are cameras there! So anyways we had our rooms switched and some guy comes to deliver the room key. As I am walking back in the room I notice the room number wasn't written with our new keys. I quickly walk back out and call for the guy to come back. I asked him what room number is this and he gives me a room number and says he's "99% sure that's what it is." I asked him to verify it please so we don't get stuck in the halls for getting wrong information of our room number. He grabs a piece of paper that was in the trash and looks at it and goes "oh it's so and so room number." I looked at him like are you kidding me you almost sent us up to the wrong room. I called the front desk asked if we will get comp'd for anything and they said they can't do anything and that it's up to the security company to see if we get anything back. I have never been so annoyed in my life. On top of it we waited around for the security guys to come back and give us an update since they said they would be back in an hour and they never came back. Of course we call the number they gave us had an automated message saying that their offices aren't open until MONDAY! SERIOUSLY!? I will NEVER recommend anyone ever staying here. This is the worst hotel I have everrrrr beeen to! People breaking into our rooms while we are sleeping and not even getting the type of service we deserve. We called the offices today on Monday and they are telling us they need more time. What a JOKE! STAY AWAY FROM PLANET HOLLYWOOD!

Nice, clean rooms. Friendly staff. We got a room with the fountain view and it was such a beautiful view in the daytime and night. I could see the Bellagio fountains from our room every night. I loved the casino floor in the hotel. It was very well designed and a very inviting environment. At night they had dancers at the roulette and black jack tables. I got to see Britney Spears' Piece of Me show inside the Planet Hollywood Axis theater as well. They have plenty of restaurants inside the hotel and a mall on the casino floor. I highly recommend this place!
The best atmosphere for gambling in Las Vegas! !  The Pleasure Pit is the best and has all the fun games.  I really like Criss Cross Poker which isn't at very many casinos yet.  They also have War!!

We had a great time here.  Were only here one night but our room was great and so was the price.  I really like the vibe in this casino; however, only thing I can say kind of negative is I just can't entertain myself in it quite as well as some of the other casinos.  But our room was very clean AND we got a free bottle of liquor when we checked in.  They gave us a little ticket to take to the gift shop for it, we were expecting a small little bottle but it was actually a full sized bottle.  YAY!  We tried their breakfast buffet the day we checked out and it was GREAT too.  They had given us a $5 off coupon as well when we checked in, so for the two of us it was like $20.

we booked on Hotels.com and this year they made me pay another mandatory $35 for EVERY day of our visit just for phone and internet! Even though i didn't want either one! I called room service for silverware because they didn't bring any with my meal and they said they would have to charge me $8.50 just to bring me silverware for my meal! The room was okay, but no extra blankets or pillows, and getting anything takes forever. the room wasn't clean, dirty and grimy. Some might mind this...our room smelled like weed, don't know who was smoking it, but i would have believed they were in our room because the smell was so strong.

This place is great!  I still see remnants of the old Aladdin casino... maybe they're not done remodeling yet... but it still rocks!  I love the Miracle Mile shops.  Just about anything you need, you can find there.

They also have the Spice Market Buffet, only the best buffet in Las Vegas!  

I played a bit of craps here, and I really enjoyed myself.  The table was hot, and the dealers still took the time to help me out.  One dealer in particular, James, kept me smiling the whoe time.  I was teaching my friends how to play, and James kept chiming in and filling in the gaps when I didn't know why I was betting a particular way.

I think I'm going to stay here on my next excursion to Vegas....

I am so disappointed with this hotel. I booked under Expedia for Labor Day. I paid with my credit card. There was an error with the name in reservation showing under my sisters name. We always travel together and we each have an Expedia account. Many times I. Ok our family trips for us . I didn't catch I booked under Expedia account not mine but DID use my credit card. The desk manager TJ couldn't have been less empathetic or customer service or solution oriented. Although he insisted he had to follow rules and policy of the hotel it was the lack of empathy and condescending attitude which was really disappointing. Hotels always go above and beyond to correct issues. Unfortunately Planet Hollywood and its management team seem not to understand this. I was turned away with my luggage. Expedia representative was shocked as she advised he could have picked phone up to call them and simply make the name change as it was under my credit card. I will never visit this hotel again due to experiencing poor customer service. I will also tell all of my family members and friends about my experience. Imagine... you visit Vegas and are ready to check in but it never happens! What a let down.

1)  Resort fees.  Come on.  You're going to charge me $25 for (a) a pool that is closed and (b) 512K wifi (yes, that's a "K").  Seriously?  With a straight face?

2)  Loud rooms.  I could clearly hear conversations in neighboring rooms and in the hallway.

3)  Try replacing the toiletries.  I'm there for four days; I shouldn't have to beg for shampoo.

I used to recommend the PH.  It's in a good mid-strip location.  There's decent music on the PA (Bowie, Costello, Ramones, etc.), but it's pretty worn down these days.  There are better choices these days.
Bed bugs alert..... we stayed right before x'mas.... changed room once as room keys given to us didnt work.. both rooms had bed bugs.... staff was unprofessional.... extremely bad cust service.....

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this hotel and casino. If you're walking the strip, Planet Hollywood is centered pretty well in the middle, so you can walk either way, without tiring yourself out too much. While checking in, we tried the $20 room upgrade trick, which didn't work, so we were stuck with our room without-a-view. Which was really okay because we weren't in Vegas to sit in the room anyway!
I believe we had the least expensive option and our room was a pretty typical hotel room...average sized and clean. The bathroom on the other hand, was quite large and included a separate shower, bathtub, toilet with a door, and a roomy counter with sink and large mirror. When everything is separate, it really makes it nice for getting ready to go out (multiple people can get ready at once). 
The casino part of the hotel was also nice and features the Pleasure Pit, which basically consists of sexy, scantily clad dealers and go go dancers, dancing to popular music.
The attached Miracle Mile Shops have practically everything you could want with many higher end shops, some great restaurants and bars, and tons of entertainment options. We saw several shows while visiting, including Marc Savard, Comedy Hypnosis, located in the V theater in the Miracle Mile Shops and Holly Madison in Peepshow, located in the CHI Showroom in the hotel. If you're interested in seeing Holly, Planet Hollywood is definitely a good place to stay. We were walking through the casino on our way to our room one night, and happened to see Holly and a cameraman. They were apparently filming for the show Extra, so we stood in the background. Didn't get to see the show when it aired, but it was great way to meet Holly! And if you are looking to see her, act fast because I believe her stint at Peepshow will be ending this year.
Overall, I would absolutely stay here again and definitely recommend this hotel to others. It is a nice, mid-range hotel in an excellent location and has many things to do and see in a close general proximity.

Tough call here.  I would probably give the hotel itself just a 3 based on the rooms.  They seemed tired, dated and, in some places worn.  But the basics were there.  A comfortable bed, hot water in the shower and an HVAC that worked as required.

What I really liked about Planet Hollywood was the set up of the Hotel and the Casino.  Unlike other hotels where you have to walk for what seems like miles, everything was easy to locate, right near the elevators and overall very pleasant. 

We also had a really fun time people watching at the Heart bar in the casino that was centrally located and had a bartender that really knew how to craft great cocktails. 

So, based on the setup I will give the extra star and call it a four. 

Thank you.

Rooms are dirty! Yellow linens, clogged bathroom sink, stained carpets. They are in a process of remodeling for the next two years (2017- 2018), I wish I new that in advance, instead I was awaken at 7am by jackhammer from floor above. Overall just a horrible experience. Never ever I will stay at Planet Hollywood again.

The Good: This is a very nice and well maintained hotel. It's placed at a great location on the strip. Earl of Sandwich is here! The dealers are attractive. The bedrooms with 2 queen sized beds are VERY roomy and comfortable. The beds are soft and the blankets are nice. They give you extra blankets if you ask for them.

The Bad: The toilets in the rooms are a little under powered. It's confusing to walk around the "mall" area inside.

The Ugly: I lost $200 on black. Screw you, roulette.

The Verdict: I would love to return and stay here with either family or friends. I recommend this hotel to everyone because it's affordable, comfortable, and convenient.

Considering my previous hotel experience in Las Vegas was at The Flamingo, Planet Hollywood is practically paradise.

So far the room is nice, book with Expedia so a little confusion there, do they have free wifi? So far I don't think so, it's a bit of a downfall...will content review after I check out on Wednesday..found some bed bugs in my bed room 1805 made a claim and I got a response! I'm not happy with it all I asked is for them to make sure this won't happen to any other guest at their hotel and this is the response i get....REALLY!!!

We were here the week of Thanksgiving in room 2161, good view of the Cosmopolitan and people ice-skating at their rooftop pool, nice view of the strip overall. We were able to see maybe 3 of the Bellagio's fountain that went off every 30 minutes. Kids really wanted to swim but the pools were closed for the season.

No long wait to check in, no issue with customer service, there was a upgrade available for $50, no free room upgrade for us. Our room was the star wars theme. Huge bathroom. Sink clogged a little but we only really used it in the morning. No fridge in the room, but you can have them send one up for a fee.

The casino was a whole lot livelier than Aria or Cosmopolitan. They did have go go dancers dancing at the pleasure pit (middle of casino). The heart bar was also in the middle of the casino and played music all night long. There was a flash mob every night in the casino, forget what time they did it, but the crowd loved it.

Another great thing about this casino is the location, if you step outside to the left you can take the kids to New York New York or Excalibur arcade, the MnM or Hershey's factory is on the way. Plenty of food spots. If you walk out to the right you can head to Caesars Palace which is not to far of a walk.

If you decided you don't want to go out, the mall is perfect in PH, you can go shopping, you can eat, there is a buffet at Todai. I suggest you try Earls sandwich, super good. We got a $30 burger from Gordon Ramsey's spot "BURGR", trust me its well worth the $30. I didn't want to get it but believe the hype.

We took full advantage of the 2 Starbucks on property. There is an ABC store in the mall right outside of the casino. There is also a Walgreens attached to the hotel outside to the left and a CVS across the street. If the kids are looking for the usual McDonalds there is one outside to the left of the casino. 

The reason for 3 stars is because there was a chip on one of the drinking glasses in the room and one day our room was not clean for some reason. Also there was never any ice on our floor, we had to get it from Starbucks or the floor above or below. They did remove the $25 daily resort fee for the issues.

Free wifi for 2 devices per room.

great tip i found by accident. book your room through www.easyclicktravel.com and you wont pay a resort fee of $20 per night.  I'm not sure if it works for other hotels as well.  the hotel is great location, great bathtub, comfy bed, good or great view of the strip depending on your room.  only downside is walls are thin. you can hear the next room so gotta keep the TV. turned up.

We didnt say here, but we sure wish we did.  
We stayed at the Monte Carlo and found ourselves coming to Planet Hollywood almost everyday for something!

The casino floor is beautiful and very lively!
We had a couple of meals at Earl of Sandwich.
We also had dinner at Gordon Ramsy's Burgr.
We saw Brittney Spears at the theater at Planet Hollywood.

As you can see, there is a ton to do here for the younger crowd and I would recommend staying here if you are looking for some lively action.

In terms of location on the strip - Planet Hollywood is in a great location! You are right by the Bellagio and only a few minute walk to Cesar's palace.  The other nice part is that the casino floor is very close to the strip, unlike at Bellagio and Cesars where it seems like its a mile walk up the door!

We also had an encounter with the front desk and they were wonderful! 
So very friendly!

Looking forward to staying here on our next trip!

This hotel is not bad, but it's not the greatest either!!! The room I stayed in had mildew in the shower, & I don't think they vacuumed the room at all before we got there. This was my first time staying here & check in was horrible! It took me 25 minutes to check, another 25-30minutes when checking out & another 30 minutes anytime I needed my car from valet! My husband & I went to a concert(West Coast All Stars Concert) & it was so unorganized!!!!! It was already 2am & there was still one more artist to come on stage, so we left! I found out later on that PH is not affiliated with the concert, they just help promote it! Never again! My $200 tickets each were not worth it at all!!!! They might want to be careful & watch who they promote bc it will give them a bad rep!

Quick check in once again.. Plus the $20 trick worked wonders this time. Not only did i get the upgrade but my friends did too. Just asked if we can all be close to one another so they gave us all 3 rooms with an upgrade..

Hotel: Planet Hollywood
Room Type: Hollywood Hip Fountain View
Room Number: 3683

Check in:
Considering it was Friday 1pm the line was short. I had to pay a $16 fee for checking in before 3pm. However they do offer to simply hold your luggage until 3pm so you can venture off and check in later to avoid the fee.

Service:
Everyone working there seemed very helpful and tentative. I did not make any special request apart from the view. I asked the lady at Check in if they had any rooms available on the 30th floor with 2 beds and she gave us one on the 36th. I felt that was a good level of service as she was very tenacious when searching for it on their system
Room service came every morning without fail and even returned later when requested.

Casino\/Restaurants\/Local Venues
The hotel as you may know is attached to the Miracle Mile Mall which has an array of stores and restaurants that you would find in many Malls.
In side the lobby there is a Starbucks and on the Casino level you will find another one which I heard is open 24hrs. Also there are many restaurants such as Pinks HotDogs (yes the one from California) Gordon Ramsey's Burger, Planet Dailies and various other cuisines. 
The old Gallery Night Club has gone and is now KOI which has more of a lounge bar feel to it. - This isn't a very popular venue and does not attract any popular DJ's however its worth seeing as promoters around the Casino will give you free entry and a free drink to just step inside.

The Room:
The rooms are themed by movies - We had The Long Kiss Goodnight. As you see in the photos they decorate the room with costumes and props from the movie.
I feel the photos on the website did not fully reflect the room. They very rarely do. 
It comes equip with the basics - Large TV, Shower and Bath tub and it was very clean and tidy yet the furniture is slightly worn and scratched.
The view was impressive of the fountains, however, the wind was very small. I would expect a room advertised as (and priced as) a Fountain View Room to have floor to ceiling windows as at TheHotel (soon to be Delano) and The Encore. 
For the price I cannot complain. Although the quality does not compare to that of The Signature it certainly is better value than that of the newly refurbished MGM Grand.

The Location of Planet Hollywood is almost dead center of The Strip (It seems Bellagio is the most central to North and South) which is a bonus and its dead opposite The Cosmopolitan so if you wanted to visit the popular Marquee Nightclub you would not need a taxi at all.

Great people,  very helpful staff! Room was very clean and very nice. Food was fantastic at Planet Dailies with great service. Can't wait to go back again. Hip Strip view at the hotel is highly recommended! !

Stayed here in May since we were seeing JLO at the resort's venue. The theme in the lobby and rooms is Hollywood glam which is nice, but overall I wasn't wowed. Our room was clean and the bathroom was large, there was a nice view of the strip, and it was pretty comfortable. There are plenty of things to do without leaving PH including a mall, restaurants and a decent casino. In addition, this is a prime location in the middle of "the strip" where you can walk to other casinos, including the Paris next door. The cons were that parking and check-in took forever, the pool was so underwhelming with no seating, and service wasn't that great. I would not stay here again, as there are way better choices on the strip for the same or less money.

Firstly, the good. Decent hotel with friendly and courteous staff. The rooms were average and ours was decorated in an "Escape from L.A." theme with artwork and props.
And now the hilarious. As soon as we walked in we noticed a bright lipstick outline in bright red on the bright white duvet cover. Then what looked like a "booger" on the duvet as well. Then what looked like a sh*t stain on one of the pillows. Then we noticed the carpet was un-vacuumed with a woman's hair "scrunchy" on the carpet. And finally the toilet was broken. Well the maintenance guy fixed that quickly followed by the a housekeeper who took care of the rest.
As we were there for a convention and we had to take down our displays in the mid-afternoon we "tried" to request a later check-out (check-out is 11am). We got the run around for about ten minutes involving multiple clerks and message machines. Finally our name was taken for a call back. But guess what........never happened. So I left quite annoyed.

WOULD I GO BACK? Probably not but maybe it will be better the next time.

Nice hotel... Shops are great. However customer service is horrible! Rooms smell horrible, room was dirty, gross sink that reeked of vomit. When we arrived there were dishes outside... Asked for towels twice and never got them. Very careless customer service! Never staying here again!!!!!!!!

I checked in on wednesday night with my GF on a comped offer for my birthday. I'm a local but figured my GF and I would spend a few nights on the strip and go out to dinner or shows. I went to the diamond check in area around 6 PM, tipped the women checking me in and then had a nice chat with her. As I diamond member on my birthday and during midweek I was totally expecting at minimum an upgrade to their junior suite and hoping if I got lucky\/they were nice I might get something better. After a few minutes the women said she was able to get me an upgrade. I took the keys and went up stairs, when I got to the room and entered it it was totally dirty and not cleaned. When i looked around some more it was full of someone stuff including their keys. I soon realized that they had someone given me keys to a room occupied by another guest. In all my travel around the world I have never had this happen, not in third world countries so not sure how it happens in Vegas, I was astonished and really concerned. 

I thought about going down and complaining to the manager, giving away an occupied room is a major safety concern both for the person whose room it is and for the other guest given the keys. I figured the women who checked me in was nice and I did not want to get her or someone else in trouble so I just went back to the diamond check in area. I figured they would be super concerned by it and extremely apologetic. Instead they just did not care, they mentioned that this had already happened once today. They then said they did not have any more rooms in the category that they had given me. I asked that I then be upgraded and they told me there were no upgraded room available at all and they were sold out. I questioned this as i knew it was untrue but they assured me that it was the case and they have conventions and all suites were sold out. Upon return to my room I look up availability online and many suites were available including the one I had specifically ask for and been lied to that it was not available. They then unapologetically downgraded me to my original room and basically could have cared less about compromising my safety and the safety of the person whos room they have previously given me the keys to.

I was with my girlfriend so I just went up to my room and let it drop. The following day I was thinking about it more and it really bothered me both from a customer service perspective but even more so from a safety standpoint and the fact that it seemed totally normal to them to give out keys to rooms occupied by others. I went down to the front desk and requested to speak to a manager around 3 PM, they informed me that he was in a meeting but they had my cell phone and he would call me as soon as he was out. Of course that did not happen and around 5:30 I went back to the front desk to try and speak to him again.

I explained the situation to him and he seemed to apologize and said that was not how things should have been handled and that he would look into it and get back to me. He said he was on duty till 11PM that night and not to worry he would deal with it. I very much expected a call back to explain the situation at the minimum but of course I received nothing.

On a separate note the rooms are decorated in the cheapest way possible, everything looks like its from ikea. They only have 1 thing of tissues in the bathroom and none in the room. There is no coffee maker in the room, basically never seen this anywhere in the world. The bath towels are so rough and used that I would have thrown them out year ago at home, worst towels I have used in a hotel in a while. No water in provided in the room, even for diamond guests. No turndown service. The elevators going up to the rooms are the dirtiest I have seen in vegas outside of downtown.

This is simply unacceptable from a customer service standpoint but more importantly I no longer feel safe staying at any caesars properties as I now know that they regularly hand out keys to occupied rooms and don't think its a big deal. This both puts my physical safety at risk and give me great concerns that valuable items I have in the room or sensitive business documents are not safe.

Love the feel of this place. The entire experience is hip and trendy. 

Check in was super quick. Check out was also quick using the in room check out. 

We got a great room with the Robin Williams "Toys" theme. The theme was the only negative thing about the hotel. It was creepy having him and these toys watch me in the bathroom. Otherwise the furnishings were awesome and the view was amazing. We were there over New Years and faced the City Center. We got to watch the fireworks from our room and it kicked butt! After the fireworks, we walked outside and partied with a ton of fun people. 

There is a great selection of shopping and dining experiences thanks to the Miracle Mile. There is a little mexican restaurant that had super cheap, filling and delicious breakfasts, along with cheap bloodies. There was a cool, round bar in the center of the mall. Be sure to stop at customer service and pick up a free coupon book.  We got lots of free drinks, big discounts and several free gifts with coupons. 

The casino was fun. The dealers were awesome. Tons of free drinks, even at slot machines. Cocktail waitresses were great. Guys, be sure to hit up the Passion Pit. Gambling with a side of hot, half-naked chicks. 

Will definitely be going back. You can usually find deals on these rooms. Be sure to sign up for the A Lister club for even more perks.
Smelly room - disgusting & unacceptable!!!  I wasn't expecting such a low quality room from a suppose to be a 4 star hotel... I am not coming here again!!!!

I really enjoyed my experience at the Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino. 

We arrived late night during Halloween weekend, and upon check-in said they had a room for us with one king bed and it was smoking.  Considering we had four people and smoking room was not even an option, they were very fast in re-accomindaitng us to a suite on the top floor which they said was normally reserved for high rollers.  I figure they use these rooms as for comped stays and over bookings since you can't even find the room we stayed in on the hotel website.  It was on the second to highest floor and needed a key for elevator to take you to it.   The suite featured high ceilings, a bar, 1 bedroom with a pullout and a living room.  The bathroom also featured a tub, shower and TV.  I would guess the suite was about 1,000 sf.  

What is also great is the location.  It's right in the middle of the strip.  Across from city center\/Bellagio and in between MGM & Ballys\/Harrah's.  You don't feel like you are at the end like Mandalay and Wynn.  

The biggest plus for me is the casino.  It has a very hip vibe and isn't huge like most casino's in Vegas.  It doesn't take you 20 mins to get to your room from the front door.  

All in all I would def stay here again.

I stayed here when it was the Aladdin, on its way to becoming Planet Hollywood. It was partially under construction, but I didn't mind. 

This was a great hotel, though I don't have much experience with Vegas Hotels in general. The casino was cool - plenty of open machines to play, including video poker at the bar. 

I thought it was even cooler to have the "underground mall" that was unlike anything I have ever seen before. But, hey, it's Vegas, innit? Stores upon stores upon stores upon places to eat and drink... wow. 

There was so much to do here - just at this one location - that I didn't feel much need to check out other hotels, although I was told I needed to, since each one boasts their own "appeal." 

I'd definitely consider staying at this hotel again. The room, with two queen-sized beds, was spacious, clean and offered up a HUGE bathroom, which was good, considering I shared the room with two other ladies. 

Plus, since I got a bit too inebriated (let's face it, i was hammered) one night and spent around 5 hours passed out at the base of the toilet, I'd say even the bathroom floor deserves 4 stars!

I've been a fan of PH since the first day I stayed there a few years ago. My husband and I like to stay there when we go without the kids because its more of a party hotel and is pretty much in the middle of everything. Last time we went I was a bit disappointed. We had a room facing the strip but what good did that do when the windows were caked with dirt not only that but our room wasn't very clean and the hallways looked dirty with lifted stained carpet and chiped paint. That was a little disappointing, there was lime and rust around the faucets in the bathroom which I get happens but I rarely see that at nice hotels. The staff is always really nice and always willing to help I just wish the room upkeep was set at a higher standard cause this hotel is one of my favorites.

ONE COMPLAINT.. I LEFT $10 ON THE DESK .. came back.. my room wasnt clean.. AND MY $10 was GONE!!! WTF kinda thieving ass ppl do u motherfuckers HIRE??!!??      but other than that.. im a happy camper.. had a good free trip on planet hollywood.. =)

The rooms were very big and very clean.  We actually squeezed 8 people in a room with 2 beds (I know, we're cheapskates) for a weekend trip in Vegas, and it wasn't as bad as you would think!  The bathrooms have lots of counter space, there is a room within the bathroom separating the toilet, the shower is nicely sized (and has kinda crazy heavy water pressure), and there is a huge bathtub (perfect for storing lots of ice with lots of drinks haha).  Great location, pretty good casino area.  We liked how Earl's and Planet Dailies were accessible for quick bites to eat!

Pros: 
Gordon Ramsay Burgr Restaurant 
Earl sandwich (open 24hrs)
Clean rooms
Close to shopping malls 
Main attraction: Fountains at Bellagio, M&m's world, wicked spoon buffet, miracle mile shop... 
Walking distance from all Top hotels (Paris, Aria, Cosmo, Bellagio)

Cons: ???? I love this hotel

We stayed here January 2012 and loved it! We are faithful Harrah's Properties guests and they comp us very fairly! This was our first PH stay and we really enjoyed it! My partner and I are both in our 40's and come to Vegas twice a year. We found PH to be young and hip and very Vegas... We liked the energy and style. Service was good right from the front desk and everywhere there after. The location in the center strip can't be beat and the views can be spectacular. Definately request strip\/fountain views. The room was cleaned to our satisfaction daily though maybe showing some nicks and dings and wear... We will not complain because the price was great and the suite pretty darn awesome. We asked for a Panarama Suite and got 1601 on the 16th floor ...facing MGM\/NYNY etc but the panaramic view was wonderful! We watched sunsets and rises and the strip lights...awesome! Be sure to soak in the huge tub! Use the wet bar for evening parties and coffee in the morning! The beds were comfortable and above average but maybe could be more luxurious? Lots of high styled furniture and movie memorabilia! We found we stayed in the room more than on trips when we stay in lesser rooms. The Miracle mile shops will keep you captivated for days... And the food choices are plentiful! Both offer a a range of price from very affordable to higher end. Again, we found ourselves more content staying on the property this trip due to all it had to offer! I will attach a few pics and hopefully a video tour of the room... Lastly, we are BIG Vegas fans... We come and stay often and we must say PH gets 2 big thumbs up for value, location, service and fun!

Our wknd suite was the bomb like dot com!  We had 6 girls posted in 2 large rooms over Pro Bowl wknd.  

LOCATION:  was PERFECT for us, since most of us have frequented Vegas over the years and walking the strip wasn't a 'must do'.  Plus the indoor mall provided tons of shopping opportunities.  We literally didn't have to drive anywhere if we didn't want to.

CUSTOMER SERVICE:  We flew a red eye & arrived by 10AM.  Being exhausted from the flight, we asked if we could check in early & they not only let us, they didn't charge a fee.  They were really nice about everything the whole wknd & we definitely thought the 'ANYTHING\/ANYTIME' speed dial was a great touch!

SUITE:  AMAZING!!!  A 2 bdrm w\/a living space in between was fabulous.  We had a small kitchen with a fridge, convection oven, & dishwasher.  The living room shades doubled as a projection screen & there was a slide projector mounted from the ceiling.  The master bedroom had less living room furniture than the other room but that was largely due to the fact that 1\/3 of the room was taken up by the jacuzzi!

Worst hotel in Las Vegas to stay at. Visit only I would never stay here again. 1st thing The valet was only open to 7 star VIP members so I had to use the self park. It's a 8-10 minute walk from the self park to the front desk where you hopefully will get someone who speaks clearly. 

So it's my first time staying at this casino and as all Vegas casinos are very large it's easy to get lost. I received extremely vague directions to where I needed to go from self parking to get to my room and when I did ask other Employees most of the responses were rude and hurried. 

Once I got to my room I try the room keys to find out they don't work and oh there is a maid still cleaning my room. I checked in at 10:45 PM Why the hell is a maid still cleaning rooms that late and why did I have to get up there to find out my keys don't work and room not ready.

After going back down to the front desk I was asked by a manager well what do you want me to do? He offered to comp my resort fees but big deal $30 off this place is a joke worst customer service, hardest place to check in longest walk to your room just all around terrible experience trying to stay at this hotel.

updating my review after staying here again this past weekend.  the room is what is making me update my review, and the staff at check in and check out.  the casino is still great and probably one of my favorite casinos to gamble in because they play good music that keeps you up and going, along with having a large variety of games and slots to play, and the staff is always pretty cool.

the 3 things that annoyed me:
- when we were making sure we had everything out of our room before leaving, we checked under the bed and there was a ton of crap under the bed from used towels to just trash.  and for some reason there were some cheese puffs in the bathroom by the toilet like someone got trashed and was eating cheese puffs while throwing up and spilled the cheese puffs.  kinda gross, but we didnt' notice it earlier
- the placement of the room was annoying as it always seemed loud in the room from who knows what.  the sounds i was able to pick up were the traffic on the strip, and airplanes from the airport.  we were on the 20th floor so i am not sure why the traffic was so loud, and not sure why we would here the airplanes as last time we stayed on the 23rd floor in the resort room and we didn't hear any sounds.  and the resort room was far more comfortable as far as room and bed comfort.
- the other thing that kinda pissed me off was the staff at check in and check out.  last time when we stayed here, the guy at the desk at check in was really chill and hooked us up with room upgrades (upgrade to resort room and high floor comp'd) but when i asked the guy this time about upgrades he was talking about how slow it is at the casino and that we would have to pay $50 a night for the room upgrade.  i told him that i got it comp'd for 2 rooms a week ago when i was there and he told me that wasn't possible and gave me a bunch of crap so i just told him that we would keep our basic room.  at check out when we told the lady about the crap under our room she said "oh, alright.  ill take it into consideration."  what the hell is that?  no offering to make up for your staff not being able to properly clean a room?

overall, i would give it a 3 for this time, and mixed with my previous 5 from last time, it balances out to a 4.  we shall see if next time is a better experience if i stay here and don't upgrade to the westgate towers.

This is for the Casino only as I've never ventured into the hotel, but I'm certain that it's nice.

The Casino is large, well planned out and full of a lot of great slot games. They have high stakes as well as the regular $0.01, $0.25, $1 and $5 games. THey had my favorite game a Rocky Horror picture show game that had me sitting there for a good half hour, not that I was winning but that I could sit there and listen to the snippets of the songs from my favorite movie. 

Not terribly crowded, it's attached to the Miracle Mile shops, so once you're done spending money with them, you can go walk and grab some useless swag in the mall.

The planet holleywood is in the perfect spot on the strip. You are close to all the more expensive hotels - ceasars, cosmo, bellagio, wynn.... but not paying the price to sleep there! Rooms were good. Service was great. I have stayed at a few other places in this price range, but this is my where I will be staying from now on in the future.

Planet Hollywood, center of the strip, huge mall inside, next to Paris...what's not to love?? It is seriously super convenient since it's center of the strip. Quick walk to MGM, Montr Carlo, Bellagio, etc. I was amazed at how walking felt so much faster or nicer since I stayed central to the strip. 

However, that and the size of my room (2 queens, a huge bathroom with shower and tub) was probably the highlight of my 3 day stay here. It was spacious although old.

 Omgosh it took me almost 30 mins to find the stupid lobby for check-in. I was not only frustrated, but had high anxiety from all the mall crowd, casino crowd and center attraction crowd that I almost gave up looking for my lobby to check in. I was that lost. And it's not like it's easiest to spot or the signs are clear because they're not. They're hidden or bring u in circles. Quite the headache. Not to mention the hidden elevators from the main floor to try and get to your room. It was too crowded and big for my liking.

The room: although spacious for 2 queens and the MOST comfortable of beds...the bathroom often smelled like sewage\/poop. I thought it was us, until I kept smelling it in the mornings when I brushed my teeth or randomly at night when we were getting ready to go out. There is rust on the bathroom faucets and creepy celebrity knacks as decor in the room. Tacky and haunting haha. The channels on tv were mediocre when I wanted something to watch for downtime. But ur not supposed to be spending time in ur room anyway in Vegas. 

Overall, it was clean and housekeeping kept it well. Aside from the smell and old stuff in the bathroom, I enjoyed my bed more than I should have and it sort of overlooked the huge throngs of people. I would not stay again unless I was desperate and lazy because it's too crowded for my liking. But I would recommend it sure.

Everything on their website looked beautiful WRONG!!!! dirty floors in lobby \/dirty elevators full of trash HELLO HOUSEKEEPING \/hallways dirty trash on the floor walls banged up and dirty \/ walked in room aw man where do I start !!! Dirty carpet dirty bathroom everything outdated furniture scratched and old . Never will I stay here again writing this review as I'm getting ready to check out (checked out sake day I checked in that's how horrible these rooms are )

I went to Vegas for my first time this weekend and stayed here.. Do not stay here. While I don't have other Vegas hotels to compare Planet Hollywood to, I can't imagine anything worst. My room was dark, dirty and depressing. The bed was made with a sheet (no other covers) and 2 pathetically uncomfortable pillows - both of which reeked of cigarettes and stale beer (even though I had booked a non-smoking room). The maid's cleaning supplies were left in the bathtub... The few lamps that were in the room were unplugged, and I quickly realized why -there were not enough outlets to plug them all in. The only source of light was one tiny desk lamp. As I unpacked in my dingy room, I found that the safe didn't work. I made a call to the front desk, had to leave a message, and never heard back. Ended up just wearing all of my valuables the entire weekend so I didn't need to worry about them. Also, there was no mini-fridge.. which I thought was bizarre- especially for Vegas.  

Luckily I was able to keep myself busy enough to avoid being in my room at all cost, but on my last night, I decided to order room service. After finishing my cold meal, I pushed the room service cart out to the hallway- and I forgot my room key.. leaving me locked out of my room (in my bare feet and PJs). I went down to the lobby to ask for a new key card, and they told me I needed ID (which obviously was in my room). They told me to go back up and wait by my door - assured me maintenance would be there in 5 minutes. 30 minutes later and no show by the maintenance guy, I went BACK down to the lobby, still mortified in my PJs, to let them know I was still waiting... they showed no sympathy, nothing. Just told me to keep waiting- apparently the maintenance guy had received a "medic call"? What maintenance man is responsible for a medic call?? He finally showed up an hour later, all nonchalant, reeking of pot, and let me in- DID NOT even ask for my ID, so not sure why that was so important for the front desk... Needless to say, if you'd like to go to Vegas and stay in a dump with poor management skills and neglect for their customers, go here. Otherwise, spend an extra $50 to stay anywhere else.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. Trying to find the hotel parking vs. the mall parking was confusing and my husband was getting really mad. He even said this place better be worth it. IT IS!

 
We stayed here June 15-17. When we first got there our room wasn't ready but the guy gave us an upgrade to a studio room. OMG.  The room was bigger than our old apartment in San Diego. A view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The bathroom was just about as big as the room itself. Our room had a sitting area with Forrest Gump memorabilia and the funny thing is that it's my all time favorite movie. That was a fun surprise. The tub was big enough for two to fit comfortable and relax. 

The best part was The Miracle Mile of Shops was right downstairs. 

I really don't have too much to complain about except the buffet was just ok. For $27.99 per person you would think the food would taste better than other places but it didn't. I liked that they had a huge variety (American, Mexican, Italian...), if you get the coupon book from customer service I think you can get a 2 for 1  in the book. 

All in all this is the best place to stay on the strip. It isn't too hip where if you have kids they get bored and it's not to flashy for older people. 

We loved it and will be back!!

i was actually PLEASANTLY surprised by this  hotel! talk about FACELIFT!! this place used to be the aladdin back in the day, and everything from the rooms to the casino floor screams swanky and modern. there is a LOT going on. the 40\/40 lounge, prive, cafes and miracle mile shops.

its really  hip and modern and draws a pretty younger crowd which is a plus, their pool is poppin with lots of activity as well! 

their rooms are very clean and spacious. and OH EM GEE two mirrors in the bathrooms VERY important for girls getting ready! 

im definitely a new fan!

I stayed here April of 2015. This hotel is a standard hotel - nothing particularly special about it. The room was clean and the bathroom was too, and it's all pretty large too considering this is Vegas.

I booked through Hotwire as a '4 star near the center strip' area. Location wise this is correct. But I don't think it warrants 4 stars. The casino is madness though - it's EXACTLY what you think of when you think of Vegas. Gamblers, women dancing on stage, drinks flowing, partying.

One final note: checkin line is always long here. They were very polite though but it took us 20 minutes to get through it and get into our room. Also, like ALL Vegas hotels they have a completely bogus 'resort fee' which is BS in my opinion. Why don't they just include it in the price of the hotel??? I'll never know.

First time here was pretty hesitant from reading the reviews but my stay was perfect we stayed on the 26th floor room and restroom was spacious modern and clean overall stay was nice ordered room service took 30 min housekeepers were attentive and punctual everyone was super nice... To top it off it has a awesome location !!
Only let down was  the pool nothing impressive compared to other ones

I'm not huge yerper but I had to write a review in hopes this will change things.

Biggest complaint the Water Pressure in the shower and tub was LOUSY

They had to have had water restrictors on the shower heads.  I swear the pressure coming out of the sink was better than the shower and who doesn't love taking a relaxing shower or bath when you're on vacation?   I filled the bath and it took literally 30minutes to fill that tub.   Great tub.. LOUSY water pressure.

I stayed in newly renovated room on the 37th floor with a great view of the fountain.  2 other folks I spoke with had similar experience.

The other complaint;  OUTSIDE NOISE.  

I'm a light sleeper and you wouldn't think a high end hotel would have windows that would let the sound in.  I was in Vegas on training for a week so I needed to sleep early and wake up early.   It wasn't good.     I won't stay here again unless it's unavoidable. 

Other than the noise and the water pressure the room was amazing and the service was great.

First let me say that I didn't pay cash for my room (i used SPG points) and it i had i would have been very upset. 

The hotel has been redone, but more in the sense of they put a new carpet in and halfheartedly painted the rooms. They are large enough, but if you look close you can see over-spray and grime where they kept the old bath fixtures. 

No one helped us with our bags when we arrived, there is no mini bar in the room, our maid didn't take out the garbage, didn't put away the ironing board, and didn't straighten anything up. All she did was make the bed and put two new towels in. Very basic. 

Don't get me wrong, this place isn't gross like Balley's or anything, but there are much better values for your money. 

I would have to say the highlight was Prive, we had a great VIP Host and had a really good time at the club.

Great Casino & Hotel. Perfect for a High School Reunion!
Just came back from my high school reunion.  The party was great.  The rooms were nice and the staff very friendly and helpful.  I would recommend and stay at Planet Hollywood in the future.

This was my first trip to las vegas, and Planet Hollywood had the best to offer in our price range.  The hotel was nice, but could have used a much easier access from the parking garage to the hotel (long walk!).  Also, when we first arrived in our room, it hadn't even been cleaned!  It was after 7pm, and it was still dirty!  After trudging back down to the front desk, they offered us the same room with a slightly better view as compensation.

The next morning the fire alarms went off from about  8:00-8:30 in the morning, and totally spoiled our breakfast.  I later threw up due in part to the migraine I got from the fire alarms.

Besides those few things, everything else was pretty good.  I wouldn't mind staying here again, if I ever decide to venture back to Vegas.
Rude and incompetent. The valets don't know how to park cars so they make you circle around endlessly until they catch up rather than help you.

This is not a big hotel like the MGM, but it was nice enough in terms of location and the size of the rooms. I got a double beds room with one of the themes which I couldn't remember. The bathroom was hugh and clean, but kind of dark. It took me forever to turn on the nightstand light. The  housekeeping service was ok, they didn't do much cleaning with my room, but provided more towels that I ever needed (14 towels per day!!!). 

The casino was small, but very hard to navigate. The buffet line was crazy! I waited for 2 hrs on a Monday night. It was a nightmare! I really like the Miracle Mile, but I didn't have enough time for shopping. 

Next time, I will try NY NY or Paris!

Meh. I would put 2 stars but fealty like being nice on Xmass. The staff is really not the smartest tool in the shed,  I have been noticing a tremendous trend. The Casino in general makes you feel depressed.  In contrast to staying at the Bellagio I would say it's worth it if your on a budget but not the best hotel on the strip . I wouldn't stay here again.

I was able to stay here using my SPG points. Worth the points, not worth paying. 

The room is was good, but my only gripes are that the room was dark and the self-parking was far.

I am just writing about the "Pleasure Pit" in the casino.  What a concept, using attractive female blackjack and roulette dealers in lingerie attire.  The Go-Go dancers are featured on small raised platforms with the requisite vertical poles.  They're very attractive and friendly too.  I like the floor layout.  I played the slots and the cocktail waitress came around to take the drink orders.  It did take some time for the drink to arrive though.  Overall I had a fun time here.

Loved the Hotel! Clean Rooms, Clean Atmosphere, very quite and calm in the corridors.

Got a Free upgrade as well!

LOVED IT.

PS: Go to Burgr.

We stayed here for about two days to celebrare my boyfriends birthday. They upgraded us to a "nicer" room. The quotation marks are necessary because the room was mediocre, if that was an upgrade I don't want to know what the original room that we paid for was like.
