I stayed at ph 3-2-15 and checked out this morning 3-4-15. my stay here was pleasant and id recommend this motel to anybody whose  traveling on a "getting away trip" or just trying to get the clean,safe,comfort for your buck trip! our room was nice,it was the will smith room so it had a few clothes he wore in some movie ive never heard of nor saw.The tub was clean,big and excellent!!!the shower was separate and didn't get as hot as i would have liked but it did the job!before i booked this motel i did look at the reviews and feel some may have unrealistic expectations for a motel you probally didnt pay more then 60 dollars a night for!

Fun Fun Fun!!!!! This is my new favorite casino in Vegas. There is a great upbeat feel when you walk in the casino. They have top 40 hip hop, pop music playing at all times and plenty of eye candy for the fellas top look at. Their deli was my favorite that I've had in Vegas. The Earl Of Sandwich, all of there sandwiches are 5.99 wraps 5.99 soup 3.99. I had the caperse sandwich it was a refreshing feeling with every bite on perfectly toast bread it was seriously heavenly. I also had the BLT sandwich also excellent,and the  tomato soup was great. Poker room was in the middle of the casino which is kinda different, its definitely a nice room that has lots of traffic going through it but not overbearing.

Worst experience ever !! From the front desk unable to accommodate two rooms on the same floor. To the dirty bathtubs and and smelly rooms.  The hotel needs repairs and didn't seem anyone was fixings the problems. The 15th floor is missing elevator button which had exposed electrical. The staff was rude and disrespectful. I had a female security attack me and threatened me to send me to jail. What a joke !! Back up security had to escort  there own staff out of the hotel. She was unprofessional , rude and  belligerent. This woman was a animal while I was calmly try to explain to the Nick the security what was happening and how I was being harassed the female security continued run towards me and attack me. It was like a high school fight. Definitely not what I go to Vegas for. Lastly I've tried to reach management and no one seems to care. They where unapologetic and offered the to refund the resort fees. As if I was getting a deal $70.00 isn't going to make matters better. First time here never coming back. I'm sticking to MGM and there partners where they are professional , clean and friendly.
i was gambling in this hotel and the cocktail server came up to us fairly quickly to offer us drinks tho it took awhile for her to get back to us

GREAT location in middle of strip cool casino\/restaurants

OUR room was NOT CLEAN!!!! dusty as hell. there was pills on the floors from previous guest... how hard is it to vacuum? sink was clogged. 

self parking is HORRIBLE be aware if u drive n park, you have to walk through the miracle mile mall after you fight for parking. the walk itself prob take up to 10 minutes sucks if you are in a rush... way better options in terms of rooms to stay in.

Planet Hollywood is perfectly situated in the middle of the strip. Just a bridge away from Cosmo if you want to walk over to Marquee. They house Earl of Sandwich, which is the perfect quick\/ inexpensive meal for the weekend. 

The hotel entrance is actually kinda confusing to find from the casino floor.. nothing is too distinctive, but yea, if you can find the big chandelier ball thing that hangs lower than the other ones.. that's where you need to go. 

I can't remember if the $20 upgrade trick worked here.. I think I might have chickened out, so maybe I didn't even try? Anyway, the room was nice enough, nothing really special. 2 Queen beds, a big enough bathroom for a bunch of girls to get ready. 

Def recommend for its location and price!

Planet Hollywood makes me LOL.

Want to know why?
-It used to be the Aladdin, and the remodel was done rather half-assedly, you can still see middle eastern\/arabesque motifs all throughout the casino and mall.(Hell, the buffet is even still named the Spice Market. Sounds more like something you'd find in Morocco rather than Hollywood)
-If MTV was a building you can go to, this would be it(more so than even The Palms and Hard Rock).
-They're desperately trying to make you feel like you're in South Cali with Pink's Hot Dogs, a mall called the Miracle Mile, the EXTRA lounge(which is named after a celebrity news show which isn't much better than a tabloid), etc....

It tries so, so hard. And it fails. The Miracle Mile is definitely an improvement from what it was originally like so that's a plus. I still want to try the Spice Market Buffet but I've heard way too many stories about long toilet trips resulting from someone eating a Pink's hot dog and every other restaurant just seems overpriced or overhyped. Also, can't lie, but I do want to see Peepshow.

Don't hate the place, but I'm definitely not a fan.

I love staying and gambling here. Clean and close to EVERYTHING.

Rooms are mid-level as far as price. There's also a piece of Hollywood memorabilia in each room (COOL!).

The gambling area is cool too. Tons of tables and it feels super super clean.

Pros:
Great location. 
Good food.
Convenient shopping.

Cons:
Mediocre pool.
Mediocre rooms.
Dirty bathrooms.

The price was pretty good considering that we were here during a holiday weekend. That's all I have to say. I will not be staying here again.

The location is really the only thing this hotel still has going for it. The rooms are dark. Customer service is terrible. We checked in Wednesday night and the line was atrocious and there weren't enough employees so it took almost an hour to check in. Thankfully the desk clerk upgraded our room because of the really long wait. The casino is cool. It has a good vibe and fun atmosphere. The buffet at this hotel is really good too. The pool is meh. Much better places to stay. I think Planet Hollywood should be downgraded from a 4 star to a 3.5. Customer service is bad, rooms are dark and old, pool is blah. However, it's dead smack center strip. If you want a great location and you get a good price it's not bad. But don't expect much else. They just don't seem to be trying anymore. If you want good customer service check out somewhere like SLS.

Planet Hollywood, prime location, good prices, ok club if you can't get into the Marquee or XS. Would come back -- so many hot chicks stay here too! Getting the suite next time with a view next time! Because I can. Oh, and check in was super fast .Gotta love it.

One of the worst casinos I have stayed at and gambled, you if you are south tower you could hear and feel the vibration of the club down below.  The slot machines don't pay either,  the waitresses rarely come around and when they do they take your order and never come back

Please don't do it! Spend your money some where else. Staff is very unprofessional and don't seem to be concerned about the worst house keeping that I have ever seen. Found a used condom under my bed with other trash.

 The very next day discovered that I took a bath in globs of gulk  (an actual hand full of hair )from only God know how many guest that have used that tub. I'm so grossed out and disgusted! Never ever going back to that place again.  When asking to speak to a manager, he is in a meeting. 
 
The never accept any accountability for any short comings. I have taken out some time to gather information about all of the corporate board of Directors from google. Their phone numbers are available. Please call them to voice your concerns. 

That hotel is too beautiful and convienantly located to go down to the dogs with unprofessional and uncaring  staff. So if you love Vegas call the CEO's and make them aware.

I'm writing this review while in my room at the planet hollywood and im having such a bad experience that I felt compelled to write about it. I got to Vegas around 930 and when I came to check in and was turned away. I should say, this has happened a couple times and I've never been turned away at any hotel. An option has always been presented to me. When we returned back around 12 they offered me a room with a early check in fee. When I arrived to my room the remote control didn't work and the shower would backed up and cut my shower short. When I called to complain they honestly sounded like they could not care less as if some how I was making this up. Let me also add the fact that their valet was full multiple times (even for hotel guest!) Self parking is located only 15 to 20 mins on the opposite end of the property , through the mall. My problems was never resolved and I will NEVER return to this hotel. P.s. if you do stay there lastly away from room # 1826

I really like this hotel and it's layout. It always seems like it's fun in here, great shops, food dining area. I haven't gambled here not sure how fun that is, but we always know what the turn out will be when gambling at any casino. The interior is just awesome. I'd love to stay here for one weekend, but as long as my sister and brother are locals here, I probably won't be lodging in anywhere here. Because I do like the looks and the feel at this place I surely will come back here every now and then when I'm in town.

What a mistake! On the surface, this place appears nice.  Our pick because it was the only 3-5 star pet friendly hotel available.  The Hollywood theme is great, and the food at Planet Dallies was awesome. 

Realize the advertised room rate only covers the room, which happens to be quite large.  Basic amenities that are available in most 1-2 star hotels these days (frig, wifi, coffee maker) must be requested and you will be charged.  There is only 1 outlet in the room to charge electronics.

Housekeeping is a joke! The bathroom counter was covered with a sticky substance.  The sink fixtures were corroded, and the one of the sinks backed up (thankfully there are 2).  OLD dog feces was left near one of the large, uncomfortable sitting chairs.  Since we have a small dog and we were only there 1 night, I'm certain it wasn't from our dog.  GROSS!

Bottom line: PH is great for the restaurants and decor.  Ssssssoooooo glad we left and went to the Four Seasons.

Life is great when you are an SPG Platinum Member.  I was automatically upgrated to a suite facing the pool and strip.  My stay was quite comfortable as usual.  the hotel amenities were great.  Even better was the fact that inside this hotel, there was a shopping mall with hundreds of stores and restaurants.  The restaurants in the hotel were all very good.  They also have one of the best Sports books in town.  
I really enjoyed my stay  in Las Vegas this time.

Casino Review Only

Pros:

- Good ventilation
- Friendly, welcoming dealers
- Fun, party atmosphere all day
- plenty of bars and restaurants 
- Ideal mid strip location 
- Good drink service 
- Most bars & restaurants accept TR credits as payment, including Starbucks! 

Cons:

None!

 (Message me to find out how to becamo Diamond without the $$$$)

This review is for the Sports Book at Planet Hollywood.  I recently stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and spent 4 of those nights in the sports book at some point.  The bartenders, Sherry, Michael and Victor were FANTASTIC!  So friendly and down to earth, always quick with the next drink and the drinks were always mixed perfectly.  Even with the craziness of March Madness, these bartenders were always on and ready to serve.  On quieter nights, my husband and I enjoyed great conversations with all three of them.  This bar is definitely a place we will hang out at again when we are in Las Vegas.  I hope that by the time we come back, they will have gotten new bar stools, though!

My favorite hip hotel on the strip!

This isn't a magical hotel or a luxurious stay or one of those hi-end suites with a retractable screen shade, but this vegas hotel is the best in overall experience.

I've booked this stay for my wife's b-day weekend and this was 1st of 2 hotel stays on the strip. I"ll tell you what if you can get a good price for a stay here, you more than maximized your buck!

Our room was clean and comfy. Nice dresser and comfortable beds. I've mentioned earlier that this hotel is hip, it is! It is not a typical run down hotel nor outdated. My room had a Nascar shrine of someone, not sure which professional driver it was but I had a Nascar display. I had to order a mini-fridge to my room to keep cool my wife's gift from Payard Patisserie and Bistro and i'm glad they were able to do so.

Getting through check-in is weird here, if i'm coming from the rear parking lot, I would walk with my baggage on-hand and cutting off part of the Miracle Mile shops, so shoppers downstairs would see me a traveller in distress to get a room Lol, but hey it's all good who cares it's only Vegas.

Its a fun hotel I recommend staying here, and don't forget to hangout at poolside its nice! Black and Purple are their colors here and it feels like being a Decepticon at night!

Last year i decided to take my Gf's to vegas for my Birthday ....which itself means that i wanted to have a blast with my girl friends...It was exactly what i had in mind and wanted modern and fun . This hotel is the best one its got best view of vegas really nice casino ....friendly staff and variety of options

Our son moved to Vegas in March so my husband and I are there at least once a month.  We stayed at PH for the first time this weekend and it will be the last!  We arrived Friday afternoon to a half empty cocktail glass and trash next to our door and it remained there until Saturday night, despite having seen housekeeping on our floor.  I use housekeeping very loosely because our room didn't look as if it had been adequately cleaned in a long time.  Our room window was smaller than our kitchen table which added to the overall seedy feeling of the place.  It lacked things you'll normally find at any hotel like a coffee maker and small fridge.  Oh and the TV and 2 lights weren't working either.  Back to the Four Seasons!

The rooms are roomy and big, the bathrooms are huge... Make sure you request a room above floor 30... Those are the quiet and renovated rooms. We had room 2134 at first and we couldn't sleep because of the bass noise from the strip and the ppl were just too crazy. We moved to room 3094
And while it was smaller, it was peaceful and quiet. The hotel is a party place, I wouldn't recommend it for couples, the casino has half naked women dancing on top of every table. It's the carnival cruise lines of hotels in Vegas.... The only positive was the room service... Prompt!

I usually stay at other resorts but since I got some compd rooms I figured I would stay here for the first time.  The casino is always fun and the pole dancers don't hurt either.  I received a normal room with a decent view of the strip.  I was surprised at how run down the hallways and rooms appeared.  Once I got into the room it was a bit drab and old looking compared to other places on strip.  By the second day I was having problems with hot water which the staff did nothing about after I reported it to them.

Pro-
Casinos fun
Pinks Hot Dogs
Cheap food but not gaming
Location

Cons--
Harrahs needs to update their rooms.
Pool
Hard not so comfy bed

If you do not care about were you sleep and want to party then it is a great place due to its location.  I would not stay here again even if I get my rooms compd again.  Too many beautiful resorts in this town.

The only awesome thing about this hotel is the casino. Period.  The casino is awesome esp when ur arriving late and coming from a long drive from LA after an 9hr workday and too famished to go clubbing.  The casino itself is a big club and on top of that, decor looks great with all the colors.

The walk from the self parking lot to the front registration is a plain nightmare, lugging your luggage thru the long mall after a 5 hr drive sucks.  ESP when you just want to arrive, check-in and get ur nite started already.

The hotel hallways are a bit dingy.  While the bed i find pretty comfortable, the rest of the room is not up to par.  The furniture is scratched up and old.  The closet doesn't even fit a large suitcase.  Low standard bathroom.  Shower head is cheap and so filled with soap scum that you are getting scattered sprays.  And don't even get me started on the complimentary toiletries - The shower gel smells cheap and doesn't lather, the lotion smells cheap.  Good thing i bring all those things with me normally so i don't even need to go near theirs.  

While i can put up with all this (minus the shower head) it would be very nice if they did a little upgrading.  I know they can afford it, esp with thier room prices and how much traffic goes on in thier casino.

Best thing about the room is always thier deep soaking tub, its pretty awesome!
I'll still be back many more times PH, but please just consider doing a little upgrading!

PH, you stole my money because you have these HOT amazing blackjack dealers.  I couldn't help and resist, I knew I should have walked away when I was up over $150 but lost it all to a very beautiful dealer.  

I guess looks can be deceiving after all. I'm sure I'm not the first guy they suckered to play. Easy pickings indeed. =(

So disappointed with our meals and the serviced we received.  We have gone to the PH is Downtown Disney and it was great. Las Vegas was terrible.  3 of us and nobody enjoyed their meal.  Only good thing was the pot stickers.

Staying at the PH for one night was a refresher in economics 101 (supply & demand). PH's marketing \/ PR dept must be geniuses because they have created a demand (and high prices) for something that should warrant no such demand.

1) check in is horrific (I am talking an hour plus wait in line), the lady who helped me said this is typical.  I am convinced they are doing this on purpose to instill in guests and passers by that PH is THE place to be. They have an online "express check in", which I am glad I did because I got to skip the massive line and go straight to the much shorter "key pick up line". But then we still had to do all the usual check in tasks so I am not sure what the point of the online express check in is? 

2) the casino and hotel lobby may be sleek and updated, but the minute you step into the hotel elevator you will notice heavy wear and tear. The elevator doors were banged up and dingy. The hallways have marks all over the walls and look completely worn.

3) the rooms are old Aladdin rooms with some added ugly wallpaper, paint and banged up furniture. Our room felt like a cave. It's only redeeming quality was the view of Paris and the Bellagio fountains (the window was really small though). The bed was obviously well used and uncomfortable.

4) we could hear EVERY. SINGLE. FLIGHT. going over us all night long (maybe our small window wasn't very sound proofed? Or maybe they didn't build the Aladdin to block out outside noise?).i have never experienced this level of sound at any other strip hotels

5) parking is literally a mile away ( you have to walk the length of the mall to get to it)

The most annoying part about our stay at the Aladdin, I mean Planet Hollywood, was knowing that people were paying in the upper $200s for this nastiness. You are paying MGM Grand prices for Monte Carlo \/ Bally's quality. As long as people are paying these ridiculous prices for such poor quality, PH will continue to charge them. 

Wake up people, just because PH has a hip casino and trendy restaurants and a never ending hotel check in line, it doesn't mean you should settle for a room that makes you feel dirty waking up in. Lipstick on a pig is all it is.

I stayed at this hotel on my last trip to Vegas. I have mixed feelings about this place. First off my friend picked us up from the airport and we parked in the parking garage. Holy cow! I seriously lugged my luggage across the mall! Really?!?! Whoever designed the hotel didn't think it was important to put the garage near the front desk!! Annoying! Second, the front desk folks are jerks! Requested one king bed non-smoking and when we got there, there was nothing available with our request. What's the point of making reservations?!?!?!? Annoying! The person helping us was a douch bag didn't try to accommodate us just basically told me that's all they had smoking rooms. Eeewwww. He ended up giving me a non-smoking handicap room with two queens. Guess that's was better then nothing. 

On a brighter note I actually really like the hotel casino. It's pretty nice and clean. Love that it doesn't smell like heavy cigarettes. Love all the lights and the colors they used to decorate, really pretty. I also love how PH is in the middle of the strip we were able to cross and go to the Cosmo. PH also had some really stores in the mall. It also had really good Restaurants like Earls and Pinks. Overall experience was good but not as great as other hotels.

** Casino Only **

We came here the other night after we went to dinner at Pampas.

When walking in from the Miracle mall the first slot machine we seen was Britney's,
of course I had to try that one.
It was pretty fun, I put a $20 in and went to 10 before hitting anything.
But I walked away with a extra $1.00 lol and put that and more in some of their other machines.

This casino is not glitzy or classy, Most of the time when we walk the miracle mile is the only time we come in the casino unless it is for a show,

Seen many shows upstairs from their casino as well as restaurants. Never stayed here, but have been here many times over the years and even before it became Planet Hollywood.

They do have some real pretty chandelier's that changed color. I thought this was a bit much for this casino but they are beautiful!

So I must be weird b\/c I always bring my own toiletries and many other reviewers complained about the ones provided here...also I though the bathroom was normal sized, not sure where everyone is staying with super-size bathrooms?

We took a limo from the airport and I am glad we did after reading about the parking!

I don't think anywhere in Vegas has free wi-fi, which is annoying, but I can't take stars away from PH just b\/c they are like everywhere else.

Good:
staff was friendly 
hotel was quiet
Earl's & YOLOs are yummy and inexpensive
great location
easy access to shops, convenience store, restaurants
Pool Cafe-Bar-Arcade is air conditioned if you get too hot
Themed-rooms are cute.  Fantasy Island!  
Casino is fun.  Relaxed. Spacious.  

Bad:
Pool is strange- there are 2 pools (one for all ages, one for 21+) separated by a parking lot type are full of lounge chairs which were filthy.  Cabanas and beds also appear to be less than clean.
We also got stuck in a smoking room, which did not reek or anthing but hey we reserved 3 non-smoking rooms on the same floor which they could not acoomodate...hello we had a reservation!

I liked Planet Hollywood, I would stay here again.

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS! Worst hotel in vegas i would give zero stars if i could. I have never dealt with less efficient and rude valet in my life! What a joke!!!! 30 dollars a night for valet in the resort fees and you literally cannot valet! The front desk is a nightmare i trued to complain and they said well its a different department we cant help you just like we wouldnt be able to help you if the housekeeper messed up. Such horrible service i will never stay here again!!!! Avoid this place for your sanity!

Good place for the young crowd, you get a nice laid-out casino floor with great places for food and drinks within 2 minutes walking distance.

Their rooms are ehhhhhh... not too clean and can be compared to a motel. Sad to say but true.

This is the first time I've stayed here since it changed from Aladdin to PH and to me the quality of service\/rooms has declined. It used to be on par with Mandalay Bay and Caesars now I'd say it's more in line with the Luxor or Excalibur but still with the higher price tag. The carpets in the room as well as the elevator area has major stains, the drywall under our sink had water damage (bubbles in the paint) and the grout in the shower was disgusting. Next time I will stay at a REAL 4 star hotel for the same price.

Please DON'T visit Planet Hollywood. 

There are so many better hotels that care about their guests and by far this is not one of them. I normally write long long reviews but I want the public to actually read this so I'll keep to the detais: 

We stayed for over a week on an extended vacation and in the first 2 days:
 - Horrible front desk - checkin they "prepaid" my credit card for the ENTIRE stay instead of just taking a deposit... which is fine but it screwed us the rest of the trip because we couldn't charge anything to the room because technically there was no "credit card" on file. And wasn't given the option - they just did it. Later we found out by the manager "oops - we shouldn't have done that... was it debit card? ... and the answer was NO and no one ever asked
 - We tipped the frontdesk to get a nice room with a view but it was dirty and could tell it has been "used" with stains many times
 - Door handle was broken at 3am when we came home... couldn't get in
 - Took forever to get a guy to come and fix it... sat on the floor for ages waiting for them to fix it when they did show up... no accomodations for inconvenience
 - Handyman DID NOT log that he fixed it...
 - 18 hours later... Wife is in the bathroom undresssed and hears loud banging on the door like a drunk idiot trying to breakin to his own room... ignore it (hopefully they'll go away) ... they do it again... ignored... suddenly DOOR OPENS! 
 - Wife freaks out and thinks someone is breaking in and has a key to her room and she's naked on the toilet in the bathroom! 
 - Turns out it was maintainence, didn't annouce himself until he walked in... person from 3am did NOT log in that he fixed the lock (where would we be for the last 18 hours if it wasn't fixed??) 
 - Manager was rude nice... as in nice in tone but rude in conversation. Basically pawned everything off as "that's the engineering department, i don't control their actions" and "the maintainence guy was following policy" and "you're welcome to leave with a refund and no fee if you want" ... 


Dont't waste your time here. It's not about customer service - you can tell they're trained to be heartless, be fake sympathetic and offer no solutions in return but say "I understand what happened. Thanks for letting us know". 

It's ruined the rest of the trip and my wife doesn't feel safe in this hotel or our room. 

If you intend to waste your money and spend ZERO time in your room - then you're fine here. If you actually want a hotel experience from your hotel - DO NOT STAY HERE. 

I wished I spent the extra money somewhere else instead of looking for the "deal" in what seemed like a legit hotel but ends up being the same service as a cheap hotel.

We stayed in 703. There was no fridge in our room. Fridges are standard in hotel\/motel rooms aren't they? Even if it's a mini fridge. Most hotel rooms come with a fridge but this wasn't the case. We had brought a cooler of liquor, snacks, food and water\/coconut water and were planning on using a fridge but instead we filled our bathtub with ice and that was sufficient for 2 nights 3 days. If you're driving to Vegas, lug a cooler of liquor and food over. You'll save money with food and pregaming before you go out.

The bathroom is huge, it's like 80% the size of the bedroom, which didn't make sense considering they should have invested some of the space for a fridge. But it ended up making sense when 5 girls were getting ready, putting on makeup and doing our hair all at the same time. That wouldn't have been possible in a smaller bathroom. 
The door to the shower is crystal clear glass, which aesthetically looks nice but it's not really efficient when someone wants to shower and someone else wants to use the sink\/mirror\/toilet. We ended up putting a towel over the glass door so that the person showering is hidden from anyone using the sink and toilet. 
The socket would work only with one thing plugged in, which sucked because that meant only one person blow drying their hair, curling their hair, or straightening their hair at a time. We had to allot time for each person to do her hair when we could have had 2 people doing their hair at the same time.

Parking garage is not connected to the hotel portion so unless you get valet at the front desk, you'd have to roll your luggage through the shopping center and casino to get to your room.

Planet Hollywood is in the middle of the strip with a Fat Tuesday located in the shopping center and an open 24\/7 Earl of Sandwich in the casino. Knocking out iconic things to do all just by staying at Planet Hollywood. They have a buffet but I didn't go there let alone see it while I was staying there.

I've read about people complaining on the cleanliness. I thought it was average, not too clean and not too dirty but I'm comparing it to a scale of frat house dirty to spa clean. There were some tiny stains in places if you looked hard enough but it wasn't disgusting as some other people wrote that it was. Maybe I'm part of the other half of the customers that contribute to the dirtiness of the hotel instead of complaining about it. I remember spilling some cheesy mac and cheese (from Earl of Sandwich) and maybe some liquor too on the carpet in the hallway. Sorry.

Cons: no fridge, wall sockets working 50%, parking garage is far away from hotel
Pros: shopping center downstairs, bathtub filled with ice to replace the nonexistent fridge, large restroom, separate privacy door for toilet

So usually I stay at the Luxor or Venetian\/palazzo or hardrock but this time I decided to trust priceline on a last minute hotel pick. I named my price and priceline absolutely screwed me with Project Hollywood. At first I told myself "how bad could it be?", but it all started at the front desk when the man checking me in spoke to me with such attitude and insisted that I pay an extra $50 a night for a better room with a view and more space. After a couple minutes he finally convinced me and sent me up with my room keys. When I got to my room there were a couple things wrong: 
1) my view was of the roof of the building next door- totally opposite of the strip! 
2) the room was absolutely tiny and was in no way an upgrade. 
3) the bathroom had hair in the sink
4) the showers seemed moldy and dirty on the corners 

So what did I do? I called the front desk and asked to speak to the manager. 
They connected me to the manager named VICKY. I explained to her my issues and how unhappy I was and once again I receive attitude from another employee of planet hollywood. After a couple minutes of complaint, she agreed to switch me to a bigger and better room. She told me to go to the 23rd floor and a bellman will be there right away. I immediatly went up to the room she designated for me and waited TWENTY FIVE MINUTES outside the door until the bellman came with my keys and luggage. Now that's not the worst part. The worst part is that the room was the SAME thing. Same size and all. Nothing better. But by then I was exhausted and told myself to just accept it and move on. Later that night I can back to my room expecting to see my room cleaned because that's what housekeeping usually does. Expect I entered my room and was surprised to see that housekeeping cleaned only ONE OF THE BEDS!! My bed was still a mess. I called the front desk and told them my issue and all the lady tells me is "let me connect you to housekeeping". I waited 5 min until I gave up on housekeeping answering the phone. Now ontop of all that, I decided to take a shower and the water was WARM, not hot, WARMMM. who the hell wants to take a warm shower at night?????
The next day I go to valet to get my car. I wait 15 min until my car comes. Then I tip the valet guy 3 dollars and he looks and me and says "that's all?" --I thought that was one of the most disgusting things ever. Upon checkout, I insisted in speaking to VICKY (the manager). They told me she isn't available and that she will call me back asap. It has been a week and I still haven't received a phone call from VICKY or anyone at planet hollywood customer service. 

OVERALL, my experience at planet hollywood was HORRIBLE and I promise you that I will NEVER go back there even if I have to sleep in a hotel bathroom stall. I absolutely DO NOT reccomend this hotel. VICKY and all those planet hollywood employees were rude and unwelcoming to the highest level.

Worst service ever.  Scott from the valet. By far the rudest person I dealt with in 30 years of Vegas trips. He actually said " if you don't like it go pay $18 at MGM. As though since parking is free they can be rude. PH if you read this you should fire him

Planet Hollywood is a great place to stay while on the Strip. Centrally located in the center of the Strip, it provides easy access to all hotels and casinos. 

The rooms are great, especially after the remodel (formerly the Aladdin Hotel). Each room features Hollywood memorabilia...with clean beds and bathrooms. 

The casino is decent, but definitely not my favorite. As a poker player, I find their Poker Room too open, with too much noise. 

There is decent shopping to be done, with no over priced couture shops (which is either a good or bad thing depending on your shopping habits). The restaurants are plentiful, with something sure to please whatever your dining pleasure may be for the day. 

All in all, Planet Hollywood is a very casual hotel with a good vibe...

The fancy bling-bling chandeliers make staying at Planet Hollywood seem glamorous!  

The hotel and rooms are decent sized, and they gave me the David Spade room.  Okay, I get it, the hotel is Hollywood-themed.  But a David Spade room??  That is SO weird.  It was a red and black room with lots of black and white photos of him around.  It was really strange.  

The chandeliers are flashy, but the Planet Hollywood is pretty much what you'd expect from any newer Vegas hotels.  The decor is on the trendier side and the Miracle Mile shops are right there, so it's a decent place to stay.

Stayed at The Planet Hollywood Resort in the beginning of July and it was a great stay. I got a deal which included $25.00 dollars a day for a food and beverage credit, which came in handy for room service.

Valet is a must! So easy and friendly staff.

I would have given it 4 stars but we got there a little earlier than expected and asked for an early check in about 6:30 am. The clerk told us that if I checked in now I would be charged for a whole night stay and to come back at 9, I found him to be VERY rude. So we walked around the hotel but realized we were just too exhausted. We waited for an hour in the lobby and saw people going up to what looked like a check in, but we decided to still wait. 8 came around and my boyfriend was asleep on my lap so decided I couldn't wait any longer and I went up asked another lady if we can check and and she checked us in with ease, for a fee, which was fine with me. She also said early check in starts at 6.... UGH! Checkout line was VERY long just for them to say, "okay you're good."

The room was great, Adams Family theme, HUGE bed and very comfy. Plenty of space to hang your clothes and drawers to fold other clothes. The bathroom had its own private bathroom, which I loved and separate tub and shower. We were close to the elevator and the room was very quiet and dark. 

The pool was cool 21 and up, its not a pool party like other resorts but it's still fun if you're a little too hungover to catch a cab and go to a pool party. I did see a couple girls flash their boobs and then get kicked out, very funny. 

The resort has a mall connected to it and you can get very lost! But it has all your needs while staying cool. 

If I were to be going on a long stay and a romantic one to boot, I would be choosing this hotel for sure.

Took a last minute trip to Vegas for the weekend and needed something central that allowed pets, so we ended up at Planet Hollywood. First time staying here and overall it was fine for a quick trip.

Pros:
- Lots of dining options (Strip House, Koi, Earl of Sandwich, P.F. Chang's, Pink's Hot Dogs, Starbucks)
- Miracle Mile Shops and Restaurants
- Central location on the strip
- Rooms are large with spacious bathroom
- Pet friendly 

Cons:
- Valet fills up quickly and self parking is far (have to walk through mall)
- Lack of desktop power outlets
- Rooms are showing their wear
- Elevators can be slow (only bank of 6 at each end)
- The resort fee includes free wifi, but limits 
you to two devices
- No mini bar

i loved this hotel!  the rooms were very clean and comfy for our big groups.  we used the suite for 10 people!  5 girls on the bed and 5 guys on the floor.  the next day in our new rooms, the two full beds accommodated 3 girls on each.  we had to celebrate my 21st big!! the bathrooms were beautiful and the room was comfy for all of us.  

i loved the lobby and the convenient shops right downstairs so we didnt have to go out into the desert heat.  lots of places to eat and touristy shops if youre into that.  we gambled a little bit as there were plenty of tables and slot machines to waste.. or win! money at.

the only downside?  even though we got a smoke free room---i lost my voice for half the week because the smoke seeped through the vents and f-ed my voice up!!  i know it's vegas but give me a break!

First off, the old adage is true: location, location, location.  Not super expensive, yet not a tacky vegas hotel, right across the street from the bellagio and cosmopolitan, right next to Paris LV, great and lively casino, SO close to the mall, and a lot of great places to eat easily within walking distance.

The rooms are a little small, but the bathroom makes up for it.  I wish I took pictures....the bathtub in of itself made the stay so amazing. I would take a soak after I turned in for the night, and the rain shower was great too.  The bathroom had a must for me: a water closet for privacy even if someone else wants to use the shower\/bath\/sink\/whatever.  The mirror in the bathroom has that great backlit frame, so perfect for putting on makeup.  Plenty of room to put all of your stuff, too.

Ask for a strip view, otherwise you'll have a view of some weird dome thing.  

The pool was also a pretty good scene, and no cover if you are a guest of the hotel.  Good DJ. 

The room service menu was SUPERB...I had a life-changing grilled cheese with pulled pork and mac and cheese.  Even PF Changs, which is in the casino, will deliver to your room!

The only criticism I have is that...they didn't have shave kits.  I forgot my razor and even the holiday inn has shave kits, but I had to go to Walgreens to get a razor.  Found that odd for a nice Las Vegas hotel.  

But if you don't forget your razor, this place is great.

We came out here for one night and it was a turn around trip just to see Kendrick Lamar in concert. This is the first time I've stayed at this hotel and I really liked it. The hotel itself is updated and modern and I will say it attracts the crowds. It has the hotel rooms, the small casino and the shopping mall surrounding the casino which is pretty clever. 

Our room for 2 was beautiful. We had a king size bed with a tv, a fridge, and a lovely view of the strip. We had a full size bathroom with a tub, walk in shower and bathroom within its own quarters. 

I really like the aesthetics of the room compared to the last placed we stay and I would recommend staying here because it's right around everything

Worst experience ever we stayed at the resort for 3 days after the first night we woke up there was a weird bug next to my sisters face we Google Drive it it was definitely a bedbug we called managers were terrible they had to have security confirm it was a bug then moved a 2 rooms down said they would not treat our clothing until eco lab confirmed it was a bed bug 30 hours  later they called us and said it was negative wich is clearly a lie they said they would not have our stuff treated. We had to put all of our stuff  in black garbage bags before we put them in our car and we are dropping them off to get treated when we get home. we were treated badly by management never stay here. They had no concern only to cover themselves it's rediculous. Only gave them 1 star that they did not even deserve because I had to to write the review.

I wouldn't recommend Planet Hollywood. The rooms are very expensive for what is available. We checked in and there were dirty, wet pillow covers on the desk, the bathroom door knob kept falling off, and the room smelt musty. I called the front desk and they stated they'd follow up with me after the room was serviced again. It took several hours for three different people to show up and fix the issue. The front desk never followed up. Spend your money elsewhere!

Lipstick on a pig!  What a huge disappointment.  Only a few rooms actually renovated but they BS you and con you when taking reservations and on their website, then hassle you when you check in and find out your room is not one of the 'newly renovated' rooms - a rip off!.  Renovations are minimal.  Showerhead sucked; one sink; nice 40" TV, but without HD signals why bother?  They invested minimal $ to renovate the old Alladin - would not recommend this dump to anyone!  Spend a few more bucks and stay anywhere else.   The Spice Market Buffet sucks - buried down in the basement\/lower level; high walls make it way to claustrophobic and the food sucks as does the service. Best thing about the stay....Rudy the bellman took care of us big time with limo's, etc...he needs to move to a nicer property to make more money.

Casino was ok, Heart Bar was fun and packed, go-go dancers a nice touch but not a big deal; sports bar (Xtra lounge) is too small but make a good bloody mary on Sunday mornings; go visit but don't stay here.
Room is nice. The bathroom has a TV and  the toilet has its own door!  Free Starbucks as you check in from the hotel. :-D
I liked this casino but I didn't get to have fun in it I was only here for my job on work related business back in 2012.

To update the last few reviews... as of July 31st, 2007... they are still going through their remodeling to change from Aladdin to Planet Hollywood... I really liked Aladdin and its arabian theme... but I guess Planet Hollywood is going to be more futuristic looking... but for now... the rooms are really ugly!  I think they are trying to add in the Planet Hollywood touches without changing much from the aladdin rooms... but they need to get new bed comforter sheets and stuff... its UGLY... and why was there a prop from Space and pictures from Firewall and Robin Hood Prince of Theives... they should at least coordinate with each room being the same theme or something... and why is there only 2 towels in the room and no floor mat!  I had to keep calling housekeeping and they only brought one extra towel.

Had to wait in line for 45 minutes in order to get checked in.  It shouldn't take that long to get checked in.  But once we were checked in, the room was a decent size and clean.  The Planet Hollywood is more of a party hotel however and I'm just too old for it.  I buy a room to get rest not to have a place to hold a party.  I should've known better.  I'll try a more adult place next time.
Nuit blanche suite à un problème sonore de la clim...approche anti commerciale..indigne d'un tel établissement !!!!

I was recently at this hotel for a expedia conference, it was an awesome experience had a shopping mall and HM in the hotel itself so I was able to get a pair of jeans to go out in that night. I thought the rooms were beautiful nice black out shades during the day after a very long night of partying. The club was a good time as well had a  costume party going on the first night that i had stayed there. Rooms were spacious had a huge tub in my room that could fit four people which I put to the test lol. Would recommend this hotel to people very good stay. Only reason for not 5 stars to me didn't have enough rouleete tables and also they didn't have free meals like other hotels I had stayed at in the past.
Bad service, called about the toilet having problems and never showed up and were very rude on the phone. Never coming back to the hotel or casino.

Nothing special about the room. No ice machine\/microwave\/coffee maker. The biggest disappointment was the wifi which we were charged extra (Resort Fee) for only worked the first day. We spend an hour or more talking with desk clerks (twice) and tech people to try to get it fixed to no avail. They did refund two days of the Resort Fee but that still didn't get wifi in the room for us.  

Also, there was a barking dog in the room next to us. We were told PH is a pet friendly hotel but that our floor wasn't supposed to have pets on it. They said that because the other rooms for pets were full, the Diamond Member w\/dog was allowed to have their pet in the room on our floor. UGH!!! The doggie wasn't happy being left alone and everyone near its room knew it. Several passers-by made comments but the dog kept barking.  We won't be back here!

Some of the bloom has fallen off the rose for me when it comes to this place.  I'm still a fan, and I'll continue to stay here sometimes, but I've got some gripes:

We had a confirmed reservation for a room with two queen beds.  When we arrived to check in, admittedly a little late in the day on a Friday, they had no such rooms and placed us in a room with one king bed and brought up a roll-away.  The promised to move us to a room with two queen beds the following day.

When we went to registration the following day, admittedly late in the day, we were told the only room with two queen beds available was a smoking room.  After asking to be placed in another property, if necessary, a non-smoking room with two queen beds was located on the property.  

At this price point, the rooms are good sized, especially the bathroom.  However, some of the beds are beat.  When I stayed here in January, my bed was beat.  The bed in the first room we had on this trip was beat, too.  To be fair, my bed in the second room was fine.  

The hallways look a little run down and dated. To me, they look dark and dingy, and the AC in the hallways could be improved in places.  

Check out was slow.  The express check on the TV did not work the last time we stayed here, and it didn't work this time, either.  To me, there is no excuse to have customers cued up in a long line to check out if you don't have the registration desk fully staffed.  People have planes to catch and what not, and a long check out doesn't help.  

Parking is a drag here, no other way to say it.  The structure is not huge, and on a busy weekend, it takes time to find a place to park.  Once you park, you have to hike the "miracle mile" through the "Miracle Mile" shopping mall to get from the parking structure to the casino and hotel.  It's not the worst thing in the world, but I can make it painful to leave the property if you want to use your own wheels to go places during a stay.

Bad customer service. Rude house keeping. Cute hotel but Bad light for make up. They dont provide tooth brushes in case of an emergency. Also no refrigerators. I asked for house keeping to mop the bathroom floor and the lady told me to use my old towels to clean it myself. 
Like I said, cute hotel just the house keeping is rude. That's all. Access to mall is great.

I was a little disappointed in the room when I first arrived, but it was adequate. The bathroom was nice and had a nice, big bathtub (I like my bathtubs). The room temperature was easy to control and worked perfectly, which you need in the hot summer. The pool was hugely disappointing. There was more lounge space than there was pool, which I don't understand. Also, and I was not the only one to say this, but the pool was freezing. Even though it was hotter than heck outside, the pool was the extreme opposite of that. It's not healthy for the body to experience that kind of extreme. People were even in the hot tub. I mean, come on, it was 111 degrees outside and people were in the hot tub?? Make the pool a little bit warmer and I would have been able to relax perfectly. From my limited experience, the hotel and casino didn't have any noteworthy restaurants, bars or cafes. I ate and drank elsewhere.  Plus, the hotel has a laundry list of hidden fees it snipes you with at the end of your stay. The next time I go to Vegas, I'll look at other places to stay first.

I don't understand how this place has only 3 stars and so many complaints. My experience here was amazing! Upon checking in, the lady that assisted me by the name of MJ was very friendly and super accommodating! We were here for my girlfriend's birthday and so I wanted to make sure she felt special. I slipped a note to MJ stating I wanted a slice of cake sent up to the room. During lunch time there was a slice of yummy strawberry shortcake waiting for my girlfriend in our room! Amazing service and no complaints here. Hopefully everybody else can experience the same.

Went through my luggage AND organized it. Didn't take the time to clean out the dirty dishes or towels though. Just threw them on a table in the room. Two days in a row. Don't bother calling if this happens to you. They'll just make a "notation." I'd be angry if I didn't feel so unsafe.

I've never been here when it was Aladdin, so I can't really compare.  BUT, it exceeded my expectations!  We stayed in the 2 bedroom panaoramic suite and it was off the hook!!!  It fit 11 of us girls comfortably and had a Forrest Gump theme.  The room was decked out with modern decor and a mini bar w\/ a fridge where we put all the alcohol we brought.  In total, we had 2 1\/2 bathrooms and 6 beds (including roll-aways and large couches).  I'm not sure which restaurant the room service came from but the chicken strips were DELICIOUS!! haha

They also have 2 pool areas and a DJ plays music between 10am - 5pm.  We stayed there for a few hours before our flight back home...a really nice place to relax and recover from the previous nights. 

Planet Hollywood is connected to the Miracle Mile so shopping was really convenient.

Best piña colada's I've ever had are served here! Came to see Jennifer Lopez: All I Have, which was beyond an amazing show and if you get a chance should see it, we came and decided to try the piña colada & my 2 sisters and I agreed that the next time we visit, we'll be staying here and getting ALL our piña coladas from here! Keep it up guys!

I did not stay at this hotel, my rating is only on the casino

I really enjoied the high energy club energy in the casino ( I was there Saturday night 12am).

Oh how I miss Vegas already :*(

Stayed here the weekend after NYE and we had a great stay.

The casino and shops are great. Everything you need is right downstairs. Centrally located on the strip. Room was nice, flat screen tv, spacious bathroom, large tub, COMFY bed, and we got views of the Bellagio Fountains. I love the atmosphere of this hotel its young hip and modern. I'm definitely returning to this hotel, I had a GREAT time.

I do agree that once you are in the casino we got lost almost every time we needed to go to our room, the layout is weird.

Memorial Day weekend PH poolside was busy as usual. A great area to spend your day with family and friends under the sun. Service is always on point here. Bar for cocktails was long but the servers were fast, friendly & always welcoming. Drinks were great btw! Overall, you can never go wrong in PH.
NKOTB conceert.   Why is there 98% ladies.  Where da fellas at.  Cougar and saber tooth gathering.  I won tickets. It's not a bad show.  Tremendous venue

In order for me to give more than 3 stars to a casino, it must be perfectly located, have a great casino, have some cheap tables, have at least one restaurant that I always must come to, have a great show, have great rooms, and have great shopping.  So this place delivers.  Maybe not for all of the above, but a lot of them.  The Miracle Mile shops are not visually exciting or high end like Caesars Forum or Grand Canal Shoppes, but it it large with affordable stores.  Plus, it has 2 ABC stores.  Wonderful.  Casino is fun, large but can be a little loud.  It seems to cater to the younger generation.  Valet parking is among the worst, so you may want to park your own car.  Location is good with the Cosmopolitan, Aria and Bellagio across the street and Paris next door.  Plenty of restaurants, good to expensive, but not really memorable.  They could do better with a marque show, which they really don't have.  I would like to stay here, but the prices are higher than the other casinos.  I seen their rooms and thought they were nice.  I always find myself coming back to this casino.  So will you.

DO NOT STAY HERE! I was on a golf trip this week with 64 guys. 3 of us who were in TOTALLY different parts of the hotel had our rooms broken into WHILE WE WERE SLEEPING! Clearly they have an epidemic on their hands. All of our money was stolen and one guys Rolex watch. They used a master key. I still have not heard from the hotel security in regards to what they plan to do (I filed a report with security of course and followed up later). This was obviously an inside job since they were able to enter my room and I had both keys in my possession. Super scary. DO NOT STAY HERE. I could've been killed or assaulted and no one at PH seems interested in doing anything.

My SO and I had a really nice stay in Vegas last year and we decided to go back again this summer and try a different hotel on the strip. I hate to compare one hotel to another, but our stay at Paris last year was so effortless. Planet Hollywood was just okay. I'm not sure if we'd go back.

Parking: Took FOREVER. Seriously we drove around the parking garage for over an hour. The entire second floor of the garage was empty, but roped off. The valet was full. We ended up stalking a couple to their car and waited for them to load up and pull out of the space while a line of cars waited behind us. I'm sorry to all the enemies we formed in the garage that day. Last year we were in Vegas during EDC weekend and still had no issue driving in and parking at Paris.

Check in: We did it this by phone\/email the morning of and only had to pick up keys. Pretty easy.

Room: Dated but cool. We had Shawshank Redemption memorabilia on the walls and paid for a strip view. I think paying for the view was worth it, we could watch the 'surfers' and at nigh the city lights were gorgeous. Room had no mini fridge or microwave. We had a non smoking room but the hallways smelt like cigarettes and our room reeked every time we opened the door.

Pool: Thumbs down. No where to sit - people were all over the edge and the lounge chairs were down a flight steps by the cafe. You could not comfortably leave your pool bag and go hang out in the water, it would be out of sight and 60 feet away. Again, hate to compare, but Paris has way more seating around the pool edge and there are easily chairs for everyone. At PH there are mostly cabanas and rentable pool beds right near the pool edge.

Casino: Pretty average for a basic Vegas casino. The Craps table was covered in cigarette ashes. Bleh.

Redeeming point for being right next to Fat Tuesday. They have awesome drinks \/drink prices and it was just so much more fun to go there and get a slushy to bring in to the casino. 

Overall I feel like this vacation was a downgrade from last year but we paid the same amount. I'm going to try somewhere else next year.

Regret staying at this hotel. Booked this stay due to it's affordable price but honestly would rather stay at any other place for a few $100 more! When I first checked in my room it smelled like cigarettes so I requested a new one since I'm a non-smoker. 

All they could do was change me to a new room the next day because they needed to reserve the other rooms for "future guests" since the only rooms available had a Strip View! But I had to PAY OUT OF POCKET for my new room the next day! Ridiculous especially since I have asthma and that room was unbearable for me.

The front desk person even mentioned to me not all rooms are 10\/10 clean, such class! Fuck this place

Formerly known as Aladdin, this is still a little charm left at Planet Hollywood. While its located a bit further down the strip toward the less active side, there is still a lot to do here. The mall within Planet Hollywood is great - and they even offer a PF Changs! (Mmmmm...did someone say Chinese Fusion food?!).

The thing with Planet Hollywood is that they have lost their theme. Aladdin was good with keeping with the theme, and made it more like the other hotels on the strip - but Planet Hollywood - well, that's normal - it's not "vegas" (and i'm using 'vegas' as an adjective here).

Pros:
- Great location! In the middle of all the action! Just a short walk over the bridge to the Cosmo and Aria! 
- Cheap Eats (Earls, Pink Hotdogs, etc)
- Convenient mall on Site (Miracle Mile Shops)
- Decent Casino Area
- Affordable Rates 

Cons:
- No Robes or House Slippers
- No Dental Kit
- Slow Service Throughout Entire Hotel\/Casino
- Small & Crowded Pool Area


I've stayed at PH about 5 times over a span of 5 years. My most recent stay was in July 2016. I feel like my experience from a few years ago was better then my recent stay. In my opinion, PH has definitely fell off. I felt this time around the customer service was not up to par. Service is super slow! We called the front desk on 2 separate occasions for a refrigerator and extra bath towels. Both times we had to call them twice because they forgotten. A few years ago they also had robes, slippers and complimentary dental kits for guests but apparently they got rid of it. I had a rental car and valet took super long to return your car. When I was playing slots, it was very difficult trying to get the cocktail waitresses attention to order drinks. The pool area is absolutely horrible. They have 2 small pools. One for adults and another for families. In between the 2 pools they have a bunch of daybeds and lounge chairs that no one even uses. Such a waste of space! The room itself was mediocre. Nothing to rave about. I know PH remodeled some rooms, but I happen to be in the older model. I only love PH for the location, affordable rates, cheap eats and for the convenient mall that it's connected to. You really do "get what you pay for" here!

Normally I have an aversion to all things carrying a Planet Hollywood label, but it seems the former Aladdin has done a remarkable transformation into its semi-new posh look.  The Los Angeles glam and glitz theme is perfectly executed, with the property looking its best and brightest at night.  Most folks who knew the Aladdin well are sure to be impressed at the significant upgrades from the rooms to the casino.

By far the biggest changes have been in their beautiful casino, gorgeous bars \/ lounges, and the upgraded mall now known as the Miracle Mile (formally the Desert Passage).  Cheesy, but most definitely "LA" is the Extra Bar & Lounge where the show Extra is actually filmed at least once a week.  I've seen Mario Lopez doing his thing during my last few visits, I seem to forget how short he is practically every time.

Without a doubt, the most impressive interior changes have been made to its casino.  The abundant tables with the chic dealers do a good job of allowing their patrons to enjoy their surroundings.  Poker players are sure to like the decent sized Poker room, however, PH doesn't run many poker events as often as they do other house rated games. I could be wrong on this, but it doesn't seem that their craps tables are rated on odds, resulting in better comps for bigger players.  Their A+ program seems to be pretty good and previous Aladdin players can resume their statuses from past play.  One thing that I wish they'd improve on is the ventilation on the casino floor, its a little too smoky on the weekends.

So what's the deal with the rooms?  The larger suites and some of the standard rooms are still sporting the Aladdin decor, which are all going to be finished sometime this year.  The regular rooms (Hollywood, Deluxe, etc.) are tiny and are 400 sq ft at best.  That's solid for a Manhattan studio but not fabulous in Las Vegas.  The big suites on the other hand (Panarama, Fountain Views, Boulevard etc) are fantastic with plenty of space (1500 sq ft +) and usually sport a great view.

Service all around is fairly good.  From the folks at the front desk to the executive staff running the joint to even the bartenders at the lounges, everyone has been sporting a smile without a snotty LA attitude (thank goodness this theme aspect never carried over).

Since the PH takeover, the demographic for this casino property went from senior citizen level to extremely young.  There are more youngins frequenting this joint more than ever, attracted by the trendy glow of its LA theme with potential celebrity sightings given their constant publicity (Pageants, concerts, Extra airings, shows, etc.).  The younger generation could use some better nightlife, Prive is a disappointment and their lounges can get boring once the eye candy wears thin.

PH has my vote for 5\/5 location! First time staying here and they are some pros and cons! The pros; location, location, location!!!! Mid-center of the strip where the action is!! Everything you need is in the hotel! The Miracle Mile shop is very good and they have all the stores you need. Earl of sandwich, starbucks, fat tuesdays, foot locker, champs, flight 23 and etc! Also the walgreens is steps away! The rooms are somehow out dated but we still managed! The only reason why we ended up here was because we booked last min and there was no more space at the cosmo!

this hotel is so wacked!  one star is an overstatement. their computer system couldnt recognize our room number even after we had stayed their for 2 nights! went to the front desk four times until they could fix the problem.  plus their rooms had paper thin walls!  I couldn't rest at all because of the stupid music playing all day by their pool. This looked to me like a 2-1 star motel at best.

Came in town for a weekend to celebrate a couple birthdays. I had booked a basic two queen non-smoking room a month in advance, and adding an extra night to the reservation was quick and easy over the customer service rep over the phone.

 Valet was convenient as we had a lot of luggage, ice cooler, and snacks. We arrived on a Thursday night at 11:30 pm and there was a long line to check-in. Fortunately, the line moved quickly.

I did the $100 trick, in hopes to upgrade to a suite. The employee searched the system diligently for a good 10 minutes, but apparently they were all booked that weekend and the only upgrade available was a room with a strip view. Boo...

They were still able to honor my request for connecting rooms with my friends.

Pros:
- Spacious
- Hot tub + shower

Cons:
- No vanity mirror for the ladies
- No fridge
- No bathroom fan
- Bottle opener costs $5.19 via room service

We stayed at a pet stay room on the 8th floor facing the pool. Here are some pros and cons:

Pros:
Room size-a very spacious room (category RR) with a large foyer and a double door leading to a huge bathroom with two separate sinks. There is a shower and a tub, and the toilet is in a separate room with a full size door. 

Comfy bed. 

Shower water pressure - too much of a good thing is not always good, but I am listing this under the pros because I'd rather have high than lower pressure. It was so strong though, I felt my fat cells beaten to a pulp (again, why its under the pros). But seriously, ph, please adjust the water pressure or you are going to injure someone soon. 

Location-right in the center of the strip! Couldn't be more convenient than this! 

Cons:
Noise level-our room facing the pool can hear and feel the beat of the pool music starting from 9 am. My iPhone app measured the decibel at 67; that's equivalent to the sound level of normal piano practice or a normal conversation between people 3 ft apart.  

Parking\/valet-three days here and we haven't been able to valet. It's always full.  Self parking is quite a ways from the hotel lobby, you have to walk half around the 1 mile shipping center to get to the hotel  there is no shortcut! 

Cleanliness-casino area appears really clean, but the room shows its age age and I would give it 7.5\/10 in cleanliness. Shower tiles and grouts were a little yucky.  At this price range, I am not complaining much.  You do get what you paid for. At least it's way cleaner than Rio's pet friendly room. 

Dog potty area - it's a small grass area about 3 minutes walk from the hotel lobby. It's not  maintained very well but serves its purpose. I just wish all the pet owners would pick up after their pets...we saw several piles of poop left behind even when there is a fully stocked trash bag\/can station. There are large palm tress providing shades most of the day. A good thing during the summer months here.

YES! Yes stay here. I don't know anything abotu the casino itself but the rooms are all nice and unique with great views. It's also connected to The Miracle Mile shops, which is arguably the best mall in all of Vegas.

There is no security here so it's a great place to go if you're looking to hire a girl for the night, plus just downstairs is a Frederick's of Hollywood where you can get your paramour a present.

From the Miracle Mile Valet you go right off the escalator, left at the Quetzalcoatl, Right at the Angel and you'll be right by the guest elevators. Follow my directions or wander for eternity in woe.

Awe, Planet Hollywood, the sweet memories of bad decisions, past.
This is one of your cheaper options in Vegas if you're looking to stay on the Strip and be near enough touristy Vegas things. 
The rooms are all themed with movie stuff. They feature (B-rated) movies and put prints up on the walls and have some props in glass tables and such. My suite was Showgirls suite (nothing but class for my 30th birthday!!), and featured a very creepy jumpsuit. But really, how much time do you spend in the room??
I would like to note that there was no mini bar and no fridge, which was a bummer. And seriously guys- get some locks for those bathroom doors!!
The casino is within stumbling distance to the flamingos at the Flamingo and lots of restaurants and shops on the strip and is connected to the Miracle Mile Mall.
The casino itself is just like any other- not a lot of interest other than gambling. They also have the Gordon Ramsey restaurant, BRGER, which, predictably, only serves burgers.
We spent a surprising amount of time inter Mexican restaurant- YOLOs. I think enough is said about that!

Don't stay here. 
Dirty, smelly room. 
Nice staff though. 
No atmosphere. Stayed for a work conference then switched hotels. 
No transport between other hotels\/airport. 
Buffett was iffy for breakfast did not try after. Very few amenities and ugly hotel\/casino. Toiletries smell unpleasantly like roses. 
Rude slow service at planet dailies. 
Liked pretty much every casino we visited better than PH. 
Myoffice manager called front desk to have all the rooms billed to her card, but none of us were able to bill to her card at checkout. 
No fridge in room for my medicine. No easily accessible outlets for phone charger and c-pap, had to pull the bed out to plug it in. 
Nice view, but we asked for an upgrade and our friend who did not upgrade had a much better view

This was my 2nd trip to vegas in the last 3 months to catch some shows and gamble with my wife. When we arrived we had to drive around the block twice to find valet\/parking, its behind the hotel but i guess they can't afford a sign? Parking is an issue here if you think you are going to pull and valet your car and start your vacation you have another thing coming. They have no parking! The valet apparently holds a minimal amount of cars and when that is full you get to park in the mall parking next to hotel and walk. This is a good trek 15-20 minutes. Ridiculous! I budget 1k a day for my wife and i when Im in vegas all being spent in this hotel and i cant park my renta car!
Wont stay here again.

this hotel was awesome!!! rooms were very spacious and excellent view of the strip.  also in the rooms are themed with various actors\/actresses photos from movies or memorabilia. the casino had huge variety of machines\/tables.  they also have the pleasure pit which starts at 8pm everynight and goes on until 4am(?).  the in-house show there is peepshow featuring holly madison from girls next door fame.  the show was very entertaining and price wasn't too bad. i paid $76 for seating which was towards the back of the arena but it's a small one so you could still see the show well.  i also paid an additional $100 for the meet and greet with holly madison.  the meet and greet is limited to the first 30 customers to purchase it for each show.  the hotel is also connected to the miracle mile shops where they have excellent dining and a wide variety of shops.  a good place to eat is the earl of sandwich...sandwiches are delish and prices are reasonable.  they also have a fat tuesdays so you can grab your favorite frozen alcoholic beverage in either 22oz or 100oz.  i would def stay at this hotel again!

I've stayed here four times now, and every time is the same. Great location, but rooms are always dirty. One time, there was a crusty stain in the carpet by the bed. Gross. Every time there's always a layer of dust on everything. The cabinets always look grimy. The purple chair always seems to have inconspicuous stains. The bed however, has always been clean. 

I think there are much better options on the strip, and I would never book this place for myself.

Pretty good place to stay. I was here on a weeknight for business and the price was right. The parking structure is a walk but if you're here for pleasure that's probably not an issue. However, having to run in 110 degree weather to get to my car for a meeting in south Vegas is a pain though! 

Service was excellent and staff were very friendly. There was a very nice gentleman near the casino elevators that spa seers questions and provides directions. The only issue I had was that when I arrived to my room, I noticed the hallway was filled with cigarette smoke and my room smelled like five gallons of rubbing alcohol was spilled in it that morning. A simple room change and all was better.

Not thrilled with this resort.  Stayed here several times for a conference. Rooms not very clean .. Dusty.  Sink and floor in bathroom dirty no coffeemaker no refrigerator.  One day at 4:00 I had to go out and ask them to clean room. Casino is so smoky you can't breathe!! My head hurt for days  . We walked through other casinos and they were not nearly as smokey. Also the miracle mile had nice shops but one part of it smells like sewer every time we visit. 
I hope to not stay here again.

There is ROT associated with this hotel.  

The superficial elements are one thing (and they leave much to be desired) - but rather I'm talking instead about its management, and some very nasty tactics they  used to tack over a hundred dollars in extra fees onto a PRE-PAID hotel bill.  The whole incident was very "unkosher," to put it nicely.  (I'd use a harsher term, but I'll refrain here...you can probably imagine.)  I have the backup in writing, so I've taken the matter to my credit card company.  But adding insult to injury, the hotel's Assistant Manager stood back and said "Not our problem." Such actions should be condemned in the strongest possible terms, if only because they are the precise opposite of hospitality.  Disgusting.  Despicable.  Worth avoiding by staying elsewhere.

If someone from the hotel were to contact me I can provide additional details, including the names of the individuals in question.
Worst video blackjack anywhere. You can't split pairs or double down.  I am not sure why they make the game so hard to win at.

I like Planet Hollywood. The decor is modern. I like the different bar options in the casino. I do enjoy the dancers at table pit to keep gamblers and others entertained. The only downfall is that the parking garage to the casino feels like you are walking in a marathon...definitely a good way to have people stop by at the shops.

The only thing this place has going for them is the Britney show. Best show I've ever seen. Would come again for the show but not to stay at this hotel. I've never witnessed so much incompetence and straight lack of brain cells in one vicinity ever. Would not stay here again. Going to stay at Paris next door next time as it is convenient and very close walking to the Britney show and most likely are more technologically advanced to have an mp3 connection in the room. I hope I remember where I valet because driving to this hotel is confusing as f#%k.! Giving one star because it won't let me hit the next key to proceed and enlighten the world about this recent hotel experience.

VALET YOUR CAR!!!!!!

We didn't valet our car b\/c valet was full so we resorted to parking in their what-appears-to-be-spacious,-but-in-reality-isn't parking structure.  Once inside you enter the circular mall and have to go around it to reach the lobby to check in.  I REALLY HATE the mall goes in a circle and you get so lost in which way you're going trying to find a way to get to the hotel.  

The hotel overall is beautifully designed with lighting, comfortable carpeting and helpful employees.  

We asked for 2 beds, but there wasn't any available so we were upgraded to a king-sized bed and got the corner room with a view on the strip.  I LOVE that PH is in the center of the Strip and conveniently next to Paris, across Bellagio, Cosmopolitan and City Center.

with all due no respect, anyone giving this dump more than 2 stars has to be stoned, drunk, or a combo of both on the entire trip. 
5-years since last visit.
Pros: miracle mile is remodeled and extended...has some nice shops and a ton of dining options which look so good, like fried lobster, burgers, Mexican, even an oyster bar. Very cool walk.

Cons: same miracle mile walk applies when you self-park; you have to walk with your roll-aways through the whole fucking mile and 1\/2 the fucking casino to register.
Very poor signs, hard to see anything clearly, got lost over and over even on 2nd day still was confused at the layout.
Pool is, by faaaarrrr the WORST I have ever seen inside a LV strip property. Just terrible, and no wonder 65% empty. 2 tiny ass pools, split with some lame disgustingly dirty and blacked chairs that looked filthy. Pools smell like ass, literally. The chorine smells like a combo of ass and feet, my sandals smelled like shit until I got home and scrubbed them to death. Even NYNY pool is better. Hell even buffalo bills on the border (at least it has a cute buffalo shape)
Each pool has maybe 10 lounge chairs, not a typo, TEN. Rest are cabanas, believe me you don't wanna be at this pool its beyond awful. You sit in the middle area with the lounge chairs I mentioned, there is nothing around you but walls, blackjack pit, and the cement ground. You cant even see the pools if you sit there. The left pool is where the disgusting party is at, with 50-60 people in a 15x10 shitty kitty pool swapping venereal diseases, and then the other shitty pool that's quieter. It was so depressing left after 1\/2 hour. If your coming for a vegas pool, this is the LAST resort, literally. Never in my life smelled something so fowl like the whiff of this pool.
Gambling....they have not as many game choices, table wise as other casinos, and very limited double deck blackjack, lots of empty 3 card poker bullshit tables that no one plays.
Nightmare car entrance that's hidden, sooo confusing, and the parking mess. At least its across the cosmo, so you can access that easily, provided their escalators work (which never were in 2 days unfuckingbelievable)
Rooms were dinky, crappy, chipped, marked, pubed.They have 2 tiny-ass drawers, the desk doesn't even have pens and paper, another joke.
Shower pressure was awful, shower looks like 1970's shower. 
In all, an awful experience. Just come walk the mile shops eat something buy something then GTF outta this shithole; stayed at motels with nicer rooms.
No fridge to put drinks.
Everything seems to be on a different level\/floor; the pool, the buffet, the registration, where\/which door is LV Blvd?  Get me the fuck outta here. It was so bad I cut one free day (comps from father in laws slot play) and came back sat night instead of staying another night.
BOTTOM LINE:
TABLE GAMES ARE A RIP-OFF. 6 to 5 for blackjacks on DOUBLE DECK, a Vegas first.
WALK 1.5 MILES AFTER PARKING TO CHECK IN
HORRIBLE BUFFET
HORRIBLE LAYOUT GET LOST OVER AND OVER
HORRIBLE I MEAN HORRRRRIBLE POOL THAT SMELLS LIKE ASS AND FEET
GORDON RAMSAYS SMEAR MUG ON EVERY WALL AND ELEVATOR
CRAPPY ROOMS
Rooms are well worn. Furniture is thread worn and banged up. Carpet stained. This hotel in desperate need of remodel.

This would have been a 4 star review until the 90 minute wait at the valet. I get it, it's check out time but to have only 6 valet on service is poor management and bad customer service especially at the end of a great stay. I won't come back for this fact alone.

I remember staying at this hotel back when it was the Aladdin, and when it became PH, I was a bit curious how they integrated the "Aladdin" theme into their overall space, because they didn't change the Miracle Mile shops or their buffet, which is still named "Spice Market."

We finally had the chance this past weekend to stay, since it was one of the more reasonably priced hotels for a trip on a whim, and it was a great location - super central, close to the Cosmopolitan (where we like to eat and drink), Paris (more eating) and Aria (even more eating).  Husband booked us a Strip-view room, and we were in the north tower on the 37th floor.

Great views - we were directly across from the Cosmo and could see (and hear) the Bellagio fountains.  However, the amazingness of the room pretty much stops there.

-The bathrooms were outdated
-We had a nice little accumulation of dust on the side tables (and even after housecleaning came by, they were still dusty), and the entertainment unit\/shelving looked pretty tired
-There wasn't much of a theme to the room, basically one or two posters of old movies
-Saturday night there was this strange whooshing sound around our window - it did that every few minutes for about an hour, then went away
-The worst part was when I turned on the sink Saturday night and no hot water came out.  I waited a few minutes, then gave up and continued to brush my teeth.  The next morning, still no hot water (just from the sink, the shower was fine).  We told the front desk upon checking out, so hopefully they went and checked it out.

Basically stay at PH for the location and price, as it's cheaper than Cosmo and Aria but still near shopping and good food.  But for a nicer, more modern stay, go to Aria or Cosmo.

The actual hotel and casino itself is pretty nice. The rooms I've been in were clean and it had a very modern look. Any staff I've interacted with for the most part was pleasant whether is be gambling, eating or just cruising through.
