There was no line, but it took us 45 minutes from the time we walked up to the counter and the time we left.
Dana is absolutely horrible, she began to work with us and my mom had some questions. Granted, her english isn't the best but i'm sure you work with a ton of foreign customers that have even more limited english. She was immediately rude right off the bat. Spoke with a pretentious tone and didn't even try to understand her question which really wasn't that difficult.
Immediately i grew a dissatisfied look on my face and one of the other employees noticed so she tried to make some small talk, sorry that's not going to help enough.
After she took 15 minutes to literally swipe our cards and turn my mood sour, we were turned over to wait on the side for someone to actually put the passes on our cards.
Julie walks out and is useless. She just stands there and asks some questions regarding an administrator key or card and also tells us to wait.
20 minutes later a man walks out and helps out with the line that has developed, the asian guy now helping us asks him something and he brushes him off.

after another 10-15 minutes of just standing there turns out the guy that walked out was the one with the key needed to work the ONE computer they have that can add the passes onto our cards.
Their counter was fully stocked of useless employees, he could have taken a second when he walked out to help us and another pair of people waiting to get passes loaded before helping with the line, but that would only make them useful.

The room is a standard vegas hotel room, none of them are bad, this one is pretty modern.
I'd still prefer to stay at caesars where the service is phenomenal and have various pools to lounge it.
DON'T COME HERE FOR ANY SERVICE.
It's also one of the buffet's worth skipping.

My fiancé and I went on a short vacation to vegas last week. Being from Southern California we have been to vegas more often than I care to mention because of a minor gambling and free alcohol problem. We never stayed at planet Hollywood before and thought we would give it a try, to our amazement the parking to the hotel is seriously 15 minutes from the main lobby if you know where you are going through the mall and are lucky enough to find lobby escalators in the middle of the casino. Also, there is no acoomodations for the travel savvy as far as bringing some food to save some money. After being told there was a fridge in our room we found out they have a portable fridge for a 25 dollar fee. We had an upgraded red suite with a tub and it was by far the worst looking suite room I have ever stayed in having a broken curtain and nothing special but a tub in it, so DO NOT upgrade it is the same as a normal room....better yet for the money you can get a much better deal and room at the flamingo, paris or a room at the mgm.

If I could give this place 0  or negative stars I would. WORST EXPIERENCE EVER BY FAR, I booked a king bed suite in the renevated part of the hotel non smoking, I also checked in online early that morning. When we arrived they thought it would be perfectly okay giving us a king bed in a smoking room when I booked non smoking. When I proceeded to show them the confirmation email I was told it didn't matter what room u book , that it doesn't mean you are getting the room you paid for???? What? Than why does anyone pay more for a nice room. so our only option was a king smoking room or a queen nonsmoking  room in the unrestored part of the hotel however we would not get the difference in money back!! Than we were told that they would save the room we did book for us for the next day just to return to the concierge. we didn't want to stay in a smoking room so a good amount of my money went to waste. Than the room was missing furniture that had been pulled out of the wall, nails sticking out of the walls and on the floor, the blinds were filthy and wouldn't even work, there was small pieces of trash scatters around the floor as if It was never vaccumed. The next day they still had NO rooms available that we had booked? Why does anyone pay more for a nice room if your just going to give us ur shitty room anyways and not return the difference in money???? The manager did not seem to care and I was too nice to continue complaining as there were others also waiting to speak to the manager. So we dealt  with our shitty disgusting room and ate the money we lost. As we were finally leaving the room we ran into another older couple that were so angry about their room and turns out the same situation had happend to them and their room was as bad as our. We all agreed we will NEVER return! They sure know how to scam ppl out of their money!(at least that couple received no service fees for the nights they stayed, after complaing for hours lol) So sadend this is how my boyfriend had to spend his birthday. He also stays here all the time as he travels to vegas for all sorts of conventions for work, and he never has had this sort of service and usually gets free upgrades when they wanted to charge me 150 more a night! But since it wasn't his name on the card they felt it was okay to shit all over us. Now he and his colleges will never stay there again after the service he witnessed I received and other familys and couples. if you DO decide to stay here I recommend you book the cheapest room as that is what you're going to receive anyways and you'll lose the extra money you put in for a nicer room. Save your time and your money!!!

Just awful! 

So I went here mainly to inquire about a show. I asked the concierge where I go to get info on tickets and he directs me to the back cashier. So I go to the back cashier and they said that I was almost there when I came inside, It's by the concierge station. I said impossible because he told me to come here. It was a confusing nightmare. After I told the staff that they aren't very smart, I left and will never return. There's no signage, there's nobody to ask for help, it's a very poorly run casino.

Let me start off by saying that I am giving it four stars in terms of service, price, and location. Service. Everyone was extremely helpful, knowledgeable and very nice. The front desk was extemely accommodating after the distaster that was the shuttle ride from the airport( see my review for grey line shuttle, then never use it!!!) I used a tip I found from www.frontdesktip.com check out the site even if you stay somewhere else.  It works. They gave us an upgrade to a larger room with a view on the 22nd floor. Room service was not overly expensive and very prompt. I called downstairs at 3a.m. for toothpaste and within 5 minutes I had a knock on the door from a bellman. Very fast response time. As I usually do in any hotel I asked for a later check out and was promptly granted a 1:00 time. We didnt actually leave the room until after 2 pm without a hassle. I signed the departure slip and dropped it along with my key in the box in the lobby. I feel that we could have stayed until 4pm or so before being told it was past check-out time. Price. I booked a two night package through lasvegas.com including airfare I payed $467 for two including taxes. Not a bad deal considering the location. It is situated right on the strip across from the Bellagio and next to Paris. In short, great location, very competitive prices, and a good experience made better by an attentive staff. Now if only I was so lucky on the blackjack tables. But that is a different story.

I loved loved loved this casino!

I went to Vegas for 4 days with my husband and we visited all the hotels and almost all the casinos. We found that this one was the best in music and ambiance. 

While other casinos are more elegant and sophisticated, this one feels way more fun! Like for young people!. The music is amazing, the dealers are very friendly and they do everything to make you have a great time while playing. The times goes by so fast in here!

The service is good... could be better but at least the waitress are checking on your drinks every now and then... they won't abandon you.

And yes, there are girls dancing in a pole in front of you in some of the tables, so this is the perfect place for a bunch of guys on a bachelor's party. Girls, drinks, gambling... what else could you ask for guys?

When I stayed at PH back in April, my friends and I stayed at I believe their largest suite (or one of the largest suites). The room was huge! It had multiple sofas, 2 bathrooms, huge tub, a bedroom, a minibar and a mini museum built into the room! Costumes are displayed throughout the room behind glass and the room offered a gorgeous view of the Bellagio fountains & Paris hotel. Beds are comfy and the decor is Hollywood-esque.

My favorite part of the room was the polka-dot backdrop that makes a perfect background for pictures before heading out for the night!

Access to our rooms were super easy to get to! Walked in, elevators to the right and off we went. We got the two bedroom suite. The living room area was nice. Had a very modern decor with vintage portraits hanging from the walls. Plenty of seating in the living room area. We even had an air hockey table right in the corner. That became very useful when we were getting ready to paint the town red. The restrooms were large. Separate shower and bath but only one sink. That didn't feel right? 

Our room had a very great view of the Bellagio fountains, Eiffel tower, that big "paris" ball, a great view of the strip. 

The only thing I didn't like was that the bed was a little to firm for me. I didn't get to sleep that well because of that.

What a deal! My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights this past week because they had a promotion of 10-nights for $599, any day any time! You can use them in blocks, so we will be returning in January to use our remaining 5 nights :) Plus, you still qualify for their free bottle per stay even with this promotion. They have a small selection of brands you can choose from, but hey, it's free so who cares?! We ended up choosing Skyy vodka.

The rooms here are spacious- my only complaint is that the TV and beds were positioned in a way where we couldn't really watch it? But oh well, we're not there to sit in our beds and watch TV anyways! The bathroom was huge and perfect for 2-4 girls sharing since there were 2 separate large counters.

We arrived around 6:15PM on a Saturday.  Non-smoking rooms were quite scarce at the time and we needed two when only one was available.  We ended up upgrading one of our rooms for an extra $50\/night in order to get another non-smoking room.   (BTW the lady at the front desk didn't even think to suggest that to us.  I had to ask)  That part didn't  bother me too much since they told me that smoking\/non-smoking is not guaranteed when I made the reservation.  

What did bother me was that neither room had been cleaned yet! They told me that it wouldn't take too long to get them ready and to come back around 7.   Guess what?  The first room wasn't released to us until 8PM and the second room (that we paid an extra $50\/night for)  wasn't issued to us until 10PM.  To top it off the they admitted that they hadn't finished cleaning the room (after nearly 4 hours of waiting!) but since we had waited so long, they just re-assigned us to an identical room on a different non-smoking floor.  That was probably the worst part of our experience.  At least the rooms were clean enough and once we got past that horrible first day, our stay was ok.

The parking structure is kind of far but I found out that if you exit the hotel from the lobby floor and turn left, walk for a few minutes and go past the tour bus pickup area, you can get to the parking lot elevators in a few minutes.  That was much easier than exiting the casino and going halfway around the Miracle Mile to get to the same parking elevators.  

Oh yeah, I called the front desk on 3 separate occasions during our stay.  A live person never answered the phone.  I was on hold for about 10 minutes once.  For some reason the express checkout system on our TV wasn't working so I had to go to the front desk to check out.  I thought that was weird.
The rooms look like they could use some rerenovating, but the price more than makes up for that. Its also in a good location on the strip, and the staff is friendly and helpful!
Hotel room are dated and blah. Construction on the the floor above us started at 7am.... Needless to say I didn't get to bed until 5am. F@*$ this place.

The best part about this place is the location. It's smack in the middle of the action and you have the Miracle Mile Shops. The crowd is young -- the average age is probably 30 or less, which is perfect for me. 

Here's a tip (literally): try the $20 tip trick (google it if you don't know what it is). We paid for the cheapest room (Hollywood Hip room) and ended up with a corner Resort Room with a strip view and the tub overlooking the Bellagio fountains on the 19th floor. That would have costed us $200-$300 more. I'd say it's worth it, but try to find the front desk agent that's the most easy-going so that you don't fail with the upgrade attempt.

About the room itself:
Planet Hollywood is the old Aladdin Hotel and Casino. You can still see the the signs of it with the "magic lamp" faucets in the bathrooms. The bed is comfortable and the room is simple but nice. As far as rates are concerned, they vary day to day. From my experience, they were cheap (under $100\/night) about 2 months before your check-in date, and then they slowly start going up each day all the way until the 48-hour cancellation period, where they then start having $79\/night specials (which made me mad because I couldn't cancel my old reservation and rebook it). I used Kayak.com to book the rooms.

The machines seemed a little tight, like most on-the-strip hotels. The poker room is laid-back with very little sharks. The rake is a little high ($5\/hand) but they do have a high-hand jackpot for quads or higher (I hit a 4-of-a-kind, which is $50. No complaints from me). Waitresses and the Pleasure Pit dealers wear the skimpiest outifts. Guys, you will like. LOL

The last suggestion is the Earl of Sandwich. If you like Arby's, you will LOVE this place. I had the original roast beef sandwich and the loaded potato soup. FRIGGIN AWESOME.

- Reasonably priced eateries and shopping.  
- Central location on the Strip.
- Haven for NYE (New Year's Eve) to get in from the cold for a little.

Hmm... How did Planet Hollywood get a 4 stars rating?  If someone is bending my wrist, I would probably give them a 3.5 stars max.

With that being said, I am happy that my room was still around when I finally made it to the check in counter at midnight.  What is the point of having a "VALET \/ CHECK-IN" lane when they cannot accommodate the capacity?  I end up having to self-park and literally walked the "Miracle Mile" to get to the check-in counter.  Oh, did I mention that you have to go one floor down by the bar to reach the check-in?  

Yup, you can tell I am not a happy camper, especially when I am tired from sitting in traffic and having to lug my bags all the way around the stupid mall to check in.  This is the most ridiculous design and a total waste of my time.  I know I need exercise, but just not at that particular moment.  Bleh.

I booked for a non-smoking room with 2 beds.  The room itself was nice and spacious, and bathroom have tub, shower and bathroom (with a separate door).  I had a room facing the strip but the window was ridiculously small, and I was too lazy to move the chair to catch a glimpse of the strip.  Everything was the way it suppose to be.  No major complaints or surprises.

Oh yea... Make sure you put your "Do Not Disturb" sign before you go to sleep, or the housecleaning will pound on your door at 9am.  Good stay, but I hated the distance between parking and check-in.

I stayed here for work, not pleasure. An event held @ PH 05\/18. I think the hotel is nice enough however they stick about 3 zillion TV's into every room...including the elevator! The peepshow videos were everywhere which annoyed me but what can you do...

Will mention wonderful people watching area over-looking the Heart Bar. :)

Conveniently located in the middle of the strip.  Self-Parking is about a mile away but the hotel does offer free valet for hotel guests its just that they take a long time to bring your car around.  Gordon Ramsay's BURGR is a treat to have late night and hotel is next to shopping center.

So if you are going to LV the location is great but the "resort &casino" is a tired old place that is in need of better management and and a face lift.  The check in lobby is jammed with people trying to get their room keys while employees at the "diamond" check in are chatting.  Want to be diamond?  pay more $ for what should be typical service?  I paid for a strip view room.  The room was old, the rug was coming up off the floor, and the doors and surfaces were dirty.  The strip view was of the roof of the casino.  The nickel and dime you.  A "resort fee" is added to the bill for what?  a crowded swimming pool where you pay extra for towels?

Plant Hollywood is just not worth its great location, just not worth the price.  Management does not care.  They are in the volume game.  It is your money, so go spend it someplace else.

This place needs some serious love. The TV's in the room are plasma and has ghost images in the panel. The rooms are a little dated but the one we had was big. The size was impressive but lacked things you expect in a modern resort like outlets to charge devices, hard to find in the rooms, such as behind the bed. I would love to stay at this resort again IF all the rooms were updated and you didn't have to pay more for modern rooms. I guess that's asking too much in Vegas these days.

Also am I missing something but is the walk thru the mall unnecessary for self parking?

Oh god, where to begin.....

The room was dirty. VERY dirty. The "velvet" headboard had a layer of (I hope) dust, and the bedskirt was stained and disgusting. I sprayed for bed bugs and slept on top of the sheets on the JIC.

The bathroom was as bad as rest of the room. The floor hadn't been mopped in weeks (at least) as evidenced by the mildewed grout lines, so to be safe I was sure to shuffle around on a towel rather than allow my feet to touch the floor.

There were splatters on the wall, cobwebs - complete with dead gnats - in the corners, and the window shade was broken and water stained. This was probably a nice hotel 10 years ago, but now it's just the red-headed stepchild of the better hotels. If you're a business traveler like me, you do NOT want to stay at this hotel, nor do you want to bring clients here. It's really for the under 25 crowd that's out to drink, have fun on the Strip and not stay in their rooms for any extended period of time. I felt downright scuzzy the whole time I was there, and couldn't wait to get home and take a long, hot "Silkwood" shower (if you've seen the movie, you get it).

Next door to me was an obnoxious group of people who snuck a dog into their room. Between the loud arguments and the dog barking, it was tough to get any decent sleep. Down the hall was another stellar group, who took the fighting to a whole new level, spilling out into the hallway at 2am telling each other to f* off. Round the clock fun for all.

Do the Strip a favor and bulldoze this place!

Originally we booked a Hollywood Hip Two Queen bed via Vegas.com and ended up getting one King instead. Called Vegas.com and originally said they could not change it but later did. When we arrived at the hotel, we found out that it was still one king bed; however, the front desk was able to change it for us. Afterwards, he told us about an upgrade for $250 to the Panorama suite, at the time we decided against. 

However, the mattresses of the room had very bad quality springs so we went downstairs to do an upgrade. Now a different front desk agent told us it was a $350 upgrade instead and that was the best they can do; we asked for the original agent who said about the $250 but it took almost 10min to find him, at the end who didn't even show up and just had the other agent tell us that it was only "part of the room" that was a $250 upgrade. 

We finally decided to finally do an upgrade to the "full room" for $300 extra. We went up to the room, only to find out that the living room TV was broken, as well as a few of the lights. It seemed like nobody's rented the room in a while. Then, we literally stayed and slept in the room for less than 4 hours and did an express check-out the following day. A day later, we discovered that our credit card was charged an extra $864 dollars. We called Planet Hollywood and waited for almost 30 minutes, was redirected from the front desk to the manager, then to the security, to find out that we had "damaged the mattress," which most likely could have been caused by the previous renter provided that so many things either did not work or was unsatisfactory. The security told us the manager is not available at the moment and gave us a "risk management" number to call at 9:30am in the morning. We later found out, of course, it was a random lady's number. 

They did not intend to deal with us at all, nor did they inform us anything before charging our credit card for this uncalled fee. Needless to say, we will NEVER be staying at this hotel again and recommend anyone against doing an upgrade if you already have a room.

One of most strategically located hotels on the strip. Almost everything is at a walkable distance from this hotel which works in favour of the hotel.

Our room was nice,spacious with a really nice theme. The front desk staff was helpful and attentive. Well there is Miracle Mile which consist of all the major brands selling the merchandise. One can spend almost a full day on the miracle mile. They have couple of good bars and restaurants inside. They also night clubs Koi and Chateau inside which are really club spots.
Gambling is OK, it does have some pretty good shops, check out the Volcom store.

Maybe I expect too much, or maybe I just expected more from a Las Vegas Strip Hotel.  Obviously the Casino and the Mall was beautiful--yes it was.  BUT, once I opened the door of my hotel room--it was a different story.  ( BTW: THIS RATING IS FOR A NORMAL GUEST ROOM NOT A SUITE) I sure their suites should be a lot nicer.  Anyways, I felt like some basic essentials were missing... NO Fridge, NO Microwave, NO Water Bottles and Obviously no goodies i.e. candy, alcohol, soda etc. Cause there's NO FRIDGE.  I felt that downed a star for me already. THEN, looking at all the furniture... it was scratched up, dented and a bit dirty for my taste.  I do not like.  Next thing... There's 2 beds, thus that means that this hotel room is made for more than one person.. yes?  Well.. I was sharing it with a co-worker for a tradeshow and did not use the restroom once.  The restroom is has 2 doors.  The French doors that opens and closes the powder room and the bath tub ( which I liked) and with a shower. By the Shower... there's a door which opens to this very very small bathroom stall.. and NO VENTS, NO WINDOWS NO NOTHING.... And talk about NO sound proofs doors.  I don't want anybody hearing my business... I was able to hear all the room showers near my room.  Literally every time I would come back into the room.. I would here showers, toilet bowls flush.  All in all, I don't feel like the room that was presented to me was worth it. THANK god it didn't come out of my pocket.  I dislike *thumbs down

BTW: WiFi is free for ONLY 1 electronic PER day.

Recap:

- No Privacy
- No Fridge
- No Microwave
- No Ventilation
- Sucky Bedding
- Sucky Bed

I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite here with a group of 20 friends this past weekend.  The suite was aesthetically pleasing and probably one of the better suites we've stayed at in Vegas.  It had a neat projector, leather couches, kitchen, beautifully designed rooms and lovely decor as you'd expect from any suite in Vegas, etc.  This was definitely a place for the younger crowd to stay, with many peeps in their 20s and 30s.  

We got a free cabana at the pool that came w\/ our suite which I believe was normally a $300 value.  It was pretty darn small, though, and one of the uglier pools I've been to in Vegas, but I don't swim often so it wasn't too much of a big deal to me.  I liked how the stores (and the Fat Tuesday bar) were extremely close to our room.  Very convenient.  

I like Planet Hollywood overall, but there were a few problems w\/ our room that I'm not sure I want to even mention here, but screw it:

-  When we first checked into our room, it looked like it wasn't even cleaned... and we're pretty POSITIVE that not much effort was put into it especially when we found nasty things in the drawers which I won't mention.  Private message me if you'd like to know what we found, lol.  Needless to say, it gave us a dirty feeling and we didn't want to stay there, and so we demanded to be transferred to another suite.

-  The new room we transferred to was definitely a lot cleaner, but what do ya know... we found yet another nasty thing which I wont mention in another drawer.  So yeah, something tells me that they're either understaffed when it comes to cleaning rooms, or their staff just doesn't do a good job.

Overall a great hotel to stay!  :-P

Stayed here for 4 nights. Very clean and everyone was super friendly. 
Great atmosphere and restaurants. 
Our room was a Suite and I must say it was like a large Apt;) with a view of the strip and the Eiffel Tower in out bedroom. Amazing. 
I'd return here for another stay.

Just got done with a fun stay at PH in the scorching heat of summer. 

The casino is loud. There were often 3 songs playing at once which can be jarring to your ears. It definitely caters to the young crowd but I saw a good mix of ages and groups. You have to understand what you are getting...center strip property, young uns', pounding music, and sometimes huge crowds that flood the areas. Everything is on site including food, shopping, scantily clad pleasure pit girls, and more shopping. 

The room was very stripped down mod. It was definitely not the intricate and eclectic martini mod you may see in Palm Springs or even the contemporary interpretation at the Linq. My guess is that this invites a lot of criticism from patrons expecting more. The look is graphic but subdued with browns and whites. The casino floor is much more elaborate with Victoria Secret's-like monochromatic pillars, sculpted ceilings, lots of crystal, and light installations that alternate colors. It reminds me of a scaled down Cosmopolitan mixed with the classic look of Palm's Place. 

The bathroom was nearly 1\/2 of our room which is a dream if you are someone who loves to preen and primp. Double doors open to a huge space with separate showers, bathtub, compartmentalized toilet, and double vanities. This is definitely Hollywood. The only downside is that this takes from the living space in the main room so you and numerous friends won't be able to share a small room comfortably. As for the main living space, the furniture was not only stylish but very comfortable with seats you can sink into. Not much else to write home about but what's not to like? 

The Wi-Fi was weak most the time but they do offer a wired Ethernet connection. The pool is on the 6th floor and may be dirty. You have your choice of two pools on either side. They are warmed and shallow, only 4 foot deep at the most. They are actually spaced very far apart so you might miss the other pool if you aren't exploring. There is a huge courtyard for sunbathing if you aren't up for a dip. 

All in all, not a bad experience. Everyone was so sweet to us and I had a great time. The most memorable part of the trip was the 110 degree F weather. Too hot to complain but there wasn't much to complain about at Planet Hollywood. Some reviewers are geared up to totally trash this property in review but you have to experience it to make this determination. The centralized location on the strip makes exploring easy should the casino or amenities leave you wanting more. This is not a new property, like the Linq or Aria, so it will show it's age. The upside is never once did I feel like management let an aspect of our experience slide or degrade.  

Tip: Valet will take you straight to the direct entrance and check-in and there are elevators near the Starbucks to your right that will take you to your room.

If you had to self park (as you probably will because valet was so busy when we went) then make your way to the ground floor and make the trek towards the entrance\/valet to avoid the Miracle Mile shops. There are no pedestrian walkways and we were hugging a wall with ventilation ducts at one point. You can avoid the crowds and having to navigate while carrying heavy luggage. This shortcut will take you to and fro should you need to go to your car. Just walk the way you drove in since the cavernous parking structure provides no cues for you.

Terrible place, book anywhere but here!!

The staff is unprofessional and rude, the rooms smell horrible and aren't nice!

When I booked I reserved a non smoking room, when I checked in they gave me a smoking room, I showed them my prepaid receipt that stated non smoking, I was told that the non smoking was a request and that no other rooms were available. Terrible customer service!

Don't be fooled by the hip fashion floor and the nice miracle mile shops, the hotel is terrible and customer service is non existent!

Have stayed at cosmo, linq, Mandalay Bay, and hooters, all are better than this!!

Awesome location off the strip! There are some many things to do here besides gamble. There are great shows here that are for the entire family. We went to a family friendly magic show that costs $20 per ticket. I forgot the name of the guy but he was on America's Got Talent and was entertaining. Other entertainment options are great also. A lot of great places to eat are located within the hotel as well.

Modern furniture gives rooms high rating. It live, jazzy, and and hip casino. But the rooms carpet are in need of cleaning. housekeep should be advised to clean previous guest hair up. 3 strains of Hair was left in shower. I am also a non smoker in a smokers room . Smell not that bad but can use a purifier in smoker rooms in general.

Hotel was alright. The rate wasn't too cheap and it wasn't really worth it in my opinion. I hate that the parking structure is so far away and you have to walk through the Miracle Mile shops. I would recommend people just driving to where Valet\/Check-In is and have someone from your group take the luggage while you drive and park. That way you don't have to lug your luggage all over the shops. Once you enter the door that is where the hotel check in is.

The Hotel was terrible. My closet was missing the door, the rooms were dirty. I got up at 4am looking for water and they did not have a mini fridge. I have never stayed a hotel that didn't have a mini fridge. After a night of drinking I woke up thirsty looking for water, I had to call room service and they brought up 2 32oz Aquafina water bottles that cost me $20 each.. This hotel will be my last choice to when coming to Vegas.. but I hope to NEVER AGAIN stay here..

This place has gone extremely down hill!  Pool area has no sun over it till 11AM and the area opens at 8AM, warm to cold showers, had to change rooms at MIDNIGHT due to a leaking sprinkler in the room...we were given a $50 food\/drink voucher that they said could be used at any of the eaterys in the casino(Burgr, Planet Dailies, etc)...that was a damn lie!  We eat at Planet Dailies and tried to use the voucher only to find out they arent even affiliated with the hotel...WHAT A JOKE!!
NEVER COMING BACK!!
I also dont necessarily like walking through the mall to get to my room everytime I have to drive somewhere...BLAHH!!

Recently i stayed in the new "ultra hip" room at Planet Hollywood. I truly can say i enjoyed staying in this room. The room was clean (and smelled great), new furnishings, and pretty spacious. I used the self check in kiosk and not only did i avoid the line but only took me 2 minutes tops to get my keys from the machine itself.

The pool area was divided into 2 sections, there seemed to be limited chairs by the pool itself and more in the area between the 2 pools.

The buffet had pretty decent food and a large selection.

Will i stay again? I Sure will.
Nice to know housekeeping makes sure they do their job.  This has been outside our door since we got here 3 days ago.

The front desk were very helpful and courteous and not put out at all when we asked if we could stay 1 extra night. house keeping were very courtious,  however they really need to spend some money on updates for in the rooms. The tiles in the shower were awful and looked grungy, dirty and old. there is one tiny shelf to hold the shampoo, soap, conditioner, and razer, for us females seriously doesn't work. need to put a seat\/bench in there so  women can shave easier, there needs to be a double sink with a variety bench in the middle to go with the make-up mirror.  so alot more updates needed but, that would be a good start.

I had low expectations coming in, but after being there for 3 nights, they are very high now. I wasn't expecting all the nice amenities PH had to offer.

I suppose my visit was good because a friend of mine comes to Vegas quite often, and she spends a lot at PH to get all of the perks.

We got to check in the VIP area without having to wait in line. The check-in clerk was very nice, and very cute as well. She helped us get our room, because we were in a hurry to get back out because of some arrangements we had going else where.

The room we got was on the 15th floor in the panoramic room. It's basically the corner suite with the living room space covered in windows. 2 bedroom with 3 queen sized beds. One huge bathroom with a shower, hot tub, toilet, bidet, 2 sinks and plenty of room. There was a second bathroom with just a single sink and toilet. The other bathroom was about half the size of the large one. It was very clean and accommodating to our needs.

It's definitely living big here if you're going all out Vegas style. I don't have a clue how much the room cost us, but it was very nice. It had a Grease theme setup with props from the movie displayed in the room.

The Casino level is pretty nice, and like other casinos... smokey :( Let's just say the dry weather and smoke didn't help me in my favor.

The pool on the 6th floor is very nice, and we had a cabana reserved for us. We had Malibu rum and coke and pineapple juice for us to drink. They regularly refilled our mixers and ice and asked when they noticed it looked low. Great service.

The mile mall is pretty cool. Some parts of the mall make you feel like your in a different part of the world or even outdoors feeling. Great shops if you like to do that kind of thing.

Overall, if I come back to Vegas, I'll be coming back here.
Small room over looking Bellagio fountain show (Nice) bed is comfy for compd room walk in shower nice TV would stay here again.

Heavily disappointed in the over all experience at this well known hotel and casino! My wife decided to surprise me with a couple of nights stay there a while back. On the first night our toilet flooded for no apparent reason. It took entirely to long to get maintenance to come up to the room to take care of the problem. For some reason the water pressure in the shower was non existent. It was extremely difficult to take an enjoyable shower. In addition the water didn't seem to heat up much at all. The only thing that met expectations was the comfort of the bed. After expressing our dissatisfaction with one of the managers, he offered us a free night stay on a future reservation. That was greatly appreciated by us, however when we decided to finally use it, he never responded to our emails. We kept on getting the run around when we called customer service and was told only the manager could set up our comp night, and the only way to correspond with him is through emailing, which he was not responding to. Total unacceptable business practice from a big Hotel and Casino like Planet Hollywood. We definitely could of done a lot better for the price. We will make it a point to tell as many people as possible, so they wont make the same mistake we made!

Stayed here for the first time for the weekend.  A friend got a good rate and it was definitely a step up from Harrah's (where we stayed last time).  

Rented a cabana at the pool Friday and hung out there all day.  Not the best pool in Vegas, but definitely fun.  The waitress charged two buckets of beer to our room that we paid for in cash, so that was a hassle.  Also, they didn't come around very frequently, so overall, pretty bad service.

We hung out in the Heart Bar in the middle of the casino floor, which was pretty decent.  It's nice that it's connected to the mall, so there are more options for eating than you'd normally find.

Not the greatest hotel, but for the price, pretty darn good.

One of the better hotels in the north strip, their bathrooms in the rooms are better than any other hotel here for moderate pricing. Each room has props hanging on the walls from a movie. Best thing is that it's connected to the Mile Mall. Just make sure to get a room high up because you might be looking at the roof of the casino. The rooms are a little dark but has a modern look.

Have yet to spend the night at Planet Hollywood's hotel.  Their casino and Miracle Miles shops are a different story.  They have a good selection of shops to browse and restaurants to eat at.

I like the casino here.  Okay, I am bias.  I have gambled here 3 times in the past.  Each time, I finished with more money than I started with which is a very good thing.  The smoke filled casino does not bother me when I am winning.  

Anyways, Planet Hollywood lately tends to be a place we walk to when we are in Vegas.  Great location in the heart of the Strip.

I stayed here for three days while vacationing in Vegas. We had a fountain view Junior suite on the 21st floor. This hotel had previously been Middle Eastern themed, and all of the fixtures in the room as well as the architectural of the building other than the façade still showed that influence. The only concession the hotel made inside the room towards its name where a couple of scattered "movie memorabilia" pieces. To be perfectly honest, a leather jacket that was possibly may be worn by somebody in a movie made 60 years ago was less fun to see on the wall then perhaps an actual painting. Hell, or even just a better color than the sandstone that was everywhere. The bathroom was also infuriatingly unlit with the actual switches nowhere near the toilet at all. Let me tell you how fun this was drunk at three in the morning. We did appreciate the quick walk from check-in to room and then from room to the strip. This is a much more compact hotel than others in the area.

The casino itself is geared to a younger crowd, perhaps, than some of the other casinos on the strip (or at least it seemed that way to me). Aside from the stripper-esque "Pleasure Pit" dancers, the crowd in general seemed younger and the music that was being played early in the morning was extremely clublike. There is, in fact, an actual dance club somewhere on the premise, I do believe that it is connected to the casino directly, but I never went. The hotel and casino is also directly connected to a reasonably large mall of course, and is pretty much directly across the street from the Bellagio fountains, which is a huge plus.

On the one hand I would recommend this hotel, but on the other I would probably choose a slightly nicer one the next time I go. If you're going to spend a large amount of money on a hotel you might as well spend it on a nicer one. Your mileage may vary.

Easily the second worst hotel that I've stayed at on the strip.  Most everyone that I encountered who worked at that hotel seemed to hate his\/her job.  Our room on the 31st floor seemed like a quick and shoddy cover up of what used to be the Aladdin hotel. The closet door barely hung on its hinges, the walls were scuffed up, and the bathroom was grimy. Not to mention that there was barely any water pressure in the shower.   It was just plain gross and all of a sudden I feel itchy just recalling it.  As if all that wasn't bad enough, housekeeping kept making our bed with sheets that were too short for our king sized bed.  We could feel the exposed mattress at our feet and this occurred again the day after we had to remake the bed ourselves. The front desk would not answer the phone after multiple calls and I suppose something could have been done had we gone to the front desk to raise a stink in person but frankly it wasn't worth the effort.  

Planet Hollywood, you tricked me with your casino glitz that misled me in believing you'd be a decent stay but now I know that the only thing worth coming back to this hotel for is some Earl's sandwich.

The best part about Planet Hollywood is the location. Its right in the middle of some of the best hotels and shopping. The casino is pretty basic, they have a restaurant, several bars and tons of machines. Their little gift shop is a great place to stock up on snacks and trinkets. The pool has a huge cement area for laying out in the middle of an adult pool and a family pool. This is a nice budget place to stay at if you are looking to save your dollars but you won't get anything overly impressive.

I DIDN'T STAY AT THE HOTEL: This is review for the Pleasure Pool

We went on Saturday afternoon from 5pm to a little over 7pm
 My sister and friends were staying here and invited me to the pool with them so i came we went to the pool the left side with the music was packed and we couldn't find any where to sit so we decided to go to the right side i noticed they had cabanas  so me and my sis and friends decided we should get bottle service and a cabanas so we go up to the cabana service and this nice girl helps us and one of her employees and they help get a low price on the left side with all the music because we figured we were gonna want to dance and drink well were in the pool so we go to our cabana and we wait for our bottle service which take 20 mins the girl just drops it off then leaves so we start drinking go in the pool and are dancing having fun then that girl that dropped off the drinks says we have to pay 30$ for gradatuity and my sis and our friend ask why and she tell us that it for that and we are like wtf like we only see you 1 time and to just drop off the bottles stuff and were just like really that's dumb so we paid it anyways but she never asked if we were okay or if we needed anything so it was dumb that we had to pay her 30$ for doing nothing she was rude after that but i am sorry miss i don't get paid gradatuity for doing my job and you weren't even doing your job good at all  job so thanks for picking up a tray and bringing it to us but it wasn't worth paying you 30$...
Someone need top teach there workers how to be a worker not rude 
after that though we did have fun the music was whatever kinda old stuff mixed with new stuff but i will come here again but this time maybe get someone else who know how to do a better job at there JOB!


end of review\/rant

Funny thing, during my 21st in Vegas I stayed at this place when it was still the Aladdin.  They were still transitioning and adding onto it when I left and when I came about almost a year later it was Planet Hollywood.  One of the newest hotels on the strip.   

Got a small about of blackjack done before entering into club Prive right on the casino floor.  Had one of the most memorable experiences on the Casino floor that night when I met two really cute Asian girls from LA here.  Later found out that night that they were part of a bachelorette party.  One of their friends was getting married apparently, anyways that was super fun to meet some hot girls and party with them all night.  And it all started on the floor of their Casino.:)  Good times!

I stayed here with friends and it was good, but we didn't really use the room much haha. We were out most of the time. It is pricey, but it was a good location(semi middle of strip) and room was clean. I would be willing to stay here again.

Terrible customer service.  Cancelled my reservation and was told to wait 10 days for the refund of my deposit, which didn't arrive.  Sent an email to inquire.  Still no response.  Called back and was told refund had been processed, gave me a "processing number" and suggested I wait a few more days for it to hit the bank. It didn't.  Called back again, spoke to acctg department -- they claim never to have been informed of the refund and they have no idea what that processing number is I was given or why I was told the refund was processed.  Whether I not I get the refund after this latest call to the Acctg supervisor or have to call yet again, I will never stay here.  There are so many other hotels.  Not giving PH my money.

I'll start by saying that I NEVER complain about anything. I can be served the wrong meal and not say a word about it to the waiter. The only reason I give this hotel 2 stars is because the shops, the food, location and the view was great. I've been visiting Las Vegas and staying in the hotels since I was a kid and this was absolutely my worst experience. It seems every time my husband and I tried to let someone know, no one cared. Out of 5 people we spoke to, only 1 woman at the front desk actually tried to help us and apologized for our experience.

It all started with reserving the room. Tried to get the deal they had on the website and the website wouldn't process it. My husband called and spoke to a manager, but they wouldn't honor the web discount. Finally, she tells my husband to send her a snapshot of the price online was charging. He does and waits for her to call us back. Two hours later, he called them back, spoke to a man who did everything and let us keep the online deal... All within 5 minutes. I work in customer service and just don't understand why no one called us back or why this guy let us get our deal when she (the manager) wouldn't. 

Anyway, moving on..  Parking is far and not easy to find, the casino is confusing and hard to navigate the first time around. Our room was advertised as a "premium fountain view room". They also advertise a "fountain view room". Thinking we had a larger room with two chairs (as pictured on the website), we were disappointed, but we decided to make the best of it and move on. When we called the front desk... They confirmed that premium fountain view and fountain view were the same rooms. Oh yeah.. We also noticed that a few of our needed light fixtures were broken. Now we get to the moths. Do NOT open your window vents at night. We had about 5 in our room every day as soon as we opened them.  But the cake topper was getting stuck in the elevator for 10 minutes.. It jolted and stopped and we had to talk to someone to help get us out. After that, I can officially say I'll never stay, or recommend staying there again.

Pubes on the tile. Chip crumbs on the carpet. Sewer smells when you run water in the shower or sink. This place is gross. 

It's only saving grace is the casino. Plus, it's a good location to get to other cool places (It's in the middle of the strip, close to the Miracle Mile shops, and of course Earl of Sandwich=amazeballs). I'm going to go back to staying at the Bellagio-- it's full of snobby people, but at least they keep it classy.

Room : I booked PH for a girls trip with three friends. Booked the hotel in Feb for the mountain view room. When our check in finally came PH did not have my room available. We needed to have two queens non smoking and told our options were limited. We ended up getting the resort room over looking the pool on the 10th floor. 
Not a bad room and it was pretty big. To compensate us at check in they gave us spa discounts and peep show 10.00 off (which BTW were worthless)

Pool: The pool at PH is BADDD I mean for here in Maryland the pool would have sufficed but this is Vegas... The only good chairs you had to pay 25-50. When we tried to lay out in the crappy free ones we were treated like second class citizens. Went over to the Hard Rock pool and they treated us much better and we were not even staying there. 

Maid Service: We never got any for FIVE days. I complained and they still never showed up 

Location: The reason I gave two stars. GREAT location on the strip. 

All in all it is a fun hotel the casino rocks and it is happening with a good crowd on Friday and sat night. But the hotel is not good. They really need to make changes if anyone is going to stay and come back. I sure won't......

I'm pretty surprised at how low the ratings are for Planet Hollywood.
I've been to Vegas a lot and I thought this was one of the better hotels.

PH has pretty much the best when it comes to location and what they offer. Numerous dining options, shops and as well as just being in the middle means you could pretty much walk everywhere conveniently.  I'm a loyal TR member so Planet Hollywood or Caesars would be the ideal choice for me, but when you compare the price difference I can't justify paying more to stay at Caesars when the room setups are basically the same.

I checked into PH and did the sandwich trick. I had two rooms so I slipped a $50 between my ID and card. I was given numerous options for my room choices in terms or floor, views, etc and was upgraded to the resort room over the regular standard room I had originally booked.

It was very spacious and I was pleased with the room. Nothing fancy as I expected but the beds were comfy and the bathroom had a nice tub and shower. 

There really is no downside to this place except for not really having any major clubs. Lots of bars but none appealing. All the dining options are good, shopping, and most of all location. Didn't have a chance to use the pool but from the pictures it looked pretty standard.

Likes
-Great value, awesome location on the strip for a good price
-ABC store inside the hotel selling non-overpriced beer\/liquor was awesome for pregaming

Dislikes
-Beds weren't as heavenly as I wanted...all of our backs hurt!
-The bathroom was my biggest gripe: a pathetic small\/weak shower head and a glass shower door that wasn't very convenient for multiple people utilizing the bathroom simultaneously...unless you're all really good friends.

I come here just for Earl of Sandwich.

Sometimes I lose money on the way in on blackjack though.

This was our first Vegas trip together, for my husband and I. Decided to stay here because my mom recomended it. 
Pros:
We found it super fast. Very great location right on the strip. 
the overall appearance was nice.
Check-in time was fast. They had many people working. 
We got a room in the 27th floor. Over looking the pool & strip (really nice) 
Room was spacious & clean. 

Cons:
The parking! Ughh, probably it was our fault by not knowing. But we took like an 1hr to find parking and when we found one, we didnt know where to go. 
(Who knew you had to walk the mile shops before getting to the resort and casino?WE didnt!) such a hassle. 
& the room furniture was a little outdated  
& not enough sitting area around pool. We had to keep an eye out all the time to get a chair by the pool. 


Overall, our 2 night stay was good. Will stay here in future (now that we know the parking situation, it should go more smoothly, right?)

This is the old Alladin hotel. They've done some updating, but it could use more. I've given three stars primarily because our experience with the staff was subpar, but also the décor is so dated. We were treated rudely by bar staff, indifferently by staff at the spa, and ignored by the maid staff. 

We ordered two waters at the bar and the waitress barked back that we had to order drinks in order to sit down. Of course we were going to get drinks, we were just parched and wanted water first. 

The spa staff was not friendly, like we are used to at other resorts. I think it's because a 20% gratuity is already included. They took it for granted. 

On two occasions the maids promised to come clean our room, once at noon, and then at 5pm. They showed up at 11:30pm, and woke us up. Lame.

On the brighter side, the Diamond check in was great, the taxi lines in and out were short, the on-sight PF Changs was great fantastic, the dancing models in the casino were a big plus, the cabanas, pool scene, pool service were great.

I stayed here for the weekend and I love it! The atmosphere is really lively, but it was really crowded during the day. But then again, the Miss USA pageant was going on and the contestants were everywhere. I actually saw Miss Massachusetts get off the elevator as well as Miss Iowa Teen USA. 

Sometimes you will see celebrities here also... my mom actually met Kelly Osbourne in the casino and got a pic with her and Jesse Tyler Ferguson from Modern Family was walking around a few months ago when I went. Too bad I missed both sightings!

The hotel room we stayed in was pretty comfortable. The beds are comfy, but the rooms could use a little more lighting. But then again, that is Hollywood style.

One of the reasons I love PH is because it has a mall, Miracle Mile Shops, attached to it and there's shops, bars, and restaurants affordable for the rich and common folk alike. The casino is also pretty large and there's just a lot to do in this one little spot. I recommend PH to everyone, actually. :)

Horrible experience. Stayed here in August and the pool is only open from 9am-7pm. What pool closes at 7pm? In Vegas? This one. The fitness room closes at 7pm too. The registration line was super long on a Monday night. They seem short staffed here and my kids were very disappointed about the pool. Also there is a $36 non-optional "resort fee" for use of the fitness room and the wi-fi even if you don't use these.

Review on the PH pool.
I was so excited to head to the PH pool on my recent trip to vegas. It's literallly 2 pools on the side, one for 18+ and the other for families. AND THAT'S IT.

The area where we you walk in from is just rows of pool chairs and concrete. 
I was SO disappointed. I think I only stayed there for about 5 minutes before leaving. Waste of time.

location, location, location!!! We lucked out and got the Charlie Sheen themed room. Can you say WINNING?! 
@ 1st i was a little sketchy about staying here since we only paid $99 a night so I though it maybe low roller. Boy was I wrong! 
Access to miracle mile mall, restaurant galore and walking distance to all the hot spots. 

My friend who was staying at Aria even said she would rather be at PH. 
Whaaat & agreed. This is defiantly a hotel for the young and restless. 
Great prices, food and staff. Plus you cant beat the dancers in the casino =)

The hotel room itself was good with plenty space. The bed was a little firmer than I like but was still comfortable. The chair with the high arms in the room was too comfortable I did not want to get up. The shower was good size and plenty of hot water for my room in the 2270's range of rooms. The TV was not that great even though it was a large flat screen the connection and video quality was horrible. It was closer to a TV with an antenna. 

The ice machine was great. Clean ice and always had plenty of ice as I tend to use a lot this was useful.

The view from my room was nice and was able to see the other hotels and lights at night. 

The hotel staff were always helpful and friendly. 

There are places to eat all hours of the night and the PH convenience store is 24 hours and had almost anything you could need. 

The casino does not have any low min tables to play like some of the casinos down the strip into the old town part of Vegas. 

The valet service takes about 30 min to get your vehicle and they do not have call down service. You will need to physically show up for your car. I suspect this is to keep traffic moving and cars just sitting there waiting on guests. It's a busy area so this kinda makes sense. You just need to plan ahead for this. There is also often a sign saying valet full. You need to look closely it also states hotel guests only. So if your staying just go on through and your good to go.

We got our rooms at a reasonable price thanks to one of our co-workers who had status with the hotel.

Overall we had a good trip and good stay.

I love this hotel.  I didn't stay here personally, but my friend got upgraded to a panoramic suite, and it was A-MAZING!!  Two rooms, two bathrooms, game tables, couches, chairs, flat screen tvs, a bar, a breakfast area, an ipod stereo dock....I could go on and on.  So cool and chic.

Also, the entrance from valet is so very convenient.  You step inside and immediately hit registration.  The room elevators are also right there.  There's no walking around with all your luggage and back and forth to your car through the casino or any of that bs.  Love it.
We won't be coming back to stay here. Heater doesn't work. Housekeeping is slow and The management could care less

Planet Hollywood is, in my opinion, one of the coolest hotels on the strip. It has an awesome casino vibe, plenty of shops, great rooms, and I hear good food although I actually didn't try the food in Planet Hollywood.

The casino floor is quite a bit nicer than say Ballys or any of the other older casinos. And I think it has a much better vibe than Paris or Cosmo (next door\/across the street). Plenty of tables although usually they're $10 not $5 tables. I found the dealers to be a pretty enjoyable group of people and never had issues. 

But the hotel's the best part. The rooms are large and the beds are very comfy. Even the standard rooms are quite spacious, but upgrade to the next tier and the rooms are very large with massive bathrooms - bathrooms so big they carpet part of the floor. 
I stayed at Planet Hollywood a number of times and the only time I had an issue - I got back from work (yes, actually work) at 3am only to find I was locked out of my room due to some issue with the pipes (it affected a couple rooms near me as well). So I had to go downstairs, figure out the issue, go back upstairs, get my stuff, go to some other room all after working for like 20 hours that day. Not happy. When I stayed there the next week, I brought this up and got upgraded. They handled it fairly well I think although it did take some negotiating and stubbornness on my part.

The hotel itself is in need of updating, but the location is so good in the middle of the strip, it's hard to not justify choosing PH. 
The rooms are dark in decor and lighting with old furniture (think: broken tv\/clothes armoires). The accommodations are underwhelming overall, but it's my understanding that they are in the process of updating some rooms. I have stayed at PH 3 times, 2 of which where things were wrong in rooms (lamps\/lights not working, aforementioned broken armoires , missing drawers etc).
My needs aren't for anything fancy, so the fact that I am displeased on the whole with the experience of staying at PH feels telling. 
They should be thankful that the location is desirable and that the adjacent Axis Theatre draws a large population of show-goers that pay for the convenience.

I've stayed here multiple times in the past, and I like the location and rooms, but today we just found a cockroach in our room...... pretty gross and definitely not a good sign.... I'll rethink staying here in the future :(

BEST HOTEL EVER! Loved everything about it! STAFF,SHOPS,WALKING DISTANCE TO OTHER PLACES,etc. If I can, I would stay at this hotel only when I go to Vegas. It has Earl's sandwiches that is open 24 hours and Fat Tuesday. That is all I need in one hotel. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

I love Planet Hollywood it's my favorite hotel in Vegas ! it is so pretty they have great store and the miracle mile mall is amazing the Mac store there's great upstairs is to die for , the foods really good the shows there or kick ass ! Britney Spears is awesome. All their bars are really cute and the atmosphere is very kid friendly in the mall ! I come to Vegas every year and I go to Planet Hollywood every time I come!(:

Check in was a breeze. The room was somewhat outdated. I had a room that had Robert Redford memorabilia from the movie "The Natural". I had a big NY Yankees shirt hanging in a picture frame right in front of the beds. I am an Oakland A's fan, so I did what any normal person would do, I covered it up with a sheet. The room was not spectacular but clean. One of the doors was missing from the entertainment piece. The TV was against the wall to the right of the beds, the problem, it doesn't come out so you can't watch tv from the bed. That was real odd. But you can sure see that NY Yankees memorabilia staring right at  you. There was also a glass top round table with other baseball stuff in it. It was kinda kool. The halls were dark but trendy.
Check-In is a complete mess here.  I'm writing this review as I wait in line.  Already been in line for 30 mins, and not even 1\/3 of the way through the line.  Total mismanagement; NEVER stay here!

My 5th time to Vegas and first time staying at Planet Hollywood. It's a great deal for being in the middle of the strip but the walls are thin and the bathroom vents are connected so you can hear conversations. That was the most negative part of the stay. Maybe if you upgrade to a better room you won't hear your neighbors. Miracle mile shops are convenient and surprisingly not overpriced! Clean room, nice staff, but our room had a lame Speed 2 theme. No luck there! Stay here for an average price and average experience.

We have had our trade show here for the past 3 years, Labor Day Weekend, and PH has done a great job overall in taking care of us. There have been some less than stellar moments starting off, but I think it has all come together nicely. All restaurants in the hotel are excellent, from the Earl of Sandwich and PF Changs up to Koi and the Strip House, 
Thanks PH!

I have been staying at Planet Hollywood at least once a year for the past 8 years. 
I'm part of the promotional team behind a custom knife show that happens every Labor Day Weekend at this hotel. PH had been so good to us over the years that I decided to stay here while I was in Vegas for the SHOT Show and UFC Fights.

Unfortunately my last stay was not so pleasant.

I was sent an email allowing me to check in online. I clicked the link and was told I would receive a text when I checked in. I got it before I boarded the plane. Pretty cool, huh?

Wait it gets worse.

The email told me to go to the "Key Desk" to pick up my keys. I disembarked the airport shuttle with some other people and went to the Key Desk. The desk jockey was talking to some idiot couple who were checking in like they were at the Registration Desk. I thought this was supposed to be an express check-in deal? Whatever.

Twenty five minutes later the people who rode with me were happily walking to their rooms while I was still waiting for this moron to tell these assholes from Iowa how to flush a toilet.

When he finally got to me, I was done in less than 3 minutes. As I walked away he called over the next person in line from registration. I shook my head in disgust wondering why they would have someone like this manning the express "Key Desk".

The weekend was over, I received my bill. These assholes charged me $22.40 for this "convenience" and refused to reverse the charges.

It will cost them all of my Las Vegas business in the future as I will go back to the Venetian for all my hotel\/resort needs in Sin City. That's an awful lot of UFC Fights and Trade Shows they are going to miss out on!

This place is where you want to be if you value comfort and location on the Vegas Strip. The rooms are stellar with the beds and bathrooms being very comfortable. In room safe and flat screen TVs add to the quality. The hotel itself has an excellent sports book, great shopping, good food, and a fantastic theme: sexy women in lingerie dealing cards and craps! The location on the strip is prime. If you are on your first trip to Vegas and are between 21 and 30 go here no questions asked. I go to Vegas multiple times per year and always stay at Planet Hollywood. Its always a superior experience for the price.
Simply the worse. Got the Apex suite, tried to throw a party.... Our children and guest were starved, and treated horrendously by staff and security.

This is my favorite place to stay in Vegas.  For all around value, vibe, opportunity, and proximity, this place has all the other places beat.  I love the energy here.  Fun and great things happen here.   I have stayed here several times during the past year and the year before and it continues to be a fantastic experience.

Last Friday I went to the Justin Timberlake and Friends concert at the Planet Hollywood auditorium and it was fantastic.  It was a benefit for Shiner's hospital.  We got our tickets last minute from one of the travelocity concierge's working in the lobby for half what the women behind us paid.  It was an amazing show with about ten different high profile acts that came to help Justin raise money for the Shiners.  Leona Lewis, Boys to Men, the Johnas brothers, the under my umbrella-please don't stop the music pop diva from Barbados (I can't think of her name.. oh yes Rihanna), and even Lionel Richie showed up to do a few songs before Justin did a full concert.  It lasted from 9PM to 1AM.  The venue was perfect.  The lighting and acoustics were amazing and I only had to take the elevator downstairs from the North tower and walk through the circle bar to get to it!  

I like the spa and fitness area here too.  It helps me sweat out the toxins and fight off the fat that comes from enjoying all the great restaurants that are near and part of the millennium mile complex.  The pool area is massive and fun.  The price is usually pretty good.  I usually stay in decent sized standard deluxe room here and it is fine.  This time I crashed a party down the hall in one of the hospitality suites.  It was fantastic.  Amazing views of the Paris Eiffel tower and the Bellaggio water show and of course free food and drink from my would-be hosts!  I would love to be able to stay in one of these suites one day.. maybe if I hit the jack pot during my next trip.
I love you, Planet Hollywood!

I'm told I posted this in the wrong area so this is a reprint..

Planet Hollywood is like a con man that runs at you, kicks you down and takes your money.  It starts at the parking lot, oo, did you miss that small sign that says "planet hollywood?" , then you trek through the Mile long mall where you walk and walk and walk..to check in.  After you check in there's a guy at the elevator, you think he's security, but he's not, guess what he's selling a time share, just tell greasy haired sales guy, that you're leaving Vegas at 8am in the morning and they'll leave you alone.  
I'm in sales and they're just an embarrassment, I'd tell the guy he should pick up a copy of Glengarry Glenn Ross movie, but don't think he would take the hint.

You get to the room, not bad until you realize..no coffee, water is $5 a bottle and you each get 1 towel, nothing more nothing less, I'm guessing if you asked for another one they'd charge you for it.  

Slots are unforgiving, nothing exciting, if you're really into gambling then most people go to old town fremont area anyway, so I can't blame Planet Hollywood there.  Waitresses are few, if you ask for a drink you may get one, then wait 30 min for another one, best to go to other casinos that serve faster.

Oh here's a warning for you, the V show?  Save your $, for $20 more you can see Cirque De Soleil (sic), the show area consists of a make shift room with chairs similar to those you'd find in a picnic, and a stage the size of my bathroom back home.   Big rip off, oh and they were trying to take pictures and charge you for them, first sign of a real scam.

This is the first Casino I've seen where they really live up to the name, If you've ever been to Hollywood, it's a town full of beggars, not a pleasant or safe place at night and a prime spot for a mugg'n, so anyway I'd avoid this place, even Palace Station would be a better choice.

We had a fabulous first time staying at PH in the heart of The Strip! Awesome, convenient location. We scored a great deal via my iPhone app "Hotel Tonight" and had an excellent check-in experience with Marilyn who dialed us in with a room on the 35th floor overlooking the Bellagio, with stunning views of Vegas, and the Bellagio water fountain show from our room. The hotel is very cool and contemporary, clean, beautifully decorated, king bed, 5 piece marble bathroom with a gorgeous tub. Part of the Caesars Entertainment group, we also got the $49.99 24 hour buffet pass valid at 5 hotel buffets including PH, Caesars, Paris, Rio and Harrahs. Free wifi in room a bonus as many hotels charge extra for this but beware it is for one device only! Would definitely recommend and stay here again. The location, standard and style are outstanding value for money.

We stayed 2 nights mid-week.  Got great rates through AAA and Sheraton which seems to part own this place.  We got the mid-level corner room but only got to stay on the 8th floor, and no plasma TV but we did have one TV in the main room and another TV by the 2-person bath tub. 

As far as rooms go it was comfortable and relatively spacious.  But since we were also paying for a view I was disappointed that all we got was a boring pool area and cranes building a new hotel across the street. 

PH is trying to be the latest, hippest, trendy, posh, "beautiful people" spot on the strip.  It's one big club 24\/7 on the casino floor - constant, never ending thumping club music, colorful but dim lighting, loud crowds, and dancing girls in lingerie on podiums all around you.  The Heart Bar is smack dab in the middle for a reason.  There is always a crowd there, even at 7, 8 and 9am - we weren't sure if they had just started partying but most likely had been going at it all night.    

The TV channels sucked, there were about 4-5 channels exclusively advertising PH.  But the bed was very comfortable and not overly silky\/posh. Other Yelpers have noted the location and the room amenities. My only other comments are that the marble bathroom floor is friggen cold and the heater\/air conditioner can't maintain "warm" at night, only blows hot for 10 minutes then cold for 10 minutes, each time with a loud "click" whenever it changes over.

But nice is that the rooms are designed so that you don't hear loud TV's from other rooms or other loud noises (yeah baby).  

Basically it seemed that this is currently the place to see and be seen - even early in the morning.  But we're not one of "the beautiful people" so we were just happy to have enjoyed a nice room in a great location on the LV strip.

The hotel\/casino is nicely located, upbeat and has impressive midstream rooms.  We had two rooms, a Top Gun themed one and The Fugitive themed other.  Both rooms had comfy king beds, nice flat screen tv's, and large bathrooms with showers and separate jacuzzi tubs. 

The casino floor had a younger vibe to it and played a mix of popular music loudly at all times.  There were a decent amount of restaurants and the decor was just average for Vegas. 

Overall, we would stay again.

Stayed here awhile back. 

+1 Mall connected to the hotel
+1 walking distance to Cosmo and all the "new" areas
+1 clean & classy
+1 younger crowd

Whenever my friends and I are in town, it seems like we usually stay in one of the hotels along this part of The Strip.   However, it always feels like a bit of a balancing act.  Cosmo and Aria are usually our preferred spots, as well as The Bellagio to a lesser extent, but none of them are all that cheap.  And while Paris and Bally's are far more wallet friendly, their rooms are pretty dated (especially the latter).  Oddly though, we never looked into staying at Planet Hollywood.  After this trip though, that just might start to change!

Since my buddy and I decided to book our trip to watch the NBA Summer League just days in advance, we kind of resigned ourselves to some pricey hotel rates.  Cosmo's rates were around  $500\/night and Aria and Bellagio weren't far behind.  Seeing that Planet Hollywood was just a shade higher than Paris and Bally's at about $90\/night, we decided to take a chance on something new.  Turns out, it was the best bet of our trip!

Considering the price point, we were pleasantly surprised with how nice and spacious our room was.  It definitely can't compete with the newer rooms and modern\/trendy amenities that Cosmo and Aria have to offer, but all of the basics were accounted for - toiletries, hair dryer, ironing board, safe, mini fridge, etc.  What's more, the beds were comfortable and plush, the wi-fi was decent (though it crapped out on us a few times), and the bases of the lamps were fitted with both electrical plugs and USB outlets, which made charging multiple devices at a time a breeze.

Beds - (https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/planet-hollywood-las-vegas-resort-and-casino-las-vegas?select=nGSmZWPGbi7e-fsniW2rOA)
Side Desk - (https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/planet-hollywood-las-vegas-resort-and-casino-las-vegas?select=3Nzhz9mX2qCDAQpr4QSQzA)
TV\/Closet - (https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/planet-hollywood-las-vegas-resort-and-casino-las-vegas?select=aEQpDmAud9OlAAAn388Yug)
Bathroom - (https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/planet-hollywood-las-vegas-resort-and-casino-las-vegas?select=tIAlaMjzHvSOCgKiTHKScg)
Shower - (https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/planet-hollywood-las-vegas-resort-and-casino-las-vegas?select=QyFm22lf8kpd06wzpEaKGA)

As far as the rest of the hotel goes, it's pretty solid.  We didn't explore the entire hotel, but they do have spa facilities, a pool\/pool parties, solid food options (Starbucks in the casino, Koi, GR Burger, Earl of Sandwich, etc.), a 24-hr "gift shop", the neighboring Miracle Mile Shops, a Walgreen's and McDonald's right outside, and Britney's got her show here (hey, Brit!).  Plus, it's right across the street from Cosmo and a very short walk away from Aria, Paris, and Bellagio.

If there was something I truly hated about PH though, it'd be with the layout of their casino.  I get that they're generally designed to keep you in, but I don't get why I always end up walking in the wrong direction unless I do an entire lap around the floor to figure out where I want to go.  I swear it's like being in Mazerunner!  Maybe it's also because I don't really gamble much here.  Not that the table rates are super high; just that we always end up at Cosmo or Paris instead.

Between how nice the hotel is and the fact that we always end up spending a decent amount of time there, Cosmo still reigns supreme for me (and Aria, to a lesser degree).  However, when factoring in the rates with the quality of the rooms and their awesome location, there's no denying that Planet Hollywood is not only a better value, but one of the best values on The Strip.

This hotel is the worst!!!!

Right now it is 11:19 pm, I am here for a convention, so not by choice. I have my wife and 4 year old grand daughter with me. The noise in my room is at a peak of  83 decibels from the concert across at the Cosmopolitan. 

I paid 185 for a Jr. Suite with a view of the fountains at the Bellagio. No one told us, warned us, or hinted at the noise. Called the desk, no help, no concern, they got there money and that seems to be their only concern.

Called the police, not about the pool party but the noise level, we are across the strip, 21 floors up and again a max decibel of 83. Somebody at the county must have well lined pockets to allow this night after night. Shame on you.

Stay away, if you expect to get any sleep. This is Tuesday night, was the same on Sunday, quiet Monday. It is getting louder.

NAC 484.150 Noise emission standards for operators of vehicles. (NRS 484.6101)

1. No person may operate either a motor vehicle or combination of vehicles of a type subject to registration at any time or under any condition of grade, load, acceleration or deceleration in such a manner as to exceed the following noise limit for the category of motor vehicle based on a distance of 50 feet from the center of the lane of travel within the speed limits specified in this subsection:

Speed Limit of 35 mph or of Less ..... 86 dBA

Speed Limit of More Than 35 mph.... 90 dBA

God forbid I have a loud car!  BUT IT IS OK TO BE JUST ABOUT THAT LOUD IN MY ROOM!

Also in Nevada construction standards say the walls of a structure must attenuate the sound at least 20 decibels. So factoring the lowest legal attenuation the noise out side must be at least 103 decibels.

So do not drive by the cosmopolitan on a loud bike, or you could get a ticket.

I have an idea. To prevent this, get a room at planet Hollywood, bring your bike up, rev it all you want it is OK with the staff and yes, no ticket, actually no one will hear it above the noise in the room.

REALLY PLANET HOLLYWOOD YOU SUCK,!!!!!!!!!!! Run away from this one.

Nothing you do can offset the bad service and underhanded way you deal with customers!

My girlfriends and I planned a trip to Vegas and wanted to stay somewhere conveniently on the strip! The location of Planet Hollywood (PH) is GREAT! It is in the middle of the strip & there is a ton of food and shopping along Miracle Mile! 

We went during Labor Day Weekend, so the price for staying 2 nights was about $570.00! We had the ultra hip room with 2 queen beds! It fit 7 girls perfectly! If there are any broke college students out there and don't mind cramping into a room, the ultra hip 2 queen room was great! The downside of the room was the lack of mirrors. You can only imagine having 7 girls trying to get ready to go night clubbing or day clubbing, but we managed! 

Since we weren't club members, we had to pay for valet, which was $38 for 2 nights! Also, long story short, I dropped my phone in the pool and needed a bowl of uncooked rice to try salvaging whatever phone I have left! A regular bowl of uncooked rice was $17!!! Man..I could have bought a whole bag of rice at home! Anyways, if you're planning to drop your phone in the pool, bring your own rice!!!!

Its my second Year staying at Planet Hollywood . Last year it was the Eraser Room . And this Year its Goodwill Hunting . The Room and Amenities are superb and this years room overlooks the Pool. WooHoo.

good things:
center of the strip
good price
miracle mile shops downstairs
elevators close to rooms 
bathrooms have closed in wc, so getting ready is easy

Bad things
room view was to a rooftop
bed okay
lots of sells people for the westgate, the club, and restuarant, and they are AGGRESSIVE
They made my friends wait 5 hours for a room and refused to take the bags upstairs because they didn't want to feel responsible 
None the the staff will give you the same information, we were told we could have a late check out for free, they wanted to charge our friends 50 dollars
A manager is NEVER ON DUTY.  whenever you call to complain they tell you the manager is unavailable...


all in all, we had a better stay at the flamingo.. sure its a little older but at least they were more professional!!
