remodeled and dimmed...efforts on hip and trendy...advance reservations...credit card deposit required...quick $fifteen taxi from airport...checking in and eighteenth floor keycard given...standard room...comfy plush bed...large lcd screen...slow channel surfing...bathtub and seperate shower....clean, dark and modern....all acceptable...although room lacking in lighting...difficulty in reading in room....fine for sleep and wash....downstairs to casino floor...smaller than norm....tables few and moslty $twenty-five minimum and up....bit of distraction from "pleasure pit" pole dancers and scantily clad dealers...a casino for men!...a novel idea, but not liking....overall a decent room for $one-hundred-nineteen plus tax a night....go out for gambling...

I stayed when this was the Aladdin, and other than the fact it's not on the monorail it's very good. Good location, good room, decent casino. The only annoying part are the time-share salesmen the second you walk outside.

Three stars because the casino is a little small.  Pool area seemed lame.  Miracle mile shops were awesome!  My room was nice sized, definitely book a resort room, but it had old plumbing sounds and also shower had a tough time draining. Had a good view of strip. The shops and location are what makes this casino
Feels like they just painted over an old beat up casino, good location and affordable, good for college kids. Not my cup of tea but decent nonetheless

i have to let go of my haiku for now. =( but it'll be back.
11 of us tried to check in early, but our rooms weren't ready, so we were directed to stash our bags with the bell hop outside --- no fee. [ they work for tips only ]. this was pretty stellar considering that we wanted to enjoy the sun as soon as possible and not have to lug our flat irons and underwear around. about 2 hours later, still earlier than the usual check in time, we were able to get our rooms and have them all close together, as we had requested. with our stay, we got a free bottle of liquor. when you check in, they give you a voucher and you take it to the gift shop and choose from a small list.... not too shabby. cruzan rum, it is. thanks, ph. this drink's on you.
each room has its own theme. back to the future, malibu shores, troope beverly hills.  each had two queen beds, a flat screen tv, a desk, rolling chair, a small side table and another small captain's chair.  the lighting was awful. it only had a lamp on the desk and a small one between the beds. the lights that were supposed to encase the posters on the wall and the side table did not work. do you not want me to see the crappy popcorn ceiling? the bathroom had no locks whatsoever. the toilet was encased in its own room, which also had no locks. there are also no vents. it didn't make much difference to me because everyone knows that my sh*t smells like roses, but the guys cared. so if it matters to you. maybe you should stay elsewhere. however, your lady friend might try to get you to stay here because it has a separate stand up shower and nice soak tub. 
we forgot our toothpaste, so i had to use the phone and call guest services. the phone has all these specialized buttons to call specific departments, but none of them effin work. USELESS. just dial 0 and listen to the endless myriad of options before you get what you want. anyway, to my surprise, i got my toothpaste rather quickly and 2 complimentary toothbrushes. BUT, the next day, i called for towels and NEVER got them. i had to canoodle some from a housekeeping cart. 
maybe what's more important is mongo surprised us with a bottle of jack and a plate of apples and peanut butter. apparently, he called the hotel and took care of everything from back home. when i walked in, there was a room service cart set up that took me aback.  there was even an envelope with my name on it with a card and everything.  so at least, they didn't mess that up.
there's two pools. but the actual space around each pool is extremely limited. so chances are that you'll actually be sunbathing in a 'tanning lot'. can't bring alcohol to the pool because they want you to buy theirs. damn the man!
during the week, ph is like any other casino. on saturday, the whole ph life kicks in. scantily clad women pole dancing between the tables. the majority of the dealers become other types of scantily clad women. during the rest of the week though. they're just regular folk, like your ma and pa.
the earl of sandwich is dope. eat there. know bliss. 
miracle mile shops are ph's answer to caesar's palace forum shops.... just not as high falutin. so i can dig it.
the miss usa peeps thought ph was cool enough for them to hold their pageant there this year. so we got to see lots of chics walking around with their sashes. what gives? are you not allowed to live without rockin your sash all damn day? sucks then. 
end result  --- if you wanna go to ph. trust your roomie.

Visited and stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to Vegas (October 2017 sorry for late post).  The room was very nice on the top floor with window looking at the Bellagio fountain show, which is basically the thing I loved the most.  
This hotel is located in the middle of the strip and is central to everything you would want to do\/visit while in Vegas. I really like this casino and there's a variety of food options inside, It's an awesome spot, especially for the younger crowd. There's a variety of cool slot games, including multiplayer ones. There's also pretty girls dancing at the Pleasure Pit
If I could give zero stars I would. Waiting in line an hour to check-in?! (Maybe longer-still here!)Really? Figure it out. Will never oil here again.

Planet Hollywood, 

I am a registered guest who checked in on Saturday 6\/27\/15 and checked out the following morning.  Honestly, I was actually looking for a room at Elara where my friends were, but I only settled with PH because they're connected and Elara was completely booked.  This was not my first time at PH, but let me explain why it will be my last.  

Have you ever seen the movie White Chicks with the Wayans brothers?  Think back to that part where they check in the hotel and they are "Soooo frickin pissed!" that they're "gonna write a letter" and have a "BF!"  That's exactly how I felt there and again now as I write this.

Well, to start things off parking was a huge hassle since valet parking was full.  This was no one's fault--just a busy weekend.  At least we were able to get the bellboy to take our bags up for us right?  Wrong.  I was so happy to not have to carry all our things up until I saw how our things were brought up.  We had bought a couple gallons of water to drink for the weekend, and one of the big bottles had gotten damaged somehow that it leaked all over our belongings.  Of course my stuff was on top protecting everyone else's bags.  I did not have a single dry piece of clothing.  When I took everything out of my duffle bag there was a huge pool of water at the bottom.  When the bellboy realized how badly he had messed up with my stuff he offered to bring back some extra towels.  He brought back two small towels.  What did he expect me to do?  Spend all weekend dabbing my clothes dry?!  I proceeded to attempt to use the phone to call the front desk and request some kind of laundry service to dry my clothes.  I used the word "attempt" because the buttons on the phone didn't work.  I was so tired from the drive and all the walking around that I didn't want to go all the way back down to complain.  I was not about to let this ruin my weekend in Vegas.   So, I just started to hang my clothes everywhere and use a pathetic little blow dryer to dry what I needed for that day.   

My friends and I decided to make use of our time by heading down to the pool.  Might as well go swimming since our swimsuits were already wet right?  When we got on the pool floor some employees were shooing us away because the pool had been soiled and was closed for the day.  I think we would have had better luck swimming around in my duffle bag of water!  We went back up to the room only to find that our room key did not work anymore.  So now we had to go down again just to get a working room key. 

By this time it's late and our group had arrived at Elara and PH so we started to get ready to go out for the night.  I'm the last one ready because my friend and I are still desperately still trying to blow dry my clothes.  By this time I'm tired of being so passive about things so I walk all the way down to at the VERY LEAST request for a late checkout in the morning.  I told the desk person everything that's happened, and all I wanted was a late checkout.  He said, "I'm sorry about that.  I'll give you an extra hour."  SERIOUSLY?  And if I wanted an even later check out I would have to call the desk in the morning around 7 AM.  How did they expect me to call when I told them that the phone did not work?

So the next day my friend and I went our separate ways since I was going to stay an extra night at a different hotel.  I was at Encore when I received word from him that he was having a hard time getting his car from the valet because it turns out that the maid threw away the ticket.  There are certain things that you find and DON'T throw away.  A valet ticket is one of those things.  My poor friend had to hassle with the car valet stuff when he could have been with everyone else at beach club.  

Normally I leave Vegas feeling like I wanted to stay another night or go to one more club.  Never, ever have I been so happy to check out and go home.  

I feel like a number of things were messed up from beginning to end and the staff at here Planet Hollywood did nothing to accommodate for our time wasted here.  Paying customers are obviously not a priority at this hotel.  They don't care to accommodate and barely even apologize for our inconveniences and frustration.  I would never let anyone I care about go Vegas and stay at Planet Hollywood.  Why stay here when there are so many options?

Never again, 
Your guests in 2810

Just got to hotel mall and decorations is really nice. Had to wait to get into the rooms until 3. Once in the rooms the room was disgusting. Dust everywhere, hair from past guest, dirty carpet, horrible conditions of the sedk table and tv stand. So far they need house keeping to come and loom as if I am lying about their dirty rooms. As of now I want my money back or move me immediately.

I am regularly in Vegas for work and have never gambled until this most recent visit. My friend insisted we go to the strip for her birthday so we did. Planet Hollywood was homebase. I found some ridiculous slots and played, and enjoyed myself. The clerk\/bank area was super awesome and turned my bag of nickels and dimes I brought from home (I only allowed myself to gamble my change jar) into dollars for the machines. They could have refused me for not staying at the hotel or being a member, but they were awesome and did it.

I didn't actually stay overnight in the hotel, but did frequent my friends' room during my stay in vegas quite a bit. The room was spacious and very clean, and I'm a bit a fan of their dark furniture (dark wooden cabinets.. ahh). Hey, and PH did my wallet good ;)

I wouldn't stay at Planet Hollywood again. From the moment me and my three girlfriends arrived I was annoyed. They charged us $16 to check in early, which I've never heard of a hotel doing if they have a room available. Then, when we got to our room it reeked of weed. I called the front desk to complain (it took about 15 minutes to even get through) and they said they couldn't give us another room, but could send someone up to spray it. Well, that never happened. The room smelled like weed all weekend because the room next to us was blowing it into our bathroom vent. We called again to complain Friday night that it was an issue, so the hotel comped our $16 early check in fee (something I feel we shouldn't have been charged in the first place) and sent Security up to look into it. Nevertheless, every night weed blew into our vents and smelled up our room. Planet Hollywood's inability to remedy the situation left a bad taste in my mouth. On top of that, the rooms are really so-so, almost outdated even. I was surprised that they didn't have iPod docks as most hotels do these days. Another thing that was super annoying was how bad the water pressure was in the shower, it was so light that my showers weren't even pleasant. All the water pressure went to the sink faucet instead, causing water to splash everywhere every time you turned it on.  I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Vegas over the past 14 years (Wynn, MGM, Paris, Hard Rock) and this is by far the worst room I've stayed in. There are better hotels for the same price or less. All Planet Hollywood has going for it is a great location on the strip.

Stayed for a long weekend with my fiance and selected Planet Hollywood due to its price and location. I'd consider it towards the middle of the road in comparison to the other Vegas hotels. Not great, but definitely not bad. Our room was clean, modern, and although we didn't spend much time there it was satisfactory. Again, nothing incredible but no reason to complain. My one complaint is the resort fee that is charged at the end of your stay. I get that nearly all Vegas resorts charge these but when you come in the winter and can't utilize the pool I was essentially charged $35 a day for nothing besides wifi use. As I said, nearly every hotel and resort charges these fees but it's still robbery once you consider what they charge you for the room already.

The hotel itself and the rooms are nice enough. The biggest complaint of our whole trip down here are the ATMs on the casino floor. They charge $9.99 to withdraw money from your checking account. This is totally outrageous.

Conveniently located near Center Strip and above Miracle Mile Shops. Make sure you get one of the renovated rooms! They're called Ultra Hip. Beautiful, modern and well-lit (see pics).

Earlier in the afternoon of the day we checked in, I called to make sure what we were getting. A girl told me I was booked for Ultra Hip. Once we actually got there, we wound up with a luxury resort room (not Ultra Hip) on the 9th floor. It was very spacious and had a view of the strip, but it was older, darker, and smelled weird. Meh...

The next morning, we heard construction noises at 8am -__- I called front desk and they moved us to an Ultra Hip room (woohoo finally) on the 28th floor. We really liked this room! Love the bathroom mirror light. On top of looking good, it smelled nice too! Comfy bed and pillows! One downside was that walls are thin.

The pools were just okay, pretty basic. There's a cool game room, though, with foosball, ping pong and pool tables. The FlowRider wave machine costs $25\/person.

Stayed here for 3 nights and it was a nice stay. Upgraded to a nicer room and I will definitely stay again. The employees were all very polite and professional. Highly recommended if you want a quality hotel with lots of shopping inside.

Ive stayed here many times when coming to Vegas!
It is in the best location on the strip if you are young\/planning to go clubbing most of the time during your visit. PH\/Cosmo\/Aria\/Paris\/Bellagio is the ideal centralized location so you arent walking forever from the end of the strip. I also like that it has the shops and places to eat connected to the hotel! Their casino area is a tad bit smaller than some of the other hotels on the strip though, so if youre mainly into gambling verse going out then some of the other hotels might be a better fit for you.

Great location, great price! The hotel is one of the closest to the airport and it's right in the middle of the action. The beds are comfortable and you can spend a bit more for a larger room with two sinks and a large soaker tub and separate shower. Internet is a bit pricey at $13.99\/day. 

There is a shopping mall attached complete with two ABC Liquor\/Convenience stores (reasonably priced) as well as H&M, Bath and Body Works, and a few less expensive dining options. The restaurants in the hotel itself are good, however they're not the most affordable. This is common among the luxury hotels on the strip.

The rooms here were all right, there's no mini fridge to keep stuff cold, so me and my friends made the bath tub our "cooler" by filling it up with a shit ton of ice. It wasn't too much of a problem, because we only stayed in our room to watch the 2013 aspen x games. The rest if the room is alright nothing to fancy. Our room was decorated with stuff about Sulvestet Stalon, it was pretty weird. The casino floor however was much better, there are a lot of tables and slot machines and a bar\/ lounge in the middle of the room. The miracle mall wraps around the outside of the casino and makes it convenient I'd you wanna shop, eat, or buy some cheap beer at one of the 2 ABC Stores. Overall my experience here was great.

if u dont want to read the whole review: its a pretty hotel with great colors and decors. you would like it if u like to party,
now for the review.
the rooms were pretty coo but the hallways were dirty. u would think that in 3 days of being in vegas that at leaste 1 of the hundreds of housekeepers could pick up the cigarettes on the ground in the hall. i called to make a reservation on the phone and got a really good deal. i got a bottle of liquor each night (and no not those little pieces of shit bottles the real thing) but here is the catch..they dont give u chasers so u have to buys those on ur own. we were able to take the bottle around with us and had a great time. the bathroom was big and we could fit a few girls in there getting ready. the shower was a clear glass door so i got to see all my friends goodies (not that i havent seen them before) 

when you book the reservation they charge your card at time of reservations. the line at check in was stupid long at 4 pm on friday which i can understand just make sure that u already have a drink before you check in. 

i would stay there again but i think id want to try out a different hotel

I've stayed at the Planet Hollywood twice now I give this place an honest review.

Rooms: Besides the fact that there was a HUGE wet spot on the floor of our room when we first entered...nothing special. The bathroom is large (which is nice for the ladies) and there's a tub to fill with ice and put your bottles of alcohol in. I know you do it...
Parking: SUPERRRR far from the actual hotel! UGH!!!!
Pool: HORRIBLE! So small and plain! Yuck. You need a room key to get in by the way.
Service: Sloowww! And for some reason they always seem to hang up on you or make you wait forever.

When it comes to picking hotels in the summer I look for 2 things: Location & pool.
Planet Hollywood has a horrible pool so...next time I would skip this place.

On my second trip to sin city I stayed here at PH, previously stayed at MGM and that was excellent so this place had big shoes to fill. Lobby was small but the set up was really nice with all the lights. Room was pretty basic nothing special, but the best part was the bathroom. Huge tub(fits 2 people he he). Stand up shower and closet type toilet room. This place lost a star because of the boring room and average pool. To me that's a big deal. This is very conveniently located on the strip, probably one of my favorite casinos. Love watching the go-go dancers on the stripper poles while i was gambling. And the miracle mile shopping was amazing. So many stores and sites I must say that was epic. 

There so many pros and cons about this place so here is a rundown 

Pros: Shopping(Mircale mile), bathrooms, casino, location, and easy to get a cab or limo. 

Cons: Average rooms, pools were just ok, no good clubs in hotel, oh and most of the average rooms have no view

I've stayed here twice and I liked it both times. It is very clean and quiet, not as luxe as some of the other hotels, but nice enough. It has a much cooler feel than Treasure Island. The location is amazing, and you can get your fabulosity fix right across the street at Cosmo\/Bellagio\/Aria. 

I booked several rooms here for CES and found their phone booking agent to be super pleasant, and when we checked in, the desk agent was accomodating and patient. The person who checked us out must have been new or tired (it was 5am and there was a long line of several people checking out). We were charged for internet access even though it was included in the resort fee. He did take it off, but only after it was pointed out.

Regarding the resort fee, they are standard operating procedure for Vegas hotels. Ceasar's properties used to advertise that they didn't have a fee, but those days are over. I just see it as a very high internet-access fee. 

The two Starbucks locations were great, Earl's of Sandwich was the perfect cheap mid-day meal, and the dudes running the taxi line were great. PH is definitely a 4 star worth returning to on my next inevitable desert pilgrimage.

This hotel seems to be skimping on everything possible including recruiting good people to work there.  So many things went wrong during my 4 night stay.
First, the valet services are slow both leaving and getting your car back.  They don't allow you to call down ahead to get the car and you have to wait about 10 minutes on average for it to show up.
When we checked in, the ONLY two bed non-smoking room available was an accessible room.  The only options they offered were to take a smoking room or take this room for the night and switch the next day.  The accessible room had a shower that was basically even with the bathroom floor other than a small 1\/4 inch railing that was covered in mold and allowed the water to cover the entire bathroom floor after a shower since the drain was pretty much clogged.  The whole room smelled like stagnant water and mold.
When we went down the next day around 9am, we were told that we needed to come back at 2pm to get our new room.  When we told them we won't be able to do that, we were told we have to come back and check again at 11am.  This of course was when EVERYONE is checking out so we had to wait in a 20 minute line to get our new keys to the new room.  The new room had a dead lamps and the room overall is REALLY dark with only a small 3 x 3 window in the corner.
One of the days, the maids didn't even bother coming to make up the room.  No new towels, no beds made up, nothing.  They didn't even come in.  When I called down to housekeeping to tell them, their response was brilliantly, "so.......".
The internet is ridiculously expensive and is charged PER DEVICE, not per room or stay.  They even charge you for use of the fitness center ($25 per person per day) since it "belongs to the spa".  What hotel doesn't have a fitness center any more?!?
Overall, two thumbs down.  I'm definitely NEVER staying there again and recommend you don't either.
We had a nice stay here, nice room a lot of shops and restaurants very close, good overall location. Only complaint our view and windows were a little on small side but enjoyed stay.

I really enjoyed my stayed at PH, customer service was great at all times,  the locations is just perfect. House keeper manager came to our room a few minutes after we checked in to make sure everything was ok, and to check if we needed anything else. the rooms aren't that newwww, (that's why i only give it 4 stars) but aren't bad, very well maintained. I always look for cleanlines and i found it here, i would definitely stay again. ohhhh and i loooove the fact that it has the miracle mile shops in the hotel..

On my last three trips to Vegas, this has been my target spot. It is well situated on the strip among many other great hotels and casinos. The hotel is nice, new and clean and very well priced. The crowd tends to be younger and more energetic than some of the other standard "fancier, upscale" Vegas spots. The mall has a great selection of stores just for that demographic. Love the Earl of Sandwich for late night snacks. Look out, you might spot Bruce Willis at a craps table.

Worst customer service EVER received at a hotel especially in Las Vegas since you have your choice of ANY hotel on the strip. Unfortunately I did not choose that hotel we were with a large group and someone else booked it. 

We got to the hotel late that evening waited in a long line as the check in staff conversed with the customers for LONG periods of time, We waited patiently our turn... as the customer walks away the staff continue to talk amongst themselves as we wait to check in for approx 20 minutes!

 We had booked a suite with  2 king sized beds and of course they claim they sold the room which we reserved and PAID for months earlier. Getting NOWHERE for another 10 minutes they claim NO ROOMS available. How does that happen?? We had PAID for a room with 2 king sized beds and NOW they only have a room with one bed for 2 of us to SHARE!

Anyway, the (boy) that's what he looked like with his shirt too big and his pants too long wasn't budging So, we requested a manager and low and behold a room POPPED up with 2 king sized beds! 

I don't have any clue as to why they were doing what they did?? The hotel was too young of a crowd and the staff looked like a bunch of young kids running it... Since when did Las Vegas become so unaccomadating?? 

If looking for a GREAT time don't stay at Planet Hollywood! Just say'n....

Casino: Newer, very hip and modern decor, located in the center of the strip, miracle mile shops, tons of ABC stores open later for your convenience, Earls of Sandwich open 24\/7, Fat Tuesday, starbucks, nightclubs, bars, and Gordon Ramsay's new burger joint; definitely a place that the younger crowd frequents.

Hotel Room: I've stayed here twice and both times I thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The first room was a resort room with the mountain view which is basically no view, but both the bathroom and room were very clean and spacious. The second time was at a jr. suite and the room was amazing with a view of the Bellagio fountains. No resort fees!

Cons: it gets super smoky in the casino floor but because they don't use any air freshener like other casinos do, it gets really noticeable. But, if you walk out of the casino and to the shops, the problem goes away.

Absolutely my go to place when visiting vegas!

Let's just say, it's refreshing to step into the lovely Planet Hollywood and to be embraced with quality decor, great service and overall good energy and vibes.

I come to Vegas all the time, since I am from Los Angeles, and have tried a variety of places....I have two high strong recommendations

1) planet hollywood
2) aria


Have a great Vegas trip and good luck ;)

I give PH four stars because I was surprised at how much I enjoyed my stay. In regard to amenities, PH is probably a 3 or 3.5 when compared to other similarly situated hotel\/casinos (e.g. Wynn, Bellagio, Plazzo, Mandalay Bay). What it lacks in amenities, it makes up for in location and price. 

The pool is cool. The patrons vary in age and size, but there is no shortage of 21 year-olds celebrating birthdays and batchelors\/batchelorettes celebrating the end of their single-hood.  The entertainment is quality.

I recommend it!

Out - Sixton.

I don't care what people have to say but the dealers are hot and sexy, there is a shopping mall for the ladies open til 11pm attached right to the casino and the 44.49 24 hour buffet is worth every penny if your a hungry fella like ,myself.

dp

A much younger crowd, my friend loved it but I thought it was just ok. Unfortunately before her trip my friend had her purse stolen and had to get a temporary ID (on paper with her photo) to show along with an old ID she had that was expired and she had already got her replacement credit card and debit card. We went to play a game on the money wheel which my friend simply observed. The young woman who was overseeing the game ID'd all three of us - including my friend who was simply standing behind us. You would have thought we were counting cards or something as all of these phone calls had to be made and this gentleman walked over and gave my license the third degree (even though I had already showed it to the original woman). It was just such a pain and a bit overkill I thought. 

On a positive note they had great live music and seemed to be fairly busy on a weekday. They had a buffet too which we tried- I thought it was horrible honestly but that's another review...

Now that I have a significant amount of time to continue with my hobbies...some of which include yelping, blogging, and reading, I'm digging through my memory to give my honest opinions and experiences for all of you!  School has been hectic but making the time to yelp keeps us all in the know.  

Las Vegas has become one of my favorite places to visit.  This was my third visit to the flashing lights of vegas with my boyfriend, whom was also the one who took me on my very first trip here,  and we stayed here our last night in Vegas.  PH is absolutely beautiful, I love that each room is decorated by a certain movie with memorabilia and screen shots of that movie.  When we hopped out of the elevator I felt so posh and fancy here, walking in the room I could smell how clean the carpet was.  You know that smell of just shampooed carpet? Ya that's what I could smell as soon as we walked through the door.  

The room was gorgeous, the bathroom was sparkly clean, and the amount of storage was wonderful.  The bed was like sleeping on Cloud 9.  I absolutely loved it.  They even have those usb chargers for iphones on the desk too.  I also loved that this hotel is on the strip but was very quiet in our rooms.  The tub was small but it was cool because you can have a hot tub bath and relax in there.  Didn't get to try the buffet here but my boyfriend and I tried the grill downstairs.  The burgers were big and juicy and hit the right spot!  LOVED IT.  

I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.  When you can walk in a room and can tell that the carpets were just shampooed, that's gotta be a good thing!

Planet Hollywood use to be my go-to spot for a nice and affordable hotel in Vegas. After my stay last week I probably won't be booking a room there ever again. 

My sisters and I had a Sun-Tues reservation. My sister woke up Monday morning and found a bed bug in her bed. She also noticed bites on her ankle and thigh. Shocked and disgusted I called the front desk who sent someone upstairs to investigate. After confirming the room had bed bugs we were moved to a similar room. We asked for an upgrade to compensate for the inconvenience, but they informed us that nothing could be done until the investigation was complete. It's been almost a week since our stay and we still haven't heard back from hotel management.                                                 

I'm very disappointed in the way hotel management has handled the issue and won't spend my money with Planet Hollywood again.

The parking here sucks big time. Using the self park, you need to walk through the entire mall to get from the back of the property to near the front where the registration desk is located on the floor below registration. Plan to just use the "complementary" valet parking. The rooms are decent, each presumably decorated with artifacts from various movies. Ours was "The Mask.' Also found out why Planet Hollywood is lovingly referred to as "Planet Ho." Was propositioned three times in two days. Either I looked like a sugar daddy or I looked really desperate. Casino floor basically very loud music playing in the evening, although there are some quiet places in the "back" of the casino.

I've never stayed at the hotel, but i sure did party at Club Prive!!  It was basically my first time at Las Vegas and partying at Prive was well worth it!!  Big ups to Jeff for providing us VIP.  He made everyone feel welcome and always made sure that we're alright.  So far, this club beats any other club I have been to in my life (San Diego Clubs need to step their game up).  This club plays great variety of music that fits everybody needs.  You'll spend a great amount of money, but this club will not let you down.  If you're planning to go out, come check out Prive!!

The room is nice, but the restroom does not lock. No breakfast! However, when I booked by billing.com it said breakfast included! They provide an $8 voucher for starbucks but it is not right place to have breakfast! 
Aldo it says Starbucks works untill midnight but it 11:00 pm last night it was closed!

This is actually one of my favorite places to park, shop and stay. The rooms are small but nice. Great location,  not too pricey, and the Miracle mile is great for middle class shopping.  YES! a mall normal people can afford things on the strip!

Ooommmmgggggg!!!! This food is one of the best I ever tried!!! 
Erica was fantastic with her services, very good customer service and the food (salmon teriyaki) was the best I ever ate!!!

Thank you Erika for your services and thank you planet Hollywood!!! I'll come back tomorrow

(3.5)
A Frickin MAZE!!!

I like to start with the positives. 
There's Earl of Sandwich. 
Prices are reasonable (i booked mine from hotel.com)
They have tubs instead of just showers. 

I originally booked a Hollywood Hip room, which was the basic. 
However, when checking in, they showed me that i would be facing the back lot. (ofcourse right?)  I was offered a $20\/per room.\/per night upgrade so i could see the strip and they also found me adjoining rooms, which was good since i was with relatives in two rooms. It was so much more convenient than being separated and plus they got to see the strip. 

MAJOR COMPLAINT= the self parking is hella far from hotel entrance!
My poor grandma and mom had to walk the entire miracle mile as we did not know it would be that far! The rest of the trip, dude and i pretty much was going back and forth to pick them up at the lobby. Took about 12 minutes each way. They have free valet, but we never like to valet in general... bad stories. 

Rooms are not created equally! (in the same category). 
We had adjacent rooms on the 16th floor and there was a few differences we noticed. The room i was NOT sleeping in had noticeably softer beds (must be the beds some yelpers were saying were sooooo comfortable- we didn't get those). My room had the very low water pressure that some guests noted, while the other room had perfectly good water pressure... 

Minor complaints. 
There's a pretty sizable opening on the doors leading to the restroom, which do not lock or close all the way. Peek a boo... thankfully not peek a poo, as you have ur private door for the toilet.

Gordon please help this hotel!  Stay here because of the Britney Spears show.  Bell desk customer service sucks.  Man that came to get our luggage was surprised we needed help with 3 suitcase.  Didn't even try to pick them up to put in his cart.    Hotel room was beat up.  Furniture scratched, walls stained, and dust on couches.  Casino pretty good size.  Restaurants and bars are nice.

Have stayed here many times.

Most recent was on 1\/23\/16....strip view, two queen beds, 20th floor.

Check in took almost 30 minutes, after a walk from basically the roof for self-parking.

Room was as-requested, with "resort access fee" cost was about $200.00....which is really stupid.  The only reason I booked this room was an event at Caesar's which cost over $300.00 a night and is easily reached after a 10 minute walk.

Carpets are stained, worn and torn in spots.

Elevator(1 of 6) was out of order and stuck open.

Short of the Gordon Ramsey Burger restaurant, choices are played out and expensive or not very good.

While I hate staying here, do enjoy the convenience.  That would be the only reason to chose PH, and probably why I'll stay here again...that said, it is an overblown, expensive and unpleasant accommodation.

Pros: Location. It is really in the center of the strip. Next to Paris, diagnal to Bellaggio, a block from Caeser's palace. Free parking (and free valet though we did not use valet) but to get to the parking, you have to walk through the Million Mile Mall, which is cumbersome. But it is a free parking (which I think is a standard for all Vegas hotels). 

Cons: Our room looked cleaned, but the furniture was very outdated (which we really did not care - this is an inexpensive hotel). But what bothered us was that the safe was broken, the drawers were all broken and gone except on drawer. No refrigerator, no coffee makers. The first night, this random repair guy knocked on our door unannounced. Also we did not get a king room as we booked.

It's my favorite place to play. It's fun loud and sexy lol. The only thing I have a problem with is that the bathrooms always smell like shit and the trash cans on the casino floor gets disgustingly full to the brim. The Extra Lounge has live bands at times and Earl of Sandwich is open 24 hrs!

You get 5 stars because every time I put $100 on black, it was black at Planet Hollywood Casino, there was even one point I did it 4 times in a row at 4 different tables just to see if I was actually "lucky"

It also doesn't hurt that I love Planet Hollywood in general and that this place is awesome!  It's probably my favorite Casino in Vegas, however, it's not my favorite hotel... 

Love this place.

Oh how I miss Vegas..

This Hotel was awesome One of my top favorite Vegas hotels for sure.

This place has a mall inside of it ! which was awesome to walk around and kill time from the 106 degree heat (In June). They also have a Rock bar where some of the UFC after parties are held.

The casino is really nice, I was able to get about 4 or so drinks from playing slots here which was more than I could get anywhere else. 

Lot's of Starbucks of course, Big hotel. 

I recommend to hit this Hotel up if you are on the Strip.

I booked through Expedia , everything seemed fine up until we arrived to the hotel . We were so lost trying to get to front desk . The parking lot leads straight into the shopping center ..We walked around the shops for a while until we finally found our way . The check in line was impossible so we decided to try the self check in , it assigned us a room and we felt relieved that we didn't have to wait in that line . When we arrived to the room I was immediately disappointed, there was two queen size beds (I booked a king size) . I call front desk and the person informs me that I must've messed up the check in process . I'm upset now . I explain that I booked a king and don't understand how I messed up the check in . He says I must've clicked the wrong thing when I checked in . I am getting upset so I  say I didn't , and if I did it must've been because I booked a king and wasn't expecting a machine to offer me something I didn't book. He says there's nothing he can do , I ask to speak to a manager . A few minutes later he comes back , DOES NOT let me speak to the manager and says he can waive the resort fee . I say I don't like the room , which had the worst view ever , had two beds and had a bathroom sink clogged. I just want my bigger bed .He keeps repeating he can't do anything, I'm so mortified and tired that I  just say fine . Never going back there , should've stayed at Cesar's palace or the Bellagio .

Stayed here in September,  got a newly renovated room on the 21st floor. It was a junior suite. Very clean and comfortable with a great view of the fountains. No issues with anything. Room was very quiet. I have stayed in most of Ceasars properties and this is one of my favorites.

pros:-- location and miracle mile shop.

cons:--- slot machines never ever pay back, not many table games (black jack), employees are rude, can't get a beverage sevice while playing slots(where are the all beverage service employees),  overpriced restaurants, peep show is not interesting as much as they advertise.

Planet Hollywood is a nice place except for one reason! 
The gym & spa closes at 7pm!!! Wtf???
I also brought my little brother who's 14 years old to the gym and this FAT lady at the desk said NO he's under age... 
That's why I call this place Planet Fattty and that's why she looks the way she does because she never believed in children's health & fitness... She believes in Fatness :(

Planet Hollywood is a solid 3.5-star hotel. I wish I could give it more love but parking and WiFi suck.

4-stars - Hotel Room. We stayed in a newly remodeled Ultra Resort Room. It was super clean and spacious. The only thing I disliked about the room was that it overlooked the pool and while I enjoyed the two-piece eye candy, even the double-pained windows couldn't hold back the boom boom boom of the bass bass bass.

4-stars - Casino. I liked the vibe and variety of games available to play. Most casinos are dead in the middle of the day but this place was jumping.

4-stars - Food. Everything tasted good!

1-star - The Underground. When you pull into the casino to check-in there are signs specifically meant to confuse the sh!t out of you. LAX makes more sense... downtown Tijuana makes more sense... this place doesn't!

1-star - Valet. Don't even think about using the valet on a weekend. The lines are longer than Disneyland.

1-star - Parking. You have to park in Arizona and walk through a "mile of shops" to get to your room. By the time you get there, you are too tired to go downstairs and gamble!

1-star - Parking Deck. There are two elevators that go from the mall to the upper levels of the parking structure. Stupid design. There aren't enough elevators and they aren't located in an air conditioned part of the building.

1-star - WiFi. First, it is an unsecured connection (when there is an actual connection). Second, it is unreliable and slow. It's an embarrassment in 2017. Their entire IT department should have their flip phones and PalmPilots taken away.

Would I stay here again? Yes, if comped.

Good to see that this hotel is under new management. When it was the Aladdin, there was so much wrong with it. Not anything bad but it just didn't compare with its immediate neighbors. Now its look and its atmosphere resembles more of the Palms than a touristy casino.

Love the loud house and dance music. Love the karaoke, love the bars and the whole scene. This is the place to bring your friends and people you want to kick it with. DONT bring the kids nor the grandparents or anyone else who will suffer from extra sensory overload.

I was "iffy" from the moment coming in but when I heard the music and laughter and the hot chicks prancing around, I knew that this place was cool. Give it a few years and this place will get its act together. It looks like there's more investment into this place. I like it already.

Upon arriving, we noticed that the resort now charges for Valet unless you are a Platinum Rewards member over above. So glad we were, which saved us at least $13\/day if not more.

The valet staff was very quick and attentive with getting a bellhop to assist with our bags.

The check-in process is streamlined now with self-serve kiosks. 

The room was beautiful with modern decor and amenities. We were in the North Tower 12th floor with a view of the Paris Eiffel Tower and Strip. Our room featured 2 sinks, a separate spacious shower and large bath tub. The toilet was in a separate room within the bathroom for privacy. Complimentary coffee and coffee pot was included in the room though they also have a Starbucks onsite.

All the staff at the hotel we encountered were very friendly.

The casino is well maintained and features several bars, restaurants, gambling machines and tables. The cocktail waitresses are readily available.

I highly recommend signing up for a free players card that you can use for discounts at restaurants, shows, and shops. The comps with the program are generous.

The checkout process was just as easy and quick as checking in. 

We will definitely consider staying here again!

I enjoy my stays at PH every time i come to visit Las Vegas. Its affordable and everything is convenience Such as Earls sandwich which opens 24 hours and the miracle mile mall which also has a fat Tuesday as well.

If you want good hotel deals. Visit my friend that djs and works in vegas at www.efxvip.com

smartervegas.com for deals too.

For my first time in Vegas during spring break in college, I thought Planet Hollywood was a great place to stay! My group of friends chose the suite in order to live it up for our first time. It included two beds, a kitchen, a hot tub and very spacious accommodations. We played music on the TV and we could listen to our jams as we got ready in the restroom. Our view was great because we could see the rest of the strip and the hustle and bustle of Vegas. 

Planet Hollywood is a great location because it is in the middle of the strip and is right next to the really nice hotels and shops. There is a mall or shopping center within the vicinity so you can do some souvenir shopping, gamble, or even grab a drink at Fat Tuesday. Fat Tuesday and Earl sSandwich are located in the same building so that was the best decision ever since Earls Sandwich is 24 hours. I really think my friends and I chose a prime location where we could really take in the Vegas experience. Despite it being on the Strip, it seems like you will always be taxiing wherever you go even when you are less than a mile away from the club. When you are in heels or it's late at night, you never want to walk back. Lucky for us since PH is in a prime location, the cost wasnt that bad. There are taxis circling in the parking area at PH so that is always convenient. 

**TIPS**
1) The suite life is pretty awesome. I would definitely recommend it.
2) If the day club is too expensive, there pool area is really nice to lounge around.
3) Enjoy your stay!

Don't waste your time and lost your money on Casino. They provide the loud and beating music to make you losing your focus on playing to win. They fool you with the striper girls uniform for the unprofessional dealer to take all your money and make you be the loser at the end of gambling. You will never win in this Casio at the end of the day. They hire the deaf dealer to work on the table to rip off your money because you feel pity on him...And again you will lost all the money because of him....There are many ways they tried to cheat and beat you and take your money on this casino ...........so easily. Never come back again...and again forever.

My friend and I stayed here last week. We stayed in 3518 and the rooms are really spacious. We didn't get a view of anything just a parking lot and mountains. I think each room here is movie themed. We got the "Honey, I shrunk the kids" theme. Beware, there is an ugly prop in the table by the window. It was a huge ant. I thought it was a huge spider so I screamed. ( I hate spiders ) Well anyway, the room was located near the elevator which was really convenient. Every few minutes or so, I would hear the elevator ding. The hotel is located in the middle of the strip and across fom the city center. Two thumbs up that there's a pedestrian bridge from city center to ph.  I liked the miracle mile shop downstairs which many different selections of stores. Two thumbs up for Earl of sandwiches and Fat Tuesdays.

Planet Hollywood is in a great location.  Seriously, it can't be topped.  However, the hotel is only okay.

The room I was in was adequate and affordable.  And honestly, that's why we stayed there.  But if you're not able to get a deal on the room like I was, why are you staying here?  Cosmo is across the street next to Aria, Bellagio, Caesars, Mandarin Oriental & Vdara... if you're not getting a deal at Planet Hollywood it just doesn't make much sense to book it.  

If you are getting a deal though, which I suspect you are, you are probably staying in a Hollywood Hip Room (they're just the basic rooms) and you won't be disappointed.  The location is superb and the rooms are, as I said, adequate.  

At about $50.00 - $80.00 a night, this is a great hotel to book.  Over $100.00 a night, you're probably making a mistake.

We came here on a Tuesday night for a random trip to Vegas.  The deal we got came with a free bottle of liquor and comp admission to the spa for 2 people.  The room was pretty spacious, the beds were super comfy!  The shower looked a bit old, but other than that, the room was great (we had a Brendan Frasier themed room...kinda random!)  Late night in the hotel was okay, Planet Dailies offered a pretty big variety of food and it's open 24 hours.  Earl of Sandwich was also amazing!  The spa was really small and not renovated like most of the hotel, but it was still really clean and the service was great.

The downside was the terrible, terrible music they played in the casino.  When I first sat down at the tables, I heard Toni Braxton, Elton John, The Fray.  All good music, but definitely not the upbeat Vegas music you wanna hear all day.  Both times my friend lost his money...it was to Bitter Sweet Symphony!  

Overall, this hotel is in a great location on the strip and not as pricey.

Want married men to buy you drinks while shamelessly flirting with you in front of their buddies?  One eye on you, and the other eye on basketball bets they can't afford to lose?  Come here during March Madness - or any day that ends in a "y."

Of course, our chances of meeting the single guys of our dreams were slightly soiled due to the Miss USA Pageant being held at our Hotel.  Rats!  Gosh darn pretty folk.  Try lounging poolside in a bikini, reading your John Grisham novel, when Miss Tennessee and Miss Georgia approach, block the sun, and ask if the seats beside you are taken in their  "ya'll cain't say no tuh us" drawls.  *suck in stomach? check! stick out arm? check!  feeling like hamburger next to steak? check!*

Since the Planet Hollywood was unable to do a complete overhaul of the Aladdin, they cut a few cost corners.  For example, my Hollywood-themed room had a genie lamp and some crazy swirly carpet.  Same great price and reliable everything - just painted purple and with giant PH symbols everywhere.

But the mall is still there!  There's nothing better than walking down to the lobby in the morning, taking 5 kamikaze shots, and then stumbling around the attached mall and spending the money in your "I'll get fired if my boss reads my Yelp reviews" savings account. 

They had nice ashtrays, which Lindsey and I glamorously threw up in on way to the airport the last morning.  See?  PH brought us a little closer to being Hollywood starlets.  

I look forward to seeing what else has been remodeled - in seven months, when I'm allowed to be within 100 yards of the property.

UPDATE: I stayed here again, the gaming floor is still good, my room was much better although still could use an update.  Caesars Entertainment is such an A quality place that I think this could be upgraded to not target the low end.

I stayed here over Easter weekend and I have very mixed feelings about this place.

We checked in and our package was supposed to come with a free bottle of alcohol, but they said that wasn't our promotion and we got other coupons. I'm pretty sure I booked the right package, but I let it go, it wasn't worth fussing over. I'm Asian, and when we got to our room our theme was.... Enter the Dragon w\/ Bruce Lee. Coincidence? I'll never know...

The room was clean and decent sized. Like other reviews said though, it was kind of dark in there. Planet Hollywood has a pretty good location: middle of the Strip, close to shopping, Earl of Sandwich, Fat Tuesday (both of which I went to every day).

My major problems with this place made the stay not as pleasant. Every morning at 10AM, someone would knock on our door to do a "room check." One day they even opened the door because they didn't hear me yell. WTF. Check out time is at 11, and we had just barely woken up. WTH is a room check anyway?? -1 BIG star

Another thing, instead of the free bottle we were supposed to get, we got a coupon for some slot credit. Well the coupon had their old rewards club name, and I went to the players club and they were transitioning into the Total Rewards Club. The coupon said I would get $15 slot credit, but with the new Total Rewards I would have to play more and then I'd be given $40. After going back and forth from the Players Club and Cashier at least 5 times, they ended up denying me the $40 when they CLEARLY told me that if I played enough I would get it. I certainly played enough, complained to them, and got no comps or anything for all my troubles due to THEIR mistakes. That really ruined the end of my trip. -1 BIG star

So thanks to their room checks and horrible service and communication between their workers and computer systems, I won't be back. If you are looking for a decent priced room this is an ok place to stay, but be forewarned at least about those room checks.

Not the best...

We spent the weekend here and I honestly wish we hadn't. For a Vegas 'mega-resort' this place needs serious help. It looks nice & all but they're headed down-hill real fast. The casino floor is SO confusing! Its almost impossible to find anything! The signs are no help what-so-ever. 

After 9pm the place livens up a bit with beautiful dealers wearing lingerie and girls dancing on poles (classy!) but thats not enough to make me want to go back.

Checking IN took forever -- this should NEVER be the case in any hotel. On top of that we ended up having to change rooms twice! The first room had moldy, wet carpet... The second was supposed to be a non-smoking room but stunk to high heaven.. 

All in all I don't think i'd go back here to stay ever again. There are plenty of other beautiful casino \/ hotels on the strip for the same amount of money.

Don't usually complain, but this hotel will take your reservation regardless of inventory. (booked King non smoking, told only option is 2 double bed smoking). Yes, right there move onto another hotel on the strip. Then the second day, we arrive back to the room at 9 PM, with our door ajar! Housekeeping cleaned the room, but never locked \/ shut the door ! (Nothing was stollen) The photos portray a remodeled hotel, in actuality, the casino and shops are new, the hotel rooms & hallways are left from the old Alladin casino.  Stay Away from all Ceasers casinos.....  MGM seems nice, or Starwood properties...

My boyfriend and I usually stay at the Cosmopolitan, but since we were meeting friends in Vegas who were staying at PH, we decided to stay there as well. I was hesitant, but the rates were much cheaper, so I thought "why not?!?"

Now I'll tell you why that was a mistake:

We arrived a few hours before check-in, but we assumed we could check in early because we always do at the Cosmo. Right here I quickly learned that PH is nothing like the Cosmo. The man checking us in informed us that it would be an $18.60 charge and kept trying to convince us to stay in a room with a better view for $20 more a night. We decided to stay in the room we booked, which turned out to be a total dump! 

The room itself was on a "non-smoking floor." I put that in quotes because the entire floor smelled like smoke for the 3 nights that we were there. Clearly no one enforced this "rule." By the time I left, I had a sore throat and a headache from all of the smoke.

When we got into the room I thought "this looks familiar!" The reason it looked familiar was because I had stayed in the same room 12 years ago when it was the Aladdin. Not much had changed in 12 years. The decor was not very "Hollywood" at all. (I know Hollywood, I lived there for over 10 years...) The faucets even still have the genie lamps on them! The "Miracle Mile" mall looks like the Middle East (again, the Aladdin decor has not changed there either.)

Our friends had a huge suite with an amazing view, but unfortunately the view was the only high point. The room felt old as well; definitely not worth the price of a suite.

This hotel needs a major upgrade and remodel. Hopefully Britney's upcoming shows will bring in enough cash to allow them to do so. The one thing I learned from our trip: just spend the extra money and stay at the Cosmo. It's clean and modern and the staff treats you like royalty.

And don't even get me started on the $20 per night resort fee! It's ridiculous that we had to pay that since we weren't using the gym or the internet. The final price with the extra fees would have allowed us to stay somewhere much more upscale. Wish I had known that. Total disappointment!

One final note: we had to cut and design our own "Do not disturb" sign because they didn't give us one. Is paper that expensive these days? I should not have to do graphic design work while on vacation, especially when I'm not getting paid for it!!!

Hubby and I celebrated our 5th anniversary at the "new" Planet Hollywood this past month and enjoyed ourselves immensely. I was sort of scared due to the reviews I've read prior to our trip. 

While I do believe that some of the rooms are pretty icky (they haven't remodeled all of their rooms), we were fortunate enough to stay in one of their revamped rooms in the north tower. 

We were upgraded to their fountain room for free which was awesome. We had awesome views of the strip and the Bellagio water show. The room was decorated tastefully with kitschy "Hollywood" stuff, a nice plasma tv and fun furniture. 

You can't beat the location, either. Oh, and Miracle Mile, too.

Everything about PH is great..that is, until you get to the pool area. Seriously, the pool sucks. And what is Vegas in the middle of a heat wave without an awesome pool?! Blasphemy!
Poor service... Had to ask 3 times for a drink ! The burger was well overcooked ! The only good point and star of the night was the cockail ! All the rest... Pass

Rooms are outdated and not clean. The non-smoking rooms still reek of cigarette. The television is facing a wall not the beds. You pay additional fees for Internet. No complimentary coffee in the rooms. No complimentary water. I would not recommend this hotel. The one star is for location. 
Construction on the pool area woke me up at 7am Saturday morning. Front desk explained that all guest were notified that construction would begin at 9am. I WAS NOT either way the drilling began at 7AM not 9am. They offered to change my room and comp me 4 buffets. Really? What's the point.

Came to Las Vegas for one night due to business, got here at Planet Hollywood at 11:00 Pm after standing in the line for more than 45 minutes got the key to room around midnight, from 8:00 Am there is construction workers and banging and noise going on here ,
Got up to tack a shower and get ready , there is no water in the room , so called the front desk and they say must be a not in your room that we are going true consultations and their will be no water in the rooms from 10:00am to 3:00 pm , I'm so mad I can't even describe it right now , if your coming to vegas DO NOT STAY Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino , they would get your money and tell you oh sorry we assumed you would know , and if you bought your room from internet your screwed and you won't get compensation for your money and terrible experience .

Came for Earl of Sandwich and went to the pool. 

The pool was free didn't ask for room key or anything, just walked straight in. Has two pools, one which is for all ages and another for just 21 and older. Both pools were pretty packed and it was hard to find some chairs. When you first walk into the pool area there's a big section for just tanning, pools are on the left and right. 

Earl of Sandwich of course is a must and it's really cheap.

Lots of shops and has a Fat Tuesday! so get drunk while shopping and grab some Earl's!

I love the fact that Planet Hollywood is at the center of the Strip and offers a wide variety of things to do without having to leave the hotel (Miracle Mile Shops, fast food and high end restaurants, Fat Tuesday, swimming, spa, etc). While I did have an overall enjoyable stay here, there are definitely aspects of the hotel that can be improved upon. 

I had reserved a non-smoking "Hip" room with a king bed, but upon check-in, realized they had put me in a smoking room that smelled heavily of marijuana. I went back down to the front desk immediately and let them know that I had booked a non-smoking room, but they informed me that they had no non-smoking rooms available at the time. The woman at the front desk offered for housekeeping to come up and spray my room with air freshener, but I declined the offer.

She then let me know that they could accommodate my reservation by performing a room change the next day. She said they would upgrade me to a larger, non-smoking room on a higher level, and that I would receive a phone call as soon as my new room was ready.

By 3pm the next day, I still hadn't heard from the front desk, so I called down to see if my upgraded room was ready. The woman at the front desk said it was, so I'm not sure why they hadn't called me. I will say that I was satisfied with my upgraded room. It was larger, very clean, and had a nice view of the strip.

That same day, my husband and I visited the swimming pool. Unfortunately, we were a bit turned off by the pool area. There were empty beer cans, bottles, and cups laying everywhere, debris in the pool and hot tub, and even the cabanas that you could rent appeared to be dirty and had stained cushions. We ended up leaving the pool area after about 20-30 mins.

As I mentioned earlier, I LOVE the location of Planet Hollywood and some of its amenities, but it wouldn't be my first choice to stay at when visiting Vegas again.

I have been to this hotel many times but it has been a few years since the last time. This time was just very disappointing, the room was very dirty with broken glass on the floor. Now, that can happen but what was worst is the lack of willingness to help me. After spending half of my stay in a dirty room(see attached pictures) they gave me a $50 credit for food without too many options to use so I never even got to use it. I think this hotel has lost a lot of his customer service abilities when it was sold to a larger corporations.
Our beverage waitress Rosey (Little) was the best server we've ever had! She's efficient and friendly!

Way over rated--$150.00 room was shabby--worth $20.00-- Glad I got a price match with NY-NY-- woodwork beat-up-blinds did not work--carpet was loose--all prices in the hotel were way out of line--especially drinks--$6.00 for a draught beer --also internet was $13.99 per day --so didn't  use-- but was charged anyway-- and no refund as it is a "corporation charge" so we can't or will not  do anything for you--- 
WIILL NEVER BE BACK--RIP-OFF

GNFSHN4

I don't think planet hollywood even deserves one star at all. So first of all me and my friends have been staying here since friday night. On sunday the front desk calls and tells us were moving rooms because of an "emergency". The front desk did not explain to us what the emergency was. So we moved rooms and they upgraded our room. And we left to go out to a club that night. Then after we came back to our room that night; my friend noticed there was a switch blade knife next to the table by her bed. Then after that we checked all our stuff, both of my friends noticed their cash was missing from their wallets. Wtf?! The security guard came, took pictures, and took a statement from my friends. The front desk changed our room. But they did not refund our money or anything. All they gave us was coupons to use at a buffet. I'll never be staying here again. The rooms are affordable but I rather pay more to make sure my valuables are safe.

This hotel is a hot mess. We arrived to a line for valet parking that took almost thirty minutes to get through, only to be told that there was no parking left even though we were registered guests of the hotel. We had to self park which took an additional 30 or so minutes because of the Brittney show. The room was absolutely filthy with a white crusty stain on the duvet, and something splattered on the mirror. I was hesitant to even sleep in the bed. The walls were extremely thin and we heard EVERYTHING going on in the next room and in the hallway. Everything was very dingy. I DO NOT reccomend anyone spend their hard earned money at this hotel when I imagine there are others for the same price that would at least be cleaner.

Was in Vegas for th iHeart Music Festival... BEST Concert Ever!!!

While I started out at a suite at TI, swapped to PH the last 2 days and loved it. Best decision ever... even though it was a little hard to find (not right near the strip) with some PH globe nowhere near the actual hotel...

LOCATION
This was the first time I have stayed in the new City Center and LOVED it. Location is fabulous, love the convenience of stepping outside and being near several dining and shopping options. There is energy and a vibe that is so much more interesting than the old (Venetian \/ Caesars\/ TI etc) area... where you walk for miles just looking at water or sidewalk... 

PERKS
The mall is fun, there is free WiFi all over - Starbucks, McDs, etc. Made it uber convenient for getting information on the tablet and phones... prices at all the stores are more reasonable too, because there is so much competition... 

Really good eateries and a booklet with promos and coupons that we didnt get to use... seemed like a lot of weight could have been gained, if there had been more time.

Oh, did I mention there is a Ross store close by?  Had to checkout the place for backup outfits! ;-)

CASINO
One night coming back from the Cosmo (across the street - nice lounge\/club), was intrigued by a cover band playing in the 'Lounge Ax' area... stayed to watch the show,  they band played to the audience nicely, trying to engage... and the sporty (referee outfit - incongruous) dressed waitress was very nice, and got us very excellent mojitos. 

I think there was a lot more to explore... really liked the clubby rock n roll vibe of the place. Such a welcome change then the stodgy and touristy places I have been going to the previous years.

HALLS & ROOM
Not a fan of the dark and punky colors in the halls.  

Room was clean and okay... like dark purple, but I think the memorabilia was not anything great, and the furniture seemed to be arranged a little awkwardly, like there was an end table missing or something. Bathroom was good though.

SUMMARY
Next time, definitely would stay here again... although Cosmopolitan looks really interesting too. Love the SATC decor over there... and I heard the pool lounge area is entertaining... almost like the commercials.

Planet Hollywood is a great place to stay in Las Vegas.  The location is one of the best, it is pretty much in the middle of everything.  You have easy access to the entire strip.  The hotel has great options for food and since it connects to the mall shops you have everything you could ever need without even having to leave the hotel.  The casino area is small but still nice.  Check in and parking are easy and the service friendly.  The rooms were great and the beds comfortable.  I guess all the rooms have a movie memorabilia, ours had stuff from Natural Born Killers.  The room was very large and the bathroom one of the better ones I have had in Vegas.   They actually have good lighting and a huge bathtub.  I was happy with my stay and would stay here again.
Cute hotel, nice food court and shopping plaza.

We enjoyed a two night stay at Planet Hollywood. Check in was a short line as we arrived earlier than check in time. At the desk, the young lady that served us was Mary Jayne and she was so kind, super nice with a smile. She checked us in early for free & sent a mini fridge to our room for free without me asking for it, so we really appreciated that. She provided us with all the information that we needed for the hotel. Mary Jayne you rock!

We get to our room and had a view of the mountains and I'm fine with that, because I'm only in the room for sleeping & showering.....lol. The room was very clean and spacious. Bathroom huge with a big soaker tub, but once again...I'm only in my room for sleep & showering! We stayed in a Hiphop room with a King bed and that was one of the most comfortable beds I ever had in a hotel and I travel a lot. PH has plenty of restaurants to choose from inside of the hotel or you can go to Miracle Mile Mall because its connected to the hotel and that's the bomb. PH, I will be back!  

P.S.
For all of the newbies in Vegas, just about every hotel on the strip has a Resort Fee!! 
GET OVER IT

Given the room we were in I think 3 stars is about right, had we been in a better updated room then I could imagine it being 4.

The rooms were ok, nothing special but they were a place to sleep which is really all we wanted for our 2 night stay. My Husband booked 2 rooms via his Perks subscription for us and his Family to stay in. The rooms were on the small side and really dark inside, they really had seen better days too. Paint was chipped and housekeeping wasn't overly enthusiastic in regards to the dusting but the location was perfect. We were on the 21st floor which has some nice views and was quiet, what I really didn't like was there was only one working Ice Machine for the entire floor, I had to walk right around to the other side of the building in my PJ's twice to fill up a tiny little bucket.

Britney happened to be performing on the 2nd night that we stayed and thought it nice that they place her pictures up around the elevator area, not so cool when fans are holding up the line to get one while posing and taking pictures there. Maybe have a designated area for this sort of thing?
The casino downstairs is pretty big and there is a great selection of shops and eateries, I LOVED the fact that Gordon Ramsay Burger was in the same building. The Miracle Mile shops is also a huge bonus too.

Check in was easy once we got through the 30 minute wait in line.

Honestly, I had a really great time here, but there's quite a few staff members with attitudes. One in particular was the bell hop - his name was Guy. They held our luggage for us while we went out and about on the strip and when we got back to pick them up so we could head to the airport they asked us for our ticket, but no body gave us a ticket when we dropped it off so we just told him our names and described our bags, but he kept insisting that we must have a ticket. We checked, but I assured him that we didn't get a ticket. Anyway this went on for a little bit he began to accuse us of loosing it and being sarcastic and mean. I was so surprised at how rude he was. Then there was some rude waitresses at the slot machines, but the rooms are nice and we didn't spend much time in our hotel so it was fine I suppose.

TOXIC VENTILATION SYSTEM

I visit Las Vegas frequently for business and I am always looking for a great Hotel. One of my pet peeves is a room that doesn't allow fresh air inside, as I can never get the central air to a temperature I desire. 
I have been working on a project at the new City Center, across from Planet Hollywood, so the location seemed perfect. 

I decided to give up my fabulous 1 bedroom suite at the Marriott Grand Chateau because of the crappy pool facility and took advantage of a special at PH. I walked across Harmon Avenue with my bags and meandered my way through the maze to the checkin desk. I stood in line for an hour and a half to get checked in while the staff handed out water and chocolates on a silver tray. The hip lobby and casino are beautifully designed but the halls are seriously in need of a good clean and\/or makeover. 

Once inside my room I decided to have a nap and get ready for the night. I awoke with burning eyes, dry throat and a stuffy nose. The bedside table and wall was covered in a mysterious white dusk and I realized it was coming from the vent above. i decided to investigate and stood on a chair to look inside the vent. To my horror the entire cavity was caked with toxic gook that looked like lint from a dryer covered in glue. i removed the vent cover with a nail file and uncovered what was certainly old construction debris, drywall dust, insulation and other unknown toxic crap blowing not only through my vent, but certainly through the entire hotel. 

I called to be transferred to another room and waited 2 hours for engineering to survey the problem. When he finally  arrived I showed him the mess and he explained that it was an old hotel and the problem was normal. There was nothing he could do but send a maid to clean up the mess. I waited another hour and nobody ever showed up. I called the front desk again, explained my frustration, and lugged all my shit downstairs to stand in line again for another 45 minutes. I was finally moved me to a new room -apparently an upgrade- but the vents were in the same condition. Seeing as there was no refund on pre-paid reservations I was pretty much doomed. i headed to the nearest 7-11, bought a roll of duct tape and covered the vents up with towels for the night. 

I sent an email to the hotel many weeks later, after they sent me a survey to rate my stay. I promptly sent photos of the vents and explained that I thought it appalling that they would subject guests to such horrendous conditions. I am sure that the entire hotel is blowing the same debris into the sleeping lungs of gamblers nightly. I received an apology from the general manager a month later stating that the room had been cleaned and that they would send a report over to engineering to investigate further. 

I would never stay at this hotel again. Any big hotel of this caliber on the strip that does not properly maintain the most important element of a Hotel room -air conditioning and ventilation- does not rate at all in my book. The dangers of such reckless maintenance procedures should be apparent  and I encourage everyone not to be fooled by smoke and mirrors.
Loved staying here stayed back in September all the host and dealers where very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is awesome and the inside was very pretty.

Very spacious rooms. Two queen beds with large bathroom & vanity area. The giant window overlooking the Las Vegas valley basin allows ample light into living\/sleeping room. Non-smoking room smells nice and cleaning service does a great job. Very efficient. 

The decor is modern with easy access to the casino through the Brittney Spears elevators. Plenty of eating areas as there is a full high-end mall downstairs offerings plenty of shopping until 11pm most nights. 

This resort offers plenty of things to do & restaurants to enjoy where you don't actually have to leave the hotel. 

Overall, this is an awesome place that's close enough to everything hot & new. Would highly recommend to anyone staying in Las Vegas for a few days.

First time staying here since Harrah's had bought it out.  This is pretty much the 2nd tier hotel after Caesar's in their chain.  
I got hooked up w\/ a resort room which had some Clint Eastwood memorabilia in it.  The rooms are updated and moderately priced...though they're nothing like the suites at Aria or Palazzo\/Venetian but you'll get better value from PH.  Cab fare to and from the airport is about $20.

Make sure to get your room in the North Tower which is newer and easier to get to.  Fountain view is nice as hell when u just wanna chill in the room for a bit.

Miracle Mile shops are convenient with stores that you would actually buy stuff from as opposed to overpriced boutiques.
The casino area is sexy and lively w\/ the Passion Pit girls and music going on well into the night with a lounge area in the center if you just wanna drink and kick it.  It'll keep you distracted enough to hit on 15.

It's too bad Privé got shut down as that was a nice club.  But I hear there are some other things in the works here that should offer up some better nightlife.

I'm a fan of this casual and hip hotel and this will be my first choice when using my comps w\/ Harrahs.

Pai Gow: There are about 3 tables that I saw.  One is on the far end facing the bar.  Sucks that none of them are in the passion pit.  Though I've never seen pai gow in any of the high traffic areas usually.  Then again I've never seen a hot pai gow dealer...lol.

PH building organization of its checkin and its parking is a phenomenal problem. I believe they purposely required you after parking to walk through the entire miracle mile of shops just to check in so you would shop. The benefits of staying here are that it's cheaper than many of the mid strip hotels, close to Marquee for day or night club (walk across the bridge), day pool is nothing fancy but has a party section and a 2nd pool for a quieter relaxing atmosphere, and of course the shopping. You can find a ton of stores and of course a Fat Tuesdays. Many people already have in their itinerary to get a drink and stroll through the miracle mile or Forum shops, so by staying at PH, you already have consolidated one part of your trip.  Overall, it's a great place for a central location that won't break the budget as compared to other hotels. There's also the spice market buffet downstairs which we appreciated, but it wasn't remarkably unique besides the bottomless wine, beer, or champagne. There are a lot of groupons that came up in the past month for the Koi lounge and the buffet here at PH so you could look into those offers. The rooms are rather simple and have movie memorabilia in frames. We asked for an upgrade with 20 dollars and were put up on the north tower on the top floor, with a view of the strip. The bathroom was larger with two vanities and did the trick for our group. Overall, nothing fancy, but we mainly paid for the central location and we all had a good time! :)

Rooms were decent but I had to have 3 things in the room repaired. As with most Vegas hotels, too much tobacco smoke all over the casino part of the hotel. Their restaurants are slightly vegetarian friendly.

Hip casino with great music.  I could hang out in the Heart Bar for hours playing poker and taking advantage of free drinks.   And don't forget to check out the Mandara spa.   I treated myself to an 80 minute swedish massage - WORTH IT.   The mani and classic pedi were good but a bit overpriced but the service was great and the facilities excellent.

Had a great time visiting Planet Hollywood. We popped in and out a few times during our trip for gambling and to see the Britney Spears show. Overall, a fun atmosphere, good variety in tables\/gaming options. I was traveling with my mom and we wished a server would have paid a little more attention to us. It was tough to find\/flag someone down for drinks and of course we wanted to try to take advantage of the 'free drinks' while gambling deal over sitting down at one of the many bars and paying exponentially more, but that was really our only (minor) complaint. Drinks at the Britney show were super expensive (but hey, it's Vegas) but the show was awesome and there wasn't a bad seat in the place.

I have stayed here three years in a row and I do not think I will do it again any time soon. 

Lets just say this... nasty... There is a reason why the rooms are kind of dark and that's to make it so the jizz stains on the walls do not show. I am not joking... you could clearly see where the load was blasted across the wall next to the bed. 

I brought this to the attention of the front desk and they simply did not care. They moved me to a diff rent room but this room was worse then the last one.
