The finish on the tv stand was very worn and the room just felt grungy, I then notice another Jizz shot across the wall and a hand print! Freaking nasty! 

I get it, I am in Vegas and people like to be freaks when out here but whoa.

So I go down for a second time and again get no care at all from the desk but they move me again. This time I see no loads on the walls or anything but still am a bit disgusted by the whole thing. 

I was in Vegas with friends and they were staying in other rooms. They had someone enter their rooms when they were asleep and steal stuff from them! (This is more then one room btw.) The management did not care, they even went to the point of not believing them. Management just pushed them around with BS responses. 

This is the single worst review I have ever left on Yelp but one of the most important. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Location: 4 stars.  It is situated right next to Paris, in the middle of the strip.  Doesn't get better than that.

The casino: 4 stars.  The dealers for the most part were pleasant, and they do not use that many (shuffle) machines.  They had plenty of single deck black jack tables and they always played good music.  They've got a bar (Heart Bar) in the middle of the casino.  If you're tired of gambling you can take a break there..they play good music (they have a DJ, go-go dancers until 2AM).  The casino would've gotten 4.5 stars, except the cocktail waitress don't come around too often. 

The rooms: 2.5 stars.  The rooms were well done, with flat screen TVs.  It was decorated nicely and the beds were comfortable.  They did have a safe inside the room, which was nice.  They did not have a mini bar in the room, but did have bottled water there for $3 each.  Watch out for static, since the bedsheets wer generated a lot of static.  They were doing construction in adjacent rooms, and we were a bit annoyed by the noise at times.  For some reason the bathroom sink backed up at times and sewers came up once.. grossed out my wife.  The housekeeper was a bit agressive too.. I guess she wanted to do all the rooms before she went on her lunch break.  These things subtracted from the otherwise nice and clean room.

Overall the hotel was nice and I'd definitely stay there again.  Their price was pretty decent as well (we stayed there mon-thurs).  Overall 3 solid stars, and if we there weren't a couple of annoyances in our rooms, the place would've gotten 4 stars.

Their buffet was actually pretty good.  But will write a separate review for that.

And btw, the Miracle Mile shops were just mediocre.. but they do have couple of ABC stores there, and they sell just about anything you need on the trip.

This was our second trip to Las Vegas.  The first time, we stayed at NY NY and *loved* it, but wanted to stay other places each time we go.  We picked PH because of it's central location on the strip, and because it was SO fun when we went in on our last trip to see Peepshow.  

I wasn't unhappy enough to with this to give it a bad rating, but I definitely wouldn't recommend it or stay here again.  

Check-in was fine, we checked in, got rooms next to the couple we were with and headed up. Their room wasn't ready, but no big deal, we stashed stuff in one room and it was just fine!

1) The pool S.U.C.K.S. Period.  There are two separate pool areas, one 21+ and a "regular" pool, both separated by a very large concrete area with lounge chairs for the general population (can't see the pools from this area at all).  Apparently you are to rent the daybeds\/cabanas\/chairs that are directly poolside.  However, this was Oct. and it was barely 70 degrees so it wasn't busy, so we nabbed a daybed and no one asked questions.  That being said, since it was "cooler" for LV and not busy, I only got to spend one afternoon up by the pool, if it had actually been average Las Vegas temps when we were there and it was busy, I would have been REALLY disappointed in the pool. 

2) The movies featured in the rooms are really stupid and obscure (Big Bully??). Silly and incidental and wouldn't cause me to NOT stay there again, but worth mentioning. 

3) The outlets were few and far between in the room; annoying.

4) bathroom is a waste of space; it's HUGE compared to the room

5) The bed isn't secured to the wall, or the frame or anything it may normally be secured to.... so it can flip up from the end: DON'T jump on the beds.

6) The Casino: I'm not sure we ever found our way straight out to the strip or to the mall or back to our room without getting lost. 

I DID really like the fact that the ABC store was right there and had anything you could need (soda, snacks, beer, alcohol, toiletries, etc. etc. etc.) That was a really nice perk.  Also the 24 hour Starbucks was nice. 

The buffet was just decent for breakfast: MGM, go there, YUM! 

The location on the strip was nice, approx mid-strip so you could pick a way to walk and make a day of it.  

The price\/location\/value was a good deal though.

Favorite hotel to stay at in Vegas! (Not just because there's a huge pic of Britney Spears on the face of the hotel) First time coming here they upgraded us to a very large strip view resort room facing the Bellagio fountains. The bathroom was HUGE! Only con was that the AC in our room was quite weak but slightly bearable. But we still loved our stay and will continue to come back!

I have always been a fan of this hotel. The location is great, so are the rooms, restaurants, nightclubs, buffet, and service, even the casino floor is inviting. We would have stayed there this go around had their competitor not been so accommodating.

I was able to stay here for a month and not go completely crazy. The hotel is clean and hip, the casino is small but new, and the restaurants are fresh and open late! 

The downside is that I stayed when the hotel was just changing over to PH from the Aladdin and half of the hotel was still the Aladdin (thankfully not the half that I was in) but from what I hear that you can tell that it needed work. 

The rooms are very comfortable, but the armoires don't have any drawers in some of the rooms and if they have drawers then they have 1. The TV s are all flat screens and the beds are comfy. The views are actually not bad, but since there's construction across the street you'll get a better view closer to the pool area or on the southside of the building. 

If you're staying at another hotel, stop by Planet Hollywood and try out the penny slots (Top Gun is the BEST!)

Enjoy!

Vegas for the 3rd time this year? It still hasn't gotten old for me yet.. :)

And every time I come to Sin City, I love staying at Planet Hollywood. Not only is the location perfectly in the center of all of the main attractions but the decor and comfort is also superb! There's a movie memorabilia in every room to suit every theme. When it comes to the casino and gambling, I love to play at the PH casino. For some reason, I feel like it's easier to win here than at any other hotel on the strip. Some suggestions for those of you who want to test your hand at gambling are Crazy 4 Poker and Roulette. All in all, I've stayed at PH for about 4 trips so far and I will be sure to stay here again when I go next month! :)

Didn't stay here, but got to hang out for a while. Played some cards and had a few drinks.. Won at blackjack, so it was a good visit. After i doubled my trip value, we walked over to P.F. Changs and had a few cocktails and appetizers.. Then the night got a little fuzzy....

Slowest elevators and a 45 minute wait for valet parking on a Monday morning. Management is on a decline. 
Lack of staff. Soap and shampoo in the hotel is a joke. Will not stay here again.

Think the biggest draws of pH are 1) the location and 2) attached mag mile mall for those that like being a bit of a hermit in the heat or maybe shop their winnings out. You'll find the usual nationally-known retailers at the mall mixed in with more of the West\/Pacific Coast ones and bars\/restos. High end meets lower end. And well, with the location, you're about at the half way point from one of the Strip to the other.

In general, it's one of the newer hotels on the strip comparatively with modern rooms with comfy beds. Each room is decorated with some hollywood-replica-iconic jacket or portrait but not completely dolled out with stuff everywhere. So not tacky.

Casino itself is alright but nothing too terribly exciting. There are a lot of restaurants that are more on the higher end, clubs (think pink bunny), and one of its many bars typically has a LIVE band playing. 

Pool is lukewarm. There are 2 separate pools with only a few chairs around the pools themselves. Sort of abysmal of a set up considering hangin out at the pools ranks up there in terms of hype in Vegas. During the summer, the sun is blocked by the casinos\/condos across the street. So for a good couple hours way before the sun sets, the pools are completely shaded. Sadly there is no way getting around unless they moved the pools to a different location altogether.

All in all, like the proximity to everything and room cleanliness factor. When in Vegas, you don't stay in one casino anyways so I recommend staying here for sure.

Please note: I have never stayed here, but I have spent NYE and several weekends on strip and somehow always end up at PH.  The ladies room is one of those fully stocked where the attendant gives you soap & your paper towel. You also have a choice of fragrances and VS lotions and potions. And even cigarettes. I quit in May but I just had to have weekend before last. I would say this casino has the younger crowd, I love one of their lounges they play the best latin music. Its kind of near the pleasure pit. now the heart bar kinda sucked. We went there once and were just trying to see the end of the colts game back in football season and the girl said i'm sorry you need to order at least 2 drinks each if you want to see the rest of the game. I've never been told that in a casino before. otherwise they would have gotten 4 stars. there was 1 min. left in the game. I would have gone back if she hadn't said this. ah well, PH, you win some, you lose some. But personally, its better to be nicer to locals since they will be back sooner than tourists. ah well...

NO VISITORS ALLOWED IN THE ROOM!!!

If you're planning to have a whole bunch of people in a suite, find another place. Since PH is now Hilton, they have stricter policies.

Only people with WRISTBANDS are allowed to go upstairs or to the pool. And they only give out 4 WRISTBANDS per room. They strictly enforce this.

I've stayed here in July 2011 and had no problem... there was about 20 of us in a 2-bedroom suite and we had some guests over. I booked a suite in January for a room in March 2012, expecting it to be the same. NOPE. They changed the policy that weekend and didn't give me prior notice. No e-mail or phone call.

Whenever we are in Vegas, even staying at a different hotel, we ALWAYS end up spending a lot of time here. The mall has great shops, my lucky slot machine is here, and Blondie's shows all of our sports games, no matter what time in the morning they are on tv.

I met my husband in the Heart Bar, so I also have some sentimental attachment. 

Another thing - BRITNEY SPEARS! 

'Nuff said.

I stayed here on my most recent trip to Vegas and I must say that I was impressed.  I liked it more than TI, and it was infinitely better than Excalibur and Circus Circus.  Plus, for the price and location, it's perfect.

The room was nice.  Pretty good size overlooking the pool and strip, which was perfect because I could see the action at the pool and whether it was worth going to.  Which it was.

The gambling?  Meh, I think all casinos are pretty much the same, some having lower limits than others.  This one is in the middle I guess.

The food was good.  The Earl of Sandwiches was good and I liked the price.  The buffet wasn't bad either.

The atmosphere was good too.  Lot's of young and middle aged people.  A good environment to meet and mingle with people.  I would stay here again.

Another positive, no resort fees

Honestly, I really enjoyed this hotel. Our room was great! The view was outstanding from the window. We were able to view the strip and the Bellagio fountains from our room. Everything was very convenient and readily accessible there. Can't complain!

This hotel truly sucks.  The rooms are dated and downright tacky.  I feel like I'm stuck in an 80's room with the tasteless, antiquated, ugly decor.  WORST part is the small window in the room.  No sunlight.  Super depressing and dreary.  When I called to change my room, I spoke with Sarah and she had the audacity to tell me that she can send me an extra lamp.  Of course she tried to upsell and make us pay more $ .  They also forgot to clean our room one night and we called, they said they'll be right over, we left for dinner, came back 2 hours later to a dirty room. I will agree with other Yelper's that have called this hotel a dump.  There are too many other options in this strip to stay here.

Paid 150 on priceline for their cheapest room- got to the hotel check-in desk and got upgraded to a 650 dollar A NIGHT suite...


FOR FREE BITCHES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


Hell yes. It was a great time. Relatively modern and nicely done up rooms. CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN. BEAUTIFUL suite. Huge tub, lots of couches and a nice bed. Sheets a little rough but that's okay we got rough in 'em. Complimentary valet-take advantage of it! But don't be stingy give them something!

GREAT location on the strip- right in the middle of it all! Ugly construction across the street but that's okay I wasn't there to sit and look at the view.

$40 free gaming credit and some good discount coupons. FUN buffet with GREAT desserts. Mall in the resort with lots of stores. 

Fun bartenders, lots to do, I would definitely recommend for couples and I would definitely go there again. I made the right choice.

Check in was too long- that's why I dropped a star & the layout was kind of insane.
Susan and Roberto (manager) were extremely rude and unprofessional. Didn't help at all while checking in

Really impressed with the room, nice and spacious with 2 queens, despite only paying roughly 60 per night (mid-week prices). $25 credit per day was included to use at the various food outlets when charged to your room, but be careful as some restaurants are excluded.

Fantastic location in the heart of the strip.

I love this hotel and casino.  The room had everything we needed: a bed, small clock radio, a shower, lots of towels and a blowdryer. You dont even need to leave this casino. Our favorite slot machine to play was the Wizard of Oz and you could play with 3 other people to increase your chances of winning. But unfortunately I won nothing! =( But got lots of drinks for free! =) Plenty of restaurants to choose from but I didn't notice any bars or fun clubs to go to inside of the casino. They need a good club in this Casino because it is very nice and modern too.

The only reason why I gave four stars was because the bed was so wobbly and noisy that if i tossed around to get comfy it would make so much noise, as if it was about to break. But boy did I sleep. Also the curtains didn't make it pitch dark in there, like other hotels do, for us party people that stay up all night and get in at the wee hours of the morning. Oh and it would be nice to have a double sink when getting ready with others in the bathroom.

I will def go back here for a stay and mayyyybe some gambling.

Never stayed here but spent a few hours in this casino during my last Vegas trip. I really like the shopping center attached to the hotel and the restaurants mixed in with the shops are a bonus.

The casino was pretty big but the layout was a little confusing. All in all I had a good experience here. Wouldn't mind coming back to explore a little more. From what I did see however, I think the four stars is appropriate.

Stayed at Planet Hollywood for a convention, and it was perfectly fine. Not exciting, not all that interesting, but clean. I did hear others complain that the staff is not friendly or polite, but didn't experience that myself. The Planet Dailies restaurant is actually really good for breakfast and easily accomodates a large group. I also very much liked the fact that it's attached to a mall with some decent shops, which also helps you hunt down that elusive bottle of water or soda with ice, which are in short supply in the casinos (or way expensive). I might stay there again - but only if I didn't plan to spend much time in the room.

Great location.  Rooms were ok, but I preferred the MGM Signature suite we had booked, but they had to moved us because they were over sold.

I love the shops and they have decent dining there.  I do not like the casino, but I do like that it was not as smoked filled at the MGM's casino.

Nice pool area, but not spectacular.  The Breakfast buffet is not as good as the MGM or Paris, but their lunch buffet is good. The location alone would make me return.

I would stay here again for the right price.

Wish I could give a zero! Stayed here for just one night on 1\/23\/2017 and came back with a severe case of bed bugs.  I'm suffering through a lot of discomfort at this time.  Will never stay again and will not recommend to anyone.

If you like shiny stuff, this is the place to go! I really liked the atmosphere of the place, especially the huge chandeliers and overall "glitzi-ness" of the place.  

PF Chang's was a great place to eat.  

My boyfriend had a hard time getting served at the bar (it was about in the middle of the casino).  You must have to be female to get someone to wait on you.

Clean restrooms - always a plus!

I stayed here to see the Backstreet Boys.  Great show.   The room was ok.  The bathroom lighting could be better. Providing a lighted make up mirror would greatly improve the situation.  Staff is extremely courteous and vey helpful.

I stayed at PH for 5 nights in late October 2013 while attending a conference in LV.  When booking, I indicated that I would be arriving late at night and that I would like a non-smoking room.  When I arrived around 11pm to check in, I was informed that there were no more non-smoking rooms because I was so late (umm, I indicated that I would be checking in late and also booked a non-smoking room?)  I told the rep that I have allergies and cannot be in a smoky room and she left me standing there for several minutes while she talked to her manager and then came back and miraculously, a non-smoking room appeared, although a handicapped room.  

Besides this annoyance with checking in after a 5.5 hour flight, the experience wasn't so bad.  The room was very spacious, bed was comfortable and the TV was good quality.  My room was kept clean with the towels and toiletries replaced on a daily basis.

The gym was a bit of a disappointment.  The spa area itself is lovely, beautifully decorated with extras like lemon water, coffee, tea, fruit and juices.  However the gym equipment is outdated and on its last legs.  Two ellipticals that I tried made loud noises and were wobbly.  The stair climber shorted in the middle of my workout.  The exercise ball was sad an deflated.  The gym did serve it's purpose, but definitely not worth the $25 a day.  

The best part of this hotel is the Starbucks right by the exit- great for grabbing a quick coffee and breakfast before heading out for the day.  I also enjoyed Yolos and Planet Dailies (see separate reviews).

We stayed here for my best friends wedding in the chapel ~ we were there for three nights. Easy, friendly valet (free!!) and check in process. 
As far as a hotel, I think it's "fine". We had our room cleaned ONCE, and that's because we were like WTF? It never got done- we had to ask for towels because when we got back to room after being gone all day it wasn't done- we talked with housekeeping management and they comped our resort fee for all three nights. Taken care of. 
Casino floor was "okay". Too many penny slots. And where we're dancing g hot guys - it's not just men and lesbians who stay there.....
Loved the Miracle Mile shops and Spice Buffet and P.F.Chang. 
The bed was HORRENDOUS - in this day when you can get a good mattress for a good price, PH needs to invest in some new ones. Our King was trashed- springs popping up everywhere :( I give it -1 stars. 
Oh, they also charged me $10 to bring up 10 champagne glasses which I thought was lame. 
The decor in our room was just bizarre- Super Mario Bros movie and a creepy picture of Dennis Hopper who was looking at the bed- he ended up getting covered with a towel. Several lights out as well. 
The chapel was small and sweet and my friends wedding was lovely. 
I don't think I'd stay there again, do to the variety of Vegas.

Second time staying at PH. It's a nice Hotel right in the middle of the strip. There's a Mall attached to the casino so you can find basically everything nearby! Earl's Sandwich and Pink's are located downstairs! 

There's a nice pool here, the rooms are nice! The rooms are movie themed. The first time we got Back to the Future, this time around we Romeo and Juliet. Bathroom's nice and big. The staff were nice, never had any problems while we were here. We checked in early and got our room early too! Spice Market Buffet is here. It is a short walk to the Bellagio if you wanted to watch the fountain show. Actually if you stand right out in front you can the show without having to cross the street. It's a nice hotel and I would def keep staying here!

First up...
The HOTEL ROOM
I was not looking forward to my virgin trip to Las Vegas after reading the horrible reviews PH received on yelp. This was my husband's trip. He wanted to meet up with his cousin from Germany who was staying there, so it really was by default. I wanted to know what we were getting into. All the horror reviews of dildos found under beds, rooms that seemed to be only halfway cleaned up after "what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas" nights scared the $#!+ out of me. What would WE find under our bed? I envisioned pubic hair dust bunnies in the corners of the bathroom, tiny liquor bottles hidden in the drawers, and cracks in the TV screen from 20 inch heals thrown across the room in a fit of bachelorette drunken stuper.
We accidentally made the rookie mistake of parking at Ceasar's Palace thinking Planet Hollywood was a part of that hotel. CP is so enormous, it HAD to have 2 hotels in one right? Wrong? Hey, it even had a Planet Hollywood globe outside. When we went to the desk, they didn't have our reservations. We were told our hotel was down the strip just "a block or so". So we took the trek to the real PH. The place was really hip and fresh and modern. It took some time to find the lobby to check in. Top tip for those going to Vegas for the first time: NO ONE is good at giving directions. So just walk around until you find it yourself. It's less frustrating. I digress...
The check in was quick. The look of frustration on our faces may have helped in getting us a good room. While the check in clerk was not the friendliest chap on the strip that day, he did hook us up with a fairly decent room. We got a room on the top floor of our wing that gave us a good view of the Bellagio fountains and overlooked our pool. 
Each room at PH features a particular film complete with photo stills and props. We got the movie Natural Born Killers which was OK, but my husband's cousin's room had Empire Records which I am, to this day, a huge (like know-every-word) fan of that film. We considered switching rooms for like...a second or two, until we realized we were in Las Vegas and wouldn't be in our rooms very much and well, that would just be crazy. **right?**
So no pubes in the room at all. No dildo either. What WAS there was a huge modern soaking tub and separate shower, big TV in tact (which was never even switched on), a makeup mirror, modern furniture, and a great view: also a nice thick shade to block out the daylight effect that happens only in Vegas at 3am!). It also had a nice safe to hide our mac book & my purse.
The CASINO
I was overwhelmed. My husband and I had never gambled before, so all of this was a bit like a fish out of water experience. The dealers were awesome. My father-in-law; a very seasoned Vegas man and gambler, laughed at us when we asked him if the dealers helped people out. To our shock and amusement, they actually did. At every table, the dealer seemed to smell our virgin blood (or the look of anxiety on our faces) and were so happy to give us a quick lesson before our first bets. The black-jack dealer, Cyndi was a smart ass bitch and I loved her. She gave us tips before and after each hand, letting us know what we did right and what we could have done better. She made us laugh and she was well tipped for it. It was my favorite part of the trip. The same was true for Roulette tables.
The FOOD & SHOPPING
We ate at the food court on our first day. We don't have Las Vegas restaurant money, so budget eating was our plan. Although at Smash Burger 3 burgers, 2 fries, 2 beers, and a water was around $60! I had read Earl of Sandwich was amazing, but the line was so long and we were starving and couldn't wait. I really wanted to eat at Gordon Ramsey's pub, but it was really pricey. We figured if we struck it rich, we would go there for dinner or lunch the next day. There were a ton of places to eat though and I really think it would be amazing if money wasn't an issue. For breakfast, we went to Blondie's Sports Bar & Grill. They have a bacon, eggs, and hash brown breakfast for $2.99! That was the cheapest food we had seen so far and it was great. Our waiter was super attentive & was also from Texas! It looks like a great place to hang out for games. They have tables with self serving taps on them that I think is GENIUS! If I had a bar, I would do the same thing. GENIUS I tell you!!!
The shopping was a great experience even though we didn't buy anything. The mall attached to the hotel and casino is gorgeous. It has a section similar to the Venetian hotel, with the ceiling painted like the sky with faux buildings. It was nice to just walk around and enjoy the window shopping.
All in all, I had a great experience at Planet Hollywood Hotel & Casino. It may not be the fanciest place on the strip, but it was clean and it was friendly. What else could I ask for to pop my Vegas cherry?

I visited LV a couple of weeks ago and my bf and I stayed at Planet Hollywood. We were very happy with our room and the casino and shopping overall. This place is more hip than some of the others and very affordable. The Miracle Mile shops were so cool and convenient. The location of the hotel was great also because when you walk out to Las Vegas Blvd, you can go either left or right and have some of the strip to browse. If you work out it is a little pricey to use their gym for a day and I was just a little dissapointed because we used the gym for a day and many of the cardio machines were broken. WE enjoyed our stay and plan to go back soon!

I love hanging out at the PH when I'm in Vegas.  It's hip and not stuffy.  It's almost like playing cards while you're at the strip club.  In the evening hours they have beautiful ladies dancing above the casino tables.  They also have 3 card poker that is unique in the sense I don't often see it in other casinos.  You can basically use the dealers hand to make a 5 card poker hand.  I've gotten 4 of a kind a few times and boats.  The dealers are really nice and beautiful.

Lost my phone in the building but found it the next day in lost and found.  A couple of hiccups retrieving it but the staff were only doing their job.  Felt fortunate to retrieve it.

As a first timer in Vegas, I couldn't have been more pleased with my stay at Planet Hollywood. It was the perfect location (right on the strip), attached to the Miracle Mile, and had a selection of restaurants close enough that all I had to do was take the elevator from my room to the casino, located on the second floor. It was also hosting the Britney Spears Piece Of Me show, so I could keep myself easily entertained just beside my hotel room! The only downsides were the lack of microwave and refrigerator, alongside the "resort fee" that we weren't told about while initially checking in. $38 a day will be charged to your card just for being there, which is definitely something you should ask about while checking in. Overall though, Planet Hollywood was the most reliable hotel I've ever stayed at, and would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in Las Vegas and near the strip.

Pros:
- Party is always on 24\/7 @this casino! Whether it was at 12pm, 10pm, or 4am, music was always pumping, young & beautiful people were plentiful, everyone was just having a good time.
- Location is awesome!! Can't beat Center Strip! And not outrageously expensive to boot.
- Rooms were clean & hip. Not completely spotless, but decent.
- Beds were very comfy & I slept like a baby!
- Part of the package my friends & I booked got us a free bottle of booze. Came in handy when we were pre-gaming before a night out! hehe
- Bonus was that they are now part of the Harrah's chain of hotels, so I was able to rack up some Rewards points while staying here! Woohoo!

Cons:
- Front desk is severely understaffed & painfully slow. And not all the Front desk people were nice\/friendly, it was hit or miss.
- It took forever for us to get anything from Front desk or Housekeeping. When I tried calling the Front desk, I was on hold for an average of 5-10 mins each time I called. And when I called back to check on a request for toilet paper that the Front desk girl said was on it's way up 30 mins prior, she snapped at me when I called back to check on the delayed TP.
- I know this can happen to every hotel, but all the drains were slow in our room (sink & shower). 1 of my personal pet peeves, skeeves me to finish a shower in my own muck lol - bleh!
- Wasn't crazy about no locks on the bathroom doors. They're double doors that just swing shut, but anyone can walk in on you unless you announce to your roomies that you are using the shower.

Overall, I did like the hotel, but not sure if I'd stay here again. If the Wynn were completely overbooked, I'd rather stay @the MGM Mirage or Treasure Island which I think were much better than PH.

Loved, loved, loved this hotel stay. We got a room on the top floor, everything was so pretty and clean and brightly colored! 

The beds were comfy... although if you jumped on the foot of the bed to sit, the bed popped up! Lol. Other than that, it was fine.

The bathroom was lovely. Seperate room for the toilet, see through shower, separate big tub, little TV to watch while I showered. 

Really enjoyed my stay here. Everything was clean and comfy!

Upon entering the casino, I asked a man in a purple blazer (who obviously worked there) for directions to Koi restaurant.  He sweetly replied, "Let me show you young ladies (we are all in our 40's;)...you are all my boss and I need to make sure you are happy!"  I could have hugged him!  How adorable and uber helpful of him!  I'm sooooo mad I didn't get his name for a proper shout out!  

I have stayed here once (a few years back)--my room was clean and fine and there were no zero issues.  My guess is that Planet Hollywood is stepping up their game with Britney as a resident for the next 2 years.  There was staff everywhere, managing the lines and crowds effortlessly.  It makes me happy to see them re-inventing themselves and looking good.

After my friend ran a $250 bar tab at the Heart Bar, and called me to come get him, I became familiar with the Planet Hollywood Hotel and Casino.  I discovered it's typically less expensive for Las Vegas casino hotels, and it's right on the Strip, so that's what attracted me. I had enjoyed the sushi restaurant on an earlier visit, so my mind was made up to stay at Planet Hollywood. I am not sorry I did.  I liked the hipper "vibe" and the fact the hotel sits atop a mall so there was something to do other than gamble. You can either just window shop, fantasize what you'd do if you won the $1 million shopping spree, or like I did, shop and dine here; the ABC Store had reasonably priced sundry items and snacks and was convenient for grabbing a bottle of water or some antacid before heading up to the room. There was a great sale going on at the Metropolitan Museum of Art shop too. Unlike the Bellagio, you walk off the elevator, through the casino and you are out on the strip in no time.   Ironically, the sushi restaurant was always closed while I was there. Check-in went smoothly but it was so noisy I just smiled and nodded at whatever the desk clerk said.  But that's a minor complaint since I loved the 80s soundtrack to my stay.  The room was enormous, strangely so, triangular in shape, and the decor was dark and sort of odd, reminding me of the Munsters, shades of purple, green and black. Not exactly my taste..  The large bathroom had two vanities which I liked but the water pressure in the shower was extremely low.  The decor of the hotel and casino is unspectacular and I kind of missed the "Hollywood" theme except there's some sort of VIP thing going on which I couldn't figure out.  I never could find my way through the casino to the right elevator, which at first was humorous but then became annoying. And guests take the elevator for just one flight since it's hard making out where the escalators are located.  The staff was not particularly friendly, but then most of the time I had trouble hearing them, and the woman at the guest center was downright rude as she was ready for her break and didn't feel like helping anyone else.  At least be apologetic!  The concierge was very helpful and recommended the Hawaiian Tropic restaurant in the mall which was great, as well as a sushi restaurant at Caesar's.  The pool was wonderful with lots of lounge chairs to relax in.  PH wouldn't necessarily be my first choice for a stay in Las Vegas, (look for a Palazzo review coming soon) but I'd stay here again.

Good lord. The only good thing about his hotel is the location. I mean it, that's the only good thing. We stayed here for my Bachelorette party, there were 20 of us. Checking in took us 30 minutes. No joke. It was really difficult for us to get 5 rooms on the same floor and have 2 sets of 2 rooms that adjoined. Even though we had requested this from the beginning (booked 4 months in advance) and we checked in on a Thursday (shouldn't have been too busy). When we left the front desk the line was insane! There were only 4 people checking people in and the line had to have been 30 people deep. I felt terrible! We also had to have a rollaway bed in one room. That was $30 a night-insane!

The customer service in the casino and the hotel was pretty much non-existent. We asked many times for them to open Blackjack tables for us so we could gamble. Usually our request is granted since we are a bunch of good looking girls who will probably be giving the hotel all of our money-not serious gamblers! But nope, one pit boss directed us to the other pit boss who told us that we had been mistaken and it wasn't possible. They sent us to Paris and Bally's. Do you normally send that many people to gamble elsewhere? Are you dumb?

There's no clubs in Planet Hollywood and "Rock Bar" is the most ghetto place I have ever been in my life. Sweet Jesus, I am from Chicago, and that place gives some dive bars I've been to a run for their money. Avoid at all costs!!!!

Earl's is good, but the line is always sooooo long. Sugar Factory was pretty good, overpriced of course, just like everything else in Vegas ;) We also ate at Yolo's one night. It was good, not great, the service was sub par-they messed up so many orders.

We stayed here mainly because Britney Spears was there and we went to her show. Would I stay here again? No way. Like I said, the location is nice, and that's it. Take your money elsewhere!

started with calling and getting different quotes from different people..anywhere from $69.99 to $238.00...Parking is a b*&^h. Good luck driving up and NOT using valet and trying to check in.   Amenities?  well there was no coffee maker, no micro, no fridge. There was an ice bucket, and ONE glass...hmm. themed room? What the heck is Tank Girl? really?  Oh and good luck finding the third floor...you know where the breakfast buffet is. No # 3 button in the elevator..There was other little things that just made it frustrating or difficult...oh if you have to walk a dog, its like frogger  across four lanes of traffic in the parking garage to an unlit designated grass area...and the luggage carts are NOT for you to use unless attached to a tip expecting bus boy.  Bed was comfy, slept well. TV was large.  Just wasn't impressed.

Here's to my second time in Vegas and my first time at PH. I must say this place is great, definitely almost number one if it wasn't for the new neighbor Cosmopolitan to steal their shine. Sure there's plenty of other beautiful hotels to stay at but PH is soooo convenient. The mall is just a few steps away from the Casino as well as PF Changs and Yolos. The pool is maybe not the best looking one on the strip but it is so much fun. To top it off its not even on the haunted list unlike most hotels nearby.  I can not wait to be back in two weeks however this time I'll be at the PH westgate's presidential suite. Yay for me!
Slowest checkin on the Planet. Plan on 1 yo 1 1\/2 hours just to check in. Service is NOT in their vocabulary.Definitely not enough trained help. Worst Vegas experience$

Anytime we're in vegas, we're at PH. The service is great, the staff is friendly. It's in a prime location on the strip and there's a shopping mall attached (with an urban outfitters!). the buffet is excellent, the rooms are a great value! extremely nice for what you pay (which isn't really all that much).

Only stayed here once, but it was a good time! Went for a friend's birthday and stayed in a suite with one king size bed in the room and a pull-out sofa. 

There's plenty of space in the bathroom. Both the shower and toilet have well designed doors so other people can be in the bathroom even if someone is showering or on the toilet. The only bad thing about the bathroom is the mirror. This was an issue for me as a girl because the mirror was pretty far away, so it was hard to see when doing make up. 

Moving to the room, there was a little sofa\/lounge chair, the king-sized bed, and the hot tub. Though the hot tub cannot seat that many, it was a fun little area for everyone to sit around and just relax. One negative about the room was the hot tub jets. We had trouble getting them to start because you had to fill the tub with enough water and the sensor was not working well.

The living room\/kitchen which was the rest of the suite. A big thumbs up for the projector in the living room area. That was definitely a perk and when you're sleeping in the morning with the screen down, it literally feels like night time. The screen does a good job keeping the light out. The pull-out and sofa were all pretty comfortable. Though it is dangerous to get too comfortable watching the projector. You'll forget you're in Vegas and not want to move from the sofa. The full kitchen provided a good area to eat\/drink\/cook whatever you wish. 

The location of the rooms is kind of out of the way because you have to walk half of the Miracle Mile Shops to get there, but once you come down the elevators, the pool is just to the left. No matter where you go in the hotel, there's a walk involved.
Good places to go at PH:
- Earl of Sandwich
- Pink's Hot Dog
- Fat Tuesday
- Lobster ME

Location of the hotel is great because it is right in the middle of the strip next to Paris and across Cosmopolitan. Once you walk out of the hotel, there's the hustle and bustle of the strip. I would definitely stay here again!

I stayed there this weekend May 16- May 19th and received the worst service I have ever received. I'm in the customer service industry and this place is lacking many many practices.

The first night I arrived to find that the room I booked and the room I was getting were not the same I received a resort room with one king size bed for 3 people. There was no rooms available with 2 beds and I was given no other option but to wait until the next day. They could not even provide me with a cot! 

The next day I called in the morning to see when my next room would be available I was told it would be by 1230. Come 1230 it is still not available and I am told that they don't know when it would be available because a diamond member was staying in it. 2pm checked again nothing 3pm nothing 4pm they finally had it available but would not release the room keys to the persons I had listed that were also staying in the room. They told that person that I had not added them as occupants which he had clearly seen me do the first night. Finally we get in our room with 2 queen size beds (in what they called their resort room). 

In the new room the bathroom smelled like sewage constantly. 

In both rooms there was no refrigerator.  

Housekeeping did not make the  bed because there was a suitcase next to it. 

There was no free wifi. (That's a big deal nowadays guys and a pretty standard practice) 

All in all no one was helpful. No one could provide me with better options for my inconvenience. And the staff lacked friendliness, eye contact, and problem solving skills. 

At 350 a night I could have gone anywhere else fairly comparable and next time I will.  

The only plus was the size of the bathroom was great and the miracle mile shops are attached.

Planet Hollywood, hmmm...our first and last stay in this hotel! Check-in took almost one hour....loooong line. The room was small.  The bathroom has a shutter closet type doors. It's not even a real door. No privacy! Valet parking full for 3 days, except on our last day.
Housekeeping never showed up at all! Yes, for 4 days 3 nights! Hotel gets a ONE star!

Three stars for great house music, good restaurants, and the Mile Shops!But in Vegas, who doesn't have that!
Love this place- by far my favorite casino on the strip. Middle of everything. Great shops.

During my stay at PH was a nightmare. I was so excited to celebrate my birthday here but ended up leaving early and left feeling frustrated. Frustrated since I walked into the room. I have never seen such an outdated, dusty and dirty room with lights that didn't even work. But I sucked it up because I didn't want to put a damper to the birthday festivities. Engineering came about an hour later to fix the lighting and all is good. My girl friends and I went down to the spa on the 27th; the male spa attendant was not welcoming and was very short with us as if we were intruding on his day and didn't have time for us, just checked us in but didn't give us directions and where to go and was shuffled off into a different direction. It was our first time here, we had no clue on where to go! Next we were greeted by another young lady. Again she was not friendly, she told us to sign and initial a sheet of paper, didn't give us an explanation to what we were signing and once we questioned what it was she got upset and with a louder and firmer tone of voice she said it doesn't matter and to just sign and initial! She was speaking very fast as of she was rushing us to get our of her way and got upset again when we asked her how to use the lockers. I expected a tour of the spa but no, she pointed with her finger where to go and just left! We had to figure out the whole place by ourselves. After the spa, we went back to the room only to see that our food that we purchased earlier that day have been removed from the refrigerator. I called the front desk and told the young lady what happened and she transferred housekeeping, not sure why but as soon as the male answered he said he couldn't help me and to call security. For what?! I just want my food, I am diabetic and needed to eat something before my sugar gets to low and I didn't have time to be giving the run around. So I called front desk again and the same young lady picked up and said he should've helped me, I felt as if they were just passing the buck and no one wanted to help me just like the employees at the spa! She put me on hold and then told me she would have a manager call me back. I received a call later from Brian, titled asthe Assistant Hotel Manager, told him the incident of the food and said security needs to come up and do a lock interrogationin the room to see who entered it. Ok I get it for my own security, cool send them up. Then I received a phone call from housekeeping from the man that said he couldn't help me and said that according to his records no one has entered the room and its not their fault the food is missing. I wasnt pointing fingers! I just wanted a solution to my problem. I couldn't wait any longer to for Brian to call us back because I need to get something to eat, so we left and came back to a voice message on the room phone. He said that the lock interrogation report says that no one entered the room and there's nothing they can do about it and if I needed proof I can come downstairs to look, other than that I'm out of luck. At this point I feel very frustrated and every here made me feel like a liar and I'm over here crying to my girl friends because this stay has been ruining my birthday! I came downstairs to speak with the front desk because over the phone was getting too complicated. The young lady went and got her manager Roberto and he came up and right away handed me the lock intinterrogation report, didn't introduce himself just handed it to us. Wow, that's not even what I came down for. As if he just assumed that's what it was just that and again felt as if I was brushed off and didn't even matter as if I was wasting his time! I tried to tell him what was going on the but kept cutting me off and not letting me speak! I wanted to tell him about the spa experience and then he cut me off saying that they don't own the spa and it' not the hotels fault whatever they did. But it doesn't matter! Front desk is the face of the company! No one here wanted to take accountability. No one cared to provide a solution. I felt treated very unfairly, like I wasn't important and as I if I was a liar! And the worst part was wasting my time! This never happens to me when I stay at any MGM properties, Wynn or Mandarin! I told Roberto just to check me out I'm ready to leave and he said, "Fine. But we will still charge you since it's past midnight" which it was only 11pm. wow, I can't believe the disrespect this man was giving me. He doesn't care to lose revenue; he doesn't care that Caesars is bankrupt and in debt or about his guests!
We left the desk feeling even worse. I felt as if he strip me and humiliatated me in front of everyone. I don't understand why this had to escalate to social media to help but it has. I can't even understand why it even escalated in the first place, it should have been taken care of from the moment I made a phone call. But it wastes my time, housekeeping, front desk and securities time and payroll.

This hotel is much more the party scene one might expect to find in Las Vegas. The room had a Kingpin - Woody Harrelson - theme. Let's just say that theme continued throughout the stay as the room had been highly abused by, I'm assuming, the constant more rowdy crowds. It was clean enough, but the carpet was dirty & absolutely all furniture was very dinged up. The view was nice from the 26th floor as we looked out over the Bellagio fountains. The smell of smoke came into our room which was the most annoying thing to me personally. Our beds backed up to the elevator shaft which was loud, and there was no break as there is constant traffic at all hours through the night. When we left to catch a plane at 5am, the lobby looked as it did at midnight--so a great place for those who go hard. We saw the JLo show here in the hotel. The venue has flat seating, meaning that if the person in front of you is a touch too tall, you lose all visibility. There are also poles throughout that interfere with some seating views. The pool on the 6th floor is also made for partying as there are only about 15 chairs. People were lined up at 10am to snag these. Otherwise you are left to pay $300 for a cabana or sit on the cement, as they are hoping everyone is in the pool vs lounging. Drinks are a touch expensive for the type of hotel, with one small frozen drink being around $20. There are extensive shops attached to the hotel; such the kind you'd find in a regular mall setting. Outside the hotel is the constant smell of weed, with a rough crowd where one might anticipate being pick-pocketed or hearing gunshots. There are men with stripper billboards on their backs & more people offering strip club or hooker\/escort cards than we've found anywhere else. This place is the epidemy of where a college group of boys might be found staying. It was a fine visit & within walking distance of most everything, with it being centrally located...just expect a party scene & nothing fancy whatsoever, along with quite a lot of noise.

I've stayed at PH twice and even though on my birthday weekend, we coincidentally got a room with Star Trek memorabilia (I'm a huge Trekkie, so imagine my excitement), both trips were pretty terrible.

First time, I ended up in the hospital (had nothing to do with PH) and the second time, I spent a good hour or two wrapped up in one of our bed's comforters, crying to my friends in the hallway outside of our room (probably the most dramatic Vegas trip thus far). Even though both times, there was absolutely nothing wrong with PH, the mention of PH still brings back bad memories.

With that said, I feel like it's unfair to rate them poorly, so based on the hotel itself, I have no complaints! I mean, come on, Star Trek memorabilia?! I was so excited when my friend pointed it out when we were settling in. Both times, we stayed in a Hollywood Hip Room and the beds were pretty comfy.

Plus, Earl of Sandwich is located inside PH and anytime you're hungry (seriously, it's open 24\/7), you can go down and grab a sub! Since our friends are Diamond members, we also don't have to wait in the horrendous line to order.

3.5

Now that Cosmopolitan and Aria are next door, this puts PH in a sweet area on the boulevard. Not fond of the casino layout though, its almost maze like and I always get confused where I am and how in the hell do I get out of the place. I like the fact that it has a mall connected because sometimes you forget to pack that cool outfit for going out and now you can just go down and buy one from the many cool clothing stores. The rates are often affordable and last time I stayed there, the room key gets you line passing access into there club. All the rooms are themed to movie but this looses nostalgia when your in the Wesley Snipes "Drop Zone" themed room. The room itself  is very nice just make sure you don't get booked in one of the disconnected towers or else you'll be walking more than you want.

Booked a night at Planet Hollywood to watch Britney's Piece of me with my best friend.

Paid $180 and change plus tax. And $20. Something for resort fee( which we did not use anything in the resort) 

$200+ for one night of stay only to find out they have put us into the corner of the corner of their hotel. The sidekick room of the suite!! And on top of that  the water pressure for the shower felt like I was showering in a 3rd world country... 

My suggestion for everyone is this. If you don't have to stay here. Book else where. Totally not worth the $$$

Came to celebrate my daughter's 21st.  My husband is a Harrahs Diamond member so our mini suite was comped. We reserved two other rooms for our daughter and friends. Rate was reasonable and rooms are nicely updated. Service is very inconsistent. 
There was a flood during our stay so half the casino floor and one wing of elevators were closed. We felt trapped anytime we needed to take the elevators to our room or leave the casino because there were mobs of people trying to get on and off since the other wing was closed. What a nightmare! One time, we walked down 10 flights of stairs to exit. Another time, we had to walk through the entire mall on our way to the club while our Uber waited 20min. Hotel mgmnt should be prepared for incidents like this and have a plan in place to help with the flow of people. I spoke with several people that waited 30min- an hour for the elevator! We literally avoided returning to our hotel once we left so we didn't have to avoid the crazy elevator line and mobs of people grouped in one area. 
We were greeted by friendly valet but dealt with an extremely RUDE BELL MAN that took our bags; young 20ish yr old that was outright angry to be there. Service at the Burger Bar was excellent. We enjoyed conversing with the sous chef, Daniel, and the food was delicious! The truffle fries are a must try. 
Dealt with an awful waitress with a bad attitude at the sports book cafe. There was a soccer game on that the bartenders and waitress were watching. She was visibly annoyed that we asked to be seated and she had to tear herself away from the game. I was embarrassed for my daughter and her friends  when she rolled her eyes while they were deciding on their order. 
The miracle miles shop is very convenient. There's nothing better than drinking while you shop!
The pool was the highlight of our stay. We booked a cabana and ordered a bottle. The cost for the cabana was very reasonable relative to other hotels and our waitress, Felicia I think, was awesome.
The DJ was great and the bikini contest was hilarious. 
Cashiers were friendly. Tables were hit and miss. I had some luck on blackjack but slots are very tight. 
Wifi was a nightmare. It seemed like it worked everywhere but this hotel. Couldn't ever get service in our rooms. Based on the inconsistent service, the flood we dealt with, and the poor payout, we won't be staying here again. We typically stay at Caesars and will be returning there in the future.
I was treated very poorly by one of the pit bosses. I didn't get a very friendly vibe from the casino. Not a fan of this place. I won't be staying here again.

I love this hotel\/casino! I've stayed here twice and--with the exception of the Westgate people trying to flag you down anywhere and everywhere, which is the reason for the 4 stars--I've had no complaints! 

The rooms are cool, the casino's awesome (even though I lost), the mall is huge, there are lots of restaurants to choose from...etc.

I agree with the review who suggested using a AAA discount if possible. I got a $139\/night room for $68\/night this WEEKEND (12\/12 & 12\/13)!

Stayed 5\/31-6\/4\/15. Get to hotel and used valet but would have been closer to self park, also when using valet average time to get car is 15-20 minute slowest
On the strip went to 8 different casinos on this trip waited 3-4 minutes at all the others. Go to check in they confirm reservation and was told got your room preselected and was sent on our way. We get to the room that was suppose to have the fountain view with a king bed and had two doubles. I will not sleep on a double "6'5 300" I hang off plus it is a vacation for the wife and I, be nice to be in same bed without a kid. Go back down and told it's just a preference but called 2 days before to check in and was told we got you for a king, but we can up grade for $20
More a night  so not much choice and that's all we can do, but another couple we traveled with came 2 hours later and got the exact room that we should have had on a upgrade to there room. So it's all about getting more on the rooms so don't do the upgrade. I asked for a manager on 3 different occasions to ask about it and there was not one to talk to. Left phone number and never heard from anyone. Will not stay here again.

I have never stayed at PH before, but never will again. They charge for there crappy gym and wifi. You can only have one device on there wifi that you are charged for. Thirty min. to check in and 40 to check out. Food not that great. Hotel is pretty dirty. Tub in room is nice. However the topper is I woke up the second night with bug bed bites. After looking at reviews it is a problem. I googled Planet Hollywood bed bugs scary what comes up. Waste of money.

The last time I was here was when it was the Aladdin so, I was really looking forward to see how they had changed it in to Planet Hollywood.

The casino it self, as well as the shops are ok, but certainly not as "Hollywood" as I expected. I like the murals of the sky's on the ceiling but it just reminded me more of the Aladdin and thought they could have done something more creative and Hollywood like.

Overall they have some great little shops, some decent eateries though this definitely is probably one of my least favorite of the Hotels on the strip.

I came to Vegas twice in one month during December 2011 and chose to stay at PH. I booked my room through expedia.com and got it for about $42\/night. 

My first visit was to celebrate my birthday, me and my friends were greeted by the concierge and got in line to check in. The man who helped us gave me an upgrade to a bigger room with a view of Bellagio! I enjoyed the water show every night while getting ready! My bf smokes cigarettes so we check into a smoking room. When I first walked in I thought it was going to reek of the smell of smoke, but it didn't (thank goodness). The room was a good size and I love the double vanities so that I can get ready without sharing counter space. 

The casino was right downstairs and around 9PM they have go-go dancers dancing on the tables in the "pleasure pit" area. If you're looking to go and have a good times, PH is a great hotel to stay at. There is along of younger people who just want to have fun! The location of PH is perfect because it's right across from Aria, Crystal Mall and next to Paris. You also have access to the shopping mall. The pool looked really nice but it was too cold to go out there. I can't wait to go back to Sin City!!

Staying & playing @ Planet Hollywood was AWESOME!!! When we first checked in, line was kind of long but moved quickly.. At our turn to check-in, the front desk clerk was very professional & asked when was the last time I stayed here.. Told him it was my 1st time & next thing you know I got a complimentary upgrade from Hip room to Resort Room with view of pool & Bellagio water fountain!! Of course, the $20 tip trick worked!!! Room was amazing & bathroom was HUGE!! His\/her sinks!! Beds & pillows were comfortable.. ( did not want to get out if bed).. Learned 3 card poker @ the Pleasure Pit.. Lost & then won my money back.. Breakfast @ Miracle Mile Restaurants are cheap & ono!! Planet Dailies had good food too!! Will definitely be back to stay @ PH!!
stay away from Jose in the sports book bar that dude has the worst service on the planet.

Compared to the other hotels I've stayed at, this one sucks. Allow me to explain\/rant. 

The rooms are old and need updating. It smells like old building. The curtains resemble corrugated cardboard, and it's so loud when you lift and lower the curtain that you can hear when your neighbor does it. 

The decor is creepy. My room had Titanic props and there is a creepy baby doll hanging from the wall. The wifi is also reeeeaaaally slow. It was included in the resort fee, but I would NOT pay for it if it ever came to that. 

The pool on the 6th floor is the worst pool I have ever been to in Vegas. We couldn't bring a bag in to carry our belongings. You have to use a locker which is located inside the hotel. There are minimal chairs by the pool, no tables other than for gambling, and we were forced to sit in the common area where there is only a bunch of chairs, some music, no shade, and 100 degrees. The 21+ pool has an outdoor PA cranked with subwoofers and you can't even have a conversation.  

On the bright side, we were able to create our own seats by grabbing some chairs that were put away and strategically placed them in the pool area, tucked away in a small area not really meant for chairs.  Also, the room seemed clean. We didn't get eaten alive in our bed like we did on our last vacation to Puerto Rico.  The only bug we saw all trip in Vegas was a cockroach in the old strip near Golden Nugget. Outside. Not inside. 

The last positive note is that their waitresses in the casino were really good about bringing drinks to the slots. I usually only get 1 round and give up. 

Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.  With all the comps going on and newer hotels, why would you even bother staying at Planet Hollywood? It's not terrible here, but it just doesn't compare to the newer hotels on the strip.  We got a deal when we bought airfare, but it wasn't worth it.

This gets a 2 star because my expectations were so high.
I have wanted to stay here forever, and finally I did. HOWEVER, the rooms were disappointing. There is no coffee in ANY rooms. There is no fridge or microwave unless u pay $30 extra a day for a portable one. But my biggest complaint is the valet parking that takes a minimum of 15\/20 minutes. During a busy time you can expect to wait 30-45 minutes for your car. I wouldn't return to stay here with all the options around. It's a been there done that place. 
It gets the 2 stars for  the blackjack dealers which were both exceptional and HOTT!

They have great casino space.
The room was ok, didn't like the design and creepy old costume they put on the wall but who stayed in the room? We spent most of the time outside.


But location was great and nice casino and close from clubs.

We booked two rooms for two nights for $650.  Although the rooms were adjacent, we felt it was better if our party of 8 had one big suite.  The host asked us if we wanted to upgrade to a 1200sf suite with an extra attached room (500sf) for $850.  For an extra $25\/head, it was well worth the price! With all that space, we never felt cramped - as opposed to previous experiences where the rooms were so small that all we can do in them was to sleep.  Although the room (and hotel itself) isn't as luxurious as the Bellagio, Mirage, Wynn or many others, it was very spacious, had an amazing view, and was perfect to party in.

Personally, I think there are three types of hotels in Vegas.

1) The ultra-lush, very $$$, and super sterile luxurious ones.
2) The pretty cool and fun ones.
3) The ghetto motel quality ones.

For us, Planet Hollywood was perfect.  Great location, easy access to the Miracle Mile Mall, pretty busy pool, and super convenient buffets.  It's not as impressive as some other hotels, but it does caters more to the 21-35 crowd.

Good location. Good casino. 

My room did not have a room service menu. Called housekeeping to send one up. Waited 30 min and had to call again. Waited way too long so I got dressed and went to earls sandwich to get food. By the time I got back to my room, I hopped in the shower, got out and FINALLY got a knock on the door with the room service menu. 

As I was getting ready, I plugged my straightener in and all the lights in the bathroom went out. Called front desk and was an easy fix but also wanted to know why the lights on the dresser mirror didn't work either. 

Ofcourse in Vegas you have very very late nights.... So I put the "do not disturb" sign into the card reader around 530am. Sure enough around 11 am housekeeping is knocking on the door and actually opens the door. Good thing I had the lock on. I don't know if another person staying had stole the sign out of my door or what but it was definitely a rude awakening. The next day house keeping came at the same time and this time I was awake to tell her I did not need service. I fell back to sleep and from 1pm-4pm someone tried opening my door twice !!!!!!!! I told housekeeping I did not need service why is my door being opened not just once but twice ! Thank goodness for the lock on the door they can't open it all the way. Sleep was very hard to get here

Check in takes forever. I upgraded to the Penthouse floor expecting a better room. It was recently remodeled and not a bad room but certainly nothing special and kind of small. I had the mountain facing room, which is fine because if you face the Bellagio be prepared to hear the fountain show all the time. It's right in the center of the strip so the location is good if that's what you're looking for. 

Nice size bathroom with a nice tub and shower but he towels were like cardboard and the TP was the cheap stuff. If you travel you know what I mean. Holiday Inn Express has better towels and TP. 

They charged for internet ($15\/24 hrs) and it's not wi-fi. I hate that, I can get free wi-fi at a Super 8. They claim they don't charge "resort fees" but if I can get it free at a much cheaper "Motel" I'm not buying that claim. 

The pool is not great at all considering it's Vegas. They do have a "no kids" pool so that's a plus for me but it's a pretty boring pool. Day beds were $50 and Cabanas were $199 w\/ a bottle included. 

Casino is fun the Go Go girls dancing above the card tables were certainly entertaining. 

The couple of times I called the concierge he didn't have anything helpful. I was looking for a spa to get massages for us and PH's spa was booked. Ended up going to the Cosmopolitan (Nice Spa) I was also looking to rent a car. There is a Hertz on site but be prepared to pay a premium for that. He didn't have any other suggestions. 

The staff was nice and did their best to be accommodating. 

I probably would not stay there again considering all the choices in Vegas. They'll have to do better than that.

Interesting property. Big hotel, small casino, big mall...seems a little strange to me. This is another joint that loves having the young, drunk douche staying in their rooms and it shows as they hover around the Craps table screaming at a 7.

The mall is actually pretty nice and full of decent stores, there are some good eateries (Earl of Fucking Sandwich!) and despite the majority of the clientele it's a decent place to hang out.

I wanted a few days away by myself to sit in the sun & relax. Coming from a cold, wet WA state. I got a room w a tub as I don't have one at home & wanted to soak nightly. Upon arrival the room looked clean, bed made, towels folded. When I looked in the tub & shower it was filled w black hairs! The bathroom mirror was dirty, marble floors weren't mopped , sheets weren't clean. I complained & they said they'd take care of it. Next day room was "cleaned" same hairs in tub, floors still not mopped or vac. I complained a second time. They said it would be taken care of. Came back after maid was there, still hairs in tub. Why can't people do their jobs anymore!?

i haven't stayed in their rooms since they remodeled, but when it was aladdin, the suite was nice. really spacious too.

so i was playing some pai gow the other day and i like this game b.c your money is pretty steady. when you win, you win big in this game. so i left the table about 10 bucks up with no lucky hand, at least i wasn't down.

then stupid drunk ass me goes over to the roulette table and puts it all on red. always always bet on black!!! sheesh! at least christmas wasn't a total bust, lakers kicked some celtic ass!!!!!!!

A great value especially when your room is free with Total Rewards as this is a Caesar's Entertainment property. First time we stayed here and we truly enjoyed it! 

Pros:
Clean room
Great view of Bellagio fountain\/strip from room
Roomy with nice sized bathroom
Comfy beds
Casino has nice layout
Openings at tables and slot machines (no waiting)
Starbucks
Variety of restaurants including Earl of Sandwich (24 hrs) (Can use Total Rewards to pay for food)
Peepshow (Fun show, great stage visibility from seats)
Free drinks a plenty on Casino floor

Cons:
Restaurants are pricey
Pink's Hot Dogs-awful and no indoor seating-not worth $9 for a hot dog
Earl of Sandwich-Reasonably priced but slim on fillings (mostly bread)
Elevators can be slow and it does not seem like all are running.
Skip Koi - go somewhere off the strip like Hot N' Juicy

Definitely will be back. Room was quiet and spacious and hotel is conveniently located on the strip as there are back ways in, so you do not need to enter from LVB.

We have a feeling the "Hollywood" theme is definitely more up-to-date and appropriate in the US than the Arabic theme right now. Such are the realities in the seventh year of the second millennium. The new facelift seems promising. Good vibe overall, in spite of the mess outside and the incomplete transition from Alladin's badly interpreted Arab kitsch to a Hollywood bling-bling kitsch. Can't wait to see the final result in a few months.

Rooms are clean overall, and have no heavy stench that is otherwise typical for most hotels on the South Strip. Bathrooms are nice too. Separate toilet, shower and a good size 2-person bath tub that comes handy to relax two tired bodies that have been slaving out badly during the heavy workweek back in LA...

However, we did found some "artefacts" from previous visitors (a few long thick black hairs, clearly from an Asian woman)... sigh. Nothing is perfect. So we lowered the star rating to 4 for that reason. So far this is the only thing that disturbed our trip. But hey, we are still here- we never know what else can go wrong... right?

Stayed here twice. Nothing special and I don't like how the casino area has like 4 different exits\/entrances and very confusing to navigate. I once went upstairs cuz its the only elevator i could find to get to my room and it was broken so I had to walk all the way back down -_-

 The restaurants here are mediocre, will not stay here again.

First of all, I like the location of this hotel.  And if you're going to park, by all means do Valet and pay the few bucks tip, because self-parking is a mile away.

We got a strip suite and a regular suite, both facing the Fountain.  Nice view, but though the Strip Suite is supposed to be larger, which it was, it just felt smaller due to the floorplan.  It was rather rectangular and narrow, thus feeling more cramped to be in. The random Hollywood movie decorations are sort of tacky; we had a plastic gun and sweater in our room from Star Trek that wasn't very attractive but I had a pleasant stay.

All in all, the location of this hotel is good, though it's right across the street from the current new apt construction.  Puts you in good location from the North and South ends of the strip.  And there's the Miracle Miles mall right next door.

Had a fantastic experience at Planet Hollywood on a recent stay.  Loved many things about the place:

1. The rooms were beautiful and very comfortable.  Ours was decorated with Ghostbusters memorabilia which was just fun.  
2. The casino was buzzing and had a young vibe.
3. Ate at their restaurant several times, and while the service was slow, it was always friendly and the food was good.  Especially good for late night snacks.
4. LOVED the pool area.  Amazing rooftop area, fun DJ, and plenty of chairs.
5. Proximity to other fun spots on the strip, including Paris and the Bellagio.
6. The concierge hooked us up with some last minute tickets to Cirque.

Unfortunately, check-in and check-out seem to have quite a queue...but that may because we (like many other patrons, apparently) waited until the absolute last possible moment to check-out.

I stayed at Planet Hollywood with several friends for 3 days last weekend.

Room: 4\/5 - The rooms are nice. 42" plasma TVs and stylish furnishings are included in standard rooms.
Service: 3\/5 - My reservation was wrong. They expected me there the night before I arrived and put me down for 5 nights instead of 3. That mix-up caused check-in to take a little longer than it should, but that wasn't a big deal. My only big complaint is that many of the dealers have no personality. They deal cards with stone-cold faces like robots. It's more enjoyable playing table games when the dealers are friendly, especially when losing.
Ambience: 4\/5

Stayed here for one night. It is funny because like the Elara, Planet Hollywood is located right at the Miracle Mile Shops too. 

This hotel has such a large casino! It is cool because in the rooms, it is decorated with tidbits of old school hollywood. There was the Wynan Brothers framed in our bathroom and an old Wheaties cereal box on one of our night stands. 

The room is nice. The decor isn't like modern or anything, it is just like any ordinary hotel room.

I wouldn't recommend anyone to stay here. My boyfriend and I went over spring break; it was my first time visiting Las Vegas however, my boyfriend has been there several times. He has never experienced a problem the way he did at Planet Hollywood. Absolutely the worst customer service ever. First of all, the mini fridge would not work, second, one of the cleaning maids simply walked into our room without knocking, third, we were wrongfully charged an additional fee and in order to end in good terms, we were constantly trying to get a hold of someone to help us dispute the charge. We were constantly given the run around from risk management and from front desk supervisors; the front desk managers would send us to risk management and risk management would send us to front desk supervisors. EVERYONE was so unwilling to help us. This absolutely ruined our trip, we were extremely disappointed by the services provided by this hotel and will avoid it at all cost!
Remarkable service from every Planet Hollywood staff member from check in to check out. Thank you for the great experience!

OMG, So many issues with this place. 

Stayed here for a bacelorette party and we had joining rooms.

1. PARKING: You park your car and you have to walk through Miracle Mile with everything to get to the hotel.
2. REGISTRATION: There isn't a clear map for registration. You need to go downstairs from the big shiny ball in the Casino to get to registration. 
3. ROOMS: The room looked nice but nothing worked! The TV in our room didn't work. The phone didn't have all the buttons. The lamps didn't work. There were not enough outlets. We didn't get blanket covers over the thin sheets. 
4. HAIR DRYER - No hair dryer in room. You need to order it from the front desk\/house keeping
5. CONDIMENTS: The products provided - shampoo\/lotion\/soap kinda sucked. I used the shampoo and it felt like GOO. :P Come on. 
6. BUFFET: Eh... see my review on that. 

OVERALL: 
Cheap price, but you would think they would keep their place stocked and working. :P

We have been staying at Planet Hollywood for years and have always been totally happy.  It seems now they need some updating.  Our toilet malfunctioned and we would have to get up and rattle the handle.  The music  from outside somewhere was so loud that it vibrated the plastic showcase on our wall and there was vibrating for several hours every nite.  It was so loud we had to turn the TV volume up considerably.  There is a wall unit in the room with drawers in it, the doors of the wall unit covering the drawers were off with the bare hinges hanging.  When the people in the next room showered the plumbing made a constant sound while they were in the shower that was about as loud as the showcase vibrating on the wall. Staff was fine.   That will be our last stay at Planet Hollywood.

I just stayed here about a week and a half ago and it was ok. it was clean and nice inside. It has a central location on the strip so you can walk everywhere. They had some decent restaurants. things that were not too expensive either.

BUT

I booked off of orbits and nothing anywhere said they have a maintenance fee that they charge 64 dollars every day. so what I thought I would pay per night literally doubled because of this fee that they do not put or say anywhere on the booking sites like orbits an kayak. 

also the pool was a joke. It was not even heated when we went so everyone crammed into the hot tub like sardines. If you are looking for a pool party this is definitely not the place.

I enjoyed how this was located in the middle of the strip which was nice. Beds were comfy but the feather pillows gave me a headache. The rooms were amazing, the bathtub is fabulous. Tried out the bathtub but was impatient enough to wait for the tub to fill up since I was tired and had a huge headache so I just jumped into the shower instead. We kind of had a crappy view and the other party had a Bellagio fountain view :\/. We also had to wait for our room to open up until 3pm when the other party had there room already. 

We had the Rambo room, we got the camo pants and his knives lol. Pictures of him throughout the room. It was nice to check him out and my bff getting busy with him on her side of the bed. Clean room. The bed made a lot of noise when I kept getting out of bed to go to the bathroom lol. 

If your not the type who parties\/clubbing or drinking a lot like us than our hotel room is the place we'd be. For one I didn't like how wifi you had to pay 13.99 for only 24hrs. Yeah sure it seems a lot of time but were not our room for that long only during night time or when were coming to relax a bit. No fridge but they do offer it with fee so we made our own for our drinks and snacks. Nice big screen TV but nothing to watch on it since we only get basic cable and movies you gotta pay for. BOO. I may sound cheap but really I wouldn't want to buy a movie all the time if I plan on staying there for only a bit. Also parking at this place was a pain, we had to park where the shops were because the other parking closer to the hotel lobby was only for valet. BOO. Our room was also noisy of whatever that was going on upstairs, it seem like plumbing issues, don't know. 

Lots of shops, few interesting restaurants to try out and pretty ok buffet. There is a Pink's Hot Dog place I tried it and now I am staying away from it. Why? because that shit made me sick. After I threw it out I felt better, even the smell made it worse. 

Fun times....enough said.

My room was perfect. I stayed in a Planet of the Apes themed room. It had an amazing view of the fountain and the eiffel tower. It was clean and HUGE. My biggest regret is that I had so much fun on this trip that I didn't get to take a bath in the amazing HUGE bathtub.

They also let me check out an hour late, which was much appreciated.

I'll be back.

Awesome place! We stayed in the Panorama Suite and had an AMAZING view of the Eiffel Tower, the Bellagio fountain show, Aria, and Ceasars Palace! The mall below was pretty cool too... We def got our sugar and oxygen fix. Service there was great! 

My only complaint... No vents in the bathrooms and the casino wasn't all that amazing.

Stayed here last December and it was such a GREAT place to stay. You really don't have to leave if you don't want to!!! A definite must if you are going out to VEGAS! Has great food, great bars, great shops, and shows

I will definitely stay here again
Definitely need more staff at front desk, only two people with like 50 people in line. Otherwise great stay: nice room, great service , nice view!

Sensory overload! If you like that, you'll love it here. I'm not so much a fan, but read on.

We ended up staying here with the fly and stay package we booked online with our friends. What's nice about Planet Hollywood is that it is smack dab in the middle of the strip making walking to most places easy to do.
