There is a never-ending parade to watch outside your window no matter which way you look. The second room we stayed in here was very nice indeed.

What I didn't like about Planet Hollywood: the sensory overload is not my kind of thing. There is loud music playing in the main casino area all of the time. Add that to all of the monitors mounted everywhere tuned to different channels, the general casino noise, all of the people, slots, etc and you have one bright, shiny, flashing place that never turns off. I'm sure it's just how they like it. It's just not my thing. I'm more of a quiet luxury and serenity kind of gal. Even the elevators had TV monitors on their ceilings so you did not have to miss any of the celebrity interviews while you were headed to and from your room!

Anyway, if your room is high up enough in the building (25 floors or above) and you face the strip you might be lucky enough to see plenty and still sleep through the non-stop construction. We had to change rooms but I have to give props to Planet Hollywood here. They had no problem with this and happily accommodated our request. Not only that, we were upgraded into a really nice room after that; so it worked out.

The other thing aside from the sensory overload that bothered me about staying here was the fact that if you did not use the valet parking you have to walk at least a half mile (halfway through the Miracle Mile shops) to get to the entrance to the hotel from the parking lot. I'm no exercise hater or anything but sometimes this was just not fun. Like at midnight when nothing is open and you have already walked miles in the fancy sandals that were never meant for that anyway. Like then. Then it really sucks to have to do that just to get back to your room.

Vegas has so much to offer and so many choices to appeal to everyones tastes. I don't think I would stay here again. I'd just as soon try one of the others for a different experience and take on the Vegas scene.

Free parking yea mile walk to front desk boo. Confusing layout with front desk hidden on first floor. Lousy cable with $18 pay per view movies. Good location on strip and within miracle mile mall with several very good restaurants and abc stores which sell snacks and beer\/booze. Room furniture hip but uncomfortable. Oh, Brittany just signed for 3 more years if you care.

Two stars for location only. Great access to Miracle Mile Shops and across the street from Crystals Shops & Aria\/Cosmopolitan 

The hotel itself is in need of improvement. Look elsewhere if you enjoy a luxurious room. The rooms here are tired and in much need of general maintenance and deep cleaning. Plus the maid staff has a few odd quirks that I noticed other Yelpers comment on like...

They use a flat sheet on the bed vs fitted but either it does not fit or they pull it so high that the bottom does not cover the mattress pad. I had to remake the bed each night to avoid the uncomfortable bunching and our feet on a mattress pad that most often is not changed.

Bottom line , Vegas has tons of rooms of much better quality with similar location. Skip this one until there management gets on the ball.
Great location . The hotel is getting old, need major work. The service is ok, I like the convenience of having Starbucks and gift shop at the entrance.

I'm pretty torn about my time in Planet Hollywood. First off, it was my first time staying here. Usually when I talk to my friends who visit Vegas they always recommend PH because its a hip, young and modern hotel. What they fail to mention is how gross it is.

Sure, the lobby is adjacent to Rockbar and Earl of Sandwich. And my room window was cool because it was straight on The Bellagio Million Dollar Fountain. But let's just be real here, that's its only winning quality.

The hotel it self is super worn out. It seems stuffy and dusty all the time. The hotel hallways always seem full of junky take out service and the cleaning carts are always left hanging around blocking the way. I mean, I was out all day and that night *ahem* morning when I stumbled back in, the hallways were hard to walk through because it seems like the cleaning staff here doesn't clear that stuff. At least make sure the hallways are clear every few hours, there's gross old food on those service carts that was out for hours!!

And during my stay the elevator failed twice. Almost closing on my cousin's fiance --- literally the doors were going to shut as he was walking in...it was pressing on to his back, shut. Dangerous! Luckily, a guard came to help the door open.

Also, when we got our room, which we requested to be on the non-smoking floor. Which, I know its Vegas, but c'mon in my sleeping quarters? Yeah the hallway was full of smoke and the smoke was seeping into my room. Like a big mega cloud of smoke. I'm sure there was more than one room full of smokers...gross.

In addition to that on the same floor my cousin's room had stains on the sheets while my bathroom sink was clogged and the batteries in my tv remote were dead.

That's the last time I stay in that wannabe modern hotel. I'd give them zero stars if I could. I'm giving one star for the window view and one star for Earl of Sandwich.  If you got some dolla dollas spend them elsewhere.

The hotel atmosphere is great. It had a really great crowd. Though I found some of the employees to be friendly there were a lot of grumpy ones too. I found the staff at the pool 21 black jack tables to be super talkative and friendly as well as the waitresses.  They were on top of it with drinks! They kept them coming.

 The indoor casino staff on the other hand was quiet, slow and not friendly at all. It's like they hated their jobs. They were a total buzz kill.

The room was kind of crappy. We got upgraded to a bigger room but the view was horrible and the window rarely filled the room with enough light. It's the room themed after the movie "Made in America." Yes it was large but I'd rather get a smaller room that got more light!

The food at this hotel is great! They have Starbucks, Earl of Sandwich and Gordon Ramseys Burgr (no this is not misspelled lol) to name a few. Fantastic!

As well, the shopping area is great! Best on the strip in my opinion.  I would stay here again if I got a proper room.

So, where to begin???? Well we decided to get the Vegas early to see the sites and stroll around. So we checked in about 10:30 am and I had done some research and determined if there was an early check in fee or not, and it cost $22.46 to do so. No big deal we had a long flight and wanted to eat and take a break. So, as far as the room we booked a "Ultra Hip Room" for about $109.00 a night through a third party site I have used for years. The front desk put us in the North tower all the way on the 23rd floor. The room itself was clean and actually very spacious ( as seen in the photos). This hotel is still going through renovations and were taking place on the floor we were on.

We booked a non-smoking room which sadly was smoked in. The room was quiet and the shower was nice and clean and was furnished with a mini fridge, couch, several chairs and a table. 

The hotel itself, smoke, smoke, everywhere is what you will smell on the casino floor. I have no issues being a former smoker but when you just don't want to be around it this was not the place. The elevators where similar to ashtrays and looked like worn out catchers mitts. The hotel seems as if it is attempting to adjust to the millennial crowd which they are failing at. Millennials do not gamble. They want experiences and Planet Hollywood Casino misses the boat. If you are looking for a decent priced hotel room in the middle of the strip, this is the spot for you.

Last weekend, I went to Las Vegas for my bachelorette party.  We booked a Terrace Suite at Planet Hollywood last month.  A group of 6 ladies.

We arrived early so our room was not ready.  We checked our bags at the bell desk.  When our room was ready, we went back to get our bags from the bell desk.  It was a very busy weekend, however, when my maid of honor asked if we could take the dolly up to our suite with all of our bags the bell desk said, "No."  Then she asked if someone would help us with our bags up to our room and he again said, "No."  I was unaware that this happened until we got up to the room.  So I called the front desk to speak to the manager, whom apologized.  I also asked for more towels.  30 minutes later, we still had no towels, so I called housekeeping to ask for towels.  They said they'd bring them right up.  Our group of ladies had to share towels because we were getting ready to go out.  At this point it had been an hour.  I called again, and they said they were backed up and had someone on their way.  So I asked them to leave the towels in our room so they would at least be there when we returned from a night out.  We went to a club and two of my friends came back at 1am--STILL NO TOWELS!  So my friend called the manager irate.  The only way we got towels was because my friend told the manager to stay on the phone until we got our towels.  This had been 8 hours from the initial request for the towels.

This is a suite, mind you, that we spend over $1,000 on for the weekend.  

The bar area in our suite had a wet carpet, from some sort of leak.  The front door was cracked, like someone had punched it, or tried banging the door open or closed.

We brought food up to the room the first night and left our trash outside the front door.  The person who brought towels did not take the trash.  The next day, when someone asked us if we wanted room service, did not take the trash away.  We ordered room service the next day and he did not take the trash down after delivering our food.  

After two nights and three days, our trash from the first day was still outside our doors.

To top off this awful experience, when we were getting ready to check out on Sunday, we noticed on the opposite side of the suite there was a large men's white tee shirt left on the table.  It had yellow stains and was none of ours!  THIS IS RIDICULOUS!

We took the shirt downstairs and showed it to the gentleman at the front desk who checked us out.  He was so apologetic and could not believe we even touched the shirt.  

We could have stayed anywhere on the strip, where hospitality and competition is high.  We could have spent over $1,000 at any other place and I'm sure would have had a better time.  
My bachelorette party was only great due to the friends I was with.  Planet Hollywood is awful and I will never stay there again, nor would I wish this experience on anyone.  I felt bad for my group of ladies who spent plenty of money to celebrate my marriage and I feel that I let them down by this experience.  I don't even know what else to say.

I have stayed here more than 20 timeson business, every January for the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) and National Association of Braodcasters (NAB), since the hotel was named the Aladdin. It offers the "Miracle Mile" shops. The hotel offers a convenient location on the center of the strip adjacent to Paris and accross from the newest City Center (Cosmopolitan Hotels) and Bellagio Hotels. The dinner buffet is one of the best in the area. The upgraded resort rooms are extremely large if you happen to get one, with very nice large bathrooms with both a shower and separate tub. All rooms have a safe.

People be warned!!! Seriously, PH should notify their hotel guests of the theme of each room before they are booked. Let's just say my friends and I were very uncomfortable in the room that we got and the front desk employee could not do anything for us...We then spoke with the Manager who was equally as useless and after about 20 minutes of arguing he finally gave us a refund. I am never staying at PH nor will I recommend anyone to stay here as well. Let me add on...we asked for some extra blankets and pillows and it took about two hours for someone to finally bring them up to us! Are you serious PH?! Especially if you guys were quote on quote "full capacity" that's why we couldn't get another room, shouldn't you guys have more than TWO housekeeping employees working?! (this is what the Manager told us when we complained about our room). Don't book here even if it's cheap...

My memory might be a bit fuzzy. 
We were there around 3 in the morning. The casino is hot! It was very sleek and modern, kinda like if Sephora was glitzy and a casino. There were Go Go girls dancing on platforms in the bars and at the table. Now, these were pretty hot girls not nasty stripper looking girls.
  We hung out at the center bar, I have no idea what it is called. The drinks were good I have no clue what they ended up costing. We were siting with who I think was Bone Thugs and Harmony? They were DECKED out and  the man and could only come to that conclusion.

I stayed here in November 2010 and the experience was mediocre.  The room was small with a tiny window...the drink service on the casino floor was horrible.  The dealers didn't seem friendly at all.  We had to complain about the hour wait for our drinks at the casino - which is ridiculous.  The floor manager eventually comped us $50 for the sandwich shop - Earl of Sandwich. I don't know what we were supposed to do with $50 worth of sandwiches either. (To be fair the sandwiches were pretty awesome)
Overall I wouldn't stay here again.

PROS: Affordable room rates, GREAT location on The Strip, connected to the "Miracle Mile" shops, has a Gordon Ramsey Restaurant, and $9 worth of Starbucks cash daily.

CONS: HORRIBLE PARKING for guests,  the Hotel Valet fills up quickly and thus closes allowing only for self parking.  This was a killer and may not book with them again.

Our room:The furniture was a very dark color which made the multiple chips in each and every piece of furniture stand out.  Next, I walked into the bathroom.  The shower was pretty ugly.  Old stained tile, worn drain, very simple faucet\/shower head.  Definitely nothing special.  Then, I walked to the sink to check out the soap & other goodies that were provided and noticed a hair in the sink.  Ick!  Whatever . . . Moved on to the bathtub. Multiple pieces of hair in the tub!!!  Gross!!! Had to use the facilities & noticed yet another hair on the floor next to the toilet.  Either housekeeping is too rushed or just doesn't care.  

At that point, we called the front desk to get another room.  This time we got an upgrade to a larger room.  When I looked in the bathroom of the new room, another hair (very long, dark hair) was sitting on the towel layed across the oversized bathtub.  The soap was placed on top of the hair so it was sandwiched between the towel and box of soap.  Did not bother to call and complain again, but did not use that towel, that soap, or that bathtub during our 2 night stay.
We saw the Peep Show starring Coco Austin. My husband and I liked the music.  I'm a big Coco fan so enjoyed seeing her, but the story-line is kind of cheesy & doesn't make much sense.  We saw the show previously when Holly Madison starred and it was completely unchanged years later.  I think they could stand to update it a bit.

The restaurants\/bars: Ate at YoLo's, Planet Dailies, and the buffet.  Food was ok.  I'd give it 3 stars across the board for the food itself.  The prices were pretty high for what you get.  For example, a simple Reuben is like $13. That seems inexpensive however when you compare it to prices at the pool bar where my husband's Bacardi Diet Coke was $15.  
Speaking of the pool, there are 2 pools which have a very simple shape. Nothing special about them.  They are holes in the ground filled with water.  Even the Flamingo has a nicer pool.  I would also recommend Caesar's, the Mirage, or the Cosmopolitan pools over this one.  

The spa:Not worth purchasing a day pass because there isn't much in there. It's old and the them is obviously left over from when this hotel was the Aladin.  This theme no longer fits this hotel.  The services do not follow the theme either like I have seen them do at many other Vegas spas.  Services are WaY Overpriced!!!!  Even for a Vegas spa.  Believe me, I have been to Qua @ Caesars & this is nowhere near as nice, but they still charge over $200 for a facial.  AnD . . . You are paying that much and the staff acts like they couldn't care less that you are there.  other than the "nameste" greeting you receive when you walk in the door, they do not make any effort to make you feel appreciated, special, etc.  

Facial itself was excellent, but I was asked if I'd like to have microdermabrasion and glycolic application during my facial.  I said, "sure."  Next, she tells me it was going to be a $20 upgrade charge.  She asked if that would be alright.  I agreed because I was using comps anyway and already spending over $200 as it was so what's another $20, right?  Well, when I went to check out, the guy @ the front desk said the upgrade was $25.  I explained to him I was quoted $20, but he insisted it was $25 & that I had already had the treatment and that I would need to pay for it.  I tried fighting him on it one more time but to no avail. 

We came to this hotel with the intention of using our $1000 comp dollars so we charged everything to the room.  Our final bill for 2 days was $644.  My husband checked out while I was finishing up at the spa.  They told him our comps covered all except $103 of our bill.  They charged our credit card the remaining amount!!!!  What?!?  We should have had more than enough comps.  So, my husband tells me this when I get out of the spa as we are driving away from the hotel.  I couldn't believe it and immediately called to try to resolve this.  The lady on the phone said the same thing . . .   All comps on both our players club cards had been used.  I could not believe this.  So, once we flew home, I looked online today and I still had $430 left in comps on my card!!!  What kind of idiots do they have working there?!?!  So, I called again TODAY and finally got someone who saw the comps and agreed to refund the amount charged to the credit card and instead take the $103 out of my comps.  

Such a stressful trip there was more frustration than fun.  My advice would be not to go to Planet Hollywood unless you want to be surrounded by a staff who doesn't give a shit that you are there from the valets to the bellmen to the waiters to the dealers.  They really don't care about you which is unfortunate since you are forking out a lot of money overpaying for subpar quality everything.  You would think that would at least buy you a little respect.

Random anecdote:
On Sunday morning after a night of partying, I woke up and was confused about where I was, what had happening and how I got there. Was I still drunk? Yeah. I think I still was.

Then, I realized I fell asleep with my contacts on so I walked to the bathroom to take them off. Somehow I managed to wash my contact down the drain :(

Oh, Vegas....you win this round.
----

The location is awesome with easy access to everything. Staying at the towers basically offers everything you need at a decent price.

Not a bad hotel, location is very good, the room was nice and clean and the hotel amenities are pretty cool. BUT, it takes forever for you to check-in and check-out. The front desk is ridiculously understaffed for a hotel of this size, and not only that, there is a million different types of priorities guest, and you have to wait for the fancy people queue to be cleared before you can check-out\/in. I would also like to add that the wifi policy is really unfair. You have to pay that lame "resort fee", but you only get to connect one device to the wifi network.

Stayed at this hotel twice? I think twice. 

Rooms are comfortable and clean! Bathrooms are clean, and HUGE! Perfect for the ladies like myself who likes to bring out the full glam treatment for Vegas! The only downfall I would say is that you don't get daily turnover. Or at least, our room never really got a turnover. 

Mostly though, this is the most convenient hotel I had ever stayed at. It's easy to get food at any hour, you can get your daily Starbucks, and the mall is attached to the hotel. 

Plus, it's not cheesy and dirty, and you don't get the stroller and children crowd here. Most people staying here seem to be younger, but not completely party crazy. The dealers in the Pleasure Pit are cute and really friendly.

I was in town for the first weekend of March Madness.  I had booked a Fri-Tues stay at Planet Hollywood in a Resort Room with a king bed.  I was put in room 1272, as I jokingly referred to it, the "'Speed' Suite".   My room was spacious and clean with plenty of photos of Keanu Reeves and "Speed" memorabilia decorating the room.  Some of the furnishing were showing a little wear and tear and were a bit dated from a design perspective.  However, the mattress offered good support and the bed and bedding overall provided a good night's sleep.  My room was tucked in the corner property so it was didn't receive much direct sunlight into the room, which actually was a blessing for sleeping in.  The bathroom was disproportionately large with two sinks and vanities, a separate tub and shower, and a separate water closet.  Water pressure in the shower wasn't great although it may be more attributable to the dated, possibly partially clogged, showerhead, than the lack of pressure in the line.  Of note, though, hot water seemed to be in somewhat shorter supply in the morning hours, but never a problem in the evening. 

As for gambling, I like to play where I stay and the bulk of my gambling was at the Planet Hollywood.  I'm primarily a blackjack player, but I also played some craps.  Planet Hollywood was the biggest surprise from a gaming perspective during this trip to Las Vegas.  Most of its blackjack tables except for those in the Pleasure Pit were 3:2 games although all of them were at $25 or $50 minimums.  These payouts and minimums were consistent throughout the entire week and at all hours.  They did have $15 tables, but they were 6:5.  The Pleasure Pit tables, when in operation, were $25 minimums at 6:5 payouts.  Sorry, but the spectacle of being able to watch an attractive, scantily-clad woman dance on a small stage while you gamble wasn't worth the lesser payout.  PH's craps tables during the daytime hours were $10 minimums, which seemed on the low end for the Strip.  Odds were the standard 3x4x5.  As for other aspects of the property, dining and drinking options really haven't kept up with its competitors or even other Caesars properties.  No matter, Planet Hollywood sits on prime Strip real estate conveniently located to near lots of places to eat, drink and play.

In the past, Planet Hollywood had been a property that I'd occasionally stay, but it rarely was my first, second, or even third choice.  This time out, it really made a positive impression, especially with its appealing blackjack payouts at many of its tables, which (for the moment) are resisting the horrible Las Vegas trend towards 6:5 blackjack games.  Planet Hollywood has made me reassess my ranking of it as a place to stay and play for future trips to Las Vegas.

This place was horrible  the service was horrible it was our first time here they were not able to give us the room we had reserve and when we called for towels they never brought them..when we went out we went valet they said they were full even doh we were staying there for 3 days  we had to park self parking.  Just the hole experience was bad I will never go back
good place if the price is right its centrally located and it has the best sushi restaurant KOI

Bachelorette party up in PH! Each room is decorated with a different movie theme. Since we had to change rooms so many times due to front desk issues (and one of the rooms smelled like vomit), I got to see several layouts. Beds are comfy. The bathrooms were spacious and each of them had a shower and tub. Oh and it was kind of a pain to have to change elevators to get to different floors. The main pool near the shops is decent. Go early if you want a cabana. The other pool is meh. If I get a good deal again I wouldn't mind staying here in the future. I remember when it used to be aladdin. Still has the genie lamp sink handles and door knobs...

If I could give negatives stars I would. If Planet Hollywood was on fire I wouldn't piss on it to put it out.. Let me explain.. I have probably stayed at around 5000 hotels in my lifetime and this was one of THE worst experience I have had.  After traveling all day to get there we went inside to check-in.  The line was probably 50 people deep at 6:00 PM.  At the rate it was moving it would have taken 2 hours to get a room.  We had tickets to Cirque Du Soleil "O" so we had to check our bags at the bell desk and go to the show. We came back at 10:00 ish and the line was 40 deep so we went to dinner to waste time.  At about 11:00 we came back completely exhausted and had to wait in line. it was about 30-35 deep and took us an hour to get to the front. So at midnight I finally get a room.. I was pissed but there were other folks with babies and small children stuck in line... All the while they had 2 perky employees hardly busy for the VIP check-in, so instead of them helping out the normal backlog they stood relatively idle.. So, once I got to the front of the line I asked them "how are you going to compensate me for standing in line for one hour - drink coupons, what?". The replay was.. NOTHING.. Fukking nothing for standing in line for one hour just to check in at midnight.. Also, the timeshare choads that they let prowl their halls are rude, unprofessional scumbags.. they insulted my girlfriend after she rightly refused their crappy deal and told her "she didn't make enough to buy a timeshare".. Bottom line is that unless you are a stupid moron with a lot of time to waste and tons of cash to throw down the toilet.. don't bother staying there because you are not the type they like..

1 star for being located on the center strip.

Outdated rooms, with old outdated plasmas. 
It's 2017, why hasn't anything been updated in 10 years? I say 10 years because that's what I was told by the front desk when I inquired about a room change because my TV didn't have an HDMI port. But it's gets worst. Telephone inside room was missing some keys, the door peephole was cracked, the sofa chair was old and seemed broken. Just a terrible hotel despite it being on the center strip. Pay a bit more money and stay at the Mirage.

I didn't get a chance to stay here but got a chance to hang out @ the pool for a few hours before attending an awesome wedding. I rolled up to the bar to wait on some peeps and had a couple pina coladas and watched some saturday afternoon college football as I sat there. My peeps showed up and decided it was time to get in the pool. Due to the fact my trunks were in the hotel I was staying in (Ballys) and I was tool lazy to walk over and get them, the lifeguard allowed me to swim in my boxer briefs...awesome! Hella good time!

We also were able to score a few big ass jugs of pina coladas for a decent price while we played in the pool. Was very good and we all did the damn thing on them coladas!

We enjoyed our stay, got a small room with 1 bed, the maids kept the room super clean and refilled the little toiletries daily (always a plus!) 
I wasn't happy with the $97 "resort fee" I paid on top of the fee I paid for our room for 4 days. The wifi is limited to 2 devices per room, and doesn't work once you leave that area lol I mean, not even in the casino!!
The casino Starbucks is double the price of a regular Starbucks so be prepared!! Oh and the baristas couldn't hear very well as our orders got botched twice. The room we got had no coffee maker or fridge unless we wanted to pay extra (what's the resort fee for??) so next time I'll make sure to look into that, potentially bring my own coffee lol
We used the gym on our vacation, 2 machines broken, but they has fresh lemon water and apples, clean towels and it was never busy, it closes early though, like 6 or 7. 
We enjoyed BURGR and pinup pizza, also made trips to fat Tuesday's and there's coupons upon check in for the halo bar.

Rooms are so old and outdated. All of Caesar's properties (except the new Linq and Cromwell) are outdated and in need of renovation. The elevators are beat up and scratched, casino floor is dirtier than most on the strip. Showers had mold and mildew, shower heads were old. Casino slots are old and outdated, they've had the same slots for the past 3 years or so. You are forced to hear the music from the pool all day starting at 11 am. I agree with the previous review, people are paying MGM prices to stay at PH and MGM is 50x's nicer than PH. I stayed at PH for the last time last weekend no more!

Check in\/out was quick and easy! The rooms are a little out dated and could use an upgrade. I got a room with a view of the strip, but the window is very small. The pool area isn't that great either. However I did like the the idea that it is in the middle of the strip. Would definitely stay again.

I'll start by saying that I understand hotels experience maintenance problems that need to be fixed due to the high volume of guests staying at the hotel, however... 

We got the handicap access room where there is an open shower instead of a stall. The shower drain clogged, breaking the plastic barrier and ultimately flooded our bathroom. While the maintenance crew drilled, snaked, and scraped the bathroom, they had to use 24 towels to soak up the water (which they told us would be cleaned up). 

Hours later we returned to see the bathroom hadn't been cleaned and the two dozen towels were left in a huge wet pile in front of the toilet. There was some sort of communication breakdown because they brought extra towels but no one to clean up the mess. 

The front desk staff didn't offer to anything in return for the inconvenience except a smoking room because they were booked. They only reluctantly gave us a hotel credit after we asked, but we still got charged for gratuity (Even though we generously tipped the staff). 

Overall, it was the customer service we were dissatisfied with - none of the staff tried to go above and beyond considering we spent several hundred dollars to stay in their hotel. We definitely won't be staying here again.

I loved my quick two night stay here! We booked through their loyalty program and got two buffet of buffets passes with it!! The adult pool was great, a perfect temperature with fast service for drinks and the towels actually fit the whole lounge chair! This hotel is on top of the miracle mile shops which is a mall with walgreens, abc stores and FAT TUESDAY! The casino was great and easy to get lost in. I will stay here again.

Our room was just as good as the location and pool. The bed was super comfy and a very cute vibe to it all. I especially loved the bathroom, no locks though.

Highly recommend!

The Good: Convenient location on the Strip.  Its smack dab right in the middle, putting you in close walking distance to many of the major hotels and attractions on the Strip.  Its also attached to the Miracle Mile shops and restaurants (complete with two ABC Stores!).  Very convenient if you just want a quick bite to eat without breaking your wallet and want to do some shopping without leaving the hotel and going out into the cold.  In terms of the room, upon check-in, we were given a free upgrade without having to ask...score!  Room was admittedly dimly lit, but clean and spacious.  Nice flat screen TV with select HD channels.  

The Bad: Many of the staff members appeared ambivalent about their jobs and were for the most part, unhelpful.  We were also hounded by PH's timeshare "greeters" until we agreed to sign up for a presentation.  Seriously, they would not stop harassing us.  Set our alarm the next morning to go to the presentation, only to be told at the door that wait, we couldn't attend because we didn't qualify.  WTH?  We had given our income level and info downstairs, but apparently they couldn't be bothered to check if we qualified...they were more interested in making the sale.  What a waste of time.  Also, housekeeping comes by early...at 9am...and pretty much will just knock once, say "housekeeping," and enter the room without waiting for a response.  We told them to come back later as we were still sleeping, and they did, every hour on the hour until the room got cleaned.  Sheesh.  Lastly, if you ask for a non-smoking room, make sure they don't put smokers next door to you.  The smoke wafted through the vents and under the door, filling our room with the stench and essentially turned our non-smoking room into a smoking one.  These smokers were also college drunks who kept yelling and pounding on the walls at 3:30am like they were trying to kick a hole in the wall.  Luckily, this happened on the last night of our stay, otherwise I would have asked for a room change or at least called security.  

Having been to Vegas at least a dozen times with family\/friends, I've stayed at my fair share of hotels.  That said, I did like Planet Hollywood and overall, enjoyed my stay.  Its also a Sheraton branded hotel, so Starwood members can get bonus points for staying here.

I love the theme and the hotel is very up beat!! The room was better than I expected, a big plus! 

My bf, a friend and I were walking here from venetian and got a little lost since PH restaurant and hotel are in two separate places. That was very inconvenient and misleading. Doesn't make sense to have those 2 separated. 

The customer service was ok. Could have been way better. I wanted to order room service since I was exhausted from the wkend and the dine in menu was missing in our room. We called for a menu and nothing half an hr later. Called again and they tell us it's in the room book. Told her it wasn't. Obviously, I wouldn't call if we had one. Getting cranky from waiting and starving. Was not a happy camper from then. Didn't order room service because they took too long so we headed out to find food.
This hotel doesn't get as much hype as it should. The casino is always clean, and the bars are nice. It's on my rotation everytime I visit.

If you're a smoker, this is your hotel. EVERYTHING reeked of smoke. The plumbing was lousy in my room, but I will say the room was fairly quiet and had some fun decor. It seemed everything about this hotel was mediocre - from the gambling to the food. I was in town for a conference so I didn't have to pay my way. If I were visiting Vegas for fun, I'd stay somewhere else!

i loved my one night stay here! overall, the hotel is beautiful.. the decor is a lot more hip and young.. with lots of pretty pinks and sparkly chandeliers. whats not to love??

i loved staying here. the room was clean, well-sized, and we didnt have any problems.  we didnt really use the room or maid service so i cant really speak on that.. but the casino is a lot of fun. especially the pleasure pit.. where you see go go dancers dancing up on platforms while you gamble. pretty cool.

the only complain i have is the pool...pretty standard.. nothing special or pretty to look at.. the service was decent but it definitely doesnt compare to the nicer pools you find at venetian or even mirage.

all in all a beautiful hotel and we got a pretty good rate. the only complain i would have is its more towards the center of the strip so if youre like me and you party all weekend on the far end where encore\/wynn is for XS, tryst, tao or what not, the cab fare is gonna be a little more. but other than.. great hotel!

We had never stayed here and decided to book our room here because we came to the Backstreet Boys concert opening night that took place at this hotel.

Overall the room was okay but we do have some complaints. Our room wall paper was peeling, there were scratches on the wall paper that should be covered. The trays in the restroom holding the lotions looked dirty and dusty. The worst part was the lighting in the room. The lighting was horrible. We had to take turns getting ready in the restroom because the lighting in the room was really bad, not enough light even with the blinds open and all the lights and TV on. We also didn't have a refrigerator. Apparently refrigerators are only available for suites according to the front desk when we called. Also, when we called to ask for fresh towels, they took a half hour to bring them after we made a second call for them.

Day one here and I'm not impressed at all.  The room is dark and gloomy.  One of the 3 lamps don't work. The there is no USB Charging station.  The furnishings are old and damaged.  The bathroom is a mess.  Cracked tiles in the shower.  All of the fixtures in the bathroom are rusted and dirty.  On top of above I'm here during construction.  The water will be off from 10:30am-3:30pm.  I'm giving 2 stars only because of the good customer service at check-in.
I like staying at planet hollywood. The rooms are clean with cool decor.  They have purple towels, haha. Its not expensive.

I really like this hotel\/casino. The rooms are nice, not that you spend much time there. The bathtub was enormous...and I like a good soak. The bed was really comfy. And the shades keep out that pesky sun, trying to wake me before 10am.

The casino dealers are very friendly. I always have a good time playing there. It'll be my future Vegas home base.

Stayed here during Christmas 2015. Had a very great view, though the room was smaller that I thought. Everything was nice, and clean. However, the check in line was so long x.x Waited an hour. In addition,I Would definitely stay here again.

This place caters more to the younger, hip crowd, and that's why I chose it.  But honestly, there's not real need to stay here.  Its more expensive than many other hotels.  If I could do it again, I wouldn't pay the extra money to stay at this hotel.  I actually would have preferred to stay at the MGM, or even Imperial.  Choose a place with a club you plan on visiting.  This place didn't have it.

Derek
I love staying here !! In the middle of everything! So please keep taking care of meee. Nice mall inside, food court, Chipotle! A lot good average restaurant.  My room view

My best friend and I decided to relieve some stress and decided to fly down to Vegas. Since it was going to be a short trip, I chose this hotel since it's close to all the places we wanted to go to. 

It was our first time staying here. Check in was no problem, staff was quick and friendly. The appearance and size of the room was pretty good. I loved the bathroom. Though, I did get some sleep, I was itching and when I got up in the morning I noticed I had a lot of bug bites on both of my legs. Possibly bed bugs? I hope not! So I ignored it and just did whatever we had to do and didn't bring it up to my friend until I told her I was going to sleep next to her in bed that night because of my bites. Then she told me she was itching too. So that's when I decided I'd go to the front desk to just give them a heads up to check the room after we check out. The lady at the front was wanted to switch us to another room but I just told her it was too late because we were checking out at 4am anyway. She was kind enough to refund the resort fee though. So I guess that was ok. But I'm hoping they really check the beds though.

Not sure if it was one time only but we got complimentary valet parking, it made things so easy because Parking at the garage was crazy and full! So if you're staying at planet Hollywood swing by the valet line and if it isn't complimentary you can still unload your bags leave it with the luggage staff and they will hold it for you and take it to your room, you just call the number they give you once you're in the room! 

Checking in was quick! We checked in at 8 pm on a Monday summer night, not very busy! We got a room with an incredible view!

The miracle mall is part of the planet Hollywood hotel, the V theater and Fat Tuesday can be found in this mall! 

The location on planet Hollywood was perfect! Everything is so near! And walking distance, the he Dueces bus stop is in front too if you rather use that as transportation, just make sure you know which bus to take!

The room was nicely decorated with hollywood memorabilia and a decent flat screen tv.  The bathroom was large and had a good shower and hot tub.  The room was very dark so it was easy to sleep in a little after being out partying very very late. Plenty of room for a mid range priced room.

The casino is hands down the best to casually gamble at.  I've stayed and played at 8 casinos over a long period of time and am a big fan.  Always seems to be exciting in their even if you are not winning.  

This is not for the older Vegas visitor if you want it quiet. But if you are a young visitor up to 50ish and are into a lively place you must play and visit here.

I did not like it. For the price vs. value, it was actually pretty disappointing. I stayed in the Hollywood Hip King Room and supposedly it was 450sq ft. but I did not feel like that at all. It was a decent size I guess for 2 people but no more. It was extremely hard to find an outlet for myself to plug in my hair appliances since my fiancé was using it for his laptop. Basically, this was not a room meant for ladies because it was so basic and not at all comfortable. Furniture's were outdated and had a bunch of dings and dents. TV suck! A tiny window so not much natural light coming through. There wasn't any main switch for the lights so you had to manually turn each of them on. The bathroom needs a huge makeover, actually the room does!

Biggest pet reeve for me though was the walk to the room every time. If you valet, you wouldn't have any issue but I don't like to leave my car with somebody else for too long. Call it trust issue I guess. If you are like me and prefer to self-park, be prepare to walk through the miracle mile every time.

I guess the only good thing was that you had a mall just right below your room. You are able to grab a quick bite or do some affordable shopping. The hotel was also on a good location.

Splurge a little more and stay somewhere else. The room did its job and I was able to sleep in a clean room. It wasn't the worst but it was most definitely not the best.

After this place was recommended by several people we are not fans.  We loved the location and access to the miracle mile shops, however, the room was dirty, the toilet was clogged, and it took forever to get someone to fix it.  The view was also crap and the room needed an upgrade 5 years ago.  The only good thing is that we didn't spend too much time in the room, and the shades worked extremely well.  We will not be staying at this Hotel again.  It is too bad because I had high hopes for this place and it was extremely disappointing.

The newly renovated room was sooo awesome! Everything was clean and new!!!
The front desk person was very helpful and cheerful. I was worried about the noise (after reading some reviews) in the room at night because of the Britney concert downstairs, but we were fine. 
The food and service at different dining places in the hotel premises were very good, esp. at the cafe, where I enjoyed the prime ribs. Check out was quick since I did it on the Total Rewards app. They also have kiosks where you can do your check in or  check out.

Played all night and every dealer was a treat. Especially Maggie and Chris. Go go dancers and crazy friendly dealers..... especially when it comes to black jack advise late night. Cheers guys and can't wait to see you all again.

ATTENTION EVERYONE!! Well we tried to call, my aunt walked in to talk to a manager and we have gotten NO RESPONSE FROM PLANET HOLLYWOOD LAS VEGAS!

At 3:30AM Monday, October 2nd, my 2 friends, my husband and I walked up to a Planet Hollywood security guard and asked to see about getting a room since we couldn't get back to the Luxor during the hotel lock downs that followed the shooting. I had returned the truck to the person I had borrowed it from, and we had been walking the streets of Las Vegas for nearly 5.5 hours. In shock, coming down off an adrenaline rush, and with Nick covered in blood, we just wanted a place to rest, watch the news, and for Nick to shower and change his clothes.

Planet Hollywood charged us $150 (including resort fees) to get a room that we stayed in from 4AM-7AM. 3 HOURS!!!! The guy at he front desk even commented on all the blood all over Nick. The LVMP officers that was blocking the strip hadn't communicated that there was a place for those displaced from hotel rooms to go to. We thought we had no other choice.
Casinos comp rooms all the time to big spenders at the tables... but couldn't throw us a bone at 3:30am after the hell we had been through!! SHAME ON THEM!!!

Maybe they'll see it and humanity will smack them in the face.

What a dump..this place is way overpriced, the beds are so flimsy they actually pop up if you sit on the edge. Hilarious? Not. Lame. The decor in the casino is gaudy and dated. The staff at the hotel except the Bell desk people were rude. The prices for food were way over what the value was. I got sick after eating at one of their restaurants.  I would never recommend this place to not even my enemy.  Skip it!

I am so disappointed with Planet Hollywood. I booked it through Vegas.com, which we had other issues with, and the hotel room wasn't great.  Very small, and none of the basic amenities. No fridge, no coffeemaker, half a closet that you can barely fit anything into.  Only allowed to have WiFi for one device.  And having them bring up a mini fridge is an extra charge. So ridiculous.  Just disappointing overall.  

I mean even the nozzle on the shower still said Aladdin - really?? You didn't even bother to change that? I'm sure all the furniture is the old Aladdin furniture too, because it was tiny and old-looking. 

We had issues with Vegas.com not telling us there is a new resort fee policy of $20 extra a night that is not included in your original purchase. (I've been a customer for a long time and they never notified me that their Terms and Conditions had changed, which I read before the new policy was added).

I understand that the fee issue is Vegas.com's fault, but when the PH Towers were still around, and I had an issue with Orbitz at the time not giving me the suite I paid for and just gave us a normal tiny room, the manager of the Towers called them for me and talked to them about it. He helped us fix the problem!  These employees at Planet Hollywood didn't even bother to try at all to help us.  The only thing they did was waive the fee for bringing up a mini fridge, and then they stuck it in the bathroom! Gross. They should consider adding more outlets in the room. 

The only good thing is the mall, and the hotel location.  The pool is eh. Small, nothing special.

I cannot believe how few amenities they have. And how little they are willing to help. They even took forever to bring us towels.  Will not stay at Planet Hollywood again.  Not worth it, I can get a nicer place that treats you well.

I am scared to go to sleep, I am scared to go to my room. 
I checked in 4 hours ago and I walked down the GRAY, DIM and Red hall- remind you of anything....The shining... 
There are exactly 3 lights in my room and I am staring at a prisoners outfit hanging on the wall. Apparently from the movie "bennie and joon" 
There is also a little girls pajama inside a table- which is even creepier. 
I am scared to take off my socks too... carpets are not in the best shape. i think the bathroom has mold growing between the tiles. 
I was considering staying at the bellagio but did not because of their resort fee's, now I am wishing i had stayed at the golden nugget.

After 2 months of dealing with CCMSI, the insurance company for Planet Hollywood, they have determined they will not assume any liability or pay for any of my damages.  This incident cost me nearly $1000 in medical bills, prescription drugs, luggage and dry cleaning.

The adjuster said in his opinion the bites didn't look like bed bug bites, despite a doctor's note stating that they were in fact bed bug bites.  I guess CCMSI thinks they are better trained to evaluate medical conditions than a doctor.

I will NEVER stay at this hotel ever again.

Was staying at this hotel and the security completely refused to be reasonable and evicted us without offering to relocate when we got noise complaints. I was in a suite with a stripper pole in the shower. What kind of room has a stripper pole in it that isn't expected to be loud? Never going back. Stupid.

I didn't stay here but it was the furthest I felt like walking most of the time from my hotel. 

I was dying to play War and this hotel had a War table so I went. I'd love to come back and gamble here! All of my dealers were awesome and the table minimums were GREAT. The atmosphere was good for my 20-something self. The cocktail waitresses also come around pretty frequently, which is nice. 

Although I must say this...the setup is a little rough. I couldn't walk away from a table without losing direction.

I have stayed at a lot of casino\/hotels in Vegas. This was my first and probably last time staying at Planet Hollywood. The rooms were decent not great. Bed was ok. Bathroom was very nice. The casino part was the let down. Blackjack payout was 6\/5, I believe, vs 2\/3 which was more standard. I sat down at the bar to pass some time thinking I could gamble a little while watching the game and having some beers. At one point I asked for a beer and they all but refused saying "my light wasn't green" because I hadn't gambled enough. So I told him I wasn't here to steal his beer and slapped a 5 on the bar and asked again.

As with any hotel there will always be some issues. We spent 3 nights here, overall it was a good experience, check in was quick and our room was clean. We had to call to get a light replaced that was broken, and maintenance responded right away and was eager to help. Had to ask for coffee on the second night housekeeping didn't replace even though we tipped. Make sure you don't get a room near the elevators, very noisy. As for the casino it is loud and geared towards a younger clientele. We took in a show, just watch where you buy tickets as the prices seem to vary. Our room could have had a little more light especially the bathroom and a full length mirror in the room would be helpful. Overall I would recommend.

We got a non smoking queen room. There's a big tub (not jet) beside the shower. The room is roomy enough for my kids to scatter the toys around and play. There's no fridge or mini bar. We got a nice view looking at the pool below and the Bellagio fountain.

We came to this casino to gamble and visit some friends.  There was nothing special about this hotel.  The rooms looked average and the casino was the same.

There were the Miracle Mile shops located inside the casino which made it convenient to shop if you needed something.  The shops included clothing stores, restaurants, and a ABC store.

Terrible service waiting in line for 30 minutes and counting to get another key.  Friendly upon check in but room is dirty and worn.  Casino staff is short.  Much better service and accommodations to be had in Las Vegas.

this review is only for the room..

first off, the view was spectacular! location is on point (center of strip). 

stayed in the jacuzzi suite. it was really basic. honestly, i was expecting it to be fancy or at least with a jacuzzi that didn't resemble a plain old tub and one that could hold more than one person. it's ok though. it's vegas! you shouldn't be stuck in the hotel all day long unless you're gambling.  

hmm.. what i liked about it was its simplicity. there were a few of charlie sheen's belongings displayed. other than that, nothing special.

the bed is comfy; "clean" is a different story which i'll get to.. no fridge and very little closet space (didn't matter to me; i never use the closet). there are no locks for the bathroom doors. *take note if you're rooming with others.  their shampoo and body wash sucked, but it's all good.

comforter was nasty!  a certain area of it smelled like B.O. haha and i didn't notice it til i woke up the next morning.. i know for a fact it wasn't me or my husband. we don't smell 'that' bad when we sweat! i threw it onto the carpet and saw shredded chicken underneath, like someone was eating a taco and used the comforter as a napkin. what!

for that reason i'm going back to never trusting hotel comforters.  they probably never change them.

i forgot to mention that the walls are thin so you can hear your neighbors' conversations. we kept our  DO NOT DISTURB sign on & twice i woke up to the housekeeper's entrance (attempted entrance as the deadbolt lock was on). they're really noisy in the morning. 

overall, ph was alright. got the room comp for five nights (thanks to ma uncle) so i can't really complain. we ended up staying only for three nights though...cuz i was complaining. lol.

i'll stay here again only if i really have to.

Pros: great location for a less expensive price (comparatively). Fun casino- average age of the clientele is 25-30 at night. Great music all day long on the casino floor.

Cons: the hotel room wasn't as clean as others I've been in. The shower was a little moldy and the furniture was dusty.  The wireless internet is $15 for 24 hours but has very minimal connectivity, and when it was connected it was low-very low.

Overall, I'd probably stay here again because of it's central location and cheap price comparatively... just wish the housekeeping dept was a little more thorough when cleaning the rooms.

This place was chosen as the site of our four day conference. With any luck and all my best intentions, I hope to never see it again. I could go on a rant for days but cover the lowlights:  The registration process was fouled. I had arranged a room upgrade before coming but upon check-in was told it had not been implemented. I was in no mood to discuss it having just humped through half of the Miracle Mile to get from the self park parking lot to the registration desk at which I could not hear the clerk due to the thudding of the obnoxious "music" that was coming discordantly from several different sources. I signed, paid for our five night stay and closed  closed the bill so no incidentals would be added. Four days later the message desk tells us there is a written message for us to call the front desk about our stay. My wife did call and they wanted an additional $196.00 for the upgrade I tried to pay for at check-in.  The upgrade?  A Strip view room "deluxe."  The room was not bad but it was no deluxe and the view consisted of pressing to a small window in the corner and peering out a badly water-spotted window at the lovely roof below and the construction crane beyond it. I believe that since they fumbled the check-in, they should eat the cost of our lavish room in which the closet door would not close with clothes in it and there was only one chair. My last issue is coffee. There is none in the rooms and two understaffed Starbucks down below. Oh! Oh! Oh!  I almost forgot:  They want $14.00 per device per night forWi-Fi!   A fifteen person line takes 30 minutes to ride. This place is way overhyped.

This review is for the PetStay program, which, unfortunately, does not live up to its "pet-friendly" advertising. The vast majority of hotel staff and even other guests were fine with my well-behaved dog walking to and from our room with me. Many were pet-owners themselves, and were very friendly and accommodating. 

However, since the whole program was clearly an afterthought, it is not the most convenient setup. To get to the "pet relief area" at PH, you have to walk through the lobby, up the valet driveway, and then cross several lanes of taxi traffic. Since you're already outdoors for most of the trek, my dog would occasionally want to start doing his thing before we got there. Which is embarrassing enough, but then a valet attendant decided to take it upon himself to tell me that we shouldn't stay at the hotel, and even threateningly ask for my room number, as if he was going to do something. If he HAD tried anything, well, then we would have seen what happened. 

Overall, not worth the hassle. For pet owners, the pet rooms usually list for about $50 more than the regular "resort," don't have much in the way of deals\/comps, and seem to be limited to a particular block (low floor, no view). They may or may not waive the $56\/nt pet fee as well. Leave the pups at home and stay at a nicer hotel for the same price, where you may even get upgrades and such (no choice here).

If you don't have pets, I also can't see why you'd want to stay here, either (or at any Caesars properties, since they all have this policy now). Basically, the worst of both worlds, whether you're traveling with pets or not.

If there were half-zies I'll give this hotel a 3.5.

The room was clean, spacious.  King size bed was caving in a bit, the toilet was making a God-awful sound each time you flushed and the TV was buzzing every now and then too.  They gave us a room that didn't have a view at all, I mean it was overlooking a wall for goodness sake!  If it's not the strip then at least you usually get the other side of Vegas overlooking the city.  We didn't complain or switch the room because we weren't given the option so we manned up and it was all good.

The staff was friendly, room service breakfast was good.

My first time staying here and it was just average. This weekend was apparently a busy weekend with conventions so prices was higher than usual. I had a bachelor party to attend and this was one of the cheaper options on the strip with perfect location of the other hotels we wanted to club at and eat it. I usually stay at Palazzo but it was a big party this time and not everyone wanted to spend some extra money on rooms. That said I did do the sandwich tip and was upgraded into slightly bigger rooms. The rooms werent at all bad but I do prefer elsewhere. The swimming pool was a huge disappointment for me. I love going to the pools to swim and enjoy the jacuzzi but it was just way too small and cheap looking. Best thing about planet hollywood is the location.

This is my go-to "budget" hotel in Vegas.  I adore the casino... so girly.  It's connected to The Miracle Mile shops with tons of shopping and a beer\/wine\/liquor store that is priced fair.  It's in a great location on the strip.  And most importantly, the rooms are nice and clean.  We stayed here the first night of my bachelorette party before everyone arriving and getting a suite at Vdara and had much better service at Planet Hollywood.  Pool was nicer at Planet Hollywood as well!

Horrible Management
I stayed at this hotel for two nights the first day I arrived I had to complain about the room spelling like smoke, and the towels that where dirty. The first night I used one of the bath dry towels turn it over and it had a blood stain on it. I went downstairs to talk to a manager and they gave me a $71 resort fee credit for the inconvenience. They never tried to switch my room or even acted like they were concerned. The next day after being out of the room for hours I came back to relax and the toilet was clogged it took maintenance over three hours to come and fix the plumbing issues. At this point I am over it and ready to go home to add to the ongoing problems I used on of their face cloths to was my face and I woke up with an itchy burning face around 5 AM in the morning my face was broke out in a horrible rash. I immediately got my things together and checked out around 7 AM that morning I tried to talk to another manager to advise what happened but the lady that checked me out had no sense of concern what so ever so I left. When I got home I called the hotel to explain the issues to see what was the proper steps to take to report the rash that I got from the face cloth and they told me to contact security to make a report and then the risk management department will handle the rest.

I filed the report on a Wednesday I was told to give risk management 3-5 days to receive the report and then call them and provide a reference number and they would advise the next steps. I called and left a detailed message for a call back on Tuesday I did not receive a phone call back so I tried calling today I kept getting voicemail so I decided to call the hotel directly to get transferred and once I did that the lady finally answered the phone. Before I could get a word out I was rudely interrupted she than told me our insurance company will be in contact with in a nasty tone, I then asked here excuse me I will need you to explain the process before I knew it we were in a heated argument and then she hung up on me. 

I am now waiting for a manager to call me back so I can get some type of resolution. DO NOT STAY at this hotel the way they treat their customers are shitty they are all about the buck if you try to give them feedback on their hotel you become there enemy!

My fave hotel on the strip!!! The wait for checking in was not bad and Best of all the mall is downstairs..staying at the hollywood hip room and its spacious and comfy.. The bathroom is great. We have a tub and shower.. I love PH!!!

We booked Planet Hollywood's Apex suite for our regional Christmas party. The suite was cool, there was a stripper pole with black lights inside which was also a shower. A foosball table and a pool table. The room was perfect for a party. It had one small standard room attached, but the "party" area was huge. When shopping around this room definitely was not the cheapest. With fees we paid $800 for a Sunday night reservation. We booked here because the agent convinced us this would be the best place to have our party, that they would be so accommodating and we would have the best holiday party ever. So we checked in around 3 just tk bring the food up and get ready, guests came at 8. Right when our guests arrived at 8 PM IN LAS VEGAS we got a noise complaint because we were playing music. We obliged and turned the music down although it hadn't seemed to be at Un unreasonable volume. About a half an hour later we got another knock on the door, it was security again saying that our music needed to be turned off. Now, we are in a suite with surround sound but ok, we took what they said and turned the music completely off. About 40 minutes later they came back saying they were going to evict us from out room because they can hear people talking and the pool table. At this point we asked to speak to the hotel manager because we were more than transparent about the intended use of the room, and this is a group of business professionals not rowdy teenagers. The experience of our apex suite definitely reached its apex when assistant hotel manager Brian came up. You could tell he was completely under qualified and\/or green in his position because his customer service was the worst I have ever seen. He said he he gave us the third warning and that was all like he was going to do. I spoke with him in a completely professional manner, I live and work in this town. I am a customer service general manager on the Las Vegas strip. I told him I value that he values the stay of all of his guests whether they paid $69 for a guest room or $800 for a suite. But that it is 930 pm and we have done everything they have asked. It is unreasonable for them to ask that we not speak or use amenities that are provided to make this room what it is. I even offered as frustrated and as inconvenienced as it would be that our entire party would be willing to move to another room or even another Ceasar's entertainment property. I asked what his occupancy of the hotel was and what he could do to rectify the situation of that we are just as inconvenienced and upset as whomever is complaining I assure you. He kept incessantly rolling his eyes, shaking his head and walking away and back up to the conversation. He told us that his hands were tied on moving us and and doing ANYTHING for us customer service wise because we had booked though a third party. We told him we did not book through a third party we booked through the number from the Planet Hollywood Web site and Planet Hollywood was on the statement of the charge. He said to contact them and walked away. The security guards that were left standing there kept continually apologizing. Saying they hadn't seen anything like this, they are being made to do this and if they were us they would be extremely pissed. They don't think we are being overly loud and everything we have asked has been more than reasonable. So we went back into the room and did what he said, called the number we booked from which rang to Planet Hollywood and Ceasar's entertainment. The man on the phone said that we had indeed booked through Planet Hollywood and he was so sorry he was going to get in touch with the manager to get this resolved. I waited on hold for 20 minutes. He came back on the phone and said he had no idea how to say this and that it'd going to sound rude but that it wasn't coming from him, but that the front desk manager (our friend Brian) refuses to speak to us or about our situation, goodnight. He then kept apologizing saying he had no idea what to do. He would have been more than happy to help us but he can't without front desk approval. We called Ceasar's Palace to see of they could help us and they were so nice and felt awful but they needed it to come from Planet Hollywood's front desk as well so they couldn't do anything. The nice woman on the phone said she would go down to the front desk where we could be seen and make them speak to us there. So we took her advice, went down to the front desk where we met David, the new manager on duty. He told us again that he was not going to help us, that we booked through a third party and Brian's notes say nothing further will be done for us. But that the room is still ours the two people that checked in can stay. I kept telling him that we DID NOT BOOK THROUGH A THIRD PARTY AND I'M SICK OF HEARING THIS. Not to mention that even if we had what does that matter. MY REVIEW IS TOO LARGE PLEASE SEE TRIP ADVISOR FOR THE REST. BASCIALLY WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER

Your always somebody at Planet Hollywood. I once saw that swishy guy from America's got talent here, Leonid, he was getting all kinds of love from the crowd so I went ahead and hollered out "Leonid your the man" and he said "Thank you baby", hilarious. Have done several Superbowl ' s here and it's always a good time. BTW, hit up the Earl of sandwich, can't go wrong

If I could, I would not give PH any stars.  WOSRT EXPERIENCE EVER!!  Shabby is how I would describe everything about this hotel.  First, my mom had USED hand soap in her room and we both had soap scum and grime around our faucets.  My room had no light on the desk, which made an already dark room seem like a cave and no garbage can in the bathroom.  Also, my mom's room WAS NEVER CLEANED!!  Not that it was very clean when we checked in.  On our third day, we were leaving the next day, we finally said something.  The guy working the front desk was very nice.  He told us that complaints about housekeeping were QUITE COMMON!!!!  When we spoke to his manager, we realized that no one cares about complaints and things that need to be improved.  One of the first things he said was 'there is nothing I can do for u.'  Uhh, what.  When did we ask for anything?  We just wanted to let them know what was going on.  Honestly, I feel like our entire conversation with the manager was a waste of time because he obviously does not care.  Also, they do not offer late check-out, not even for a fee, so you have to book an extra night.  Seriously!  For how much I payed, I expected more.  I understand that it is not Bellagio or Venetian, but it is not a Motel 6 either.  The only good things were Earl of Sandwich and the 24hr Starbucks.

Although my stay was ok (for work meeting in Vegas-2 nights), I am noting some things that visitors should be aware of.  I travel a lot, I know everyone now nickel & dime's you-- I really hope that the FCC starts making all these ridiculous resort fees illegal. I paid 22.40\/night extra for a resort fee, which strangely enough, you still have to pay to use the fitness center. I didn't use the pool or the internet. So annoying. If I pay this ridiculous fee, I want a coffee maker in my room, a newspaper, a bottle of gratis bottled water....NADA-gimme something!!!!  The Starbucks line in the lobby, I waited in twice, half an hour each time- they really need to get that situation fixed-it was so frustrating, I just want 1 black coffee. Overall, the bed was good, the tv good, clean enough, quiet enough..I just feel like a bottle of water, or least a bottle you can buy would be a big upgrade for this "Resort Fee", or a simple coffee coffee maker... I won't be staying here a again.

I had the most horrible experience here. In our first room my husband and I came back to our room from the pool & I went in to shower & found pubic hair stuck to the walls & was absolutely disgusted! We called the front desk and were told management of housekeeping would come up. Mind you, it took  6 tries to get through because the phone was cutting in and out. We waited 2 hrs and no one showed up. My husband went down to the front desk and was given a new room after almost 30 min. We were upgraded to a new room. Went out again to the pool the next day. My husband had emptied his pockets of any loose money (dollars & change) as well as one of our room keys before heading out. When we returned housekeeping had came by while we were gone and $40 that was emptied out of his pockets was gone. My husband called front desk and was told nothing could be done. I called front desk after we were done getting ready to go out and was told housekeeping management can look up who cleaned our room and the time. When we returned my husband went down to the front desk and was given the info about when our room was cleaned. He was told nothing else could be done about the money only that he could file a report to check cameras etc. We love out of the country & leave tomorrow so this hotel pretty much leaves our stay of visiting the U.S. with a sour taste. I will never recommend this hotel to any friends, family of even strangers!

I went with my dog and told the lady upfront that I have a dog with me. Later on, they locked us out and the manager wanted to speak to me. They were several complaints about excessive barking. I apologize my dog was probably having anxiety. The manager was nice and accommodated us.

As for for the rooms, this is worse than other strip hotels. They bathroom drains are clogged. The tables having chip on the legs. They need to seriously renovate, there were only few outlets. Usually the hotels we stay at have outlets on their side tables or lamps. The room was too dim as well. The bathtub was dirty. I was actually itching from the bed too, hm i dont know. 

The housekeeper was also rude.

I'll book to Paris instead of planet next time.
The Casino is nice, but thats about it. The rooms are terrible, just dirty and run down. I definitely won't stay here again.

Loaction is great. Right in the middle of the strip. The casino is huge and spacious. I never felt cramped up when playing. The King room we had was huge and clean. They do need to remodel soon though. The shower is starting to show cracks in the tiles and the carpet is starting to show that it is old. But it was clean and I never felt like it was unsanitary if you know what I mean. Our view was awesome, we had a view of Bellagio Fountains, Paris' Tower, and the pool. If you drive into Vegas or have a car rental the parking garage is hella far, so watch out for that. I would definitely stay here again if the price is right. I place this hotel above Excalibur standards but below Bellagio standrds. It is right there with MGM, TI, and those types of hotels in Vegas.

Had I not won a free trip here through Horseshoe Baltimore, there is no way I would have ever stayed at this property.  It's not really my speed.

Even if I was still in the party scene, I would not stay here ever again though since they expect guests to party without coffee.  

There are seriously no coffee makers in the room.  Even janky motels on the outskirts of Atlantic City provide this benefit for its guests so I was shocked when the front desk operator told us we could "order room service coffee if we wanted to."  At $8 a pot of coffee or tea, no thank you.

As far as the rest of the room, it was serviceable.  Because we checked in relatively late, we were given a dual queen room with a handicapped shower.  The beds were comfortable and we had a great view of the Cosmopolitan and the other hotels across the street that we most likely would have liked much better out the window (but are there any bad views in Las Vegas?).  The television was large and it mostly worked (the remote control was pretty slow but that's par for the course at casinos).  So the room was relaxing at least.

Having all of the Miracle Miles stores and restaurants closeby is a perk of staying here as opposed to many other casinos.  But I had an amazingly tough time finding the exit to these places.  I had a hard time finding my out of this casino in general.  In a way that few others have stumped me.  It is maze involving multiple party pits and dancing dealers.  If that's your thing, this casino might be for you.  But I spent all of $8.50 playing multi-hand video blackjack here the whole weekend.

Honestly, I never thought I'd find a Caesars property worse than Bally's in Atlantic City but this one might take that "prize" for sure.

I'd give Planet Hollywood four stars if it were not for the incredibly loud dance music they play in the casino all night, and at the pool during the day.  

Like many other hotels on the Strip, we arrived on a side street and into the lower level of the hotel where the parking is and where the lobby is located.  The rest of the public spaces for Planet Hollywood and the casino is on the second floor, which makes the pedestrian access to Planet Hollywood on the elevated sidewalk \/plaza a floor above Las Vegas Boulevard.

We checked in and got upgraded to a larger room!  Not sure why we were upgraded.  The room was large and adequately appointed.  The room had a large foyer that seemed like a waste of space.  It could easily have been cut in half and added to the bathroom, but the bathroom was already huge.  A counter on each side with a sink in each counter.  Shower and soaking tub.  Great.

Housekeeping was great.  We noticed two light bulbs out in our room.  I told a housekeeper and it got fixed before we returned.  

Everyone at Planet Hollywood was very nice.  Hard rock band in one of the lounges playing for free.  Scantily clad gals dancing on platforms in the middle of the casino - nice touch!  Big sports book action.  

Easy access to the Miracle Mile shopping mall, Axis theater for the Britney Spears show, and the V Theater for some smaller shows.  20 min. walk to Showcase Mall, or to Caesars, and across the street from the Cosmopolitan.  Good location on the Strip that can save a little money on taxis.

Two pools.  Adequate.  Easy check in around 8p on a Friday night.  Free Wi-Fi for guests because you already paid for the $25 daily resort fee.

The best about it: 
-Location:  It's a terrific spot, central to the whole strip and attached to the Miracle Mile Shops...makes is the perfect spot all year round, regardless of weather

-Starbucks: inside the hotel...if you're a coffee junkie, it's right there for you!

-Food: Not the place for world renowned cuisine, but they do offer some great "chain" style choices like PF Changs, Earl of Sandwhich and various others attached to the MIracle Mile.  

-Bathrooms: Double Sinks, sunken tub very cool.  

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The drawbacks:

-Nothing major, the suites are average but clean and well appointed.  For the money, it's not a bad choice

-The Casino is really not for us...it's small, dark and plays the same 5 hip hop songs over and over and over and over again all night.  I like to play the tables late at night and it's just too dark and makes you feel like it's a cloudy day.  

-The Pool...again, nothing bad here, just not as big or as "wow factor" as others I've seen.  

Overall, I would try another hotel in the same price range before I returned.  I cannot say it was a bad stay, so give it a try if this is the price range you're looking for.

Happy Vegas Days and Nights!

Literally writing this review as I'm in the hotel bed. 
The pool is closed right now undergoing a make over that's fine but it's Spring break..
Talk to your bell men about making sarcastic remarks it was very rude and left a bad taste in out mouth. It was our first day here. 
My bed has a sunken in side where it looks like Sally from American Horror story sewed someone into the mattress. not even joking. I even pulled the sheets back to check. 
Other than that everything is clean. 
The bathroom is awesome I love how big it is and has a nice large tub and separate shower. 
We do have a very gorgeous view of the strip and of the Paris hotel. 
But seriously get a new mattress.

Today,  PH confirmed that they are committed to the worst customer experience ever.  30 min wait for elevator, gratuity charged from buffet without authorization, and yet another maid coming into my room unannounced. 

Robert, a manager, credited me $100 F&B as a make-good for a maid barging into my room with practically unannounced. That was greatly appreciated... until the maid did the SAME THING the NEXT DAY with EVEN LESS KNOCKING! Do you have no decency, PH?

Also, I'm writing this review because it looks like they deleted my original review from Facebook.... can't tell if my original Yelp review is still there or not.

Planet Hollywood - you're a bunch of criminals, and your housekeepers have no boundaries. Never, ever giving you a dime ever again.
One of the worst hotels i have ever stayed at. Rooms are dated, the entire hotel  has a very old look. Staff is rude. Overpriced compared to other decent hotels in the area.

My two girlfriends and I stayed at ph for a quick weekend getaway. 

The ph website only shows some of the nicer rooms...but I can only comment on the room we did stay in. The room we stayed in, 3712, was Battlestar Galactica themed. hmmm...it was small and sparse. I don't know how much the room was for two nights but I hope it wasn't too much...my friend was the one who paid for it.


Also, when you valet your car, and you are not a Diamond or Platinum club member,(we were only Gold Clubbers) forget about having the best entrance, instead...expect to drag your heavy ass suitcase throughout the whole Miracle Mile Shops to get to your room. 



Don't know if I'd stay here again...But would definitely would stop by Earl of Sandwich!

If they give you a room close to an elevator, I would strongly advise to change rooms. The room we had was right next to an elevator and we could hear EVERY elevator all night long. Didn't get much sleep due to that. I called the front desk and all they could do is waive the resort fee (which we weren't using the Internet anyway), give us a later check out to try to get some sleep, or move rooms for the two hours left in our stay (we stayed here for only one night).
