The room was very small. You could tell it wasn't maintained very well (chips in the wood, carpet faded, etc.) The bathroom was probably the best part about the room. I've stayed at a lot of hotels on the Las Vegas strip, and this o e definitely fell short.

Just returned from a 4 day stay at Planet Hollywood. I was surprised at how rundown the hotel appears now.  My first stay at PH was in May 2011.  My husband and I were both excited to stay on the Strip for our first Vegas trip together, as PH is well located for sight-seeing and casino hopping.  At the time, we were pleased with our room and the overall hotel, though the pool area left a lot to be desired.
    Fast forward to 2014:  Upon arrival, we found the check-in process to be quick and pleasant.  The lobby and casino still appear to be sparkly and well-maintained.  Upon entering the elevators we were confronted with the first signs of wear and tear - dented and scuffed elevator doors and dirty floors.  When we disembarked on our floor, we noticed the carpets were stained and bubbling up in sections of the hallway.  The wallpaper was marked and there were actual dents in the walls.  We held our breath when opening the door to our upgraded room, a Junior Suite.
     Surprisingly the room afforded a great deal of space, as the bathroom seemed to be the size of a standard room, with a giant soaking tub, separate shower and toilet closet.  The décor is not dated but feels worn.  That, coupled with the obvious smell of stale smoke (in a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor) and a mystery stain on the armchair in the room, did little to inspire great confidence in the cleanliness of the facilities.  The bed was comfortable but the pillows were awful, too flat or lumpy and much too firm. The most disappointing aspect of the room though, was the lack of a mini-fridge or minibar.  As we were traveling with a group of friends and knew we would be spending some time in the room, we thought we would keep a few cold beverages on-hand to while away the time.  Alas it was not meant to be, as they obviously want you out of the room and on the casino floor. 
      The pool is as bad as I remember from 2011.  The deck is a giant, white, concrete space, with chairs arranged around an outside bar.  You can't actually see either pool from the deck, you have to walk up a flight of stairs and try to wrangle space around the pool itself.  Of course, you could pay extra for a daybed or cabana next to the pool.  These "extras", however, are no cleaner than the regular chaise lounges.  The daybeds all have stains on them and the cabanas are just slightly less dirty.
      Overall, the state of the hotel beyond the public areas, is disappointing.  For the price, inflated at checkout by the accompanying Resort Fee and other add-ons, I expected more.  I rated it 3 stars due to its location, the good restaurants within the casino itself and their customer service.

Second time my husband and I have stayed at the Planet Hollywood Hotel.  We came here this time for a friend's wedding held at the chapel downstairs.  It was held in the PH chapel, and the photographer was so awesome for them.  We truly enjoyed it.  The hotel itself is very hip and great for a younger couple like us.  I love the mile of shops to walk around in and people watch.  And of course, the Britney slots !  . Thanks for another great trip, even if we left with less money in our pockets, we still had a good time and made great memories.

We've stayed in the Planet Hollywood several times over the years the rooms are starting to deteriorate because they're not doing maintenance in them due to the renovation from the top down floors why fix something your going to replace in a few months

So many problems at this hotel. We had a view of the strip but their curtain covered the view and they said it was part of the design and couldn't be fixed. The casino was so smoky we couldn't gamble there and the next morning my wife and I had bloody noses from the smoke the night before. They were doing construction that woke us at 7am, so we had to move rooms.  The hallway our room was on was constantly dirty. There were old dishes sitting outside of rooms for 24 hours, there was trash on the hallway floor, coat hangers on the floor, a broken glass we heard break in the hallway was there for 14 hours, etc.  Every time we talked to someone about the problems we were having, they were very rude.  The breakfast buffet was very expensive and the worst buffet I've ever had. Other than the great location of the hotel, this NOT a place we'd ever stay at again.

Ok if you've stayed her before and liked your experience, wait another 5 more years until you decide to stay here again. Rooms and customer service have downgraded 95%. We had the resort room. They don't provide covers, just the white sheets. Hallways are rundown. Shower doors are broken. Our sink didn't have the hot water working. Drawers are beat up. Our security box didn't lock. Bathroom door didn't shut close. Writing it all down makes me realize how ridiculous this place is. Oh and if you want to complain about your situation, get ready to be handed to staff with attitude and make you feel stupid for complaining. Paid $780+ for 3 nights. Better off anywhere but here.

Checked in yesterday. So far so good except for that clown at the front desk. I think his first name was Jose young male with a military cut. I don't mind when you can't check in early but when some jerk at the front desk makes it my problem it is beyond disappointing. And no tag line like "hi welcome to planet Hollywood". Instead we got a disgruntled young punk who needs an attitude adjustment.  If you are reading this PH I suggest you start hiring engaged employees especially with unemployment still high.  As prominent employers have always said, you need to hire stars to represent the company's image. If you don't want a cameo appearance on the strip I suggest making every attempt to deliver that "wow" experience.
My famlly went to the resort every thing was great but I would not recommend to go there on weekdays because it is usually full and when my family went there there was barf in the pool

Totally totally inconsiderate, rude and unhelpful reservation staff and manager. There are about a million steps that they could have taken to prevent me from writing this review but none were even attempted. The first issue was when Planet Hollywood claimed that Expedia had canceled our reservation (Expedia said they had not). The front desk staff then dismissed us and told us to basically "deal with it" ourselves. When we insisted that this was a mistake they made no attempt to contact Expedia themselves and see what the problem was (although I asked them to please help us by doing so), instead we were forced to take over an hour out of our workday to do a ridiculous back and forth "he said she said" between Expedia (who said the reservation had never been canceled) and the reservation desk until absolutely nothing was resolved.

Instead of taking any responsibility for it they said it was our fault for thinking that Expedia would get it right. We must be complete idiots thinking that Expedia, one of the largest booking sites out there, wouldn't cancel our reservation for no reason (which they still claim they had never even done). I understand that glitches happen, but when they do anyone with decent service skills would at least attempt to work this out with the agency instead of punishing their guests. Worst case, if this was absolutely something they could not get resolved with the Expedia they should have at least treated their guests with enough respect to attempt to apologize, attempt to work it out with the agency themselves, upgraded our room in an attempt to say sorry for all the hassle they caused us, or even just having SAID I'M SORRY FOR ALL THIS HASSLE. Nothing was done. They were very rude to us and I highly encourage anyone else who has similar experiences with this awful service to speak up and continue to take their ratings down to what they deserve until they learn to treat their guests with decency. It's fine to put on a happy face and be nice when there's no issue with your booking, but the real quality of service comes out when there is the slightest glitch. 

This was the initial woman at the front desk and her manager who were rude and completely unhelpful. After explaining the whole situation to the woman at the front desk, we spoke to the manager who additionally treated us with disbelief and disrespect and acted like the whole ordeal was our fault. We were checking in waiting awkwardly for over an hour trying to sort this ordeal out. I've seen reviews on here of people who were upgraded after checkin took them a whopping 25 minutes. No one attempted to do anything to try to compensate us or even say sorry. 

I see people writing bad reviews on here because they had to pay a resort fee or wouldn't get free toothpaste. We know how hotels work. We were totally willing to pay what was fair and not expect anything other then basic respect and decency and the reservation staff completely failed. In the end we only booked 1\/5 nights, not wanting to give these awful people our money. Now we have to spend even more time out of our day tomorrow moving hotels. 

We are in Vegas a good percentage of the year for trade shows and spend thousands and thousands of dollars on hotels and these people will not receive any more of our money or any of our friends or associates if we can help it.

Had a really great time gambling\/walking around Planet Hollywood. I didn't stay at the hotel, but I probably spent a good 2 hours or so playing games and drinking. I really love the crowd here. Generally young\/middle-aged, laid-back but not sloppy and the smoking wasn't overwhelming or prevalent. 

The dealers\/ladies were all amazing here - we had an absolute blast playing "The Britney Wheel" game - where bets payout based on 1, 2, 5, 10, 20 or 40 increments on the wheel. Super easy to understand and super fun.

The cocktail waitresses were very available, but our drinks were not strong at all - and they were small. And although, they were available, they were not very friendly - and honestly, a bit older. They looked tired and annoyed by everyone and everything. One was rude\/rolled her eye at me when I'd hailed her "not in her section." Sorry, lady.

I'd definitely visit Planet Hollywood again to gamble - perhaps give the hotel a try, and ask for double-pours next time, or buy a large drink.

I have stayed here a few times. Each time was fantastic! The staff is nice. The rooms are updated, clean and modern. Casino has lots of slots and games to choose from. The buffet is best on the strip!!!

Reviewing just the hotel rooms.  

What they have going for them is the Miracle Mile, Earl of Sandwich, BurGR, and location.

I've been spoiled by the likes of Vdara and Cosmo, and am staying here because I got a great package deal on Southwest. Knowing how cheap I got it, I was fine with the idea that PH is not going to be as nice. However, I wasn't prepared at how filthy it would be!

Resort Room #1: I was disappointed at how yellow, dark and dingy the room is. The lights are very dim. Hand prints all over the windows. Remote didn't work. The "Hollywood" relics looked like it was just randomly placed in the room. I asked to be moved to a different room.

Resort Room #2: It didn't get any better.
- Unidentifiable and suspicious stains on the window. It was evident that the efforts made to clean the windows were half-assed (like wiping it once and leaving half of a handprint still visible with streaks).
- As I was taking a bath, I noticed something green floating around me. Looks like an old sponge from the previous guest. Ew.
- Black, mold-like substance around the bathtub drain.
- scuff marks and chipped paint on the dressers and bathroom sinks. 

Please train your housekeepers to be more thorough with their cleaning. I would have been way happier to have a late check-in into a clean room.

Also, the parking lot is the same as the Miracle Mile Shops which is a big trek to get to your rooms.

Conclusion: 
Dirty rooms. Would not touch with a 10ft pole. "Hollywood theme" is an exaggeration.  It's a shame because they have prime location, a mall, and great restaurants.

I've never stayed at Planet Hollywood, although I would, their rooms seem very nice! 

Plant Hollywood has gone through some changes since I have lived here, mostly on the facade. From being the front of the extinct Aladdin, to Plant Hollywood to the addition of the Harmon corner. It's modern looking and to some an amazing sight. To me it's ok, it's nice and all but I'm just not overly impressed. 

I do like the finished off look they've given the Harmon corner, adding Twin Peaks and a Bubba's. Anything Vegas can do to make it not seem grimy and trashy. They don't have any 'can't miss' restaurants, Koi is ok. I ate there several years ago and I would go back but that's about it. I've seen Peepshow with Holly and recently Meatloaf in the smaller theatre upstairs, it's good and really not a bad seat in the house. I've also seen Journey in the other larger theatre and we sat high up but the seats weren't awful so for those things. It's cool!

This would have been a 4 star review were it not for the fact that you feel like you're walking thru the Cabo or Cancun airports the second you try to walk inside. There are at least 3 or 4 nested people at each door who try to stop you and say "are you staying here? Do you want to see the shows? Want tickets? Are you stupid?" Maybe not that last one, but that's how they make you feel. Really? Are the shows doing that bad that they have to keep asking? I had someone chase me down as I walked to the bathroom trying to sell me tickets. ugh!

We got there around noon, which was several hours before check-in, but they still let us check in withoout any trouble. Our room was good. We finally got the king size we always ask for. AC worked, bathroom was nice and big. Our room theme was Sister Act 2, which was kinda weird. Made it hard to do certain things under the watchful gaze of nuns :)

I had my bachelorette party in Vegas and stayed at this hotel for one night. My girls were awesome because they actually came the night before (originally I planned on coming the night before) but it was my sons 8th grade graduation so I missed the one night of fun in vegas.... I couldn't miss my sons graduation. I made it on time in Vegas starting my Saturday morning. Anywhoo, hotel is gorgeous and clean. Love the look and atmosphere.  Very fun!
While the casino is 4 stars, the rooms are a mere 2 stars for an average of 3 stars.  Nicely located on the strip.

I came here right after it opened (since they had a deal); we asked for the renovated area.  Wasn't like a brand new place, but the overhaul was acceptable.  The Alladin was old.  Everything was fine, and in all honesty, I don't spend much time in the hotel room anyways -- just a little bit of the early morning to recover...
I think the most important thing is to have a good location.
The attached shops are just like any other typical mall.
Anyways, the buffet was average (compared to the Wynn).

Stayed here once with my husband, it's very modern but just didn't fit our taste. We prefer luxury and not so much of a noisy place. You can hear everything in the hall way. Valet took forever to get our car every single time we would go out. Didn't really like it that much.

In short ...

What I like:
- Nicely appointed, modern-feel to the casino.  Nice to see them ditch the old Aladdin theme.
- Really high-energy feel to the place, despite the dim lighting.
- Young vibe.  Nice up to date slot machines.
- Nice shopping area.  Glad to see they kept the old Aladdin shopping area featuring pretty reasonably priced goods.
- Lower end but fun food options like Pink's Hot Dogs and Cabo Wabo.
- Good location on the strip, right near the Paris, Bellagio and Cosmopolitan.

What I don't like:
- Basic rooms feel kind of small for some reason.
- Party vibe to the place also means it can get really noisy depending on who's staying near you.
- Not a huge fan of the shows featured here, and Brittany Spears?
- Traffic is shit around here
- Buffet is meh

This is a clean casino, but not too upper end.  It is a nice place to play some table games, as their table limits are usually $5 or $10.  I gambled here for many many hours during my trip to Vegas last year, however, this year I didn't gamble there at all.  Each time I walked through the tables that I wanted to play were full.  Sadly, they had other tables that were not running.  So, I got running to another casino.

Still one of my favorite casinos to hit on the strip.  When I have friends or family in town, I usually take them here. 

Why?
1.  Good table games. When I say good, I mean lower limits even on the weekends.  Every table also has some dancers keeping you entertained while you lose your money. 

2.  Poker Room:  Tough to call it a poker room since it's not really blocked off.  It's more like a bunch of poker tables in the middle of the casino.  Regardless, some fun and good games here, especially on the weekends. 

3.  Miracle Mile = Shopping Experience and Restaurants Galore

4.  Bars, especially the Heart Bar, always has a great mix of people and a decent range of music.

5.  Goretorium (New)

6.  Rooms:  I've only seen the rooms, haven't slept over-night in them. But still good enough. Nothing too impressive though. 

My only issue is parking, but it's no different than any other strip hotel and casino.  You can always valet, but they usually require that you are staying at the hotel if it's busy.  Not usually an issue because they've valet for me most of the time, even if I'm not a hotel guest.

Planet Hollywood perfectly suited my Vegas needs.  The room was clean, the bathroom was great (including a GIANT soaking tub that reallllly hit the spot), and the staff couldn't have been more friendly.  In addition, the rate we paid on the room could not have been beat for a better room or location.  

I'm already planning my next Vegas trip and will be staying at PH!

Mad props for the renovations team for Planet Hollywood. I got a superb deal for ph for a week long business trip and it's one of my favorite LV hotels now. It sits towards the center of the Strip, right across from City Center. Immediately when you walk in, the lobby welcomes you with a cool and lounge-like ambiance. The rooms were very spacious and had very nice furniture and a 42" Flat screen. The beds were pillow top Sealys which were very comfy. The sheets had a high thread count since I kept running my hands over them. 

Now the casino. The new PleasurePit is the main casino floor and all of the girls wear fishnet stockings, boy shorts, and a corset. Not only the garments are hot but the girls are not bad at all.

PH also houses the PEEP Show and the new club Gallery. I didn't have a chance to visit either but I'm sure I'll visit PH very soon. Definitely recommended!

Very fun casino, especially for a younger crowd.  Always seems busy and there is a huge nice mall attached for shopping.  The casino has plenty of beautiful dancers and dealers to keep you interested.  The music is great and there is a good vibe here.
The casino has nice tall ceilings and there wasn't a ton of smoke. We gambled here a bit before seeing the show.

I came here last month for my 21st birthday - yes, typical! & yes I was a Vegas Virgin as well.  I arrived at the hotel around 10am and there was a $28 fee for early check-in.  That was fine with me because I just wanted to get situated in the room.  

The agent who checked us in was extremely cold!  I want to say her name was Charmaine or something like that, but I'm not sure if I'm making that up?  Anyways, I work in the service industry so I have an idea how things work at hotels.  When asking her certain questions, she would ignore me.  I found myself asking multiple times before she would finally look up from the computer and spew out half-assed answers.  I thought once again, fine.  She probably hates her job.

Onto the room!  I actaully liked it; I found it quaint.  The beds were comfortable and I loved the bathroom.  We had the Brandon Lee room which I found amusing because my boyfriend always makes me watch Bruce and Brandon Lee movies.  That's all the positive I can say about the room.  Everything else you have to pay for, like a fridge?  But I guess that's typical of Vegas?

On the plus side, I really enjoyed the casino!  I was winning money on those penny slots!  They also had a good variety of games.  The mall was pretty cool too and the hotel was conviently located on the strip.  This little tidbit is the only reason this place is getting 3 stars, and that's being generous.

All in all, the rooms are nice, but that's not enough to make me a loyal guest.  This place nickle and dimes you and gives shitty service!  No thanks!  I will probably come back soley for the casino.

One of the worst hotel at Vegas. The line at check in was horrendous. They really should have more people working at the reception when the line is outrageously long. We waited for over 40 mins just for checking in. 

The room was just OK. But I find the scene they had going on in the room a bit creepy. My parents had the room decorated with pictures from Interview with the Vampire, while we stayed at room 911 with Robin Williams pictures all over. The tub was nice tho. 

They also don't have their own parking garage and share one with the mall and other casinos. So the walk from parking to their hotel took a while and it was confusing. 

Like other reviews stated, the hotel was nicely located. Other than that, I don't think I would stay here again.

We stayed at the PH because I got a great deal on Expedia. The downside: It's REALLY hard to find your way from the parking garage to check in. You have to walk through a shopping mall. Don't bother! The valet is FREE so drive up to the hotel entrance and let them park it for you. We unfortunately didn't so I had to drag my poor, sick mom about 2 miles through a shopping center before we got to the check in. The check in line was very long... 

BUT Once we got up there, the service was outstanding, they upgraded our rooms and we got a free bottle of alcohol for each suite. The suites are absolutely gorgeous! We got strip views and extravagant bathrooms with giant bath tubs. The one in my parents' room was so huge you could fit 5 people in there easily. 
The decor is classy and fun - different movie memorabilia in each room. The bed was like a cloud!!! I wish we could have brought it home. This was my parents' first time to Vegas, and my mom's last vacation before she passed away. I'm glad we stayed here because it was a great experience and we felt like we were in the lap of luxury even though we were on a tight budget. Great deal!

If I could give this place negative stars I would. They are a waste of money. You pay the price of a luxury hotel for a cheap motel 8 experience. This weekend was the worst. The elevators were missing buttons and the rooms were filthly.  We reserved 2 rooms a month in advanced and still when we got there they couldn't accommodate us accordingly. We had to take 2 rooms on separate floors. Overlooking this, planet Hollywood continues to be the worst. Trying to enjoy our time at the pool a racist lady starts an altercation with my brother. Immediately security attacks us as we're walking out.  The security officer who was unprofessional , aggresive, and unreasonable  threatened to hit my sister and take her to jail as we were walking out. The manager had to have the female security taken away from us and escorted by their own security. No attempt to make things right was made by anyone. By far the worst experience ver.  Don't waste your money here.

We stayed in a resort room for 1 night which was very nice.

The good: - rooms good, food great, modern

The not good: - Service is poor. Get prepared for a long checkin queue 20 yards long.  Worst of all was valet parking. Don't use it. It sounds attractive - it's no charge (you can park your own car or use valet). So we used it.  Then after checkout at 11am, we asked for our car. They said 20mins. They took closer to 30mins, and that was after we had escalated and jumped the queue. They said it was busy that day. They were making it up - they were understaffed, and their attitude was they didn't care. We missed our flight because of this unexpected wasted 1\/2 hour. Don't use it. 
This left a sour taste in our recollections of this place.  Of course, while we were waiting for our car, we were looking at that long checkin queue for the next people.....      This place is not service orientated.

For a four star resort your basically treated like you're staying at a 1 star motel. After traveling 4 hours to get here, we expect to rest in a nice smoke free room. But of course that is not our case. Right when we walk into our room, the smell of weed was the first thing that welcomed us. I called down to the front desk to complain about the room. The first thing that they offered was to have housekeeping come deodorize our room. Which to me was unacceptable especially when the smell will still linger on the sheets that I will be laying on. They were not able to change our rooms due to the fact that there were no other rooms available. I then ask to speak to a manager, which was not available to assist with my complaint due to being the ONLY manager on duty and the person I spoke with was not apologetic in regards to my issue. Since I could not take being in the room anymore and patiently waiting for the manager to call me, I went down to the front desk. And again, no help. They did offer to waive my resort fee and change my room for the next night stay witch I refuse. Mind you, we traveled here for a Jiu Jitsi competition that my husband will be competing in and he needs a room that he can relax and prepare before the competition. We don't need anything waived, we just want a smoke free room!!!! The gal at the front desk seems annoyed with me and again the manager was unavailable to asisst. If you want to pay over $200 a night and treated horribly, this is the place for you.

Just stayed here for my first time last weekend, and it was surprisingly awesome. The room was a lot better than I expected it to be. I'd have to say I wasn't in the westgate towers but, the hallways off the elevator make it look kind of trashy, but once you get into the rooms, it's all good. It's very conveniently located near the miracle mile shops so you can pick up some decently priced grub...ESPECIALLY EARL OF SANDWICH, 6$ sandwiches open 24\/7...that's money right there...The casino is nice, it has the pleasure pit, which everyone loves, and it's conveniently located in the middle of the strip across from City Center, and Paris is right next door. The stay I had was pretty excellent.

We stayed here for the night. It has a Austin Powers Theme (purple, red and psychedelic).  The tub was too small.  

Since we got this hotel for 50% off, I can't complain.  

Checking in was a pain b\/c we came in through the mall!

I love planet hollywood becuase this is Britney's home for now haha...

June 2011 - They've definitely upgraded and did a lot of remodeling from when i first came out to vegas at 15. I still have the photo with the big earth globe in front. 

Anyways my first time here was for my cousin's bachelorette. We stayed in a suite with 2 rooms, kitchen, living room, jacuzzi annnnd stripper! So much fun! perfect space for 10 females. I enjoyed the jazucci - their pool (outside) was nice a spacious enough to find a perfect spot to tan. 

We were in the tower that didnt have the slots :( so we had to walk to the other tower... which is perfect it gave us a reason to walk around and get that exercise. 

They have friendly staff, its very clean and refreshing to stay or just even come walk around planet hollywood.

January 2014 - Came back for my girl friend's flirty thirty! woot woot! we didnt stay here but we came to watch BRITNEY B!TCH! the amphitheatre \/ venue was huge - all the seatings were perfect! Britney's show was amazing. i'm a fan!

March 2015 - Walked around the shops, reminds me a lot like Ceasars Palace or is it the Venetian?? idk.. We came here to eat at CABO WABO! Yummmmm!

Awesome rooms, restaurants, shopping. 
In the middle of the Las Vegas strip, walking distance to all the hotels. Great casino

Staff is great from valet up to room. Room service was slow and more than 45 min  room mediocre. Old room pillows and bed not soft. The bathroom fan is broken   No music paid for tv music but selection is limited no iPhone plug in. It is just outdated.  They need to update room. Oh and no coffee maker ugh

One of the more hip hotel made to attract the younger crowd.  Surrounded by the miracle mile with plenty of shops to walk around and see and places to eat or drink.  Casino is right in the middle of it all.  Hotel rooms are themed, I stayed in the Beetle juice room.  It had a painting and arm from beetle juice.  

Gambling wise, games are all pretty much the same, minimum is a little higher since it's right in the middle of the strip.  They have a pleasure pit as well.  Slots not many selections to choose from.

Didn't stay here, but did a lot of drinking and gambling here. Drink prices are a little on the high side, but you're paying for a great view (the servers) and to drink in a place that is actually happening.

I stayed in May 2017. I booked an Ultra Hip Room, 1 king bed, non smoking. Little did I know upon check in, the amazing front desk had upgraded me to the Ultra Panoramic Suite. I regret not getting her name but I was in for a shock when I saw my room number for what i payed. (About $350 total) It was the best experience I've ever had. I'm forever loyal to Planet Hollywood and I have recommended friends and family to stay here.. even though they might not be as lucky as me. Jetted tub was amazing and it was nice to spend the night looking into the lights of the strip. Love the miracle mile shops and Fat Tuesday of course!

One of the nicer properties on the strip. I stayed here when it was an SPG property and before they got bought out by the Harrah's Group(Now called Caesar's Entertainment).

Each room has a piece of movie memorabilia. My room had the wrench from the movie "Hoffa" which I haven't heard about nor seen before but I hear other rooms have cool stuff like Back to the Future props.

I booked the most basic room but due to elite status was upgraded to a premium room with a fantastic view of the pool and the Bellagio fountains. The bathroom had a separate door for the toilet which was convenient in that when someone had to go, other people would use the sinks and whatnot. There were two sinks so we obviously filled one with ice to keep our alcohol chilled.

At night there's an area of the gaming tables where dancers get up and dance called "the love pit". The hotel and gaming areas really convey "sexy" in every way.

My wife and I got married here at Planet Hollywood...I myself had never been inside the casino before that time, heck its Vegas...there are so many casinos so little time.

I was actually pretty damn impressed with the casino itself.  In fact my wife loved it so much she wants to stay here from now on when we come to Vegas.   

I can not speak for the rooms but the casino itself it well laid out.  They have free parking in the back.  The only issue is that to get to the casino you HAVE TO walk through all the Miracle Mile Shops in the back.  The only way around them would be to be dropped off on the side or the front of the casino.  Its a pretty long walk from the parking garage through those shops, but they are really nice shops so you can always do some window shopping.

With Vegas Strip casinos its all about location.  This used to be the Aladdin Casino back in the day (its where Elvis got married).  Its right across from the Bellagio and right next door to Paris and the Flamingo.  

I look forward to staying here next time we visit Vegas.  

:0)

I stayed here from august 8-12 for my 2 yr anniversary w\/my boyfriend and mostly the 2 reasons why i chose this place was: 1) no resort fees, save me a extra 80\/100bucks & 2) in the middle of strip\/location was key for me.

Parking was packed once i finally got to vegas around late 12ish, i had to park on the 4th floor. I'm not the one to complain about how far I parked but better lighting couldve helped. I think P.H. needs to work on how their hotel guests could find a easier and CLOSER way to the lobby. Seriously my bf and i had to walk all around the miracle mile shops with our luggagge and people staring at us. Idgaf about the staring  but thats kinda bad on the hotel b\/c guests who pay good $$ to stay here have to drag their belongings to the lobby area. Probably a good 20 mins we got to the lobby, line was super long...i got to the front desk...first the employee said she couldnt "find" a room with 1 king size bed, theyre not ready , etc...she had offered a 2 twin bedroom next to the elevator and asked "if that was okay?"

-___________- IS IT OKAY? heck no, i had asked her politely that when i booked the room in may that I had wrote on the guest's preferrance\/special accomdations box that i would like 1 king size room, non smoking, & on a floor higher than the 10th floor (bc i wanted a view and not stick to the smoking designated floors below.) she said okay then it was totally dead silent for 15mins looking at her computer then she finally looked up from the screen & told me she was looking for another room....and 5mins passed..she magically found a room on 22nd floor w\/ 1 king sized bed. i took that, room keys were set and apologized also for everything..which i def am glad she did apologize..just a lil dissapointed as well b\/c i had mentioned that when i called a day earlier and asked if i could pay in cash for the room..some employee said yes you can..but when i got there i couldnt and it had to be on a credit card...which i didnt mind either way but cmon they need to educate their front desk on communicating with each other.

my bf and i got to our room, it was nice spacious room..bathroom was surprisingly huge, comfty bed, and a great view! we got a view of the bellagio watershow, our pool, cosmopolitan...it was a nice thing to see for paying for a hollywood hip room.  my only concerns about the room was that the ice bucket was real small, the sheer window blinds were halfway broken, the water pressure for the showerhead def needs a lot more improvement (other reviews have said the same as well) - i felt like you had to stand there for 10mins to even just get your hair half way wet, weird noises in the ac vents (scared me stimes in the middle of night-also another thing another reviewer had mentioned) and also they need to work on their tv's in the rooms - the remote was not functioning fast enough like you had to press it a couple of times to get to one channel and the power button the actual tv just did not want to turn the first few times...also i usually carry a couple $100 bills with me when i go to vegas and i usually leave some in the safe at any hotel i stay in vegas..and their's was broken! so i had to hide my money some place else...but cmon now...p.h. get it together! 

overall though, the room was actually clean, i had a good nights sleep every nite i was there, great view from where i was at, location was perfect b\/c it was in the middle of the strip\/plus the shops were downstairs. i probably wouldnt stay here again unless i had to...i would prob stay at monte carlo or treasure island again just b\/c i did enjoy their accomdations better plus they offer special deals and coupons. P.H. didnt have anything going on! they didnt have at least a free drink or 10 bucks off of your buffet even if you were a guest! every hotel ive stayed at here in vegas has always given me coupons for being their guest and p.h. = nothing.

Besides bad food at Planet Dailies, I enjoyed my stay at PH last time. That was why I suggested my family to stay there this time. However, it was a disappointment. Was it because of spring break and the crowd? The bath tub in our room was not clean. My sister saw floating grey particles before she entered the tub. Yeah, that was gross. I asked house keeping to clean the tub but apparently the person who answered the phone did not understand the word "tub". I repeated 5 time "Please send someone to clean the bath tub" and all I got was "what?" REALLY?
Awesome casino.  We there with some cousins to play roulette and they had gogo dancers there dancing next to us while were were gambling.  Nice ambiance and great place overall.

While I never take vacations, this was a real treat!  I really loved the interior of the casino, and the overall look of hotel rooms.  It was really great!  Location can't be beat, as it's located right in the middle of all the action.  Nothing is too far to walk to!  The Spice Market buffet that is located in this hotel was really great too!

Over all, the beds were comfy, and every room had a plasma screen TV.  What's not to love about those two amenities!?
.

Rude rude rude. Even the front desk people were rude.

Every employee we encountered at this place ( including the shops ) were rude. 

We stayed there for three nights and had to change our room twice due to "water pipe explosions"

First night we had to move from floor 12 to 21.. the second night was from 21 to 15. 

They offered to bring water to our room but it turned out to be two bottles of drinking water.. but no thanks. 

This place use to be the old Aladdin's hotel and it seems like they didn't fix much.

I've stayed here the past several times I've been to Vegas. 

It's in a great location.
The rooms are way cheaper than nearby properties (Cosmo\/Aria\/etc.).
The blackjack tables are always available.
The dealers, depending on where you sit, can be really nice to talk to or really nice to look at. Some are even both.
It's a really fast trip back and forth from the airport because drivers can totally skip the strip if they want to.
It's part of Total Rewards which as far as I can tell is the best rewards program.

The only thing I really don't like is the resort fee and having to pay for internet if you don't have a high status with Total Rewards (me).

The price for this hotel was not bad for being smack in the middle of the strip. We stayed here with 25% off cyber deal so maybe that's why. But Planet Hollywood is cheaper than most hotels across the street in the same location, so I'd stay here again when I come back. Plus, I wanna use my Total Rewards card so I can get freebies for gambling! 

We stayed in room 1135 this past weekend, the couple next door was having super loud sex. If you're the couple and come across this review, we were the couple next door competing with you! *high five* We got upgraded to a larger king room upon checking in so that was nice. We had partial view of the strip; the bed linens and bathroom was clean. My only complaint is that there aren't any electrical outlets near the night stands on either side of the bed for me to charge my phone at night! Hate that. The framed white tuxedo worn by Burt Reynolds near the bed where I can see at night kind of creeped me out. Otherwise, perfect temperature setting, clean and modern room, large soaking tub and shower. The shower was a bit old but it didn't bother me. There was a his and hers sink too. No need to fight for mirror and counter space when getting ready. 

The casino is awesome! How so? I made bank! LOL! They'll probably get me next time. They play good music, top 40, sexy ass go-go dancers with nice bubble butts dancing on tabletops everywhere, dealers were friendly and engaging, and cocktail waitresses were attentive and nice. I really couldn't complain! Had a great time!

Stayed here last night and got a room with a view of the Strip. The view was nice, but the window was very small and only one or two people at a time can see out of it. The room itself was decent, but nothing special, although the bed was pretty comfortable. Found a few small stains on the blanket, which is never good.. bathroom would be nice if it was the 90s but could definitely use a lot of improvement. For $210+, you can definitely do better at other hotels on the Strip.

This is probably our 4th time staying here, I'm actually still in my room writing this. I'm a bit disappointed this time and I'm not sure if I'll ever come back. The room was clean but you can tell that the quality had gone down a little; towels look old and thin, the handle for the tub faucet is broken, no trash can in the toilet, and no fridge in our room this time. Their buffet ran out of prime rib last night and the line was still pretty long waiting to get in. I was pretty upset about that because we paid higher rate due to holiday weekend. How can they not have prime rib!!! When my husband ask if there's more coming, he got a fat NO! from the lady who looked very bored cutting meat. 

I have to say though, valet and check in staff are still awesome, very friendly and helpful.

Let me start by saying that the hotel itself is pretty cool and its awesome that it is in a mall so there are tons of stores nearby for convenience! The rooms are okay, nothing super fancy, but there is no fridge, which sucked in vegas!! But what really made the stay at this hotel horrible was the manager...and a few of the staff members. The manager could give a shit less about her PAYING customers and treated me absolutely horribly. Her staff weren't much better and weren't exactly jumping up and down to assist me. I lost my wallet in our first room (before we upgraded to a better view room) and no one at the front desk\/concierge desk were helpful when trying to help me get a hold of someone in security, who always seemed to be missing! Finally, I got a hold of someone and they were able to find the wallet, but the security people were rude as well. I do have to say that I am thankful to the housekeepers who found my wallet and were gracious enough to turn it in. They were all very friendly passing by in the hallway. 

This was my birthday trip and I did a lot of research before choosing a hotel because I wanted it to be a great experience for a decent price and I feel like I made a mistake staying here because of the horrible customer service. Where I come from, typically the customer is always right, and even when the customer is wrong, still treat them with respect and kindness because they are paying to stay at your hotel, when there are TONS of other places to choose from on the strip. I will not be staying here again!

First room (#744) had a wonderful view of the roof. A huge roof. That's about it. Grout in shower looked moldy, furniture scratched\/ broken, lights didn't work. New room was a little better, but furniture again beat up pretty bad. Scratched.. drawers missing. 

Location is great! Can't beat it. Mall pretty neat too. PH suffers from what they all do, the maze of the hotel\/casino\/mall. Maybe I am not good with directions but it took me 10-15 minutes just to get in or out of the building. And I get it, forces people to walk past more stores, and casino things. But doesn't make it less annoying.


Side note.. non smoking floor smells like smoke. And has ash trays on the hall. Even under the non smoking signs. Kind of annoying.

overall, slept good in the comfortable bed. Room was quiet. And room seemed mostly clean. Depending on price, I'd return.

Planet Hollywood is fairly nice and has a lot of attractions (ie: shows, shopping, eating, etc.) on its main floor\/casino. The rooms are nice as well with a cool contemporary feel to it. Price-wise, this hotel isn't too bad compared to Wynn, Belagio, etc. But in my opinion, it's location isn't the best on the strip. Be prepared to either cab often, or walk a lot.

Big disappointment. 

Check in: 30 minutes in line. You know what it's like to check in for your flight at the airport? Well, it's exactly the same here.

The room: One of the phones didn't work. The phone that worked was missing the faceplate template, so I had to guess on what the buttons were. Also, several of the lamp cords were unplugged. Super noisy . Heard the elevator going up and down constantly. 

Signage: Tiny, sparse, vague.

I called the font desk to ask a quick question. 30 minutes on hold.

Wake up call: That part was good. If you have a question when you're there, I suggest calling "wake up call" instead of the front desk. 

Meeting rooms: Big pillar that blocked out the line of sight for about 1\/3 or the room. 

Wifi: Ridiculous. $13 for EACH wifi device you connect to it. 

They must have a great sales department, because there's simply no reason this hotel should even still be in business being so poorly run and organized. 

Casino: I feel bad that they make the female card dealers wear such skimpy clothes. It's super cheesy and low class. Shame on you Planet Hollywood for appealing to the sleaziest common denominator. 

They also do a horrible job of promoting what's going in in the hotel...such as the shows, and restaurants they have there. and where things are located. Hard to believe they mess up such a simple thing as letting guests know what's going on in the hotel...guess then don't need the business. They won't be getting anymore of mine. 

Pay attention to the negative reviews. They are spot on.

First time I stayed here, it was still the Aladdin and was undergoing construction. Now it's the Planet Hollywood. You can still see random Aladdin things, like the sink fixtures and the "Spice Market" buffet. But it's kewl . . . on the strip, has lotsa places to eat, casino, and a club. 

Funny part is our room was "Hollywood Hipster" themed and our room had NELL! You know, that movie with Jodie Foster and the secret creepy language? We had a display of a broom and a little shovel from the film. 

Weeeeeiiiiirrrrd.

Aside from that the hotel was really nice, beds really comfy, and we got a cheap deal . . . with the economy all shot and everything. I would suggest checking them out next time you go to Vegas. 

xxx C

I was excited at a thought of new construction in LV. 
I was dissappointed to learn that the new "Planet Hollywood" is just the Aladdin with a new coat of paint. YUCK. I like brand spanking new hotels...  

I am kind of pissed they took away the Middle Eastern Theme. No not Ali Baba...or Salami Salami Baloney... I loved the light show...

I remember the shops...  I bought shoes and clothes here... 

I will never stay here.

Yo Yo Yo.....  Infodiva.... is tired...  Let me go get about 4 hours of sleep...  hehehhe

Infodiva zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz
Fun little spot and had a blast here! It sure has changed a lot since the Aladdin was taken over.

Came here for the buffet. Long line, but my friends came ahead of us so we zipped in front, sorry to the people behind us. There seemed to be a lot of food choices, but if you look closely, there really aren't many things to actually eat. I didn't eat much, maybe 1.5 plates. I usually go for variety anyways, but having not much variety, it was a disappointment. I would avoid unless it was comped.

I have to say I love this place Planet Hollywood the hotel is absolutely nice they have a bar in the middle of the casino at the heart bar where if you are with a lot of people you can always meet them is very convenient the mall also is a very good mall here

BEWARE. We left six Britney Spears tickets on the desk of our room before we left for dinner two hours before the concert. When we came back our tickets were gone. Before we left housekeeping came to 
clean our room.

When we got back to our room are tickets were gone. We tried everything to get them on our phones went to the box office no help because we got them from stub hub.

I advised front desk of what had happened told them I think housekeeping may have thrown them away. All they did was point me to their lobby computers to print new tickets but after paying for it their printers did not work. 

I complained to the manager and the manager said that she spoke with housekeeping and housekeeping did not throw any papers away. Finally we were able to get our tickets from stub hub on our phones and we saw 27 minutes of an hour and a half show which we spent over $1200 to watch.

Right after the show the manager told us they found our tickets which housekeeping did have. In fact she smiled at when while she showed me our tickets. When I asked them to compensate us for the loss of the show, for our rooms or for anything, they refuse to help us whatsoever. They were uncooperative, they were unhelpful, they were rude. I was told the only way they can help me is by filing a report. I do want to get anyone in trouble I just want them took acknowledge what they did to us and to compensate us for the loss of this weekend and the show. 

However they refuse to do anything other then to call security to our room to investigate and write a report. This place sucks do not stay here they steal from you, lie, and do nothing to help you out.

Took a little R&R trip to Vegas with my boyfriend and decided to stay at Planet Hollywood.
I like the location of this resort, because its kind of in the center of the Las Vegas Strip.  

Check in was smooth, no problems there. Their promotion they had going on was what really won us over ((free booze each night we stayed)).  So of course, we were skeptical on how BIG the bottles would be, so to our surprise, they were actually a decent size...to be approximate, $40 bottle or so ((at least that's what it said on the receipt)).  Speaking of claiming our bottles, the workers in that shop were not friendly at all...it was like they just wanted us in and out...

But other than that, the other staff were nice.  Our room had a great strip view ((even though there was TONS of construction being done right across the way for new hotels\/resorts, but still we got a Strip View room)).  Our room itself was okay.  The bathroom was pretty cool because it had a separate bath and shower area which is always a plus, especially walking around all day.  Bed was comfy.  Nice room overall.

Shopping area was real nice.  LOVE the sandwiches at the Earl of Sandwich...YUM! ate there twice! haha
great restaurants...

PROPS to Halo Bar. =] Spent most of the time there.

Would definitely stay again.

Stayed the night of 12\/5 after it took us more than 30 minutes to drive here from Harrahs.  The valet guys were super friendly, and the girl that checked us in in the diamond check-in was great but the girl that stood next to her was very rude.  The beds in the room were comfy but the decor was weird and didn't mesh well.  While playing, I had ordered a drink from Christi (not sure how spelled, but white, glasses, thin, super curly hair). After 37 minutes I went looking for her and she had the nerve to tell me that she had been looking for me ( I hadn't moved at all since ordering the drink) and had brought the wrong drink and tried to tell me that that was what I had ordered.

Then went to the other side of the casino and was approached by Sandy? and told her what happened when she asked if I wanted a drink, hers was brought to me within 3 minutes, AND she had other drinks too!  She is the reason for the 3 stars.

There was also a slot attendant (Tony) that was very rude and dismissive.  I don't get why Planet feels the need to be so snobby and uppity with rude employees, yeah it works for the kids that don't spend a lot but won't work for people who actually play.

Not a fan these days. I use to rave about this place, it was the "go to" hotel that was fun, nice, and reasonable. My husband booked this hotel cause it's centralized to everything and the shopping is so close. My issue with it is we booked a room for my daughter and her friends, they couldn't even accommodate her in a room closer to us, they were put in a room on the complete opposite side. My husbands friends had to switch out of their room cause the a\/c wasn't working. My husband was here on business a night before I arrived and he had to get switched out due to their wifi not working. We get into our room the walls have paint splotches, furniture completely beat up, rust all over the bathroom sink, shower....um you'd think this was a motel 6. Then I call for in room service, it's an hour and a half wait. Give me a break. Get with it Planet Hollywood, you need a revamp. 

Update: I waited for my husband to get back from his convention and decided to ask for a change of room. I realized the room did not have a full length mirror hence the paint splotches, looked as though it was ripped out and when I plugged my iPhone charger into the bathroom outlet the power went out. I spent 15 mins flipping the switch for it to come back on. We get to the front desk and the "customer service" rep tried to tell me that it happens in her apartment all the time....this is not an apartment this is a hotel for one, no comparison. Then she proceeds to say "are you looking for an upgrade?" I was pissed but found it quite entertaining. She was missing the point, I could care less for an upgrade, I wanted a proper room, that's all. Not the sh*t show they put us in and through. She calls her "manager" out, I believe her name is Desiree....who proceeds to tell my husband "I switched you out yesterday because you complained about the wifi"...again for someone who is titled "MANAGER" she didn't get the point, she focused so hard on the fact that she already switched my husband out because of wifi issues in the room he stayed in the first night. While this whole time, the real point is, we booked 3 rooms, two of which were for 3 nights, the rooms online advertise full length mirror, complimentary wifi, etc etc...certainly didn't advertise a dump. All we wanted was what was advertised and what we paid for. Unfortunately aside from a revamp, their employees need some guest service training. They clearly don't know what guest relations is. They are horrible!

Could do a bit better on the friendliness tip.  We weren't asking for much more than a smile or a nice welcome.  The hotel itself is ultra modern when u enter the lobby, and the room is great, large tub is great, but the check-in experience put a bad taste in my mouth.  The Heart Bar is cool though.

I've stayed here numerous times and always really liked it. The rooms are nice and have cool little memorabilia sprinkled about, and I love the proximity to the miracle mile shops. Good gambling. Plus it has starbucks in the hotel! On the downside, the last time I stayed there, they were super stingy. They charged us to have room service bring us a bottle opener (almost $5 - and we didn't get to keep the bottle opener) and charged my friend for an early check in by one hour. It just sucks because this type of thing makes me not want to stay there and it's a great hotel.

I made reservation at Planet Hollywood for Labor Day weekend which also happened to be my 10 year anniversary. When I called the reservation line to book my stay I asked if they could make any special accommodations regarding my anniversary. The reservation line said that I would have to call the hotel front desk, which I did and they referred me back to the reservation line. So at that point I gave up and was already apprehensive in staying there. So here are some other factors that prompted such a low rating:

Check in - I requested an early check in (2:00) & when we arrived at the hotel and checked it at the front desk were told we had to wait till 4:00 because our room was still being cleaned. Off the bat, we are experiencing bad service.

Ice Machine - I took an ice chest with some  sodas & water and wanted to keep them cold. So I went to the nearest ice machine which was just down the hall and it wasn't working or just didn't have ice. I had to walk way across to the other side of the floor to get ice. I called maintenance and room service to get it fixed and was promised they would take care of the matter. Well guess what? It never got fixed even after calling 3 times and promised 3 times a Technician was being sent. I had to walk clear across the other side of the floor every time I needed to get ice and so did other annoyed visitors.

WiFi - I was promised free WiFi as part of the resort fee but every time I tried logging in none of my APs worked. After many attempts I finally called the front desk and was told to access the Internet and sign into the Hotel's WiFi by simply providing my email address, which I did. I then could see that the Hotel's WiFi would appear in my phone's WiFi setting but it never worked with any of my APs. So basically I had to use up my personal data all weekend because the Hotel's WiFi sucks.

Robbery - So there was also a robbery on our floor, one our neighbors left his room for a few minutes after the cleaning lady showed up & his room was robbed. They took his work laptop, back pack, & money. Sounds like an inside job!!

Room - I reserved the Vista Room which was about 585 in square feet with a nice King size bed and ample size restroom with a walk in bath.  The room's decor appeared outdated & used. The shower head and water pressure wasn't great and toilet kept plugging up. 

Room Service - normally in all hotels that I've stayed at have usually cleaned our rooms as long as you are gone and the don't disturb sign is removed. Not here! I had to call room service to have our room cleaned and get fresh towels. It was never done automatically which was totally annoying!! 

I also was awoke at 6:40am by house keeping stating that I had ordered a bed. It was me and my wife and we already had a king size bed so why would I have ordered a bed. The early morning knock scared the shit out of me since my neighbor was robbed the day before. Room Service never showed up during the day but came at 6:40am to bring a bed I didn't order! Go figure!!  

Overall, it wasn't a pleasant stay and I'm sure the hotel is more fitted for another type of demographic that doesn't care about details and too drunk to demand good customer service. 

Sorry PlaNOT Hollywood, love the Casino and its Vibe but your Hotel & service staff needs improvements.

I think I love this hotel and if I had to pick one, this would be one of my preferred hotels on the strip. 

First, the miracle mile shops are downstairs and you can literally lose yourself for hours if you have nothin better to do. Second, the location is right in the middle of all the action. You can walk across to some of the other hotels, visit Walgreens, eat a Pink's hot dog, get a tattoo, all within a few blocks from this hotel. There is also Gordon Ramsey's restaurant downstairs and Britney Spears is performing here... Yes, there's also a club here. One more thing is that the standard rooms come with a deep soaking tub and the decor in each room has posters and props from Hollywood movies. No fridge or microwave though and my only gripe is that the gaming options are definitely overpriced so I would suggest taking a walk to one of the "Cheaper" casino's but I guess that's what this "deluxe" hotel can afford to do. Another grip is the Pleasure Pit. If I am going to gamble, I do not want to be distracted by these half naked women with their hoo-ha's hanging out dancing on tables near the gaming. If you're there for that type of attraction, go to a strip club or walk the strip, you will see plenty, lol. Other than that, 4 stars for location, glitz, convenience, glamor, etc. 

I recently purchased a suite across the street from the Planet Hollywood right next to the Cosmopolitan so if anyone needs a suite in a great location and doesn't want to pay Planet Hollywood prices, HOLLER!! lol

Really truly not my favorite. Check-in takes so long that you have to wait in roped off, winding snake line (like at Disney World) just to give your name and get to your room. After a long day of travel that is the last thing I wanted. The front desk staff were also unhelpful-- I had to ask where the gym and the pool were, no one offered that information and the gym is hidden inside the spa (way back), and the pool is randomly on the 6th floor so you'd never find it alone. The lobby has hideous lighting that is constantly changing and made me feel sick while I waited. The room was huge but the space was all wasted-- there was no refrigerator so we threw tons of leftover food away during our stay (not what you want in a city known for food), the television was positioned so that you couldn't watch it from the bed without straining, the decor was hideous and my back hurt every morning when I woke up from the terribly uncomfortable beds. My husband's company booked the room for us but I'd never stay here again even if it was paid for-- the tackiest hotel in the tackiest mall on the tackiest part of the Vegas strip, it just doesn't get any worse than that. The wifi was apparently free but also really really bad-- not fast enough to stream a movie or do work from the room. 

The only reason I thought of giving the place two stars instead of one is because Koi (restaurant on premises) was delicious-- but all of the other food was mediocre at best. The pool also wasn't scenic or particularly clean-looking but the staff was super nice and attentive out there and it was really big so there was plenty of room for guests to relax by the pool without being on top of one another, which was nice but it was just such an ugly pool space. The one staff member working at the gym was nice as well and they gave out free water bottles and apples. The view from the room wasn't so hot so I hope no one paid with that in mind. I'd go elsewhere.
First time in Vegas and I stayed here. Decent room loved the set up of the gambling floor. Awesome restaurants and friendly staff. I would come here again.

Good casino but a bad hotel.   Hotel needs a makeover with its rooms showing age.  The advantage to Planet is the casino which is always busy and you seem to have some luck or at least some fun. Food choices are good with Ramsey Burger and of course the buffet is hopping.  If your not a upgraded player than be prepared to wait in line at buffet solely do to lack of speed from cashiers.  Never too full if they would just go faster and maybe slap the crap out of tourists that stand there for fifteen asking questions. ......its a buffet! !! Thankfully I have the upgraded club card to bypass this hell.   Location is central with walking the best way to get around.  Club is a club that is a club.   Tourists keep me from going to clubs in vegas which is wierd but really they are like kids  in a candy store acting like brats or old looking like perverts.

I was skeptical when I heard that the Aladdin was being redone as a Planet Hollywood hotel & casino, but they've done a great job at sprucing this place up.  They put up chandeliers and a lot of other shiny objects, and they have one blackjack pit with go-go dancers.  The center bar is still hooker central, so if you need a hooker, now you know where to go.  I've yet to go to their club Prive, but I have eaten a few times at their buffet and consider it one of the best in town.  The new poker room is OK, and the mall has some great shops & restaurants -- H&M, Blondie's, and Hawaiian Tropic Zone are a few of my favorites.  Oh, and one time I saw Ashton Kutcher and Demi Moore playing blackjack and snapped a picture.  Cool.

Just recently stayed here again over the memorial day weekend and I had to take off another star on the rating. 

When my friend reserved our rooms, we got an email saying that we can upgrade upon check-in and to state if we were interested. We jumped on the opportunity not knowing that our "upgrade" would be for the same room we reserved with a "strip view." The upgrade was priced at $22 for a better view! For $22, I was expecting a really nice view of the strip. We were disappointed at the TINY window and the "strip view" wasn't all that great either bc it was just a view from the side of the street but not directly on las vegas blvd. Then when we checked out and viewed the final bill, turns out they charged us $28 instead of the $22. So annoying. 

The hallway floors were dirty. When we checked in there were pizza boxes and trays in the hallway that weren't removed till the next morning and the crumbs were never vacuumed off the hall even when we checked out after 2 nights.   

The only positive about our stay was the staff were friendly and the location is super convenient. They just need better maintenance and stop over charging for shitty "strip views.

We got a regular Hollywood Hip room 6 of us split it, and it ended up being very reasonable for a 3 night stay.  ALSO, very roomy.  However, a big flaw was that it was $30 a night for a cot.  I've never been anywhere where it costs extra for a cot, so that was quite annoying.  We tried to get a free upgrade- that was a big no go. :(  

Bathroom was also quite spacious, with a separate room with the toilet- which is perfect when you're cramming multiple people in one room.  Loved that we got a free bottle of booze when checking in.  The location is perfect I enjoyed the casino and the mall connected to it.

The pools were kind of lame.  We went out to the pools pretty early- like 9am and were able to secure a few spots, but any later than that you're pretty much SOL for having a spot near the pool.  There were many chairs down in the center, not facing the pool...which I find odd.  There were so many unused cabanas and seats that it seemed ridiculous to not let people use them if nobody else was paying for it.

Despite the few flaws, I would definitely stay again.

I was in charge of our recent company retreat and we chose Planet Hollywood for our hotel accommodations. 
Our group of appx 40 rooms were all booked on average for 4 days\/3 nights.

None of our group utilized the pool or parking so this review is just for the corporate booking\/rooms\/baggage\/casino.

Overall we were extremely pleased with PH. Corporate reservations were easy and there was quick follow up on rooming requests prior to our check in. When a few of our group had plane delays causing room cancellations the rooms were easily re-booked and that problem quickly solved. The front desk had no issues keeping our reservations straight and check-in was extremely quick for everyone. Since we mostly checked in on Wed and Thurs we avoided what I can assume would be the busy weekend times. 
My only complaint with check-in was the lack of benches in the lobby area. I realize that not having people congregating  in this area is ideal but it would be nice to have a place to wait for people. One bench just didn't cut it so adding more would be nice. 

The hotel rooms themselves are rather large and everyone said how comfortable the beds were which was great.  Some of our rooms were older than others but all were clean with huge bathrooms and varying degrees of views of Vegas. The higher up you went the better the view of course.  I don't think this was really all that important since we came to Vegas to do everything BUT spend time in our rooms. 
The shower had great water pressure and the bathtub was super deep.  Keep in mind the floor can be very slick so be sure to lay down floor mats\/towels in advance of bathing.  Common sense BUT you would be surprised!

The only issues with the rooms seemed to be that many of our lights were burnt out or so dim that they were useless. These were the ceiling lights upon entry into the rooms and not related to any lights that plugged in.  Also even though we had WiFi access it was extremely unreliable and many of us had trouble staying connected.  Not sure what the solution to this problem would be but considering we were there for a corporate function it was a tad frustrating.

Many of us spent time in the casino and at bars within the casino floor and all of us felt that the employees were extremely friendly and there was a wide array of games to keep us entertained. 
ATM fees are $6.99 (which I think is standard around Vegas casinos) so beware of this if you plan to take cash out.

The employees in the Starbucks were especially friendly and helpful.

The checkout process was super easy and leaving\/retrieving  our bags with the baggage desk was a really fluid process. 

Finally everyone used Uber and having a designated pick-up and drop off location made the process so easy for us all. 

Overall everyone had nothing but great things to say about our stay at Planet Hollywood and I would be more than happy to book any of our future Las Vegas corporate stays there.

My boyfriend and I decided to stay an extra night in Vegas and got a room at Planet Hollywood. We made the reservations 1 week in advance. The shows are wonderful we saw Britney Spears and Paul Zerdin both absolutely entertaining and fun. However, the actual resort was a complete disappointment. First, we had a room overlooking the pool area, don't recommend, and were subjected to deep base sounds pulsating until 8 or 9. At 2 in the morning after our evening was completed we laid down to sleep and this continuous noise and rumbling echoed throughout our room...we had no idea what that could have been until it dawned on me how close to the elevators our room was. It was the elevators...non-stop, up and down all night long. We were unable to sleep very well. In addition, the room was a bit disappointing and sink was not working properly. The casino also was not as good as some others nearby and if you gamble at the bar they still charge you for the drinks...none of the other casinos did that. So my advise is to see shows here but stay elsewhere...or at least away from pool and elevator banks.

Scabies from this hotel. Without a doubt. The room smelled, was dirty. Drains in the bathroom clogged. 
Had to go home and doctor confirmed scabies. I live in the country and haven't been around anyone or situations where I could have gotten this. After the first night in the hotel I wake up from a sound sleep itching like crazy. After two more days I looked like the photo below. Hands, feet, both legs and arms, groin and chest. Doc said worst case she ever saw. 
Hotel management was not helpful and tried to deny any responsibility that the dirty room was the cause. 
Reporting to the proper agency's in hopes they hold them responsible. 
I posted a review here as well and have been contacted by other guest who have recently had similar issues. 

Be warned.

Planet Hollywood is an under rated hotel in my opinion. 

The rooms are nice with above average decor. I've seen the suit rooms and they are nice and worth it if you want to go that route.

The indoor mall is great too. They have painted ceilings that make you feel like you are outside and coming off a ship in the Mediterranean. They have a simple light show with rain effects that comes on every 30 minutes or so that emulates a lightning and thunder storm out in the ocean.

I haven't been to the clubs, but the Buffet was great and the Groupon I purchased really added extra value to the whole thing. I don't gamble so I can't speak on behalf of that as well.

Nice hotel. Located right in the middle of the strip. Stayed in a pet room that was rather large. Nice bathroom, comfy bed, clean enough for me to not complain. Only thing that bothered me was the occasional smell of sewage that leaked in every time we came back to the room. It would linger for awhile, but eventually go away. Other wise, it was a nice stay.

Stayed here for Super Bowl and had a blast. The projector was bomb, the screen was literally 10' x 12', it could've used a better audio system though. Plantet H.Wood is a great place to shop, eat and stay.

Such a disappointment. They don't have enough vallet parking to accommodate guests. We had to self park, drag our bags across the parking structure in 110 degrees then through the mall and casino. Super smokey even in the rooms. Only plus staff was very nice and helpful. Really poorly structured. Won't stay again. They over charged for room fees too.

If I could give this Hotel a Zero I would.  I don't know where to start.  I had requested two rooms that were non smoking and connecting.  I called them twice in the morning prior to arrival to make sure they had honored my request.  Upon arrival I was told they had no rooms next to each other, and that the only rooms they has was smoking.  I cancelled one room and all 4 of us stayed in one room.  Housekeeping did not do a good job cleaning the rooms.  The bathroom smelled of urine and the sinks were filthy, not to mention the carpet was not vacuumed at all.  Pluming is definitely an issue.
To add insult to the injury, they broke my car key at the valet parking and said it was broken to begin with.  I spoke with the "supervisor" and was told that my key was already broken and that they are very honest (which made me the dishonest one).  
Long story short, I will never ever stay in this hotel again.
The ONLY good thing about this hotel is Gordon Ramsay's burger place.

If you are a Las Vegas Local (Like Me :-)) there really isn't a better place to go on a weekend night. You have everything you need to make a one-of-a-kind "Vegas Baby" experience. The two or one star players don't know how to party so let me help you. Maybe then you will rethink such a low ranking for one of the best spots in town. 

Here is my typical night out at PH:(Warning: it isn't for everyone and I do not endorse this behavior. Please do this at your own risk. This what I do and you have to be 21)

1. Start your night with a Fat Tuesday in the Miracle Mile shoppes (who cares if you have to walk a 100 yards from the garage; it's good for you) 

2. Then work your way  to the Casino and pick your poison (Slots, Video poker, Black Jack, Three Card Poker, Let It Ride, Craps you name it they have it) My all time favorite is QUACK SHOT! Ask a floor manager to help you find it. Put 20 bucks in and have fun. We hit the jackpot quiet a few times over the years.  

3. Go back and get another Fat Tuesday. "I DO" (180 octane with extra shot)

4. Now work you way over to the "Pleasure Pit" (really it is the pleasure pit) with hot girls dancing on the poles while you play black jack. "One and Two Stars Guys Really"???"Five Stars in my book all the way baby"!!!! It's Vegas Baby not Kansas Dorthy! 

5. Now you are ready to hit the night club. check-in at the base of the club next to the pleasure pit and ride your way up to heaven (really you will be going above the casino to the second floor via escalator) . This spot is kicking around 1:00am. Have fun! By now the Fat Tuesdays have kicked-In so don't push it (drinking) or you will be sorry. At least that's what happens to me. 

6. It will be around 4:00am when you get done with the club and you will be hungry and ready to eat; but don't worry it is time to go to your last spot.  

7. come down from the club and back to reality; head to the right and visit Earls' Sandwich. This will hit the spot "Trust Me On This" 

8. Now that your belly is full and you can think again it is time to hit the Poker Room. The chips will be loose at this time of night.  If you are an experienced poker pro like myself then you will feel you have stepped into a shooting gallery. For some of you it is good night from here and time to take a cab home. Please do not drink and drive in Las Vegas (our families are on the roads; remember that). You can pickup your car later in the day. 

That is my  true 'Vegas Baby Night" Night Out!

Fun Stay!!!

We came here for my fiance's birthday. Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino is a super trendy and fun place, however, we did have issues with our room. I specifically booked a non-smoking room but for some odd reason, there was still a really consistent cigarette smell in the bathroom coming from the vents. I reported this issue twice and no one seemed to have an answer or care to come check out the problem so that was a red flag for me. There was also a leak in our room (room #861) when we used the bathtub. The room we booked was supposed to be "newly renovated" but it didn't really seem like it. The frame of the bed and the furniture was extremely dusty and although the house keepers did come in to "clean" our room, they did a very sloppy job at it. 

Outside of the room, I do love that Planet Hollywood doesn't have as bad of a cigarette smell as other hotel and casinos on the strip. I also love the entertainment that they have (i.e. JLO's show was fantastic!). 

Overall,
It is a fun hotel and casino but I would have to think about if I want to stay here again. The room was cool but not as amazing as I thought it would be and the cigarette smell was really frustrating and kind of put a damper on our room experience.

I hope this review helps you decide on where to stay during your Viva Las Vegas adventures! :)

If not for the great strip view our room had, this restaurant would deserve only one star. Our stay at P. Ho was a comedy of errors, long delays, and unmet promises.

Let's start at the beginning. Showed up around 9pm on a Thursday. I know it is a busy night for hotels because I do what many people do: come on Thursday evening and take Friday off, to squeeze an extra night of fun out of a Vegas stay. So the line was understandably large. But it wasn't large enough that we should have spent 45 minutes waiting. There were only 4 receptionists trying to work through a line that was 30 or so people deep.

When we finally cleared the line, we were told that we would not be able to get two adjacent double-queen rooms, let alone adjoining. I told the guy working on us that we would be fine with rooms that were close to each other on the same floor as well. He couldn't find any of those either, and came up with a solution: he would upgrade us for free to two adjoining rooms with a strip view (which we normally wouldn't have access to based on what we paid for), however one of these rooms would have a king bed and the other would have the two queens we asked for.  The receptionist assured us that we would be able to request a rollaway build at no charge. I was honestly satisfied with this outcome, but it gets better:

- We could only put our stuff in one room because the adjoining room was not cleaned yet. The room would be ready later in the evening.
- When we dialed for the rollaway, we were brusquely told that this would cost an extra $30 per night (!!!) Clearly a case of the foot not knowing what the head is doing, but still. We eventually got it cleared up, but not without going back down to the reception to yell at people.
- The bathroom in the king-room had two faucets, but one of these only dispensed hot water. Repeated requests to get this fixed were never fulfilled.

Overall we felt that for the amount we had paid for the privilege to stay at PH was high enough that this level of service should have been much higher than it was. Next time I go to Vegas I definitely won't stay at PH... I did have a much better experience with the Venetian in 2009. Heck, Circus Circus might've been a better experience. Sigh.
Pretty average.  The music was so loud and often had maybe 4 songs competing with each other. The carpets look like they need some TLC
Great hotel!! The room was very clean and modern !! We loved the gym in comparison to hotel gyms! Best buffet !! We spent a lot of time at the Heart Bar! Great drinks and music!!
