I didn't stay in the hotel, but I played some games and spent some time around the casino as a whole.
The place is attached to the Miracle Mile Mall, which was attached to our hotel.  So we passed through more than we played.
I went over to the service area and picked up my Total Rewards card,which worked at several casinos.
At night walking through there were some ladies dancing in between the gaming areas too.  Just a head's up for people.  If you want to avoid it with kids or want to see it.  Just an FYI.
Didn't see any rooms, but the casino was nice enough that it would be on the list of possible for the next visit.

So pissed that the wi-fi is $12 bucks a day!!! What's worse is that there is no 3G reception anywhere in the area. I'm personally convinced that they jam it intentionally. They really need to learn that $10 bucks for a friggin jack and coke and no Facebook, etc is going to prolong their recession and ultimately burn them.
I for one will absolutely not come back to Vegas for at least a couple of years due to the extortionistic prices and tactics.
Nice rooms
Nice pool but it closes too early
The cheeseburger restaurant has awesome bloody mary's!

This is a review for the hotel only.  Spa to be reviewed separately.  In terms of staying here as a guest this really only rates 2 stars, bathroom is nice sized, room decent, bed was very comfortable.  Honestly though, there is nothing really interesting about this place and I found it boring at best.  And cleanliness was a real issue. I did attend a conference here, and for conferences I would rate it a 4 - great sound quality and conference rooms, only downside was lack of plug space for laptops.  Hands down best food at a conference ever; this they got perfect.

YIKES. We had a very bad experience here, unfortunately.

I went for a work trip and you can't imagine the thrill I had knowing we were staying in the same hotel that Britney is preforming at (the teenage girl in me is still star struck) but honestly, I've never had a worse experience in Vegas. The first day our room wasn't even ready when we arrived, by the third day our room hadn't been cleaned once, and the fourth day our neighbors took it upon themselves to hotbox their hotel room which led to the vent pumping their smoke into our room. At first the hotel did NOTHING about our neighbors and told us that this was impossible. Finally after much pestering they sent a secutriy guard up who immediately confirmed our suspicion and told the front desk to move us. They then refused to give us adjoining rooms like we had reuqested when we booked the hotel and didn't even offer us a discount despite spending 5 nights there! 

Terrible, terrible, terrible!

I came here last night to check out the Crazy Girls show with my husband. While we were waiting for the show to begin, we signed up for the players card and wandered around the casino. 

When you sign up for the players card, you have the option of two free drinks or $10 in table play. The people signing us up were so nice and attentive, and gave us advice on where the best spots in the city for locals are. We opted for the drinks and redeemed our drink tickets at the Heart Bar. The bartender mixed them well and made them strong, which I appreciated!

I really like this casino because it's centrally located, and there's a variety of food options inside, It's an awesome spot, especially for the younger crowd. There's a variety of cool slot games, including multiplayer ones. There's also pretty girls dancing at the Pleasure Pit. 

Highly recommend it!

Pros: Earl of Sandwich. The fact that it's home to the greatest sandwich shop of all time makes finding a place to eat a breeze. Besides that, it's connected to tons of shops and restaurants so you don't have to go too far to get a great meal! 

Cons: The elevators are so slow! I have no idea why, but while we were there, only two elevators were working at a time. It could take up to thirty mins just to get onto an elevator so many people chose walking the stairs as the better option! Ridiculous! Also, there's a huge inconsistency with the rooms. We booked three rooms but they were all completely different sizes. Same overall look but one was way bigger than all the rest.

I love this hotel, the location is convenient , there's a shopping mall in the hotel so if your not a gambler you can shop.  There's a large selection of eateries especially earl's sandwich which is 24\/7 and inexpensive. We tried BURGR that was great too!  
The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the room, we got a room with two beds which made the room look a little larger than if you had a king size, the bathroom had a extra large tub but too bad it wasn't a jacuzzi , the walk in shower door was backwards or designed wrong because after you showered you have to open the door and reach behind the door for you towel and wellll...the cold air would rush in, at least put a towel hook on the wall so you could just reach for your towel more quickly.oh the the kicker was as I type this review on the sitting chair near the window the air vent next to me is filthy dirty with dust bunnies, you would think they could vacuum the vents once in a while.

I've been going to Las Vegas at least twice a year for over a decade, and I consider myself to be well acquainted with the city's hotels, and local attractions. This year (Christmas 09) I decided to get out of Chicago's cold weather, and on out to Vegas.  I've stayed at most of the hotels in the city, including Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Hard Rock, Excalibur, Four Seasons and even Rio.  I found a good price on the internet to stay at Planet Hollywood, and decided to give it a shot.  All an all, I probably won't be making a trip back to PH again.  

Good Points:
Planet Hollywood is located right on the strip, across the street from the top shelf, ultra swanky Aria hotel. PH has plenty of slot machines, and more than enough restaurants and bars to have a good time. Planet Hollywood's decor is something a kin to a dance club, with endless neon, flashing lights through out the lobby.  If you're into a club like atmosphere, might be right in your wheel house. The sounds of high energy dance music, and classic rock run rampid through the casino's sound system.  Also PH is connected to a huge mall called the magnificent mile, where visitors can shop at high end stores and people watch.  I was also impressed with their Planet Dallies Cafe. The cafe serves up (somwhat reasonablly) priced food. 
Finally, PH is close to other tourist attractions on the strip-meaning all of the other hotels.  

Negative:
The rooms at Planet Hollywood are not that nice at all.  The hotel will and does try to charge you for every little thing. For example, a view of the strip will cost $50.00 a night extra, depending on your room. If you decide to order room service, please ask before purchasing your order. A $16.00 breakfast turned into a nearly $30.00 meal, after the hotel threw on a take out tax, cover charge tax as well as city tax.  This also goes for the spa at PH.  We paid for a massage (male massage therapist for sports massage) and a manicure for my girl. The price was about $250.00. Not bad.  However; after the spa service was over, they hit us a gratuity fee of 20%. Of course, this was totally wrong since we had already tiped or massage therapist and nail tech cash right after service.  The rooms are also small (unless you are paying for an upgrade).  Room service came to clean late in the day, and did not do a very good job.  

Overall, while the hotel was certainly a site to see, it did not meet up to my standards for a relaxing experience.  PH might also invest in getting larger signs to show guests where all of its attactions are.  My best advice is to stay at a place like Mandalay Bay, and spend a little more to stay at THE HOTEL.  The rooms, service, and over all expeirence is a lot better.  

If you can find another hotel in Vegas at a better or equal rate, I would not suggest staying at Planet Hollywood. 

The staff at the hotel is not friendly, and gave us the impression that we were bothering them.

I came here on my Ellen giveaway. Really quick check in considering I was checking in on a holiday. The front desk was really nice when arriving. The parking is confusing, you park at self park and walk through the whole miracle mile mall to get to check in counter and back again if you need something from your car. Free parking though. They gave us a room with a view to the back of the casino, boooooo! One plus is that the location of the hotel on the strip was frigging fab! When we got to our room it was nice and roomy, then I ran the bath, very very loud plumbing and thin walls! Only one of the side lamps worked, all the cables to the other lamps were just tangled with each other, uhh fire hazard.  We stayed a total of 3 days and 2 nights,  house keeping never came, no clean towels no clean sheets for those days. Oh and courtesy flush when using the bathroom, they get backed up very easily considering the fact that you have to flush the toliet paper you've just used. Major plus, I lost my phone and an amazing couple returned it to me! Anyways, pretty good for a free stay at a hotel.

Stayed at PH for 4 nights at the end of June.  Overall a great experience and a good choice for this visit to Vegas.  Service, location, and value. 

The good stuff: 
-  Great location!  Center Strip and attached to the Miracle Mile shops
-  Great value for the room price - couldn't beat the price for this nice Hotel
-  Cool \/ Hip Hotel, nice rooms, liked the feel of the casino

The not so good minor stuff.....
- might seem an odd thing to say, but the window in the room seemed way too small!  I have stayed at 15+ Vegas hotels and remember most to have full wall windows (ex: Mandalay) or really large windows.  I enjoy looking out at the strip and it seemed strange to have this small window?  
- the pools are too small - like really small for Vegas.  Tried unsuccessfully 3 different days to grab a poolside lounge chair and it wasn't happening.   There is a huge sun deck area between the pools, but you really lose the "poolside" atmosphere.  I know that the pool scene is a big thing in Vegas these days and PH misses the mark here.
- Valet was a bit of a hassle and seemed understaffed most of the time we were there.  The guys were great, just not enough of them.  Just a minor issue.

We would absolutely stay here again.  Again - good service, great value, great location, and overall a cool casino.

This place is perfect for the twentysomethings. Super nice rooms and well decorated lobbies. The 24 hour coffee shop is a fun place to connect with friends at 3 am. The buffet is complete and the staff is courteous. I don't want to stay anywhere else. Plus this place has the perfect location on the strip.

We stayed this last weekend at PH and had an awesome experience. The room was clean and the bed super comfy.  Loved the oversized bathtub and the Strip view. The halls smell of smoke but no issue with that in the room. Friendly staff. ..Great location. Skip Planet Dailies-slow service and the food is not so great.

Dirty room! If I can put 0 star, I will.. The front desk are not very helpful. They just change with the same dusty and smelly room,I will prefer staying at hard rock hotel , wasted our 2hrs waiting for them to help us!

Last June I stayed at Elara (old PH West towers) and absolutely loved it. Last week I stayed at PH in the North Towers. The room was nice, the staff was polite and helpful and the location (middle of the strip) is excellent. There are plenty of good places to eat at the hotel and the shopping at Miracle Mile is great. While I didn't gamble much at PH, the casino is adequate. I would've given a 4 star rating if it weren't for one HUGE con...the walk from the hotel room to the parking garage (valet was full 2 nights) is ridiculously far! It has to be the better part of a mile; not kidding. It easily took 10-15 minutes to get to the car as I had to walk halfway around the mall each time. The parking garage entrance to Elara is maybe 20 yards from the elevators. Won't be staying at PH again.

For the price point, no complaints. I've stayed at a few vegas hotels, this being my first at PH. Does it compare to some of the more expensive ones? No. But at half the price, it shouldn't. For an affordable option it's my favorite of the bunch. Thought the room was average in a good way, above average bathroom, helpful staff, and plenty of dining options between the hotel and attached mall.
Definitely check out Yolos in the hotel for a mango margarita, ABC in the mall for cheap food and (alcoholic) drinks, Britney at Axis (DUH).
There's no good club in the hotel so you'll need a cab to go out but with its central location a cab will run you about $10.

The location is awesome but the rooms are dated.  The rooms are dark and they have creepy props in them.  My room had a puppet of a dog and it felt like it was staring at me while I slept.  My other friend had Beetlejuice, so I can't imagine what that was like.  I would come back for the location and service but not for the rooms themselves.

I had reserved a room at Planet Hollywood for my birthday and I was excited for the stay based on the pictures on Yelp.

But that wasn't what I got.

I walked into the room (which was the lowest price range) and was incredibly unhappy. The room was SMALL. The bathroom looked like a wreck and it just felt icky in there. So I called the front desk asking if I could upgrade to the next price range up (which was an extra $20\/night, that sounded pretty reasonable).

Extra star for letting us check in 3 hours early and for being super super accommodating with letting us switch rooms.

I don't remember what the second one up is, I wish I did so it could probably help those of you looking at this review but the room was significantly bigger and the bathroom arrangement was MUCH better. It had the tub in the middle, the shower on the right and the toilet on the left as well as two bathroom sinks.

The second night in, I called housekeeping for more towels. After waiting about 45 minutes with nothing, my husband called again and someone was promptly at our door within 10 minutes with not only new towels, but WARM new towels! Not really sure what happened that first time around. 

The Mile Shops are okay. The fact that Earl of Sandwich is open 24 hours is a nice plus. My only other complaint is that it was hard to find the room elevators in the casino.

Judging by other reviews on here, it seems like your stay will be fantastic if you pick the right room price level. I'd probably give this resort another go. The stay wasn't awful and the beds were nice to sink into after a long day of walking.

If I could give this place any less of a star I would do so. So biggest thing to make this place not worth the land it is built on is that they  first, GAVE ALL MY INFO AND MY ROOM BILLING INFO for both of the rooms that I had booked under my name only to another person. This in turn caused huge issues in our group, we actually had a huge blow up in the lobby due to this. Second, they allowed another person in our group to go and check into a room that I was told was not ready to be checked into WITHOUT ME BEING PRESENT and WITHOUT ME EVEN BEING AT THE PROPRTY. Now I don't think I am an expert on privacy laws or occupancy and identification requirements, but I believe that this is something that is illegal or against the law, not to mention I would also think this would be against hotel policy. I am actually getting legal counseling for this and am looking into what I can do about a situation like this. ANYONE OUT THERE CONTACT me if you have any info you can share.

Let's get to the hotel. Bathroom doors were broken, out of the 3 rooms we had 1 had a fridge, power plug to the desktop computer area didn't work(which is not a big deal just have to mention it all), and how in the world can you have a hotel now a days that doesn't have an ipod hook up(either to the tv or clock radio) to play music. Also we asked for 2 glasses to the room to use for drinks and they charged me $10 to use an extra pair of glasses. This the first time I have ever had a hotel charge me to use some of their glasses. I could have gone and played cheap slots and ordered free drinks that would come with a glass. 

Now to the pool. When I walked out to the pool it was nice to see all the space that it had. But then I kept walking looking for some pools to go into. And kept looking and low and behold finally found their pools. When I saw how small and horribly bad these pools were I thought I would kill myself. But after looking at how packed and disgusting the water was in the pool I figured if I want to do that I might as well get in because that disease filled pool could do it for me. This is definitely one of the, if not the worst pool I have ever seen.

I can keep going on more and more but my hands are tired and I don't want to waste any more of my time at the moment. If you want to know more get in touch with me.

Center strip is where it's at!

You can walk to all the good places from there.  The rooms are big.  The bathroom was the size of my son's bedroom at home!  Got a good night's sleep in the comfy bed and didn't hear a thing all night.  The casino is attractive.  There are many places to eat on the property or only steps away.  We'll be back!

I stayed here four months ago. I got a promotional mailer for a free room. We paid for an extra room for our babysitter. When I called to make the reservation I requested for the rooms to be joining. We checked in pretty late. I realize checking in late means that the hotel staff probably won't be able to make your requests happen. They weren't able to get us joining rooms, or two rooms even on the same floor. It wasn't a sold out weekend, either. We had to call the next day after check out and request that one of our rooms be moved. They couldn't get a room next to either one of our rooms. We both had to move rooms to a different floor in order to get joining rooms. What a pain in the butt! Their food at their cafe was delicious. Their portions were large and the wait staff was very friendly. The rooms were decent. It's hard to complain when one of the rooms is free. They only have one small window in each room. Don't stay m for the view. Their water took forever to get hot and was barely luke warm at best. Overrall the stay was nice but I wouldn't pay over $200.00 a night for their rooms. It wouldn't be worth it. It's a good hotel to stay at if you can get a deal. it's nice that they have their own mall and it's a good location on the strip.

The location on the Center Strip is excellent.  It doesn't feel like it takes too long to get anywhere on the Strip from here.  Another reviewer mentioned that there are 2 Starbucks, which I appreciated too.  They have some great restaurants, including one of Gordon Ramsey's.  I love that the shopping is right there too; it's so convenient.  The room was much nicer than I was expecting, and the bathroom was huge.  There was a ton of counter space on the vanity, which was surprising, and a large soaker tub.  I also liked that there was a separate water closet and a lighted shower.  

The check-in line on a Wednesday afternoon was rather long, which I was surprised by.  The parking garage is really confusing if you are self-parking.  We kept following the self-park signs and ending up in the valet line.  I did think it was rather confusing to navigate the casino and hotel, but I'm sure they do that on purpose, hoping that you lose patience with trying to find your room and staying to gamble.

Anyone rating this place 5 stars clearly thinks that Motel 6 is on par with the likes of Mandarin Oriental.  If it weren't for a week long work conference at this hotel, I would never personally stay there.  I am giving it 2 stars based on its location.  The location is central to everything which is really awesome.

Cons:

Walls are super thin.  You can hear EVERYTHING!
The rooms look well worn.  Cracked tiles, stained carpet, broken drawers.
No free WIFI
No free gym 
Subpar Room Service
Icky Pool
Housekeeping - If you want clean towels and bed linen, you have to throw it on the floor in the bathroom with and leave a big sign saying "Please change this funky ass mess, thanks".
I'm not a gambler so I cannot comment on the gaming activities and offerings.

I've stayed here on two different occasions. It's in a great location on the strip - really walkable to a lot of places, which is exactly what I look for when I go to Vegas. The rooms are nice, large, clean...I really have no complaints about how comfortable it is. I have concerns about the customer service. Both times I've stayed here, it took over an hour in the check-in line. I've only stayed here in the summer, which I think is probably prime time for Vegas. In addition, I had a really hard time getting in touch with the concierge or front desk (line was always busy). I had to go downstairs to the front desk anytime I needed something. I just don't think this hotel can really provide top-notch service.

I would definitely stay here again. We stayed here in July 2014, had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains and Eiiffel Tower, nice sized rooms and beds. We also won on craps here too, I love the fact they have 2 Starbucks plus the Miracle Mile shops here.

This review is purely for a walk-thru casino visit with a short stop at a bar on the casino floor.  Planet Hollywood was easily accessible from the strip.  Walking in, we were greeted by the typical sights and sounds of a casino.  Something that felt different was a party atmosphere.  Maybe it was the type of music they were playing (current dance\/pop from diverse artists), but it felt like a good time in there.  Slots were of the usual variety and I didn't win anything!  Still, it was fun passing through.
Rooms are nice and clean... Bathroom have a separate shower and huge tub.. Separate toilet room. Loved this hotel! Rooms are cheap too.

The best thing about staying in Planet Hollywood is that Earl of Sandwich is on site. It is really difficult to find tasty and affordable food on the strip and Earl's is open 24 hours to boot. Chipotle is a close second (located in the Miracle Mile shops) but they aren't open 24 hours. 

My parents gamble frequently so we stayed at a comp room here. Our main purpose for this Vegas trip was to see Britney (soooo awesome!!) and it was nice that post show, we could go directly back to the room. The rooms were alright - there's a lack of attention to detail that I'm pretty meh about and I feel like they haven't upgraded the rooms in forever (hellooooooooo...lack of plugs around the bed!). 

Planet Hollywood's layout is totally weird and if you self park, lugging your luggage throughout the shops to get to the lobby is no fun. This place gets the job done for a clean place to sleep but don't expect super luxurious digs.

This review is for the casino and buffet only, as I never stayed in the rooms.  The location is good, in the middle of the action.  It's pretty modern and newer, it seems, but there is kind of a lot of filth in the casino.  Not in terms of trash, but rather in terms of hoochiness.  Like I would NOT go here with my 65 year old mother at night.  I would be too embarrassed of the half naked cocktail ladies and dancers.  Not everyone is into that sorta thing.  The buffet was good, though.  It wasn't extremely huge or fancy, but I would visit the buffet again... probably during lunch, rather than dinner.  I imagine the casino environment wouldn't be as risque during the day.

Worst place ever, I lost my purse - that's my bad but calling 'lost and found' 15 times in 5 hours and not getting a response??? Terrible!!!......zero stars is what I would have posted but Yelp won't let me ;)

I took my "besty" to Vegas as a belated birthday gift, and a few of our friends came along as well. I chose Planet Hollywood due to its location on the Strip. Considering this was a buddy trip -- PH was the PERFECT hotel. My experiences with the hotel staff were all pleasant. PH offers an upbeat casino and an all around fun atmosphere. I do wish that the hotel had nicer rooms but not a big deal. BTW -- check out Gallery Nightclub when you go --- it's beautiful! When I was there LL Cool J performed live. For absolute relaxation -- I will continue to stay at the Wynn --- for fun times with friends ---- Planet Hollywood!
What a piece of crap hotel this is. The rooms are terrible and smells like shit. Paid 270 for this never again, this shit is like a motel 6.
fun place to stay.  the decor in our room was pretty out dated but I can't complain too much cuz it was free.

Friends and I stayed here for a two night weekend and enjoyed every bit of it.  Even though we didn't get the room we wanted (Hollywood Hip room with 2 queens), they were able to accommodate us in a bigger room with 1 king and a roll in bed (for no extra cost) which was very cool.

Overall, the hotel is nice, rooms are hip, and they have the miracle mile shops which was awesome.  

If I were to do it all over again, I'd get the Resort Room with the view of the strip.

Ok, if you have never been to Vegas you need to understand that the normal rules don't apply. There are no cheap options for good food or really anything else, that's not how Vegas works.

PH is in a pretty central location compared to a lot of the other hotels. I like to hang out further North on the strip and it's not far from here. When it comes to price this is a great place to stay, especially if you book early. But don't be mistaken you don't want to hang around PH for nightlife, head North on the strip. The pool is also horrible, there is a reason it's free and there are a bunch of kids there.

There is a mall attached to PH that has some relatively inexpensive options for food, there is a pizza place (near the canal) that is decent. There is a good buffet, it's not cheap though.

If you want to hear popular music in your hotel you should stay here. If you don't mind\/want to see scantily clad women working in the Casino stay here.

I'm glad I came here so I can pay $18 dollars in valet and still wait exactly 28 minutes for my car to be brought around. Was it busy you ask? Not a single soul in Valet. I'm standing here alone... still 28 minutes to get my car. I ask the Valet attendant why is it taking so long? She tells me because we get all casino guests before you. Ohhh awesome I reply. So forget first come first serve for the MAIN hotel valet. Let's make me wait another 28 minutes AFTER paying an insane amount for Valet. That's just such an awesome business model you have.

LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

For all the people complaining about the noise and partying, this place isn't for you. If you are 35+, go to Paris across the street. This place is a hip location that caters to the 21-33 crowd.

Super fun casino, great drinks, great atmosphere, tons of hot girls walking around, some expected drunk guys. This place is the exact reason I come to Vegas. If i have to stay at the Wynn, Palazzo or Bellagio, I would be bored to death.

Really enjoyed staying here. Stayed for a 5 day conference. This hotel is central to everything on the strip. I went to Earl of Sandwich to eat every single day we were there. Great sandwiches at a normal price $6 or $4 for breakfast. Got to do some gambling too and while I'm not quite sure I won, they have some fun slot machines. Our room was very clean and checking in was easy. However, our friends who slipped the guy a $20 got a waaaaay better room, upgraded to a suite overlooking the Bellagio fountain. Now I know for next time. Only bad part about this place is the casino level is super hard to navigate. It took us five days to somewhat figure out the layout and  I'm still thinking we would get lost in there. Would definitely stay here again.

Valet stained my car with big oil footprints on our Mercedes. Very disappointed. Hotel is ok and great location but disappointed with Valet. If they have oil on their feet, probably shouldn't get in customers car.

I was pretty disgusted with the lack of cleanliness. There was some kind of  bodily fluid stain on the duvet cover. Our neighbors room service food tray sat out in the hallway on the floor for over 24 hours. The only good thing about it is the location.

Location, location, location - and that's why I would give 5 stars.  However, there is evidence of wear and tear in the rooms, internet access sucks, and the access to self- parking is a hassle for hotel guests and that is why I am taking away 2 of their stars. 

 I love that it is in the middle of the strip and that there are shops and restaurants.  
Forgot to pack something? Go down to their shops like Urban Outfitters or Sephora, or the ABC Store for snacks and alcohol. They are also home to Earls Sandwich (24 Hour sandwich spot). 

The negatives: Their rooms are a bit older and not as posh as Cosmo or Wynn.  The room we stayed in last had a credenza with missing doors and it's lights wouldnt turn on.  Also, you could tell there was a spot for a fridge but no fridge.  If you self-park, you  have to lug your luggage nearly halfway through the Miracle Mile Shops just to get to your car. I guess we could do Valet but then we would have to wait to get our car back each time, and I hate waiting.  Internet access? Forget about it.  No reception in the rooms or when you're down in the casino or shops (and its not just AT&T because friends on different carriers also have had that same problem).  PH's solution?  Pay $14 for 24 hour internet access to one device in the room (no thanks). 

I will continue to stay at PH because it is cheaper than Cosmo and in a great location, but I will also continue to complain about not having good free internet access and having to walk a ways to get to self-park.
Had the best time, after 3days returned rental car. Everything is in walking distance. Gordon Ramsay has the best food. Of all the restaurants.

Id like to call this wasted Wednesday. At 10am went to the front desk and let them know we are having trouble opening the bathroom door. Came back up and key cards weren't working. Went back down from the 20th floor. Let them know. Came back up still didn't work. On the plus side my kids were in the room so i was able to get in. They started a work order and apologized. About 45 min later i called to see whats going on. Cant leave, because we wont be able to get back in. In the mean time my son needs the bathroom and we cant get the door open. Trying to get a 2yr old to understand he has to hold it doesn't work. (Shower it is) this is kinda humiliating.He cried so hard when he couldn't use the potty. He didn't want to use the shower but couldn't hold it any longer.  Finally got a guy up here to start working on it at 11:45. Lots of I'm sorry's  but that doesn't get my time back or make me feel like we were compensated at all for issues we had no control over. Pretty disappointed. Ill update if things get better or god forbid worse..edit they fixed the bathroom door and replaced the battery in the front door. Im so glad i found the screw left on the floor before my 2yr old could. Still no compensation or even being checked on to make sure everything is ok. My son has been dealing with diarrhea since.

This was by far the worst hotel I have stayed in on the Strip, and definitely not the cheapest.  The lady at the registration desk was not friendly at all.  We got into our room and were immediately not impressed.  The room was very dark.  There was a small desk light and one end table lamp.  There was also a large lamp in the corner, but it was not plugged in for some reason.  It did work though, once we found the problem.  There was also some running lights around the room that did not work at all.  There was a missing drawer and missing doors in the dresser.  There was only one single accessible outlet, which we discovered later also didn't work.  We complained about the light at the front desk within an hour after checking in.  The desk clerk offered to move our room, but insinuated that it wouldn't get any better.  He did supposedly place a work order for the lights, although we never saw or heard from anybody and they were never fixed.  After showering the next day, I discovered there was no hair dryer in the room.  They brought me one the next day, and it did not work.  After spending three nights in the hotel, I was finally able to actually dry my hair!  We were staying at PH on New Year's Eve, and our friends that were travelling with us received information in their rooms about the street closing, but that was not provided to us.  We also learned from visiting other rooms, that our room was also missing an end table lamp.  Some other minor details, that I'm sure bothered me more based on our terrible experience...the furniture was haphazardly placed blocking access to the window, our bed was not made on the last day, there were two closets but only one had hangars.  The location is good, but I definitely recommend staying elsewhere.  There are plenty of options on the Strip, many priced more reasonably than PH.

We didn't stay at Planet Hollywood, but spent a LOT of time there on our most recent trip - gambling, eating, drinking, and shopping. 

Casino - nice and spread out. Craps dealers are all great and craps tables were always fun when we were playing (maybe it was because WE made it fun;) ). There's a starbucks within the casino, which is VERY nice- especially since we all got in late after a full days work and just wanted to grab a quick sandwich in between gambling. 

Food - we ate at Cabo Wabo, starbucks, late night @ Earl of sandwich, and PF Changs. All were great - friendly servers\/employees, great food, good drinks (PF), etc. PF Changs should probably have asked the 4 20something year olds who were already intoxicated who came in to eat lettuce wraps and do saki bombs and drink a ridiculous amount (us....) to leave the nice, family friendly atmosphere... but they didn't... and we were grateful ;) 

Shopping - countless number of shops - only shopped for an hour or so, but they have everything from clothing stores to electronic stores to souvenir shops.

**THEY HAVE GARRETTS POPCORN** - I literally saw a guy carrying a bag of popcorn from the corner of my eye in the casino, recognized it as garretts bag, and followed him (im not creepy i promise) until I caught up to see where he got it from... and it was in their mall.... Needless to say, THIS previous chitown resident was THRILLED ;)
Gross!!!  Room is dirty and  looks like a major fight went down.  Carpet is torn up, patched hole in wall, cabinet I has  major scratches all over.  This is no resort!

A nice hotel on the strip. Rooms are movie themed: the room we stayed at had Pulp Fiction memorabilia.

Our room was fairly clean. No refrigerator though so I was a bit disappointed. If you want one in your room there is an extra charge.

There is a separate shower and large tub. Bathrooms were very roomy and well lit. 

The casino area is great. Lots of tables and machines. There are also dining areas and Starbucks, even though I must say paying $5+ for a venti is ridiculous. In addition they don't accept Starbucks rewards.

My one major disappointed is the parking situation. The valet for the hotel is always full so you end up parking in the Miracle Mile mall parking lot. The entrance to the hotel from the mall parking lot entrance is 1\/2 a mile! So basically you go through half the mall. Not bad if you don't mind the walk but when you are carrying heavy luggage and\/or are running late, it can be a major hassle.

Note you can valet your car at the Miracle Mile valet but note during closed hours (11p to I believe 9a) you will need to contact security to pick up your car because there is no valet attendant at that time.

I like the location of where this is located which is center strip. Earls and Fat Tuesday is right down stairs and so is the miracle miles shops. Cosmo is right across the street and if I ever need anything, Walgreens is also located at planet hollywood. 

The rooms, however, seem really old. Some things in our room were broken or just old. I had the hollywood hip king room and it was pretty small. Just enough room for the bed. The front desk was able to upgrade my room to a strip view at no cost which was nice. The cost isn't too shabby either. I stayed here because we had an offer for $27\/a night. But even without a special, I've seen pretty low prices here for being on the strip.
The lady dealers rock! U most sit at 'La Ninga's table for blackjack and play roulette with Marie....very fun
This place is not well kept, smells like smoke and the rooms are dark with only a small window for the queen size one bed option. Let down.

I love Planet Hollywood - the staff has always given exceptional customer service and the casino is nice. 

So I am asking PH to please get rid of Prive Nightclub. For all that PH has to offer, any hotel guest going into Prive, will NOT want to stay at PH anymore. Not only are the doormen and bouncers extremely rude, they are also pervy and stand offish. They give you the "hint" of putting out in order to get in for free. I'd rather pay the cover. The crowd was not upscale at all. I would spend my money somewhere else. Since Prive is not owned by PH, get rid of it. The club is mkaing your hotel look bad! 

I only give PH 4 stars because I love the hotel, amenities, staff and casino. get rid of Prive and I would give it 5 stars.

ugh, really wanted to like this hotel but the room we got was on the 32nd floor and was dark, dingy and old.. the bed was cozy but because lets face it the room was pretty scary and dark and I could only imagine the scary things hiding in there..the hotel was pretty cool looking, the pool was pretty boring so we didnt bother getting in..

The staff are rude and the pool area is the worst I have ever seen. Just a huge concrete slab with no atmosphere. The pool bar was shocking and like some sort of back packers kiosk. Awful. The check in staff were horrible and stung us with an upgrade charge because we didn't want a smoking room, despite giving them prior notice. I will never ever come back here.

It doesn't hurt that we're traveling with Seven Stars members, so our upgraded room on the 22nd floor had a view of the mini Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains in the distance. I do wish a mini-fridge were included in the room, but alas, a small inconvenience since we were often out and about.

Room was clean, modern and spacious. The location of the TV (in proximity to the chairs and bed) was a bit odd, but we only watched TV to check in on the a.m. news (oh look...another warm, sunny day in Vegas). 

Location is good for walking around, although we did Uber quite a bit as casino blocks are not like neighborhood blocks and the best shoes in the world won't save your feet after a long day of walking around. Played a few penny slots and did okay, but I'm talking about penny slots here...so my $14 payout on my $1 play isn't exactly covering our expenses.

Located next to a strip of shops, we did visit the ABC store to stock up a couple of essentials. The Starbucks in the hotel and Earl of Sandwich in the casino is a life saver for when your time-clock is all a-mess from the sensory overload for which Vegas is known.

Plenty of entertainment in the casino, whether gambling, listening to folks sing karaoke or going to a show. Customer service was friendly. Security was prompt to respond to the drunken 3 a.m. hallway scream-match between a group of guys.

Awful service at the front desk. Reserved a room with 2 queen beds and they said they don't guarantee rooms when you reserve them. The lady on the phone when I made the reservations clearly told me the room would have 2 queens. The front desk wasn't helpful at all in remedying the situation.

I'd expect some sort of kickback since we didn't get the room we wanted, we had a reservation for a 4 night stay period, and had a large group of 4 different rooms. You would think they would want our future business. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vegas. Definitely staying at the Palazzo next time.

Lots of seats to rest your weary feet while you are on  the Strip. Quite a few reasonably priced souvenir shops for any who wants a little bit of Vegas to take home. The restrooms are clean, so that is a big plus.

Walk into the lobby of the hotel, and you are greeted by beautiful floor to celieng light fixtures that are roped chandelier style. looks swanky, so I got super excited!
We got there around 11ish, so there was barely a line at check in and I was crossing my fingers that our room was ready. We were greeted by a young man who was super nice and gave us a "high level" room simply cus we asked..LOL. and the room was ready!

We got into the room, and we were shocked at how nice it was. Ive stayed at 5 star\/diamond hotels before at vegas and I thought this was going to be a downgrade..but it met my expectations. 
The decor is modern with deep purples, black, and velvet. The bed was super comfy and I fell in love with the pillows. 
The bathroom was huuuge! If you have ever stayed at the Venetian or the Palazzo, it is the same idea and size. There is a shower and a seperate deep sunken bathtub, for two or three! But I turned it into a makeshift fridge (alot of ice) and alchy bottles. The cleaning ladies didnt mind at all! 
Plus we had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain\/water show and Paris' Eifel Tower!
Ohh..BTW the rooms are themed after movies..we got the Robin Hood theme, thank god we didnt get the Exorcist room..lol
The only con about the room is that we had to call security to fix our in-room safe and the armoir door literally fell on my foot!!!

The casino looks huge, but its a mind trick..lol. The casino is built in a circle..so it looks like there is alot of table games and slots. If you want a lil spice with ur table games go to the "Pleasure Pit", a few girls dancing in the middle with poles. Kind of a knock off the PussyCat Dolls Lounge at Ceasars Palace outside of Pure. Didnt play much here, not much action and the casino is kinda dead..rather hit up the Bellagio across the street or the Venetian for more fun in the casino.

Another plus for the "miracle mile shops"...sooo much good shopping to do here! 

I would def stay here again!

The outside of this hotel is the complete opposite of the inside.  It looked like a barbie dream house EXPLODED inside here and Barbie somehow became naked and running around dealing cards.  We came here to gamble for a bit and I nearly died of either happiness or anger when I saw the pink tables with hearts to bet in.  The dealers were all women who shuffled with their breasts together just for us.  It was highly distracting and I swear all the women had bangin' 20 year old bodies with not so bangin 45 year old faces.  I also don't know if I can trust a woman with a rack the size of my head to count to 21 that fast.  Basically I lost a bunch of money here in the pleasure pit and made my way back to Paris.

Stayed at the hotel during a conference. Liked the room. Spacious layout. Not a five star but clean and has a great location. A bit difficult navigating the casino and back to the elevators. I'm sure by design. Only downside was my room spelt like marijuana.  My clothes in the wardrobe style closet spelt of it. Security advised it's coming in through the vents and nothing to be done. Not legal to spoke in hotels, but might exist in other hotels. I haven't experienced it before. Kinda skeeved that I'm breathing in other rooms recycled air, bit I think that's hotel normal too. All and all I would stay again. I do recommend the hotel for a less expensive alternative to Aria and Cosmopolitan locations.

I've stayed here two years ago when they first started construction on the new Planet Hollywood. They did a great job in giving the place a much needed face lift. Its now a hot and trendy spot where you can Gamble and get your drink on. Attached to the casino is the Miracle Mile shopping ball. I have to say that the ABC store in the mall is a life saver. Everything you need is sold especially bottled water to rehydrate yourself after a long night of drinking! 

We had a Jr. suite and was pretty big. It had a large 47 inch flat screen and a HUGE bathroom with a tub and shower along with his and hers sinks. 

The Vibe at ph is cool but there isn't much else to do there except to eat, drink, shop and gamble. The casino floor isn't very big but it has everything you want to see in a casino. Service was good and I would consider staying at PH again.

I love the casino and shopping here. This place has great restaurants too. I would stay here again but would not stay in their cheapest room. It was dated and just kind of gross. Not terrible but for the money I paid I expected more. Not sure if a room upgrade would help. The bathroom was very nice. Great location on the strip. I recommend eating at Koi and Gordon Ramsey's Burger restaurants.

Awesome casino - Thank you Triple Double Diamond Deluxe with Cheese slot machine!

Hot dealers - mostly girls

Guest Service - turned us down to view rooms at their new Westgate building because my husband and i didn't make over $60,000 a year combined, this is all after talking to us for 10 minutes, making us fill out the damn form and enticing us with a free show... HOW RUDE..

For the amount of money that goes to this hotel and casino, you'd think that they would be proficient in finding you an answer. I called the box office to answer questions I had on tickets for a show. They stated the box office opens at 10am. I drive down there through traffic. Get there just to find out they don't open til 12pm. Wait til 12pm in line. Then they tell me the specific box office opens at 2pm. Just a complete waste of time. Dread wasting money in this establishment or any other Caesars Entertainment group property. Very disappointing.

We went here to celebrate my son's bday.. I was so excited because last time i checked in here, it was Alladin Hotel and we had a nice suite
room..Unfortunately, planet holkywood is a big disappointment.. rude receptionist, rude front desk.. bathroom sink is clogged and its leaking from underneath, the shower room is clogged.. i slipped and almost fell in the bathroom.. i called the front desk to request if we cam change of room, and he told
me in a flat voice, "not
tonight, only tom during check out time".. no apologies heard.. we called the housekeeping to give us more bathroom
rug for overflowed water.. he is the only person who apologize for inconvenience, he called the maintenance and he came at around 1:30am.. after he drained the water from the shower and bathroom sink, he left it so dirty (yuck!!) i didnt really feel
comfortable after that.. that early morning, i went straight to the receptionist for
change of room.. still the same "no smile, no  word of sorry" not even concerned with the guest complaint..  im never gonna check
in here again.. i go to vegas at least 10x\/year.. if you want a really pleasant staff, whollmake you feel at home and comfortable, then dont go in here.. ive been to palazzo, venetian, nobu, trump, hard rock suites, ceasars, aria, wynn and encore.. this hotel by far is the worst ive been

I couldn't have possibly found a better hotel to celebrate my 21st birthday than Planet Hollywood. Working at a hotel, I am pretty critical of most properties and to know that when I checked out impressed with PH it was a great feeling. From check-in to check-out the customer service was top notch and something that I would praise. Upon check-in the staff was amazingly friendly and sincerely excited for my birthday! The process was quick and painless and in no time we were headed up to our room with Britney Spears room keys in hand! The view was amazing and I'm sure we were upgraded from a standard (booked the room at $45) to premium strip view\/fountains because it was breathtaking from the 38th floor. Cleanliness of the room was superb and shot down all negative pictures and paranoia of stained sheets and mildew in strange areas. The casino had such a young hip feel to all of it that it didn't seem too outrageously fancy and just made me feel comfortable. The Britney Spears elevators had my fiancé taking selfies left and right and partying to the music in them up to the room. The Axis theatre for Britney was very intimate and somewhere I know we will come back to. After a few drinks I quickly realized what I loved most was the central location of the hotel and how nice it is to be able to stumbled to the room without a cab or long walk to the other side of the strip! Overall I would highly recommend this Resort and Casino for its exceptional staff, room cleanliness, location and low rates.

The casino and the mall is awesome! But this review is not about the casino or the mall,  I was a little surprised though for my first time staying at Planet Hollywood, the rooms were not that impressive. No fridge, not closet or drawer space. When I called for a fridge, they were going to charge me additional fees for the luxury of having a mini fridge. As being platinum rewards member,  I would think a fridge is a small accommodation. Room service was quick, and efficient, and house keeping was very responsive. But lobby help was rude and seemed as if they were unhappy about being there. I am not sure if I would ever book a room here again. Rooms are old, and need an update, and the resort fee is a joke for the simple fact that there isn't much of a resort... Only half of there pool is open for crying out loud!
Beautiful place to spend the night or few and they even gabr their grand big mall top walk around in circles and but your self something pretty

We came here to shop, eat, and catch a show.  We loved the layout of their shopping area and the show we caught was called the Variety Show. Damn good if you ask me! My review is based on everything we exp outside of staying at the hotel itself. Would love to stay here sometime to see how the rest of the casino is like.

Once you get past the disorganized and confusing shit show that is their shopping mall Planet Hollywood is actually an interesting casino with a great open floor plan to the gaming area and plenty of unique areas to explore.  Featuring plenty of entertainment options and venues plus a few eateries worth checking out plus one of the more spacious parking structures on the central strip I think pH and the Miracle Mile Shops provide an intermediate between the low and the high of Vegas, the sort of place where there is something for everyone but at the same time nothing in particular worth 'seeking out.'

We just had an awesome stay here for the weekend. This place is so generous with the comps. We're not high rollers by any means but Planet Hollywood picked up the tab and paid for EVERYTHING. Rooms were over $250 a night and we paid nothing. They comped us at the restaurants and shops and even gave me chips to play at the tables. We ended up walking out of here big winners too so I have absolutely no complaints about this place. Drinks are easy to get and they have a stellar selection of table games and machines. The dealers and other players are all so friendly too. You do get your typical groups of loud douchey drunk meatheads roaming around but that goes to be expected if you're staying on the Strip. Overall one of my top favorite places to stay in Vegas for sure.

I loved this hotel until my last experience. 

The rooms are cheap but the front desk staff are so unbearably rude. I purchased $55 worth of pictures from the pool (since they have the WaveRider now) which the employees at digiphoto would leave for me at the pool or at the front desk since they were having trouble with the system. I went to the front desk to pick up the USB and they looked at me like I was crazy and said they don't take things for people there and to check lost and found. After checking with lost and found and the pool I rechecked with the front desk who more or less waived me off. The manager wouldn't even come out to talk to me about the issue.  

Horrible customers service. I'll stay else where from now on.

As of oct 1st 2012 all of the total rewards hotels charge $25 for checking in b4 3pm :-( SUCKS! I arrived about 12 noon yesterday (after staying at Bally's 2 days :-) ) & asked if my rm was ready. The lady at the frnt desk advised me of the brand new policy, regardless if they had rooms ready or not. I decided to keep my $25 for gambling, so I left my luggage at the bell desk. Cool. I came back for my luggage at 2:45 & got in line to get my rm key (the lady b4 had pre-registered me) when I got 2 the frnt desk the lady told me my rm wasn't ready! REALLY? Needless 2 say I was a bit pissed off, I said "you don't have anything available? I just picked up my luggage. I have to come back? Why can't u just get me another room?" The lady reluctantly said "let me check." She did get me a room, but why did I have 2 ask? Their customer service needs a bit of polishing!!! They gave me rm 1411, it was very nice (eddie murphy themed), very modern furniture & huge roman tub. The only thing I didn't like about the room is that the window is very small so it doesn't get much light. On a good note, the bed was oohhh ssssoooo comfortable & so were the pillows. The bathroom has a seperate glass shower & the water pressure was oh so welcomed after a long day & no winning :-(  the cocktail waitresses are very pleasant & come around often. I would stay here again (especially since my rooms are comped), but I won't expect friendly & welcoming service at the front desk. Oh.... their buffet is pretty good 2. Although 99% of the desserts are cupcakes, lots of flavors though.
Great room. Stayed 6-17\/6-19. Nice staff. Would def go back!

I did not like Planet Hollywood the walls were extremely thin in the rooms and you could hear other peoples conversations the casino was we got two nights free for going to listen for a timeshare which they kept pushing and pushing I finally got mad and got up and left I would never do that again for their Westgate timeshares

check in was quick on a memorial day weekend, on saturday. we got the sargent bilko room. bathroom is large toilet has its own room large tub for your drinks. comfy bed, flat screen and a view of the PH TOWERS. trendy casino, hotel for the young crowd, i would definetly stay there again may the westgate ph lol. btw please do valet its free anyways.bellhops were dolls.

Best thing about this hotel is that Earl of Sandwich is downstairs!  This hotel also houses the Miracle Mile Shops so you have easy access to Fat Tuesdays and affordable shopping (H&M, Billabong, an ABC store) if you stay at his hotel.

As for the rooms, it is just your standard hotel room decorated with movie memorabilia from popular movies.  We liked our very spacious bathroom though.  Shower and hot tub, and lots of sink space.  Unlike the former PH Towers (now called Elara), there are not many outlets for charging your electronics (seems like a MUST these days living the smart phone\/ipad\/kindle\/tablet age).

For casino, since Britney does her shows here, they do a lot of promoting and play a lot of Britney's songs in the casino.  They also have a pleasure pit for some of the card games.  Dancers will come out at night in the pit.

Not much to complain about this hotel so I wouldn't mind staying here again. The sleeping rooms alone are 3 stars but I'm bumping it to 4 because of all the easy access to shopping and Earls downstairs.

This hotel (Casino not included) is not out of this planet - world? This is the second time I've stayed here and I'm not completely impressed. I get the whole wanting to get the dimly lit, dark furnishing Hollywood vibe, but what is with that niche in the room? That huge space between the two faux columns in the rooms are not convincing anyone that it's supposed to be that way. The Elvis room had a shadow box in the niche with a night light that spooked me. My bed was right next to it and needless to say my back was turned to it the entire stay (no disrespect to the King). The biggest complaint was the water pressure in the shower? There are toilets that have more pressure than this in any hotel and in any town. How can the tub have more pressure than the shower? Well they get a star for the comfy tub and the pressure there. 
Our room didn't get cleaned the first night. Do they not keep track of which rooms have been cleaned? None of the trash cans were emptied, hair stuck to the shower floor...sad. The beds were comfy, but the lighting in the room and bathroom is awful. The lights in the bathroom made us look greenish yellow and the room itself was dark and dreary. there are only 2 drawers to unpack your clothes...actually, i should probably shouldn't unpack considering the room we ended up with is a smoker's room - bleh! I think we booked early enough to reserve a nonsmoking room. I'd wake up in the middle of the night inhaling smoke residue - I could feel it going up my nose...disgusting! 
I don't think they did a full-on renovation because they have some of the Aladdin fixtures and wallpaper. Who do they think they're kidding? 
I really enjoy gambling at this casino, but they really need to work on the hotel.

Perfect location, which is super important!!! Spacious room. Cheap price if you avoid the busy season. Nice shopping mall with most of the stuff you would need to buy.

A little complaint, I stayed for 4 days, for the first three days no one cleaned the room, changed the towel, etc. etc. Also the room is outdated.

We enjoyed our stay at Planet Hollywood.  A friend seemed to have allergies everytime she was in the room, so that was a bummer.  We loved the Miracle Mile shops since they had everything one could possibly need without requiring us to leave the hotel.  We also really loved their little cafe called Planet Dailies for breakfast.  The food was awesome.  

The Pools: 
-The pools close at 7pm!!  (We were bummed since we wanted to float around after dinner w\/ some drinks)
-2 Pools on 6th floor (the 18+ pool was featured on "Knocked Up") 
-6th floor pools do not have much seating adjacent to the pool.  You will need to get to the pools before 10am if you plan to have a good spot or plan on renting a cabana for the day for about $200 (includes a fruit bowl & wait service) 
-The pool on the main level (featured on Holly's World) which belongs to the West Tower we were told is accessible to guests staying at the hotel.  It's much prettier, but plan on having your buns on display since a Miracle Mile throughfare runs alongside the entire pool.

The Gym:
I didn't go because I was feeling cheap.  $25 to use the gym for one day!  A fair amount of people run\/walk along the strip in the morning.  We found this to be an entertaining substitute.

If I could give zero stars, I would. The rooms are filthy, even after changing rooms and asking for the new room to be cleaned again. Customer service is good but that should be a given in the hospitality industry. DO NOT BOOK A ROOM HERE U LESS YOU PLAN TO NEVER BE IN YOUR ROOM FOR ANYTHING OTHER THAN USING THE TOILET.

I came here to celebrate my anniversary with my fiancé and had so many issues with the room. 
One ply toilet paper really was not pleasant for us, the shower was flooding and I slipped and had to call housekeeping to get it fixed. We told them we would leave the room for an hour and they can come in then. We came back to the room, called and asked if they had came in and they had no idea what we were talking about...so after 15 minutes of waiting for housekeeping to check with the shower guy- someone finally came in. 
The next day we waited for housekeeping to come in, and they never did. At 8:00 at night I had to call in and ask for someone to come clean our room. 
The tv was hot, the wifi as promised online didn't come through\/false advertisement, you actually have to pay for it. 
I spent most of my time calling housekeeping while in the room. 
It's a shame this hotel is in a good location, but has so many faults. I will not be back here.

Very good service at check in even though it was very busy.  If you are a Blackjack player you will be please to know that they change the rules at the tables several times a day that enables you to find a table that increases you odds.  That's nice.  Great location again.  I will return.

I am very happy this has became apart of Harris gaming! They are the only ones that have keno at the bar (heart bar). I love this bar. Sandy and Michael are the best as far as bartenders go! When ever i am at the strip i alway go into see them. In the day time it is a slow pace which i love. I am not about the clubbing type scene. At night full of young people drinking and it turns loud.

Ok so my partner and I spent the weekend of July 29th to July 31st at this hotel.  We were there to see "All I have" by J.lo, Amazing show btw.  So, my partner thought it would be a good idea to stay at the same hotel that the show would be so that we could drink and not have to worry about getting to the venue and so forth.  We have never stayed at this hotel so it seemed like a good idea.  Well, when we got to our room on the 17th floor, the first thing we noticed immediately getting off the elevator, was that the lobby area "not registration" but when you exit the elevator on your floor to go into the hall ways towards your room, there was no air conditioning, mind you the temperature this weekend was 115 degrees when we arrived and humid, which I have never experienced before in Vegas, but anyway, the lobby\/hall way were at least 85 degrees inside the hotel.  Once we made it to our room, as I open the door the first thing to hit me is the smell of Pine sol\/slash bathroom if you can imagine that smell. The rooms were pretty roomy and actually very large, the bathroom was huge (Plus) but that was about it.  The air was at Max and the room felt like it was barely at 75 degrees, there was no mini fridge, we quickly found out that we could rent one for $20\/day! No thanks.  So we take a chill and decide to nap and then shower to hit the town.  It took literally like 5 minutes for warm water to come out the shower. We called it in and the response we got was, "this is normal is high rise hotels"  What?  Really?  UUHhhmm, I have stayed at multiple hotels on the strip on floors higher than the 17th floor, and that has never happened.  Being a CA resident and knowing that we are in an extreme drought, wasting so much water just to take a shower hurt.  So then we head down to the pool and we find out that in order to enjoy ourselves near the small pool, that was overcrowded, cloudy water, that they have for a 23 floor mega hotel, we have to rent the chairs at $20\/ person per day.  The towels were free though.  The hotel is run down, the elevators have no air ventilation inside either, they took forever, the hallways are dirty and fixtures falling apart.  No premium channels and the tv is like 10 years old.  The Wi-Fi was free but it sucked major balls, I had no reception the entire weekend, and if you wanted an upgrade, you guessed it, $9.99 for two devices per day. The last and quite possibly the most disgusting thing I experienced and unfortunately did not see until the last day, was that my white sheets had blood stains on them.  Never again, for the price that we paid, we could have stayed at The Mandalay Bay which we have stayed before and it has been awesome.  I can't believe that this hotel is part of Caesar's Palace.  Never again!!  I guess all their money is going into paying Britney and J.lo that they have forgotten about the property.  The one star is for the customer service we received, it was appropriate.

Review only for the Performing Arts Center.

The Performing Arts Center in the Planet Hollywood (formerly the Aladdin) still has the best sound and sight lines for concerts in Las Vegas. Recently saw Nine Inch Nails perform and it was outstanding. Access in and out of the theater was a breeze with no long waits even to the rest rooms. Ticket prices are modest compared to other venues like the Pearl.

This review is for the casino only.  

The PH Casino is always crowded and generally quite noisy.  I've played there before a show or when I went there for dinner but this is not a destination casino for me.

I do find a fair variety of games but I generally stay in one area near the Miracle Mile Shops.

A couple things bothered me about this place
1) 45 minutes to check-in at 10PM at night with only 3 employees working the counter
2) no mini-bar inside the room
3) Our view in the room was pretty much overlooking the roof of the attached mall
4) They need more lighting in the room
I'll give an A-OK score to an A-OK hotel....
Pricewise, you'll probably get a deal than staying at other hotels on the strip.

The Pleasure Pit and Earl of Sandwich would be my favorite highlights.  The hotel is connected to the Miracle Mile shops which is convenient and I like that the hotel is pretty central on the strip.  I am an asthmatic and the smoke seems so much worse here than other hotels\/casinos.  Bring your eye drops.  PH should invest in some sort of ventilation system.  The decor seems outdated. The carpets in the halls need stretched and the rooms' bathrooms redone. The bathrooms are large with a tub, but who uses a tub in a hotel anyway.  I would rather a double sink or vanity area to make getting ready easier.  Also there is no closet only a small armoire.  I thought the room was good.  It was clean and the beds comfortable.  It has the perfect amount of amenities since you spend almost no time in there. I wish the rooms' windows were larger and more centered on the wall so you can see the view.  The pool is pretty private (on the 6th floor) and I like that they have two separate pool areas; one is 21+ and the other a family pool. The adult pool has a DJ most days of the week but it's still a far cry from the other party pools. This is more of a pool to relax. I was shocked that for such a lack luster experience you have to pay so much for beds\/cabanas at the pool.  They were running a spa deal for $99 if you choose at least $200 in services. With this you also get to spend the day using the other spa amenties (gym, hot tub, showers, steam room and sauna).  The deal seemed good but after my facial I only stayed an hour because I ran out of things to do.  What they should do is get rid of Koi (Its so bad they give out free open bar all night every night to everyone- males included)  and revamp the spa area.  It is outdated.  Although I haven't been, I heard Aria has great spa amenities such hot stone beds, a pool, etc. and the things I mentioned above.  The gym at PH costs $25 a day and I'm not sure why.  It has less equipment than a Holiday Inn.

It seems like this hotel has gone down since it's days as The Aladdin.  Although the casino is newly renovated, it seems like little more than new wallpaper and pictures on the wall.  

Here is why I gave it only 1 star:

PROS:
1)  The Miracle Mile mall - it's great to have this in the hotel when you need a last minute shopping trip before you go out for the evening.
2)  The Dailies Coffee Shop - HUGE menu with pretty delicious food!
3)  Starbucks - inside the hotel!  Need I say more?
4)  Bell staff - Our room wasn't ready at the check-in time (even though we had registered with the front desk in the early AM, so we checked-in our luggage with the bell staff so we could go to the spa, and lay by the pool.  We had gone in\/out of the checked-luggage area multiple times throughout the day, and they were always so nice and accommodating.  

CONS:
1)  We checked in at the front desk at 8:30am, even though check-in was at 3pm.  But at check-in time, our room still wasn't ready!
2)  The door on the armoire was falling off the hinge and almost fell on my friend when we tried to use it!  
3)  NO hair dryer in the room!!!  - even Holiday Inn has one!!  WTH!
4)  We asked for additional towels, and no one showed up.
5)  We were at this hotel for 2 nights\/3 days, and no one came to clean our room!
6)  The pool here is HORRIBLE!  It's 2 small rectangular pools on either side of a HUGE cemented patio.  There isn't much space poolside to hold many people so the lounge chairs are side to side and you have to climb in from the end of the lounge chair to get in!  The only area with a lot more lounge chairs is the cemented area which is extremely hot, no umbrellas, trees, or even misters!  Good luck frying in there!  AND, don't even think of getting a cabana here.  Yes, it's reasonable at $500, on the weekends, but it's nothing more than a portable tent with ratty day beds underneath.  The pool waitresses are not the ones you would expect at a big hotel during the summer: ugly bathing suits, sandals that look like they came from Goodwill, and some should be wearing more clothing than swimsuits.  Also, no one kept the lounging areas clean.  We arrived at about 2pm at the pools, and there were empty plates laying on the floor, behind, and on top of empty lounge chairs.  No one collected towels from lounge chairs that people had vacated, so it looked like a tornado.  Gross!
7)  There are no signs or directories - We had to ask multiple people (who all told us varying directions) where to find the pool (located on the 6th floor of the South Elevators), the Spa (on the Mezzanine level), the concert area (you have to go into the mall)
8)  The website SUCKS!  Bad layout, barely any pictures of the pool, you have to type in the name of the Spa in a internet search engine to find their website!  You can't navigate into the spa website from the Planet Hollywood Hotel and Casino website.  


If you have to stay around this particular location on the strip, here are your ALTERNATIVES:
1)  The Towers at Planet Hollywood - nicer rooms, nicer staff, much much nicer pool, nicer everything!
2)  Paris - cozy rooms
3)  Bally's - big rooms
4)  Caeser's Palace - a classic
5) The Cosmopolitan - because it's new
6) Aria - just beautiful
7) Bellagio - same as #6

The best place to party like a Rock Star.

Planet Hollywood might not be the biggest, most well known, or fanciest, but it's definitely one of the best bang for the buck. They are located in the center of the strip across from the famous Bellagio Hotel, You'll have easy access to explore the other hotels and attractions on the strip. There is a liquor store at the Miracle Mile (ABC Store), with reasonable prices. I always find this place 50-80 dollars cheaper per night compared to rest of the big name hotels in Vegas and the rooms are very clean. The Go-Go dancers make the Pleasure Pit a fun place to gamble and buffet (Spice Market) downstairs is fantastic. If you show your loyalty, Planet Hollywood will welcome you back with free complimentary night stays. I've been offered those vouchers a couple times already, even though I'm not a big gambler. They were recently acquired by Harrah's from Starwood, so I might write follow-up review on the new management. 

A little about my credentials:

My baby face makes it difficult for me to walk around Vegas, but go there about 4-5 times a year. I've stayed at various hotels, but recently decided to stick with Planet Hollywood. I'm that big of gambler; I've tried counting cards at Blackjack but I can't count past 10 without using my fingers. I think I do better with dumb luck anyways.

We were staying here for a week.  We have stayed here a few times in the past couple of years.  I have to say that this stay was just ok.  Our bed was, for the first time, horribly uncomfortable.  25th floor --overlooking the pools and across from Cosmopolitan.  The band at Cosmopolitan plays till midnight on the weekend--and plays very loud!!  OMG loud!  We could actually feel the room vibrating with the music.  5 STARS for housekeeping!!  We rent a car while we are in Vegas--the drawback for us is parking in the garage at Planet, and getting through the mall to get to the casino to get to the elevators.  a good 20-25 minutes (ok, we are in our 50's, so maybe we are slower).  Breakfast at the Buffet is good--make sure to go to the Destinations website to print out $5 discount coupon for the buffet--and make copies, too--it's good anytime.
Our room was Hollywood Hip--it was not a brightly lit room, by any means--bathroom is poorly lit, as well.  But I do like that the shower is separate from the tub.  
Be aware that when you book and pay for your room ahead of time, that you will be charged upon check in $27 per night for the resort fee--very high considering the wifi is only workable via phone line connection (which my tablet doesn't have).  I don't use it anyway while I'm on vacation--but that's a pretty steep resort fee...especially if you aren't planning on using any of the spa, pool or internet offerings.  
During the day, the music in the casino is classic rock--its a great atmosphere--then the head banging music rolls on for the evening.  And it's piped in very loud--yes, again with the loud music.  
I'm not saying this is a bad place to stay--it's not--it's really just ok, average, not great but certainly not bad.

They are getting a 3-star because (and only because) the rooms are decent for the price. The elevator might be the slowest elevator I've ever been on in my life and the buffet line is definitely the slowest buffet line I've ever been in my life. I did a walk through of the restaurant (while my husband saved our place in the massively long line) and there were about 30 empty tables yet the buffet line wasn't moving AT ALL. If you come here try to stay on the lowest floor possible and do not come to the buffet.

Excellent stay. The rooms are themed from different celebrity. Purple and black seems to be the trimmings. Large, spacious rooms, nice TV. Right in the smack middle of everything. There is shopping, bars, restaurants, and many more. It's located closely to everything. I like it here. They have a 24 restaurant downstairs, which is really nice. The food there is yummy. Daily Planet is what it is called. If I want a fun time in Vegas(partying) this is the hotel I would stay at. (=

We go to vegas about 6 times per year. We have seen our share of hotel\/casinos, both good and bad. This was our first stay at Planet Hollywood, and most likely our last. Here's the brief version for you skimmers: If you can get a room at a reasonable rate here, and are the type of vegas visitor that only needs a place to crash after going hard all night, by all means, go for it. If you are more discerning visitor, who cares about comfort and wants the feeling of being pampered, you should probably settle in and read on...

Stay dates: April 19-21, 2013

After sitting in traffic out front on the strip for about 12-15 minutes, we circled the block looking for the parking entrance. We discovered it is actually on Harmon. We saw no signs on the strip directing us to where the entrance is. Arrival and check in were smooth enough. Valet was quick and friendly, as was the front desk. I was happy to see a designated check in line for Total Rewards Platinum players and above. No upgrades were available, so we were only able to get our reserved "Resort Room". So far, so good.

Upon arrival in our room, I notice a large foyer, void of any type of furnishing other than a large mirror on the wall. They tout these Resort Rooms have additional space, but what good is additional space when you do nothing with it? Not really a complaint, just an observation. To my right is the large bathroom, dual sinks, oversized tub, and separate water closet, all as advertised. The main room seemed underwhelming. A typical desk, a 2 chair seating area with memorabilia table, and an entertainment center\/closet\/dresser. Closet and drawer space is in short supply. 2 drawers and probably 7-10 hangers in the closet. Kind of odd for a "Resort" room. Don't most people stay in a resort for nearly a week? Where would they put their clothes? The bed was a little on the firm side, but not bad. Room was quiet, with minimal disturbances in the hall.

After the 4 hour drive, I flop in the purple oversized chair in the sitting area, and am shocked how uncomfortable it is. Sinks way too low, no back support. It's almost as if the cushions are missing. Probably the worst room chair ever. I head to the bathroom to wash up and get ready for the night ahead. While washing my hands, the sink starts to back up almost instantly. The drain was very slow. How does this happen? Housekeeping doesn't notice while cleaning the sink? Or do they not give a shit? I am going with the latter, because when I turned off the water I noticed a long blonde hair wrapped around the handle.

We head down to the casino. First stop: Yolo's. Decent tacos with the casino floor price tag. $15 gets you 3, $16 gets you a build your own margarita. You probably can't get out of here for les than $100 for 2 if you have drinks, $60 if you don't. Service, drinks, and food quality are good, no complaints here, really. I actually liked Yolo's.

The casino has a good selection of slots, and many $5 minimum tables. Dealers and pit staff were good and friendly. Cleanliness was sorely lacking in the slot areas. Many full ashtrays, empty beer bottles and cocktail glasses. Again, was happy to see a special line for Total Rewards Platinum level players and above for the casino cage. A feature that seems to be dying out across Caesars properties, usually reserved for Diamond and Seven Stars players.

Saturday morning we prep to head out to do a couple things around town. Shower water pressure is weak, but water temp is consistent. Towels and amenities are fine. We have 2 sinks, but can only use 1 due to the slow drain on the other. We head out and board our elevator to find more common area filth. An egg mcmuffin wrapper on the floor and an obvious orange juice spill, which was there long enough to be almost dry and sticky. Are any of the cleaning staff paying attention here? Probably not, because when we came back later in the day we wait to board our elevator and again, filthy common areas. As a matter of fact, a pair of men's boxer briefs were laying on the floor in the north tower elevator lobby. Really? Underwear? On the floor in a common area? What an absolute disgrace. This is the point where my opinion of PH finally goes from "not bad" to "what a dump".

We had a long Saturday night in the casino, and Sunday morning was unforgiving. We opted for room service for breakfast. Another huge disappointment. I had a chicken hash and eggs that was totally disgusting. The chicken seemed like leftovers that were microwaved and dried out, tossed together with frozen fried "breakfast potatoes" and topped with 3 eggs. I should have gotten an omelet, but the menu description for this item was pretty appetizing. The reality, not so much.

I was really looking forward to a stay at PH, but was sadly met with disappointment at every single turn. The positives were far outnumbered by the negatives, and I will not be returning. My advice would be to stay away, there are much better options in Las Vegas.

This is more a review of the casino than the hotel.

 I have never received such horrible service from any casino. I sat down at a table and gave the dealer my TR card, i am a platinum member, along with my hundred dollar buy in.
