I can't remember the name of the movie the room featured, but it must have been some C-list film anyway. The room seemed a little dark, but I think that was because most of the furnishings were darker colored. I had light where I needed it, which was good enough for me. 

The bathroom is a larger-than-average affair, with a large soaking tub (no jets), a decent sized sink, and a shower big enough for two. While the rooms have been renovated, some touches of the old Aladdin remain...like the faucets and door handles for instance. Toiletries were PH branded, smelled nice, and got the job done.

I ate on-site a few times. They have cheaper places, like Pink's hot dogs, along with moderate and pricier places such as P.F. Chang's and Strip House. I also did the Spice Market buffet for brunch one morning. There are also a bunch of restaurants in the attached Miracle Mile Shops, so there's no shortage of dining options.

Oh, speaking of Miracle Mile. One of the nicest malls I've been in. i was able to get a pair of Crocs because my feet were killing me from all the walking I'd been doing. 

As for the casino, it's a bit confusing to navigate. Once you get your bearings, it's a bit easier to deal with. I had a few drinks at the Heart Bar and Extra Lounge, which was fun. Even more fun were the $10 roulette tables!!! lol. Cocktail service was a bit wonky...it was faster to go to the Heart Bar and get a drink than to wait for a cocktail waitress. The overall vibe was very young, hip, and trendy.

PH is probably in one of the best locations on the Strip. Very close to Paris, Bellagio and CityCenter. Also, beware of the guys who are trying to sell Timeshares...they hang out at various escalators in the casino and may even be near the elevator banks as well. They try to entice folks with offers of free\/VIP admission to various parties in town. Blah.

I had a very good time here. I'd stay here again, but then again, there are several other hotels on the Strip worth checking out as well.

The hotel rooms inside are fairly nice, however the surrounding area is not at all.
The hotel lacked daily essential necessities if you forget your bathroom essentials. Every hotel ive ever stayed at carried them except Planet hollywood.

Another thing if you plan on doing your makeup in the bathroom FORGET IT.
The bathroom has such dim lighting you cannot see anything! You cant style your hair or do your makeup you cant see anything! 

I requested a lamp or something to brighten up the bathroom and they bring me a broken desk lamp!

Went to Vegas to see the Jeff Dunham show and stayed at Planet Hollywood. Worst hotel I have stayed at. Very over priced for room quality. Bed was extremely uncomfortable rolled to the middle of the bed all night. Bed flipped up when you sat on the foot I the bed. Very noisy hotel. All night I was woken by noise in the hallway. The doors exiting the hotel were very dirty like they are never cleaned. I can say positive for their steak house it was beyond  awesome. Service was awesome food was out of this world. Also show was awesome. Wish we would have stayed at another hotel.

This review is a true testament that every place is worth a second chance and Planet Hollywood was one of those spots for me. 

The first time I stayed here the experience failed on all levels and I swore up and down I would never return. However, when looking for a weeks stay I found a heck of a deal and was (to the penny) $1200 less than the MGM side for the same duration of visit. That had me feeling like I was a VIP or getting away with murder.

One major plus for PH is the location as it's in the heart of the strip and smack dab in the middle of where I usually inhabit. I split my gambling between Planet Hollywood and MGM so with close access to Bellagio and the tram from PH ease of getting around was a breeze. If I ever did decide to do it someday I know there is the monorail behind PH to maneuver up through that end of the strip as well. 

Beyond that, I loved how the elevators were strategically placed away from the action and rarely had 15 million people trying to pack into it at one time. Also there is enough assortment of food choices to keep you on the premises so kudos to that as well. There were only a handful of times we ventured out to our regular joints, but for the most part we were content with getting food and eating it in the confines of the room.

For the fashionista inside all of us being so close to the miracle mile was nice as well. I know having things like the ABC store for quick beverage runs added convenience to the trip and the vast array of stores was able to subdue the wife's shopping itch for hours on end during our stay as well. 

  The room itself was spaced out better this time around and looks like the decor got an upgrade since the last stay as well. The bed was very comfortable and the side chair was a joy to have as well to do my normal staring out the window at the Vegas life (don't worry I don't mean that to sound so creepy). 

On the Caesar's side I can say by far that this is my favorite hotel experience at this point and when a good deal presents itself a desired destination. I'm glad that it was a few bad apples the first time here who ruined my stay and it was not a direction reflection of what truly is Planet Hollywood. I admit I still miss it as the Aladdin (so much for time stamping myself), but with hospitality as I was shown I'd say the genie will continue to grant wishes for many years to come!

I love Planet Hollywood! Rooms are very spacious, the decor is tasteful, its decently priced, and it is in the middle of the strip! I would definitely stay here again !

I also loved that you get a bottle  (i chose tequilla, but they have other options) upon check in!

This is a pretty good hotel to stay at for its location.  Our room was clean and the hotel and casino had some nice decor but it is dark.  There are plenty of shows at PH as well as the surrounding area. There are  plenty of shopping, bars, restaurants also at PH and  the surrounding area as well. Beware of the pool though because  it can be quite offensive with an out of control anything goes crowd and for some reason the casinos allow this ($$$). Absolutely disgusting and so offensive and is why we don't go to the pool anymore. The Miracle Miles Shops is attached to this hotel which has great shops,  restaurants and bars. I saw a restaurant advertise an egg breakfast for under 5 bucks  (inside the casino it's almost 20 bucks!).  However I STRONGLY RECOMMEND if you are driving to park at the valet. Trust me! You will have to walk through the mall to get to the hotel dragging your suitcases through the mall trying to  dodge people the entire time. Walking from our room to our car took approximately 15 minutes and that's not counting on getting lost which will probably happen if you are not familiar with the place PARK AT THE VALET! All in all it was an okay experience but I will probably not stay here again because I did not like the casino as this and many Caesars casinos on the strip have gone down hill in the past few years....They took out  many video poker machines and the ones they left they changed out to low\/no paying machines  as well as those  money sucking penny machines. Boring!

Exceptional service! 
Valet...fast and courteous. Self Parking is a nightmare because of where it's located. If you self park you've got to walk a through the Mile of Shops to get to the front desk. I would HIGHLY recommend the valet parking. If traveling with someone in need of handicap parking, valet is your only option.  
Check in...a front desk attendant with a personality, smiles and great conversation. Gave us an upgrade to a bigger room and a nice view of the strip :)
Restaurants...overpriced as you would expect but the service made up for it. Very attentive waitstaff at every eating establishment we encountered
Concert venue....an awfully long line that led around the Mile of Shops. They need to open their doors sooner to give that long single line of people a chance to get to their seats. When you arrive 30 minutes early to a show you would expect to see the whole show but because we waited in that entrance line for about an hour, we missed part of the opening act. However, service was exceptional here. When my friend needed assistance in the steep climb out of the venue, security didnt rush us out. They told us to take all the time we needed and one even offered his arm to her and assisted her out at her pace, not his.

Planet Hollywood Hotel is a great example of how customer service should be!

This is the second time staying at PH. The first time was before they remodeled the room. Coming to America is one of my top favorite movie and we ended up in the "Coming to America" themed room which I thought was funny lol.
Recently I stayed again for Labor Day weekend and OH BOY...
First, the parking garage walk to the hotel is A W F U L.
The walk is extremely far and I had to walk back and forth so many time.  HATED IT. 

Even with the remodeled room, the ac unit is old, the showers had like orange mildew, no long mirror, really dingy feeling and smelled.
We requested for a non smoking room and I woke up at 8am with the smell of cigars going through my AC VENT! WTH! I called downstairs and the front desk was beyond USELESS. So gross, I nearly gagged in my sleep. 

1 star for location and everything else I HATE. 

Never staying at PH EVER AGAIN.

I decided to make a last minute trip to LV to join my family celebrating a birthday.  They were staying at the Bellagio for four nights.  I was only going to stay for two nights, and by the time I had decided to go the Bellagio rates were higher than I wanted to pay for given the quick stay over.  Since Planet Hollywood was just across the street from the Bellagio, and the rate seemed reasonable, I decided to stay there.
I won't say that it was a horrible experience, but I was definitely disappointed.  The rooms are dated and didn't feel exceptionally clean.  The decor has a 1990's vibe to it.  I'm not sure how much of it is carryover from the Aladdin revamp prior, but it wasn't up to what I would consider "current Strip standards".  It seems appropriate that this is Britney Spears anchor arena for her shows - it has a slightly "trashy" feel to it. 
Some of the issues that I had regarding the room were:
- missing front of one of the drawers
- strange odor from the faucet water in sink
- pull chain shades that kept sticking
I can see being in my 20's and coming here to have a raging time, but those days are a little bit behind me at this point and would rather opt for comfort and modern amenities (like at Aria) than "just a place to crash" at the end of a long night.
Cool hotel, efficient check in process. Remember to ask for a fridge if you need one, and we didn't have a little coffee maker.

Not sure if there have been other reports of theft in the past but when I went it was a Friday night me, my bf, my friend and his gf were staying there and we went to Marquee. Were out of the room from 9pm-2am. When we returned, my friend noticed that $400 was missing from her wallet along with the $20 that she had left out the table. Before we left we put the do not disturb sign on the door which was gone when we got back. My friend isnt dumb and you dont just misplace $400 she knew where she put her money. She filed a report and talked to head security and they said she would have to wait a week to see what could be done bc they needed investigate. Well today I talked to her and the event occurred two weeks ago and she tells me that she is not going to be reimbursed bc PH is not liable for stolen items. WTF! Thats bs coz we knew we closed the door and my friends suitcase got looked through. PH employees such as housekeeping have access to our rooms and can just steal hella sh.t. Basically PH can eat a d*ck and if you are goin to stay here and have valuables USE THE SAFE.

*Wes 

is his name! 

( if you read the review...you'll know what that's for)

The bathroom is nice I loved the tub and the view of the strip was beautiful. Our room wasn't cleaned very well though, my son found a beer can between the closet and the tv stand and a lot of paper thrown behind the tv stand. Also the day we stayed there was on jlos birthday and that's where she has her show and the parking was horrible we spend literally over half an hour looking for a parking space. It's kind of difficult finding front desk. Other than that I liked the hotel it's in the middle of the strip so everything is pretty close by. The hotel looks nice and has great restaurants. I also heard people saw kim kardashian and a few other celebs that weekend. I will definitely be back to this hotel, but next time I'll make sure the room is properly cleaned.

Mixed crowd is good but ghetto is not.  poor AC, long check in, 3:30 am thin walls can hear these fuxors next to me still yapping!

Some Friends drove in and wanted company- her mom is part of starwood, so it was half off for the weekend so for $80\/ night it's liveable but would much rather spend the extra money and live in a Venetian suite 3x the size without the ghetto.

Poor room lighting... a hole in my sheets.. For starwood would much rather stay at a quieter Westin.

The bars inside were c0kkfests and just smokey though the air filtration system is better than some other hotels.

It does have a little bit of character(add star) and it's not the "cheapest" hotel so I don't understand the weirdo crowd.

People are not well groomed here, but I suppose if you want to learn what not to be like this is a good training ground.

Went to Vegas recently for a super quick 24 visit. Who doesn't??!!

This was my first time staying at PH.  Lots of things to review about, but some important items first:

1) Hotel Check-in:  My friend and I arrived early and saw their check-in kiosks and tried to see if we could check in early. They charge $20 for this, so we said, nah.  Right behind these kiosks are actual humans at a registration desk. I think it's by design they only have two people work at the desk. You arrive, it's hot (it was 113 outside), and just want to relax for a bit.  The have a guy near the kiosks to ask questions, but he wasn't super helpful. The line for registration was quite long, so, not super worth it.  We wandered about and came back at 3pm. My friend booked two beds and had the confirmation to say so. When we checked in with kiosk, it assigned a ONE king bedroom. We thought, WTF?! We asked the random guy, what the heck?! He said it's NOT guaranteed you'll get two beds even though you purposely book and pay for that.  He pointed us to the registration desk and the line never seemed to move (again, two people manning desk). Good thing we're friends and it's no big deal, but seriously?! Lame!! Disappointed in the room switcharoo.

Also, our room was great and had a great view of the nightly water show across the street and of Paris across the street.

One additional negative - the next morning, we were up early to shower and get to airport.  The shower door was stuck due to the rubber and we feared we'd break it. Had to call maintenance to fix. It took him about 15-20 min.  He mentioned they remodeled these rooms a bit ago, but do yourself a favor, ensure the door actually opens when you arrive! 

2) Hotel buffet - PASS!!!  We heard such great things about their dinner buffet. It's down below and costs $39.  Nice spread and vast offering of different types of cuisine.  Sadly, the food atvmany of the stations was sub-par.  A lot of the rolls\/bread was stale.  Some of the meat lacked actual flavor.  The salad station needs more toppings. I'm also diabetic and was told they had a great selection of sugar free or diabetic friendly items. Well, when you walk up, how would you know which is diabetic friendly?  I had to wait and ask the baker. She pulled two items from fridge underneath. Just a couple cakes.  

Recommendation: SKIP!!!! Not worth the money and the food doesn't seem to be super fresh or have much actual flavor.  We both left thinking, that was disappointing.

3) Plus side - the indoor mile long mall. It has everything!! If you need water, snacks, etc, skip Hotel store and go to the ABC store. Much better savings.

4) Axis theater - we were there for the Backstreet Boys and that was the major highlight.

I can't stand staying here...Doesn't matter if I got the card and winning money and get free night stays I just can't get over the fact that the parking is eons away from the elevators. I don't mind the rooms. The rooms are in fact classy and sophisticated. Trendy I would say, but the walk from the parking...drive me nuts. I just want to get from my car without going around miracle mile (wow maybe that's why they call it that? - yeah I know miracle mile in LA it's just about a mile to walk to the elevators lol) I  can do the free valet thing but the wait just to get your car is the same as if you walked to your car or even more...I wish they just had a hallway that cut down the middle since apparently the entrance of the parking is directly parallel to the entrance of the casino and doesn't matter which way you go, its still freaking far. I swear when I stayed there 3 times, the 3rd time I found that going to the right was faster since to the left you pass the water thing but I think I was just delusional or think that I was going in the nearest direction possible.

The hotel snob side of me is out, so you better watch out! I will not apologize for it either. When I stay in Vegas, I'm not one of those people who say: "oh, it doesn't matter, you only need a place to sleep."

If I can't sleep well, I can't party hard. You feel me, dawg?

Pluses:
- Central location

- For our two night stay, I only had to call housekeeping once for extra towels, they gave us more than two nights worth, which I appreciated.

- There's a Starbucks at the casino floor if you want a light breakfast in the morning (because you should save you appetite for the buffet!) 

Cons:
- the DOUBLE beds. Not as comfortable as other Vegas hotels I've stayed in, and the standard rooms at other hotels have at least QUEEN beds.

- Had an attitude problem at check in with Bernie. He wasn't entirely rude, but he was not willing to hear my explanation either and instead just stated "i've seen this a hundred times, but you still have to pay additional $$$" to secure the room. WTF.

- The pool area. IT SUCKS. When I go to Vegas, it's all about the pool for me! PH is unacceptable: uncomfortable plastic lounge chairs, small pool, some of the towels were tattered. Please invest in new towels! (the employees at the pool area were all very nice and courteous though)

I won't stay here next time, especially with better hotels on the strip.

Carpet is worn, bubbled to the point I keep tripping, tike grout in bathroom is not stained, it's dirt! They must work hard to find pillows this hard. In my life I have never ever seen nor felt a pillow this hard and stiff. Not impressed won't be babk.

How is this a 4.5 star hotel?  Far from it.

They offer free valet but it takes them 20-30 minutes to get you your car?

I might as well walk my bags through their mall.  Would have been about the same time, less tip.  

Rooms were okay, one of the lights didn't work.  Large restrooms though but thin walls.

Plus, they have too many people chasing you down to look at their new timeshare hotel.  It's pretty annoying after the 10th time.

The lobby is placed strange to me what is seemingly to the back and bottom of hotel. The rooms are smaller but decorated modern with pop culture movie and television show memorabilia. The location is very central to the rest of the strip and the casino is decent size where you probably would not lose someone all night in the event you wander away chasing that lucky machine! Great place to stay for those who enjoy lots of television when not in Las Vegas:)

for my 21st birthday i wanted to completely splurge. i booked a panorama suite and it was just plain r-i-d-i-c-u-l-o-u-s. i was literally speechless once i opened the door to the suite and saw the view... the pool at Paris at one section of the suite and through the other was the Bellagio fountains and the las vegas strip (jaw drops). rates for this room weren't bad either, especially since i booked a couple months in advanced.

the front desk hooked it up with a couple free drinks and some free slot play. 

decor and overall ambiance of the lobby and casino is super hip and energetic.

the mall had an h&m, uo, a metropark and a fat tuesdays (giggles in giddy excitement)

pools were nice, and there was a huuuge space filled with rows of lounge chairs to take drunk naps in and listen to some chill music.

prime location, right in the center of the strip, makes getting to places on foot so much easier.

i had the time of my life in vegas and alot of that can be attributed to the wonderful accomodations provided by the planet hollywood hotel.

Check-in\/out: short line, friendly agent and asked for and got 22nd floor room overlooking Bellagio fountains. Checkout was drama free at the desk.

Room: I got completely remodeled floor with a 22nd floor room overlooking the Bellagio fountains so that was the best aspect of the room. The room itself was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was fine except you could tell the shower was getting older. The grout was not sparkling. Worst thing was that the room and the hotel smelled like smoke, especially if you didn't turn on the A\/C. Wireless or wired Internet was $13.99\/24 hour period. Sucky thing is that you cannot pay once and use wired and wireless with same computer. Lame. The movie theme of my room was a Tom Arnold movie called "The Stupids." I had never heard of it and after reading about, it is appropriately named.

The Hotel: I think the smokers come to this hotel to suck in everyone elses' 2nd hand smoke since the ventilation in this system does not seem to work as well as the newer hotels. They must have not spent money redoing the system when it changed names. This hotel was particularly difficult orienting yourself to where exits are. I had to find landmarks so I could go in the direction I wanted. The PH employees trying to grab you at the entrances are annoying. I have no idea what they were selling since I avoided them every time (but from other reviewers: it seems to be a timeshare trap). Did not see this at any other hotel.

Location in center strip is very good. If you want to use the monorail, you have to go next door to Paris and travel your way to Ballys through the Paris mall.

Verdict: I always thought the PH restaurants were cheesy and knockoff. I think this hotel follows suit.

My husband and I stayed at the Planet Hollywood Hotel last week and we got a great deal ($65.00\/night) for a hotel that is located right on the main strip.  We got a free upgrade to a suite which had a sitting area with a flat screen t.v. and another flat screen t.v. in front of the bed.  We got a view of the swimming pools and we were also able to view the fountain show from Bellagio hotel.  The bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi tub and also a shower and it had two separate sinks.  The only downside to the bathroom was that it was right in front of the bed and there is no door; so in the morning, the light would come in and it seems like you left the light on in the bathroom (there is a shade for the window in the bathroom but it really didn't do much to keep the light out).  

The swimming pools are okay; there are two separate swimming pools and jacuzzi but the pools weren't really that big.  I didn't even go in because the water was cold.  But it was a nice location to just chill.

The parking lot is a bit far from the lobby.  I wasn't too thrilled that I had to drag my suitcase with me halfway through the Miracle Mile Mall.  I like that there were a lot of places to eat there and I highly recommend Earl of Sandwich, they have delicious sandwiches, salads and wraps (it was about $6.00\/sandwich which is a great deal especially in Las Vegas).

The only complaint I have would be that the walls are thin, I think the people in the next door were having a party and it was very loud.  For both nights, I heard a lot of noise coming from the other room, I was very tempted to notify the hotel, but I didn't. 

I would definitely stay here again for the right price.

The location of this hotel is GREAT!  It was also connected to a mall with shops I would normally shop at.  The decor was still in the Aladdin style, but that's ok.  The mall was not as big as other resort malls on the Strip, but pretty decent  -- Urban Outfitters, Victoria's Secret, H&M, Gap, etc. 

The casino was very confusing to navigate and my girls and I got lost our first night there.  (It didn't help that we were drunk either. lol)  The EXTRA lounge was nice and I thoroughly enjoyed having karoake in my hotel.  

This hotel isn't THE best on the Strip, but it's definitely not THE worst.  We stayed in an older (non-renovated) room and it was pretty decently size.  It was a resort room with a tub separate from the shower and two separate sinks. This was perfect since I was there with my girls and we needed space to get ready for those long nights out.   The first room that we had was too warm.  The air conditioner was broken and it was quite uncomfortable, but after a quick visit to the helpful front desk we were able to change rooms.  Overall, we tried not to be disappointed because it's Vegas -- you're there for a good time.   We weren't in our room much anyways.  We got a great deal on Priceline, so we couldn't complain. 

Reasons for only 3 stars:
1. confusing casino layout
2.  missing glassware from room (we had three glasses instead of four)
3.  broken air-conditioner making our first night (morning) uncomfortable 
4. in-room safe was missing from our second room
5.  their nightclub Prive started to suck after a couple of hours of being there

But overall, it was a great time.  Can't wait for the whole hotel to be remodeled so it won't be such a mystery next time as to what room we  will get.

I dont know what happened to my last review but l will post another one here. This is what l found inside of my tub!  A big ball of hair. Went through pure HELL trying to get 100% of my money back. I call the CEO and the founder was refunded ALL of my money back plus those $50.00 per day resort fees.

Staff was unconcerned about the used condom under my bed.  They checked me into a filthy room that was mopped with dirty smelly water stains dried on the floor.( Smelled like mildew) I requested another one.

 They treated me like im the one with the problem. They tax the hell out of you with hidden fees. And give you substandard service and show no remorse. 

Take my advise and go somewhere else.

Had a great stay at Planet Hollywood! We arrived around 5:00 pm and they offered us a complimentary upgrade! We had booked a standard room but received an upgrade to a Boulevard Suite! The room was massive and had a pool table, lots of places to lounge around and 1.5 bathrooms. The Boulevard Suite is a one-bedroom suite - the bedroom portion resembles a standard Planet Hollywood room, with a bigger bathroom (had a jacuzzi tub). The living area where the pool table and conversation areas are had an entirely different character - black is the predominate color with white accents. The room was very cool, but lacked some of the luxury - tech features of the newer mega-resorts - ie. tv in the bathroom, automated drapes, automated light controls, etc. One minor fault I give to PH is that the self parking garage is ridiculously far from the hotel. You have to walk through the Miracle Mile shops to get to the casino before you can get to the lobby. Luckily, the resort elevators are directly accessible from the lobby so you don't have to walk across the casino like most other Vegas hotels.

For the price I payed, I was very happy with my experience at PH. 

Check-in\/out: I was expecting to walk in and see the huge line to check in. I know there were tons of people in the hotel, so it wasn't a question of a lack of patrons. The line was short and quick, and the self checkout via my phone made it such that I didn't have to visit the front desk again at all. Once I walked the strip and went into other hotels, I felt lucky that I didn't have to wait in the kind of lines I saw at other places. Luxor and Aria come to mind right off the top of my head.

Location: Perfect. Right in the middle of the strip, across the street from the Bellaggio. 
Room: Very nice. For the price I paid, it was quite large, nicely appointed, and the restroom was HUGE. It had a nice big bathtub as well as a stand-up shower, and the toilet was in its own little room. It did surprise me that it didn't have a fridge, though to be honest, I probably wouldn't have used it. But just to let you know.

Wi-Fi: It was very confusing to discern whether some of these Vegas hotels had free Wi-Fi or not. In the case of PH, if you're paying the $32ish dollar "resort fee" (which I don't know who DOESN'T have to pay that), it includes free in-room WI-FI, and it worked pretty well. In fact, if you want to use your own cellular data, the signal is MUCH slower than theirs.

Ambience: The hotel was lively, casino was always busy (even on a Monday and a Tuesday), and the staff was always friendly. One thing I was dreading was the smell of smoke I had read about in Vegas reviews in general, but I never felt it in their casino. Maybe because their ceilings are like 4 stories high, it ventilates pretty nicely?

I didn't rent a car, so I can't speak for the parking situation, though I have to admit just to the naked eye, it looked like an incredible pain in the ass, which I suspect it's because it's got the shopping mall attached. The RTC transportation buses made it really easy and affordable to travel the entire strip north to south, though with so many stops, it could take a while. You're sightseeing anyway, so it didn't bother me. 

I would recommend PH to friends and family and stay here again myself.

Came here during EDC Weekend. Nothing much I can rate on.
VERY Cheap if you get rooms with a group of friends.
Pro: Earls Sandwitch is down stairs. Fat  Tuesday near by. Cheap Casino. 
Cons: You cant help by order it almost everyday until youre over it

Service: We checked out and I realized I forgot to check the closet if I left anything in there. Front Desk called security for me and of course security being a lazyfuck didnt want to go check lost and found for me. I kindly said" I'm not sure if I left something would you be able to check if the housekeepers have found or logged any findings" He continued to ask what did i specifically lose and he doesnt know what to look for if I dont know. USELESS ASS. Front desk lady was kind enough to try to handle it her self and told me she'll make sure someone will call me tomorrow and get everything situated with me. If something was to be found they'll ship it. I'm glad at least the employees care about their customers.

Besides the security I'll for sure come back!

I have stayed at this hotel a few times and I must admit that it's one of my favorites. 

We enjoyed the Jeff Dunham show here.  He is incredible and I was so glad he was doing his act here.  It was fantastic.  The are where they do their shows is beautiful.  Everything is up to date and comfortable.  The hotel staff in the concert area was very polite and helpful. 

We enjoyed gaming here as well, lots of choices and plenty of staff offering drinks. 

There is also the shopping.  You can never go wrong with a mall in your hotel.  It offered us so many food choices at every meal.  There were show options in the mall as well as drink options everywhere.  I have stayed here with and without kids.  Without kids involved a lot more drinking and appreciation for the shows and bars.  With my kids, they loved the shops and the water show and seeing all the lights from the room.  

The room was in great condition and well kept during out stay.  The hotel maids were very friendly and accommodating.   There are a few sweets that stink because they have that huge poster hanging on the side of the building so it limits the view from the room.  It's a million or billion little dots that cover the window so you can still see Vegas but you can't take pictures because of the dots (poster) over the window.  There are the upper floor suites.  

Parking wasn't an issue, they have several floors for guests only and several floors for the mall parking.  I have parked here when I went shopping and also as a guest and never had any trouble. 

I will be staying here again, thanks to the great accommodations and the wonderful staff

rooms were clean, and comfortable. not a terrible place to stay and the cheapest by far on the strip. however...

the first room i was given had a constant "whir, whir, whir" sound. the window also had a strange vent that pumped dust into the room when opened. i called the desk and they said "yes, your room is next to the service elevator shaft. we can move you." great, i go down to the desk and they have no idea what i am there for. i have to explain all over again. 

second room was fine. until i put my feet into the bed sheets and found half of them were missing. my feet were on some weird scratchy mat thing, and the mattress. i had to remake my own bed before i could go to sleep.

wanted to order room service, but all the food pages from the book in the room had been removed. ordered another copy so i could order food, but it took forever to arrive. i called after 15 min and was told "just wait, he's busy and it takes him time". bah, i left and ate elsewhere.

the decorations in both rooms included weapons. a giant knife and a pistol inside a clear-top table in the first room, and a throat-cutting wire and a stabbing knife in the second room. the pictures on the wall were of schwarzenegger pointing large guns at someone not in the frame. bedroom -- pistol. bathroom -- automatic rifle. just what i want to see when i am about to take a dump...hey, look it's arnold in a threatening pose with a gun pointed at me. sadly it did not scare the shit out of me, if that was the intent.

wtf? is there a room that doesn't have violent and gory death as a theme? another reviewer mentioned logan's run. i guess violence is what they mean by celebrity and hollywood-esque these days. come to think of it the curtains and chair were a convenient dark blood color.

oh, tried to use the spa but they said all their systems were offline and infotech had to come fix things. i walked in at 6am and asked if they could fit me into their first slot of the day, but they said they were unable to function without their computer screen. they called me at 9am and asked if i was still interested. 3 hours of sitting around waiting just to see if your calendar is free. brilliant.

last comment. i was constantly hassled by people idling around by the doors. these pesky sales people would say "have you received your free gift?" and then try to chase me down and convince me to sign up on some 90 minute pitch for real estate. over and over and over, every time i came or went by the doors some sales person was chasing after me with an offer i just could not refuse. please. no more. one woman even tried saying "hey, just come over here. i really need to tell you something" when i came out of the elevators. they should give out a "leave me the f('&&#$k alone" symbol to wear so you can turn them down permanently.

update: do not use the fast checkout process. a $5.95 room charge appeared on my credit card. i called accounting and after a 30 min hold time was told one of the water bottles in the room was missing. i told them i didn't touch the water. they agreed to reverse the charge, but only after i read my credit card info to them over the phone. eh? if they had my number to bill me for the mysterious bottle after i checked out, why do they need me to read them the number again to reverse the mistake?

moments later i noticed i was billed for a spa appointment that mentioned above. i was not allowed to go because the computers were not working. and yet my room was charged after i checked out. after 15 min on hold the accounting department said they could not help me and transferred me to the spa. the spa put me on hold for another 15 min. when they tried to look up my appointment they found a completely different set of charges and said they had to research the differences. again i had to give them my credit card over the phone. 

now i can see that random charges are being sent to my room number, which is then tied to my credit card. so disputing any of the charges requires you to give the credit card number to someone on the phone. seems like a scam to me.

dropping my rating from 3 to 2 star due to the hassles, mistakes, erroneous billing and deceptive practices. they say they are refunding the full amount, so i'll leave it at 2 stars for now. if i have to continue to waste time on this, it'll be headed straight to planet 1 star.

I've now stayed at several resorts in las vegas. This is definitely in an ideal location being basically center strip and in the mall. The weird thing is the parking set up. To get to the hotel you have to trek down pretty much the entire mall to reach the check in for the hotel. Could be different if you use valet but we did self park. 

Room was nice and well maintained upon entry. The pool set up is weird as well. They have a ton of open area that pretty much consists of just nothing. Also nothing dazzling about the pool. Just a square with a few cabanas set up around it. Would i stay here again? Tough call for me. Possibly if the Wynn or Cosmo were sold out. Plus side is gordan Ramsey burger is located in the casino\/ hotel. Outside of that i would say its pretty basic. Definitely not going to knock your socks off.

When ever I come to Vegas I always stay at Planet Hollywood. But my last 2stays haven't been that great here haven't been as good as my past stays. So after a long day of walking I wanted to soak in the tub. After I was all done I proceeded to drain the water and noticed a rotten egg smell. It kept going worse and that's when I noticed that my shower was now being backed up in fluid and chunks of stuff we're coming up( the smell became so bad I was gagging). I called the front desk she says maintenance will be there as soon as I can 45 minutes after that I called the second time and asked if they were on their way and she checked said yes there on the way up to your room now. 1st call 11:06pm, 2nd call midnight is is currently12:57am. I talked friends into staying here and not sure I'd do it again! I'm sitting here typing this with my eye oh so very heavy because  I'm so tired. I'm very PO right now I can ever shower until someone clean up the chunks in the shower that came up with the water. I'm my option PH has gone down hill. I hate writing negative things, but had they come right up checked it out I may not be so mad but keeping me up till after one in the morning is ridiculous

If it were possible to rate less than one baded uoon the front desk staff's attitude, i definitely would. I Booked and confirmed a King non-smoking room.  Notified them we would be arriving about 9pm, confirmed the reservation and pre-registered on line. 
Arrived 8:45 pm,  after driving nearly 600 miles, used the kiosk to check in,  received the keys, then learned the room was not what we had reserved.  I called the front desk,  explained the situation,  was placed on hold for the better part of 10 minutes then disconnected,  no one bothered to return my call. 
I went back down to the desk from the 21st floor,  waited approximately 15 minutes then spoke to a young man at the desk, he said we don't have any king rooms available,  I asked why then was my reservation confirmed for a room that wasn't available?  He merely shrugged as if to say that's the way it goes... he did offer to cancel my reservation so I could look elsewhere...
I was floored, if this is customer service it's beyond comprehension. I asked to speak with a manager,  met a woman who said she was the supervisor,  her attitude was little better, she said "maybe we can switch you to the room you requested tomorrow"
Having spent much of my working life in customer service, I'm at a complete loss as to the non-challant attitude in dealing with an unsatisfied customer.  
At this point in time,  I could never in good conscious recommend this hotel to anyone.

I've stayed here a few times since they changed from the Aladdin. It was a pretty cool transformation.

Check in goes very smoothly and the reps are always polite and helpful. In the room there was Hollywood paraphernalia on the walls of the bathroom and living area. The decor was very modern and trendy, which gave a great upbeat atmosphere to the room and hotel itself. And you can't beat the location of PH on the strip, it's right in the middle & I've always had ridiculous prices so I was sold. 

One time a friend and I was stopped by one of the time share reps as we were walking around, so we stopped to talk to them and actually signed up for the presentation because one of the gifts were $200 in promotional chips. And another time they were giving away free bottles each night of your stay. 

Found out that it's no longer Prive but now Gallery... anyways Prive was pretty amazing! I've gotten in thru comped tables and VIP entry, thankfully I've never paid to get in there. Great music, people and waitstaff. We partied all night long every time til about 5:30 or so. And when we had our table Big Sam was awesome and he took care of us big time!

Koi is a Japanese restaurant also located inside of PH. It's a pretty decent place to eat.

The one dislike that I noticed was in the rooms there are still fixtures from when it was the Aladdin. That's probably my one complaint, PH remodeled nicely and I would have thought that they could spring for their own fixtures. Overall I've had good times there and would go back.

We had a really nice time staying at planet Hollywood. Our room got upgraded when we checked in so we had a king bed and a gorgeous view of the bellagio fountain. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. My biggest issue was that the shower was pretty beat up, the shower head was literally detached from the wall. You could still shower fine but it was really ugly and brought the overall vibe of the room down. We were on a pretty quiet floor, didn't have any trouble sleeping from noise or anything.

So let me start by saying I never write reviews, but this situation has me so upset and angry that I must do so this time.

Here I go. My wife and I stay here at the hotel for 5 days. We drop our car off on a Thursday and pick it up on the following Monday in Valet. When we come out on Monday my tire light is on and there is a nail in the side of my tire. We had driven 250 miles no lights no issues. I file a report with security and go on my way to get a new tire since my car doesn't come with a spare. $302.00 later I would like reimbursed. I call their "Loss prevention" phone number 10 times. I leave messages every time nobody ever calls me back. I finally call Caesars International and they assign a person to research the incident. Almost 2 months later( June 26th-August 15th) he concludes that there was no construction at the time of my occurrence so it couldn't have happened there! Are you kidding me? Mind you I have been a Diamond member at Caesars for many years. I have never asked for anything even if I feel something wasn't right. This situation, however, really upsets me. I have spent thousand of dollars at their properties but I can assure you I will never spend another dime there. It's the principal of the matter. They would rather not pay me back $302.00 rather than me come back. These casinos don't care about anyone or anything other than the bottom line. Shame on me for thinking they would be loyal to someone who has been loyal to them!

No toothbrush.

Stayed here midweek while in Vegas for work. It was my 7-8th time in Vegas in the lat 2 years and first at Planet Hollywood. I had the resort package or whatever. for 3 days it came out to roughly $400. The room was spacious, but that's about all that it has going for it. 

First off, the self-parking is way to far from the hotel, even for Vegas. Yes, there is Valet, but that still no excuse. 

The decor looks cheap and lazy. The elevator doors are way too fast and close on literally everyone.

The wifi is slow and actually tracks your data, as  result I was unable to log in to my works VPN, or even play video games.

I call it in and got put on the line with IT, who basically said everything looked fine. and they didn't see any issues with tracking my data.

Then, I ordered chicken wings to my room. They weren't good, but I didn't care because I was starving. The guy hands me the bill and it had gratuity included. So I tip the difference in the amount I would have tipped and included gratuity..

The dude looks at it and goes: "So you're only tipping me three dollars?" 
I go: " Gratuity is added"
Him, sarcastically: "I know, enjoy your stay at Planet Hollywood"

K.

So I brought a toothbrush and toothpaste travel kit from the last hotel I stayed at.. Somehow my toothbrush snapped and so I call the front desk for a dental kit. The inform me rather rudely that they don't provide toothbrushes. What kind of hotel doesnt provide toothbrushes. To make things worse, the cleaning people saw the snapped brush i had and threw it away... along with toothpaste I had left.

"Enjoy your stay at Planet Hollywood"

There are tons of hotels to choose from in Vegas, at reasonable prices. The vast majority actually care bout the comfort of their residents, unlike Planet Hollywood. No reason to subject yourself to a mediocre experience.

Not the best, Check in lobby is horrible. Theres usually 2-4 people helping at the counter and after each customer they disappear for about 5 minutes in the back. Rooms are okay, not much lighting and are not cleaned well. I found broken glass under bed, and raisins on the couch from the previous guests. House keeping left my room door open which could of resulted in loss of personal items. Assistant Manager Bryan Doka was sarcastic and very dismissive when it came to my feedback on my experience. I do enjoy Planet Hollywood's casino but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Well, another hotel in Vegas down. Will I return? No. 

The rates were totally inflated and I'm sure that there was probably an event there this past weekend as well as a Canadian holiday however, totally not worth it. We were there for 4 nights. 

Blaring Britney Spears was enough to kill me - all weekend long in all the common areas. 

We went to 2 restaurants, 1 club and the gym here - as well as the Starbucks. Underwhelmed is all I have to say. 

And lets not forget the pool - full of garbage, murky as a milkshake and generally lacking any cleanliness on the entire rooftop scenario. Garbage, human hair and fluids everywhere - disgusting. The pool actually glowed ORANGE at night it was so dirty. Like another reviewer said - feels like you're in a parking lot. 

The gym was in the spa area and only open until 7pm. Equipment was old and looked like something my grandpa would've built in his own basement - the photos online are NOT what their gym actually looks like, do not be fooled. 

At Koi nightclub we got bottle service and had the equivalent of rocket fuel served to us - we were both very sick from the poor quality vodka - I can't remember if we were offered anything of a decent quality......we gave 1\/2 of our bottle away to strangers. 

Rooms were relatively clean, but our $70 per night upgrade got us a minute view of the pool and the bulk of the view was their rooftop satellites (we were on the 9th floor).

All this glory for about $250 per night. 

Decent location - would never stay there again.

We were told we would have complimentary wifi - it was $14 per day!!

Someone's POOPED IN sheets were sitting in the hallway all morning. 

Elevators took at least 5-10 minutes at any time of day other than around 8am.

I'm echoing some of the recent interviews saying that this hotel has gone downhill.

Maid service:

The maid stopped replacing the ice bucket and glass cups I used after the 1st day of my stay. Sometimes some of the towels weren't replaced either. The light switches and shower area definitely needed some TLC.

Elevators:

This is the 1st time out of several stays where I experienced elevator problems. One day it was an elevator that kept on clearing out the buttons that were pressed each time it would stop at a floor. Now imagine if you were on the 20th floor and there were people stopping at floors below you. Next day it was waiting for an elevator at the casino level. 20 minutes passed by and all the elevators seemed to be going down, but none were coming up. There was a crowd building up as we were waiting for elevators. Some of us decided to just take the elevator going down and just ride it up because none of them were stopping to go back up after going to the lobby. And this was on a busy Friday night.

Hallways:

I see trash left outside of doors that aren't picked up even after maid service cleans up rooms. I also see trash just thrown on the elevator floors and not picked up. Does Planet Hollywood even care about their appearance anymore? 

Planet Hollywood forces you to pay a resort fee, but lately this hotel has been feeling anything but that. Remember to use WI-FI since that's included with the forced resort fees anyway. The only thing that saves this casino are the friendly folks at the sports book. Please upgrade or fix the current problems. You used to be a great place to stay in Las Vegas.

I really enjoyed my stay here. We had an upgrade to the 19th floor with a great view of the pool and Ballagio fountains. The bathroom was super roomy with a sit-down shower and jacuzzi bath. Great designing and fast elevators. The casino was confusing to get out of but customer service was great.
Just was walking through to see what was inside.  Consider it a big mall that you can sleep at if you wished to!  Since I did not stay at the hotel itself, I can not give it any further stars.

Love love lovedddd PH! I have been to Vegas numerous times and have never stayed at such a lively hotel. It's perfect for 20-30 somethings. From the moment we stepped inside I knew it was going to be an awesome trip. 
The hotel room was clean, spacious, and everything worked. Our room had props from Jurassic Park which I thought was awesome. The only small flaw I found in the room was the closet. It was tiny but it wasn't a problem for me. 
The casino is super fun. Even at 5 in the morning its happening. We walked around the surrounding hotels after clubbing and they were all dead. PH was the only one still playing loud music and had people mingling and gambling. The bar\/lounge Heart I think it was called was really fun. Perfect place to people watch and sip on a few drinks. There is even a mall downstairs. This can get dangerous if you find that you have free time. Way too easy to go and spend money on cute shoes and clothes. Theres also tons of places to eat.

The only reason I am giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is the pool. I think the pool is the biggest problem with this hotel. The layout makes no sense! The lack of trees and shade makes the pool area very unpleasant. However, its not difficult to go to other hotel's pools. 
Overall I loved this hotel and plan on staying again!

Check-in was speedy and friendly and a message that was awaiting my arrival was instantly passed on.

The strip room was good on the 24th floor, small window overlooking part of the strip and the bellagio fountains.

The room was large, as was the bathroom, and I found it to be clean and daily housekeeping was to a good standard.
There were no problems with out stay, but just as there was nothing spectacuar? 

The location is certainly a plus point for this hotel - pretty central on the strip.
I would have nothing against staying here again, however with such a variety of choice in Vegas, I'd likely choose somewhere else for a different experience. If you choose to stay here, you wouldn't be dissapointed. It value for what you get.

Omg the bed!  Straight from heaven!  I want to steal it! Best sleep of my life. We are now shopping for the same kind. Vegas locals, and we get free rooms due to our points. Stayed at alot of hotels and other than the parking being hella far,  it's been best experience we've had. Here, Cali or Mexico. Hands down. Clean room and real friendly staff. Great place to rest your bones.

3.5 stars

Better than Aladdin.  Very nice interior.  Valet blew beyond all recognition.  We had better luck going next door to Paris for efficiency.  

I lost (almost) all sense of direction navigating through the hotel.  Everyone's right though, the casino is glam like a Sephora explosion. 
Liked all the music played throughout - made me think I had XM radio following me.  

Bathtub was excellent, but it would've been cool to have the shower gel double as bubble bath.  I liked how spacious the bathroom was.  Storage space was little to none, and I had a great view of the underutilized pool.

For an extremely busy hotel, we never waited more than a minute for an elevator.  Nice.  Strained my neck viewing the overhead monitors while we rode between floors.  Excellent check-out options (phone, tv or just dropping keys in lobby).
 
Worth a return trip.

$10 minimum for black jack in the mornings but it goes up to $25 at night. Tables do not do continuous shuffle. The dealers were super cool. 

Hotel room - 2 stars
Didn't like layout of bathroom - it was not very practical and one of the doors squeaked. Room did not seem well maintained. 

Has Gordon Ramsay Burger - 1 star

Has Craps machine - 1 star

I've liked Planet Hollywood Hotel in the few times I stayed there, not only because I can have a view of the strip and the dancing fountains in the room but also because of the miracle mile shops. But last April, I went there with my sister who was visiting from Canada to celebrate my birthday, we were in room 2595 and I was ready to relax in the bathtub after a long, tiring 1st day when I noticed a strand of hair sticking out of the drain. When I pulled it, a lot of hair strands came along with it presumably from previous hotel guests. I was so disgusted that I went down to the front desk and asked to speak with the manager. To appease us, she offered to give us some hotel credits but never bothered to do a follow-up with us if the problem has been addressed to our satisfaction. She didn't even have the courtesy of replying to my email that has the picture of the hair I found in the drain- sent it to her company email danatihan@caesars.com! 

Imagine if it has not been my habit to check the cleanliness of the toilet & bath of a hotel, I could have had an infection or contracted some other diseases. 

Personally, I will stay away from this hotel in the future.

First impressions are everything and we were sadly let down by the experience we had. On arriving to the hotel we were in awe of the  attractions. Anxious and excited we checked in to have our first issue. The told us one card was declined and we used another. However we were actually charged twice for the same room. We checked our accounts and call the bank to find that neither card was insufficient and that the error was with Planet Hollywood. When Capital One and Chase say the same thing it's scary. Both told us to demand a refund. The Hotel obliged us but we have yet to be credited the return. On to the room, if your expectations are to frigidly underwhelmed, then this is your utopia of discontent. The room was dated, with a subtle essence of smoke. The decor was basic and boring. Our particular room had themes from the movie "that old feeling" starring Bette Midler. We got an "OLD FEELING" from theme of little relevance. Updates needed all around. The restroom seem to be the most updated thing in the outdated room. However there were issues with the water barely being warm and the room itself, FREEZING! Clearly hearing everyone else shower or use the bathroom was also annoying! The best part of room 3067 was the view of the Belagio & Caesar's Palace with mountains in the background. The scenery was lovely. Prompting you consider that you'd made a mistake in resorts. We longed for the experience Bally's provided minutes into walking into our room. But I guess it's all in a design to get you out of the room. All the money must have gone into the casino area and restaurant's. They phoned in the rest. Can't foresee us returning there.

We stayed here for a convention in August 2013. I have more positives than negatives about my and my husband's experience, but we'd still not return.

First off, we got what's called a "Hollywood Hip" room. It has a good amount of space for inviting friends to hang out with a desk, double bed, and two chairs. If you go down to the casino floor, there's a pretty good sandwich place called Earl of Sandwich. We ate here four times in six days, so we're fans. You're also in the middle of the strip which was really convenient in blazing hot weather.  There's an ABC store and a Walgreens around the corner so most Vegas goers should be stocked for whatever they need. But as convenient as it was, we won't be going back.

The really large negative was that the room was pretty gross. I put on clean white socks and after an hour of walking around unpacking in them, I took them off to discover they were black. Also, the fact that it has Hollywood memorabilia isn't enough to really capture my attention. Yeah, we had the Paradise Island room, which was kinda neat, but it's like these few pieces are trying to distract you from the fact that this is kind of a boring (and severely unclean) Vegas resort. It's got a flashy, loud casino floor.. but just look at the Bellagio, or Caesar's, or Mandalay Bay. They at least have some character.

My recommendation is Vdara. Down the strip, but worth it - so much personality and a great value.

Stayed here one night. The room was nice, comfortable bed. I loved the bathroom l, it was really big with two separate sink areas on opposite sides, a separate shower, and nice soaking bathtub. Toilet was in its own little room too so more than one person can be in the bathroom. The lighting in the mirrors is great, good for taking selfies . Parking is free, but it's pretty far from the actual hotel. They share the parking garage with the mile shops. Once you park there's not really any signs directing you were to go to check in, even when you get into the Casino there's no signs for check in. But overall I was satisfied, would stay here again.

I find this hotel to be quite lovely. When it opened, it was one of the first to really modernize and upscale the decor. I still am hypnotized and enchanted by all the sparklies and shinies everywhere. Those colorful balls are awesome!

I have been spoiled by the Palazzo suites, so now regular-sized suites, to me, seem small. They're still pretty cool, especially when you decorate them with caution tape for a birthday!

The restaurants inside the hotel are actually pretty good. Everyone loves Earl of Sandwich because it's so accessible, Planet Dailies is good for American food, Yolos has great chips and salsa and Mexican food, and Strip Steak is their fancy and tasty steakhouse.

Unfortunately, at the moment, PH doesn't have much of a club scene. Prive closed down because of shady management, and Koi is a sorry excuse for a club. Please don't go there (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/koi-las-vegas-2#hrid:tlABUss3VIxG44GWmDrWvQ)... I'm trying to save you!

My BF loves to gamble in their casino. I like to strut around and people watch in this fun casino. Their central bar, The Heart Bar is sexy as hell. Actually much of PH is sexy... :)

PH gets huge points for the Miracle Mile Shops - you can just pick up anything you need that you may have forgotten you need, like some patent leather leggings or fishnet stockings. How convenient!

I have to say, I was really unimpressed by their pool situation. They have two teeny tiny pools in the corners of a gigantic cement area on top of the casino. The cabanas are just jazzed-up EZ-Up tents that they charge an arm and a leg for. My suggestion, and what we did, was walk through the Miracle Mile Shops to the Planet Hollywood Westgate pool instead - it's gorgeous, fun, and bigger. (See review for more details: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/planet-hollywood-towers-by-westgate-las-vegas#hrid:E1YnkqHysH2EaSWEegtDrQ)

Overall, I like to stay at this place. It's fun for younger Vegas-goers like us, it's centrally located, and it's connected to the Miracle Mile! What more could you want?!

Okay. It's been a mere two months since I've been back and BOY and I ELATED to report that the renovations are mind-blowing! Hooray for $40M upgrades!! I am still dismayed at the plumbing--the shower drain takes forever; it's gross having your feet wade in the after bath. Ha ha!
Planet Hollywood. The former Jolly Roger.  
The reason I rated this go-to hotel a mere 3-stars is mainly due to infrastructure in the rooms. 

POSITIVES: High energy, fun dealers and dancers, bartenders & great weekend DJ's.  The on-site Miracle Mile Mall is a plus: eateries and a variety of places to dine and shop at make it a pleasant experience for anyone.  The resident performers have been a hit as well: Britney Spears, Jennifer Lopez & most recently, Lionel Richie (so awesome--must see!). Oh, and let's not forget to mention their Sports Book: cozy and easy to watch multiple games.

CONS: I have grown tired of rooms that have toilets that run all day and sinks that don't drain quickly, along with shower heads that are a hit-or-miss in terms of pressure.  Also, sometimes we have nice hot water; other times, barely hot water. 
The pillows are disappointing. I feel like I'm laying my head on soft balloons. 

In the end, the pros always outweigh my cons. Hence, this is our hotel of choice.

I like to stay here because rates are reasonable and its in the middle of the strip.  Way to many ladies of the nite aka "hookers" at nite and during the day.  Hell cant sit alone at a slot machine without one hitting u up.  Starting to get lots of hood rats and hoodlums in here.  Pool was total trash, it was like Jersey white trash and their big vacations of their life.  Won't be coming back.

Ok, the bad news. Pool area sucks. Here's why:
1) You can't sit on the chairs by the pool, you have to pay 100 bucks or so to reserve
2) Pool area is soooo plain and boring (unlike Bellagio pools, even Excalibur and time share pools like Tahiti Village were superb)
3)Found a huuuuge lonely booger floating around in the pool. haha gross

Another downer: 
Sometimes you get unlucky with a weird movie themed room.
The room we got was kind of awkward (Robocop??), especially since our party consisted of my girl and her sisters (contrary to common beliefs, girls aren't fascinated by big mechanical guns). They were like "Wtf?"

Other than that, this is the ideal place to come do what y'all come here to do: act a fool, jump on your beds, run across the hotel hallways drunk to your trunks pretending you're Superman wrapped around in a bedsheet cape... at 5 am in the morning.

The best thing about it all is that you don't have to call a taxi when you're all done with this gorgeous-looking hotel and your legs can't walk for shit anymore, cause HEY GUESS WHAT, you're already home!

I played, got drunk, and crawled back to my room. Day 2, repeat.
 http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/planet-hollywood-hotel-and-casino-las-vegas-2?select=eZgPKosLmpebFi7j6vIaLg#ikcVFZo89s_prL_OsOrrVQ

I was decently impressed by Planet Hollywood, the hotel portion. We got a pretty good rate and the quality of the room itself was better than some of the other hotels on the strip, but obviously not the greatest. I liked that the room was spacious. Ours was a standard room with 2 beds. The bathroom has a tub and a shower stall and the toilet has its own door which is nice when you're sharing with a lot of people. 

Location-wise PH is okay. It's a little far from hotels like the Wynn, but it was conveniently close to Aria. It's kinda give and take with the strip, right, you can't be close to everything! If you're into shopping then PH is perfect because the miracle mile shops are right there. Their food choices are also pretty good because there's an Earl of Sandwich (cheap, awesome sandwiches and soups), Pink's hot dogs (an LA native's fave, although I've actually not eaten at the Vegas one), and there's a Fat Tuesday (definitely an essential)!

I do have a couple of complaints about PH, though. The room lighting was really scarce. They were missing a few lamps in there. With 8 girls trying to do hair and makeup at once, finding a well-lit corner of the room was quite difficult to do. And why is their parking garage soooo far. It felt like we were the only ones carrying luggage through the entire miracle mile, but I'm guessing others had to do it. Sorry I'm not really one to valet, and that was a pain to get to the check-in lobby area. Ugh, and that check-in line seemed to take a decade. We checked in around 8pm-ish, so I wouldn't expect a crowd, but it still took a long time. What's with that?? 

Overall they might've gotten 3 stars, but they did give us a free bottle with each room (they didn't really skimp either - Skyy and Seagram's, I think it was). Sweet, 4 stars it is :]

Pros:
-central in the strip so you can walk everywhere easily 
-rooms are a good size and clean
-free wifi however only one device can use it at a time
-lots of shopping malls 
-earls sandwich is inside 

Cons: 
-shower head and toilet paper roll were broken after a little usage
-you have to walk through the "miracle mile" of shops for the parking lot just to get to the lobby. There was no quicker or safer way to get there.

I stayed at PH for a week while I was in Vegas for my first time. I got a great rate, had a view of the Bellagio fountains, our Warren Beaty room was clean, had a comfy bed, and a nice big tub.  

PH is in a great location on the strip across from the Cosmo and Bellagio. From Planet Hollywood's block down to the Venetian block is the best part of the strip, IMO. Middle of the strip casinos have higher table minimums (not so good) but have great places to eat, tons of places to shop, and many places to quench your thirst. Outside of that area on the strip are good places for cheap eats\/drinks, and have less expensive slots and tables. 

PH casino is huge and I've read about people complaining how big the casino was - that was a positive for me as I'm not afraid to walk and would prefer a large casino, esp not when I'm in Vegas. 

Spice Market Buffet was ok. Honestly, if I didn't get free tickets to eat there, I never would have picked there. I'm happy I went to one buffet while in Vegas. I've read tons of reviews on buffets, but there are such better places to eat then buffets while in Vegas. Earl of Sandwich is a great place to get a quick bite to eat. $25 will get you 2 sands, 2 drinks, and 2 chips. Pink's is at the front of the hotel and was a decent place to stop and get a hot dog. It was $25 for 2 dogs and one drink.  

People need to remember that you are not staying at the Venetian, Bellagio or Cosmo and if you want to pay 3 times more then what PH charges, then stay at the other hotels. My room was clean, had more then enough room for 2 people and really all we needed to shower, change, and sleep. I really liked the area of the strip that the hotel was located and thought the casino was a great place to make my donation.

This place is the WORST.  I have never stayed in a such a disgusting hotel room - ever.  We were traveling with our son and two dogs and decided to stop in Vegas to meet up with my sister and her family.  They put us in a 'Pet Room' which apparently means we have to sleep in a room that a number of animals used as a bathroom.  Which, you can't blame the animals because there is no convenient place near the hotel rooms for them to pee.  The 'dog park' is downstairs, across four lanes of valet traffic and is a pathetic patch of grass.  It is dark and hidden and a little (a lot) scary at night.  When we complained about the room we were told that it's a pet room and that's why it smells.  
This is not a pet friendly hotel.  This is not a kid friendly hotel.

There are only 2 pros to this hotel - location and shopping. With that being said...

Where do I begin? I have had PH on my list of hotels to stay when visiting Las Vegas and I was looking forward to staying there. The pictures on line of course, appeared to be well appointed and contemporary. What the hotel offered was contemporary but worn and torn! 

The lobby is very misleading. It was clean, vibrant and colorful, which made me excited to see my room. As soon as I hit the elevator and saw the doors close, I knew something was very off. There were scuff marks on the walls of the elevator, scratches and initial carvings in the metal and the doors looked like they had been kicked several times with scratches and dents. Approaching my room, the hall way carpet was torn and stained in several spots, unravelling and bubbled in others. I came to discover during my stay that all the elevators were beat up.

I got to my room, the Resort Room, and it was covered in a layer of dust everywhere. There were spill marks on the desk with splatter marks down the leg of it. By that point I was uneasy and checked the bed for bed bugs! I opened the closet to hang my clothes and noticed the wood was chipped all throughout the bureau, with the worst of it where the ironing board was placed. One of the drawers didn't open properly.
I called to have the room cleaned and dusted. Throughout my entire stay of 3 days, no one cleaned the spill marks down the table leg. There were chips in the wood on the tables as well.

The pool - another disaster! PH charges $118 for reserved day beds. That would be great if the daybeds weren't all stained with mysterious spots, some of them questionably large and obvious. Regular deck chairs are wobbly, with support bands busted off or missing. And since they were supposed to be white, they were visibly dingy.

The casino - Signs pointing you where to go are confusing. As a group of 6, we got lost quite a bit, continually walking in circles, even when sober, lol! We actually started paying attention to location markers like light fixtures and escalators as points of reference because the signs were useless. Not to mention, the casino constantly had dirty glasses and beer bottles everywhere. The place just couldn't stay cleaned up. The Strip entrance to the casino was horrid. The glass doors were never clean, with a dirt film of finger and handprints covering the inside and outside.

Call me partial, but I love a clean, well appointed hotel, no matter if its cheap or expensive. If I'm paying upwards of $800 for 3 days, I want what I paid for which is high quality, good service and cleanliness. I'm very disappointed with the cleanliness and upkeep of Planet Hollywood. I have stayed in many different hotels on the strip from the Stratosphere to the Bellagio and I will not stay at Planet Hollywood again. I will not recommend it to anyone.

3.5 stars

Pool ain't great and rooms are now a bit outdated, but I do really like the convenience of the Miracle Mile mall attached to this hotel and also the location of the hotel casino on the Las Vegas strip.

I've stayed here in the past and again most recently in June 2015 and the rooms have since outdated themselves.  We rented two rooms right next to each other and opened the connecting doors.  Rooms were a fair size.  Two queen size beds each with large bathrooms that included a jacuzzi soaker tub, stand-up shower, long counter with only one sink, and its own toilet room with door within the bathroom.  Beds were a fair deal for comfort.

The service is just fine - didn't run into any problems.  On the last morning when I was leaving early the safe was not  opening up with the code we thought it had been.  I called downstairs immediately because I needed to take out my passport, and the service man came up pretty quickly!  

All in all, I'd stay in this hotel again and recommend it for mainly it's location on the strip, fair price, and the convenience of Miracle Mile shops.  Plus there's an upper walkway to get to Cosmo hotel pretty quickly.

I stayed at PH many moons ago, back when they were still transitioning from being the ALADDIN hotel (some may argue they still are!)

PH always has GREAT room deals on the off season, which is why I ended up here that fateful weekend. See, I was having my bachelorette party, all of my friends were on a budget, but I really wanted to stay on the strip for my Vegas stay. Enter PH, which had rooms at a ridiculous $20 or so a night. Sold! The rooms are nothing amazing, but they are clean and this hotel is centrally located on the strip. 

However, this wouldn't be my first choice. Part of the fun of coming to Vegas is staying in a really cool, really swanky hotel and PH just isn't one of them. It is the practical and economical choice, if there is one, in Vegas.

Would come again.

Merriam-Webster dictionary defines a COMP as -"given free as a courtesy or favor" Apparently Ceasars\/Harrah's Entertainment does NOT!  Since my comp room cost me $70 for 2 nights with their bullshit resort fees and taxes.  These resort fees where they give you nothing for something really have to stop!  It's the equivalent of going to a restaurant and being charged a utensil fee.

Additionally, my smoke free room on a smoke free floor had smoke permeating from somewhere.  And I'm not sure if PH is now pet friendly, but somebody's dog had definitely pissed in this room because it really stunk like dog pee.  I was going to look with my UV light but thought better of what other atrocities I might uncover.

For locals PH has by far the most inconvenient and furthest self park lot. I actually parked at The Cosmo because it was closer to my room.

On a final note the shower-heads are old (probably original) have not been cleaned or replaced and are undoubtedly full of Vegas' hard water deposits which turns the shower stream to barely a trickle.

Shower has mold, pool service sucks no one at pool and none of cabanas being used.  None of the cabanas were never occupied and I sat in one of the chairs to place my stuff on their while I got into the spa and was asked to move and put my belongings on the floor.  I complained to manger in lobby which was no help.  They should be open, especially on slow months.  How hard would it have been to just tell me that if someone rents it out I would have to move which would not have been a problem for me.

50 bucks is a good deal for a one night stay on a Monday. The room had a Pretty good view. The casino is awesome and the restraints are bomb. I would recommend to a friend. The mall is huge so if you wanna shop there's plenty to look at. All in all its a good place.

Really like PH. For the price, the rooms are very nice, they are large, feel more like a mini suite. The hotel is high-end, with a lot of attractive aspects like the location on the strip, having a mall connected, etc. I think this is my new favorite hotel in Vegas.

To christen our inaugural trip to Vegas, my gf and I decided to book a hotel that neither one of us had stayed at before. A few clicks around the internet later, and we found a pretty solid deal for two nights here. No perks, but the price seemed reasonable for what looks like a great resort online. 

Whatever you do, DO NOT self park when you get here. You're probably thinking what I was thinking when I pulled up, which is that valet service probably isn't free, plus I just don't like handing my keys over to some knob so he can mess with my seat positioning and AC. So, we drove off the park ourselves... and wound up knee-deep in the Miracle Mile shops, where I proceeded to haul our bags for what seemed like all 5000+ feet of it before finally hitting the check-in station below. 

They were, of course, out of king beds for the room we booked, but the woman offered to upgrade us to a larger room with a king for no additional fee; the only downside being that it was a smoking room. We accepted, since Vegas is typically good at making sure smoking rooms don't smell like you'd expect them to. 

Our room was Wheel of Fortune themed. Kinda rad, even if I do think the show is lame. The round display case which held a board tile lit up neon green at night. That was cool, made for some nice ambiance. 

The room itself wasn't very clean. To the eye it was, but it could've definitely used some serious dusting. 

Here are a few cons:

- What is the point in boasting that there's a 42 in. plasma TV in my room when every station it gets is in standard definition? That's like saying you have all the latest films available on VHS. 

- No coffee maker, but there is a sign letting me know there's a Starfucks down below, eager to rape my wallet on the daily. 

- Room service prices appear to be high, as expected, but P.F. Chang's has a menu that's in line with the pricing if I were eating there anyway. Oh, hey there, $8 room service surcharge fee that's hiding down below in tiny font! Almost missed you there. 

- If you're getting drinks at the pool, make it a double. They're already bending you over to the tune of $14\/pop, what's another $4? Drink enough to forget what you paid for it. 

- They have a gym, and you can use it for the completely reasonable fee of 25 FUCKING DOLLARS A DAY. I laughed and left when informed of this. I suspect my laughter would have intensified had I actually seen the gym, since I doubt it's more than a couple treadmills and some mismatched dumbbells. 

- Wi-Fi isn't free. This will matter when you realize that AT&T gets a shitty signal in the building. 

I know this is how Vegas works, but charging me for every little amenity a la carte doesn't do a whole lot to insure my future business. I'm more likely to seek out a hotel that will include all of that in the price of the room. I don't go to Vegas to workout (I'm not a meathead or anything), but $25 to work off a night of drinking before the day begins is a slap in the face. I had a decent stay here, but the cons outweigh the pros too much.
Robert at the front desk is AWESOME!!! He helped us upgrade to an amazing room and we got to check in super early. Very friendly and extremely helpful! Thanks Robert!!

I was at Planet Hollywood 2 weeks ago and was excited to see that when I was going to 'check in' on Facebook I'd get to take advantage of the '2 for 1 drink' special at the Heart Bar.  So I checked in and went to the bar.

I was disappointed first of all that the bartender needed me to walk to the front desk (or concierge?..can't remember exactly which one) in order to redeem the coupon...and then come all the way back.  However, I was more disappointed when I got there and the supervisor REFUSED to help me.  She apparently was closing out and leaving and told me to come back in the morning.

Regardless, I asked her to please find a way...after a long drive I really just wanted to relax for a bit and take advantage of an offer that I was excited to use...this was to no avail.
