There was no fridge. We had the Jurassic Park theme room. The lights in the cases where the movie props were also burned out. The room was dark, even with the shades wide open.

PH rooms are always expensive. Even the smallest one. Probably because of thier great location on the strip. Thier rooms definitely need to be updated badly.

On the plus side, the room included free coffee and a coffee maker. The soaps were actually good size bars and there were plenty of towels. Bathroom was really nice for a small room.

NEVER STAY HERE!
I used to frequent this hotel often and over the last couple of years the hotel has gone downhill. The rooms are in serious need of renovation. When we first got there our sink wouldn't drain. We called maintenance and they said they would fix it. We still had the same issue even after they came. It also seemed as though the rest of our stay the room had a constant smell to it. At one point, when we returned from dinner, our bathroom floor was covered in water. We couldn't figure out if it was the tub, the shower or the toilet. Not to mention the grout in the shower was mismatched as if they just put grout in places that was missing chunks. 
When we went to the adult pool area on Sunday where we paid for a day bed. There was no one to tell us where to go or if there was even a server. When we first walked up to the pool area you could tell it hadn't been cleaned, at all. It was DISGUSTING. There were empty beer cans and plastic cups everywhere. There were even bottle caps and cups at the bottom of the pool. When we finally chose a day bed we waited 15 minutes before a server finally came around and told us we would be better off moving to a different bed because they were short handed (information that would have been useful when we paid for the day bed). Once we moved beds we found that the safe to the second bed didn't lock. We were constantly having to watch our stuff. We paid for a day bed for a reason. After being there for maybe 2 hours (most spent out of the disgusting pool) we were over it and left. 
All in all, if you want to gamble, then go there just for that. For anything else, AVOID at all cost.

I've stayed at most of the nicer properties on the Las Vegas strip.  Averaging 3 trips a year to Sin City,  for the past 5 years, definitely makes me well versed in all things Vegas.  So when my friend decided to have his bachelor party in Vegas, I was stoked.  I'm always looking for an excuse to go... and when I found out we were going to be staying at Planet Hollywood... they didn't need to ask if I was going, just tell me when and I'm there.  

Stayed from Wednesday to Sunday.  I know I know... that's an eternity for Vegas. Typically, two days and three nights is more then enough; any longer, and you'll be burnt out.  By Friday I was pretty much fried... mainly from all the drinking sunup to sundown.  Anyways, I'm getting off the topic.  

Here are it's Good Points:

** Planet Hollywood is a decent size casino by Vegas standards. Even though they have only two mini-baccarat  tables, a table minimum of $25 for a weekend was fairly priced.   If mini-bacc is not your game, all your usual table games are there for as low as $5 min.

** After taking over the former Aladdin, they've really given this place a face lift .  I love the crystal chandelier from the lobby escalator.  Catered definitely to the younger crowd, this place exudes a lot of energy.  A good amount of traffic inside the casino.

** Positioned centrally on the "Strip".  A definite plus, saves you on cab fare.

** There's a mall... provides plenty of shopping and cheap food court eateries.  Trust me, after 5 days here... I needed it.

Now here's the Bad:

** The standard rooms are over 450 sgft (good size for Vegas).  Linens are nice but I'm not a big fan of purple (yuck!).  That's the theme color at this place.  Each room has an article of clothing from an actual movie that's encased and displayed.  Mine happen to be the dress from the Exorcist... not good, not good all.  Creeped me out.  We also booked a suite.  It had an air hockey table... big plus.  Problem was the low ceilings and again, the purple decor.  What made this a negative for me was the price (average daily rate: little over $200).  During that time-frame, I could've stayed on a nicer property like Palazzo or The Hotel @ Mandalay for the less.  Oh well, ultimately we all wanted to stay in the same Hotel.  All-in-all, the accommodations has more good points then bad, it's more of personal reasons for me... 

** Their Pleasure Pit, a designated table game area with scantily clad girls dancing on stripper poles, is a uglier version of the Pussy Cat Doll lounge @ Caesars.  The girls are really not that ugly, just not as attractive compared to PCD lounge or Playboy Club.  If you're going to rip-off an idea... you gotta make it nicer.

** Since they do have a night club (Prive) here, you get the drunks and obnoxious folks after 1:30 roaming the casino floor.

** Don't have any fine dining restaurants, except for the Strip House.

** Outside of the mall, there's no real attraction or landmark.  For example: Bellagio has the Fountains and the Conservatory, Mirage has the Volcano, Wynn has the light show, etc. 

** Their comping system is very slow and lacking.  When someone plays a minimum of $100 a hand and average about $300.  One would think you can get things right away especially when times are hard and you're starving for big players.  Granted we're no whales, but when I ask for something simple as having my cigarettes comped.  It took the pit boss over 30 minutes later to approve.  Took the the cocktail waitress another 20 minutes to get it.  BAD, VERY VERY BAD!  Also the pit boss was rarely rating the players.  Played for 3 hours at the table, the dealer had to apologize after she saw our disgust.  I never have this problem at Bellagio or MGM, I get it w\/in two minutes.  They definitely need to improve their customer service or they'll never have any committed gamblers.  

All-in-all, it's a good property.  More then likely I won't ever stay here again, especially after dropping a couple of g's here w\/o reaping anything.  Decided to spend the rest of my gambling money at Bellagio.  Planet is on par with properties that cater to young folks like the Palms and Hard Rock.  Modern and contemporary everything.  So if you want something centrally located with plenty of cheap eateries then Planet Hollywood is a safe bet.   Just don't gamble here.

I've stayed at this hotel multiple times and I've frequently make an appearance or two even when I don't stay at this hotel. The rooms are very nice and the suites that overlook the strip are awesome as they have large circle tubs that over look the fountains at the Bellagio. 

The pool area is great, but in the busy season, the pools are a zoo. Lots of people and only so much space around the pools. 

They have a nice selection of restaurants and are attached to the Miracle Mile Shops which is an added bonus. The location is great if you like walking the strip. If you rent a car or have a car to valet, that gets interesting as the location of the garage in comparison to heavy traffic.

Went to Vegas for my wife's birthday in August and stayed 3 nights. First when we went to check in they said there was only a handicapped accessible room and smoking rooms available even though I had booked a NON smoking room a month before. I HATE handicapped rooms and refused to take either one. After asking to speak to a manager and a little bit of a wait he magically was able to find a non smoking regular room. The room was nice enough, some things had some wear and in need of updating but overall the room was OK for the money. The problem was with the construction noise at 6am in the morning for all 3 days, the service at the desk and the LAME excuse for a pool they have. There are 2 SMALL rectangle pools on the 6th floor with10X more concrete than there is pool and they are ICE COLD!. There is a reason there are no pictures of the pool on their website. I complained at the front desk about the construction noise and the pools being so cold, they apologized said there were no more rooms available and they would look into why the pool was so cold. On the plus side its in a good location is fairly cheap but I wish we would of stayed somewhere else. I will not visit again.

Excellent location. Room was spacious with a tub and a shower.
Everything was clean and nice. The mall attached to the hotel made us super convenient to shop for Black Friday 2017.

Upon arrival at 1PM, I was being charging early check for additional $15 which I refuse to pay so I had to return later.  This was certainly a first that I have ever heard in hotel doing this as an additional service after I waited 25 minutes in line to check in on top of  additional $20\/night resort fee was definitely something that I didn't expect after the booking for mediocre room that claimed to be 4-stars by the rating (keep in mind that many of these ratings are bought by the company just like Chinese government buying stars for their hotel ratings) is horribly bias and bought since I know how some of these rating guide works.  I certainly didn't expect that hotel in the USA is following the foul business practice of airlines.  The casino is just average since it is surrounded by fierce competitors who can easily out do this mediocre resort.  Since it was booked through bookit.com, I couldn't refuse the room and check out since the penalty is 100%.  I've decided to opt out of all amenities such as spas and restaurants since I was quite dismay of the poor business practice and I have NO doubt in my mind that  that they will add a mandatory gratuity to your bill if you happen to use their spas and other services. Since I have my own internet, why should I have to pay for resort fee? For WHAT? I also blame BOOKIT.com for NOT being truthful about their latest unsavory business practice.  This review was posted and removed by Farris of Yelp.  THIS ONE WILL STAY.
I am too stuffed to speak. If you walk by this place stop and eat. The ribs were fantastic, the service was great! The seating was so comfortable I was falling asleep.

The best thing about this hotel is the location, you can walk practically anywhere since it's in the middle of the Strip, which is a plus. The set-up of the hotel might be a little confusing. Check-In is hidden on the bottom floor and the only way to get there is on elevators\/escalator hidden in the Casino. 
The first room we stayed in was nice, it was Baywatch themed, it had two costumes, which I thought was pretty cool. The Baywatch bathing suit on the way had a light which was a nice plus, but the table case with the other costume light was broken, which was a little disappointing. The view was fine, nothing to rave about. I heard the hotel was the Aladdin previous, which might explain why the bathroom sinks like a magic lamp. The rooms also look dated, especially for a hotel that opened around 2007. The hallways look awesome with the nice carpet and then you open the doors to a dated room, that looks kind of like an older Best Western. The second room we got, I cant remember the theme, but it was a little big and pretty much the same as the first room - but the bath tub wouldn't drain - which I also saw a complaint about on here. The table case light was also broken in this room, so it seems like they're probably all broken. We got the room for a great deal, so that's what made it seem better. The beds are also a little hard. But overall, I had a nice time, I just wish it was a little nicer for how much the hotel usually is (for an extra day it would of been about $134 on Tuesday, but we paid about $70 a night - including the resort fee using a discount site).
The Miracle Mile is also located in the hotel, so if you don't feel like walking far to get something to eat, you can always grab something down stairs, but beware that the prices are at least $2 more. But it's still a nice place to walk around.
Overall, the location is the best part of this hotel.

We just stayed at Planet Hollywood during our first trip to Vegas, and it was A-OK. 

Things I liked: It's mid-strip, which is a great launch point for exploration. Our room (Ultra Hip with 2 queens) was modern and clean with a large bathroom. The Miracle Mile Shops are attached and have tons of shopping choices. It was easy to get in and out via Uber because the vehicle entrance isn't on the strip. The hotel was quiet. And, it was relatively cheap! 

Things I didn't like: Everywhere including our room had a constant, mild smoky smell (not a higher prevalence of smokers here, but I wonder about ventilation). The toiletries weren't great. The pool was easily the worst compared to other hotels we explored. PH doesn't host any of the super compelling\/classic food or entertainment experiences.

This was a fine place for us to stay on our first trip because we honestly didn't spend much time in the hotel--we were too busy exploring! On a future trip to Vegas, I think we would spend a little more money and stay somewhere nicer because our priorities would be different.

I stayed at PH a few times a few years ago and everything was great, so I decided to book a room here as a halfway point to Havasu. Everything was horrible.

1. I forgot that if you self park you have to awkwardly walk through the miracle mile shops. That in itself with luggage adds a good 10-15 mins before actually getting inside the casino.

2. I forgot that it's hard to find landmarks to figure out how to get to the escalators or elevators to get to the lobby. Which means awkwardly walking around the casino for another 5-10 mins before finding an employee to ask how to get to registration.

3. Registration line took forever. I checked-in online and still waited for 30 mins...pretty pointless.

4. The room was pretty disgusting. It felt like a seedy motel as opposed to the 'hip' room it's supposed to be. The furniture was dinged up and in a weird setup nonetheless. The carpet made my feet dirty after walking on it barefoot...gross, so gross.

5. I was interested in ordering room service, but there was no hotel information book with a menu (that is generally standard for Vegas hotels). 

6. I tried to check out on my T.V., but it wouldn't even turn on...had to call and leave a message through their system to check out. 

7. Hours after checkout I receive an email telling me to  checkout online for an easy alternative...so helpful after I already checked out.

the rest of our group stayed at the bellagio, which was one room short - therefor my buddy and i found ourselves across the street at ph.

beyond being made fun of the whole weekend, i actually liked ph. the casino was refreshing modern and 'hip,' and the room was really nice.

the casino floor bathrooms were also super clean - and when you go on a 3 day binge of tequila shots and buffets...this is important.

the one major downfall was the pool. im no high roller but comparing the ph pool to the bellagio pool isn't even fair. i think my childhood neighbor had a cooler pool - and possibly better looking people hanging out around it.

would be fine staying here again - if i had to.

Blah.....  Not impressed. Stayed here for 7 nights and tried most of the restaurants and a lot of the gaming. With the exception of the fabulous staff at Koi most of the folks here seem tired of the guests and just going through the motions. I remember when the bartenders were engaging and fun to talk to. The ones here don't seem to give a crap about creating raving fans and returning guests.... Especially the Sports Book bartenders. They just seem to expect a 20-25% tip for nothing. The poker room staff was great...  On 2 of the 7 days I stayed I came back to find my room wasn't cleaned at all and towels were not replaced. Beats me why they charge a resort fee and provide no resort amenities. Heck I just wanted a clean room. I could go on and on but what's the point. Avoid this place if you want the Vegas experience and the royal treatment you expect when you come to Vegas and splurge on fun and excitement.  This Hotel is just a big downer.

Pretty good hotel. I stayed at the west gate in a 1 bedroom suite, but also got a chance to go into my friends 2 bedroom suite, which was pretty impressive. The 2 bedroom suite had a great view, while the one i stayed in did not lol. Can't complain though, the hotel was clean and had a nice welcoming feel to it. 
Earls of sandwiches is right downstairs, so you can get a delicious sandwich for lunch without having to walk far.
There's shopping for you shoppers downstairs too lol and it's in a nice location on the strip.
Great place to stay if you ever get the chance!

The three stars are mostly for the location, which is fantastic -- you're right in the middle of everything. There's a Sephora in the lobby! And because I went on a Monday, the rate was only $99 ($69 plus that garbage mandatory "resort fee" of $30). 

The room is perfectly decent, and the bathtub was HUGE. I love that there was a TV set on the wall in front of the bathtub.

What keeps it only at 3 stars is the service. There was hardly any. When my safe stopped working, it took Security 40 minutes to arrive and fix it. When I got overcharged for internet, the front desk lady gave me an attitude and basically called me a liar over the phone (they have a 2-device limit; one of my devices got kicked off the wifi and I had to reconnect) before begrudgingly waiving the fee as a "one-time courtesy." When I needed other amenities, nobody answered the phone.

As long as rates are low, I'd go here again for the location (until I can afford someplace swanky like the Aria or the Mandarin). Just don't expect amazing customer service.

Friend's family were visiting the states and invited me. I had the room for myself. I got the 50th floor which required a security key. It was a nice floor, bed was great.

What's Inside?
-TV Bedroom and TV in Bathroom
-AXE spray\/Soup\/Shampoo\/Dryer
-Bathtube and Shower separate
-Safe Vault
-One person sofa
-Two bottle of aquafina
-Ice tank
-Desk
-Internet $14.99\/day

PROS:
-Bathroom is big, same layout as Bellagio\/Venetian\/Palazzo bathrooms
-TV in the bathroom have ceiling speakers
-Bed was very comfortable

-Miracle Mile shops just downstairs
-Plenty of restaurant on site: $-$$$
-24 Hr Starbucks

CONS:
-Bedroom TV is an old tube
-No Ice Machines on the 50th\/51st floor. Closest ice machine was on the 38th floor. Or I'd have to tip the butler for ICE!
-Internet was ridiculously expensive

You enter Planet Hollywood through a very modern-looking lobby, but don't expect that style or modernity to be found elsewhere in the hotel.  Our room was clean, but the armoire that housed the TV and the ironing board had a gaping spot where a mini fridge used to be\/should have been. There was obvious wear and tear on the furniture and the door (who wants to stay in a hotel room that looks beat up?) The fixtures in the bathroom were leftover from the days when the hotel was the Aladdin (the shower faucet even said 'Aladdin' on it!) Our phone didn't work - they sent one guy up to inspect it and said they would send another to replace it, but never did. They also forgot to take our credit card at check-in, which meant that we couldn't charge anything to our rooms for the first day\/night. There were loud mechanical noises going on throughout the second night making it difficult to sleep (plus we could loudly hear the shower and bathroom noises from the adjacent rooms). Service at the pool (we paid for a daybed in the 21-over section) was lacking, and the spa, while great service, felt very old and out of date (and was still reminiscent of the Aladdin days). I wouldn't stay here again.

My absolute favorite hotel on the strip to stay in! I am a total rewards member so they comp rooms for me. I have stayed in all of the Caesars properties but truly love this one. It's in the middle of the strip so everything you want to see is sooo close. The restaurants are all amazing! So many choices. The miracle mile is a great place to shop for all budgets! The rooms are so nice. We always have a great view. Beds are comfortable! But the deep soaking tub is the best part! The need to update some of the movie memorabilia in the rooms but I really don't have any complaints!,

Stayed at planet Hollywood. Worst experience.
1) the check-in lady "Cassie" was EXTREMELY RUDE. She was giving major attitude and was disrespectful.  She ruined everyone's vibes and killed the mood for my entire party. I called to speak to a manager and she didn't care, she said "she'll handle it"... Didn't seem to care at all.
2) hotel is extremely old and outdated. Carpet in the hallways was ripped up and very old.
3) room had BROKEN cabinets (tv stand). One door was missing and the other door is broken. 

Overall, I hated this place. I've stayed at many hotels- this is ultimately the worst one. The customer service is so horrible.

I only went to the Casino part... even though I didn't win any $, I still had a lot of fun. The decor is cute and the lights on the top change colors. 
Bathrooms were really nice and clean :)
It's also conveniently located kind of in the middle of the strip so if you do stay here, you can walk to either side :)

Sad to say I have to give them two stars. The rooms where way to small for the price and the resort fee is like $35 a day plus having to walk the miracle mile to get to the casino is really annoying. I love the younger atmosphere and the mall is great but the casino needs to do better with their rooms plus the bath tub head fell off and I thought I was going to flood the hotel room but luckily I was able to figure it out and put it back on. I have had a better room at Sunset Station. If you wanna go shopping go here or the fashion show mall.

Disappointed about service at the check-in, the quality of the room, the maintenance service so far. Paying $1300 for the boulevard room and it looks like nothing but college boys stay in this place. I wouldn't book this room again, although I'm sticking it out this time because it's my son's 21st birthday. See my pics of the room.

First time staying here. I've stayed in numerous other strip hotels, and this isn't the best nor the worst. They upgraded us at the front desk at no charge, which was great. Extra 100sq ft, his and her sinks. Not to mention the room was covered in Steven Seagal memorabilia! Sold for me! Customer service was top shelf from Valet to checkout. Wifi is FREE for up to two devices (after you pay resort fees) also, great view of the strip. 




The casino, lobby situation can be a little overwhelming at first. But once you use landmarks to remember how you get around, you'll be good. Our landmark was the Britney wheel to get back to the hotel lobby. Minor complaint about the rumor, and I do mean minor! The shower took about 8-10minutes to get remotely warm. 

We also ordered room service. Wasn't terrible. We ordered the Sunset Strips and Chicken sandwich. Both were delicious. Waiter was very nice and knew both my name and my wife's when he came in. 

Overall, I love staying here because of the customer service and PH central location on the Strip. And also the Total Rewards program covers all Caesars properties!

Went in for a vegas donation tattoo and we made our appointment the day before and our artist was very accommodating to our SMALL changes , not to mention he was funny!! (Billy) would definitely recomemd!

My wife and I usually stay at PH when we visit Vegas.  The location is excellent with access to the entire strip within walking distance.  If you rent a vehicle, accessing the valet or parking garage is very convenient.  

The rooms are comfortable and casino is always alive.  There are several good restaurants (Earl's and Gordon Ramsay's BurGR) and of course Starbucks has more than one location inside.  Staff is always friendly and accommodating.

We brought our daughter, her fiancé and her brother out to Vegas for her 21st birthday.  We had rooms at Flamingo but our VIP host found rooms a Planet that saved us about $80 and since this was my daughters original choice we switched hotels.  We got in very late so the hotel was full, the front desk clerk said he had two dbl queen rooms, or a suite that we would have to move from in two days or gave us the option of changing in the morning after checkouts.  We figured if we're spending more than 6 hrs in our room we should be beaten with a tack hammer anyway so we just kept our rooms. 
Rooms: very easy to find, clean and roomy, not much of a view, large bathroom and pretty quiet. Maid service was great.
Casino:  layout is a bit confusing, lots of walking in circles but that could be attributed to the drinks, they definitely aren't going to cheat you hear.  I do enjoy their sports book.  Actually being able to sit in the bar\/lounge and watch all your games is nice and the bartenders are great.  Sat down for a few hours while the ladies shopped and grabbed a nap. My dealers Ellie and Yolanda were probably the two best I've encountered, lots of fun and helpful.
Overall it's about average.  For the younger crowd that's there to party I'm guessing they'd go 4 or 5 stars but for the parents I'll stay at 3 or 4.

I decided to stay a few nights at this place for my vacation since it was affordable than other places. After finding a parking spot, I go check in and didn't realize how long of a walk it was just to get to the lobby since I had to walk by a bunch of shops to get to the casino and then make my way downstairs.

After checking in and getting to my room I took a look around and saw it wasn't too shabby. There was movie memorabilia and a good sized TV. I didn't like that the bathroom had 2 doors on it. Also the water from the showerhead came out pretty weak. The bathtub was decent sized but I didn't use it. The beds weren't that comfortable and made too much squeaky noises.

The view from the room was alright but the window was really dirty and had a lot of water spots on it.

The casino area was decent. I like playing slots so there were a good amount of games to choose from but they didn't have certain ones like other casinos. The payouts here are terrible though.

Aside from the longass walk from the parking lot to the room, my first night I went to the shop outside the casino near the south elevators to ask for directions for BurGR. The rude female employee told me there's an info booth which I didn't see it and brushed me away with a rude tone.  

The good things about this casino are BurGR, Fat Tuesday and Earl of Sandwich. 

Would I stay here again? Only if it was comped.
Horrible experience will never stay here ever!!!! Escalators never worked ...the mattress was hard as rock we left a day early...one good thing Gordon Ramsey burgers were delish

I love this hotel and casino because I always win here. I'm lucky on the slot machines and there's a lot of things to do around this place. There's a mall full of shops and a bunch of restaurants. I've stayed here once before but it was a few years ago and the rooms were very nice too. They have a great roof top pool and the cocktail servers are always all over you. 

The location is across the street from the Bellagio fountains and next to my other favorite casino at Paris. I love this location. Parking is easy too and there's a lot of it which makes me happy because a lot of casinos have limited parking that is hard to find.

Let me start off by saying I was so completely stoked at the great deal I got with this hotel.  I assumed it would be awesome based on how cool the casino looked. 

I have to say this was the absolute worst hotel experience.... EVER ( And no I am not be over dramatic). ok, fine, i will give it 1\/16 of a star for the pricing, which should have been an indicator of what was to come. 

Lets start off by saying there is absolutely no point to look on their website to judge what your room experience may be. That would be a complete waste of your time. The website does not resemble to room at all. First, the room is completely depressing, barely any lighting and really big, dark furniture. Don't expect to cover up with a cozy comforter, oh that's right, you just get a sheet to cover up with. So at night ( during the peak of summer) you can either sleep with your AC and freeze, or turn it low or off and toss and turn all night b\/c your so freaking hot. 

Ladies, don't plan on straightening your hair (which we all know if an absolute essential). That would just be too much to ask. Why you wonder. Well, the moment I plugged in my small straightener, the breaker went off and the bathroom went dark... TWICE and as a result my expensive beauty essential went dead. I made a claim with the hotel and after sending a security guard (WTF) to my room, I was told that the hotel was not at fault and I was just going to have to deal.

The nicest part of the room, I reckon, would be the bathroom... if you like to find a cockroach waiting for you in the morning as you walk into the shower...... seriously!

I would have rather stayed at Hooters, at least I would have left smelling of chicken wings!!!!

Don't trust them with your luggage! They will take your tip and not deliver if they don't go thru it!
My laptop was stolen and when they made me come down there to talk to them they have a book of stolen items and the gentleman next to me was complaining to Jordan and he was being a jerk!! Great customer service at this hotel!!

I enjoyed my stay here soooo much!

I had a fabulous room.  Although Bruce Willis staring at me over the top of a gun, while getting ready in the bathroom was a little intimadating.  

The room was spacious and in good repair.  They crowning glory however  was the view.  We had a view of the Bellagio fountains. It was so magnificent.  

However, my friends were in the south tower, with a room halfway renovated, they had a small tv( we had a plasma) and still had the alladin carpet with a view of nothing.  

Ask for a renovated room, and try to stay in the north tower, you will not be sorry

The casino was tons of fun.  We gambled a lot.  I didnt win anything but my friend won $1000.  You can pull a daily slot for a chance to win $2million, I won tickets to Stomp, and the boy one a flashlight!

Planet Hollywood's location on the Strip is its chief draw - it's practically in the middle of everything.

To me, their name doesn't exactly evoke glamour, so I'm left thinking of the periodic table or Punnett squares, inexplicably - maybe it's the "PH" plastered everywhere? Thankfully, the reality of Planet Hollywood is something else entirely: the casino is more modern, and less tacky, than its previous incarnation - remember the Aladdin? There's usually a good crowd on the casino floor, or at the many eateries and bars.

Want to shop? Go to the attached mall. Really want to get shopping done? The Forum Shops aren't far away. If you're not in a shopping mood, and would rather ogle pretty women, sit in the Pleasure Pit and get your money systematically stolen by their attractive card dealers, and watch the go-go dancers undulate, distracting even "serious" players who ought to be focusing on their gambling.

Haven't stayed at their hotel yet, but I always enjoy a drink (or two) here when I'm in town.

First time in Vegas and this was a great choice for a place to stay!  Check in was done via email and we received a text when the room was ready.  The porter with our bags actually beat us to the room by a few steps.   We needed a mini fridge for medication and it was brought up within 20 minutes of checking in.  Room was clean and spacious.  Huge bathroom. We didn't hear any noise from other rooms.  No delays with the elevators.    Checkout was a breeze done via the tv, so no lines.  The only negative - the 2 chairs in the room need to be replaced.  Sitting in them wasn't possible - could only sit on the edge of the seat to put on shoes etc, otherwise would sink too low\/far back.  Would definitely return.

Nice hotel, nice room.

Actually, our room was reallyyy nice.

The beds were comfy and I won at DaVinci Diamonds.

David Spade is nice.

My go to hotel on the strip due to value, environment, and location. 

The casino has a good vibe. Table limits are not too high. Blackjack dealers are well above average for the strip. Plenty of gaming tables, slots, places to eat, etc. A relatively small casino but that is good. To me places like Caesar's and The Venetian are overwhelming. 

Hotel rooms are always clean and the decor is modern and decent. Room prices are great. 

Sure, you can find "better" on the strip, but that will cost you.  You can find cheaper on the strip, but your experience may suffer. Bang for buck, I love PH.

Good riddance to this rubbish service and hotel.

Tried to book a reservation over the phone for my daughter, but all I got was either being put on hold or passed back and forth from front desk to reservations.
I told reservations I am paying with my credit card and they insisted that my daughter must have my credit card to check in and then tell me that I should have booked 3 days in advance.

This place is cheesy. After a recent stay I will look elsewhere. It's got themed rooms with generic replicas of props behind a glassed frame.  It's basically still the Aladdin with a new facade in front.  I know it glitters but it's in a unfinished part of the strip and it just has a isolated and deserted feel to it.

(PLEASE READ IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT STAYING HERE)

Wont get to deep with my review, but here are some things you should know before booking here.

Arrived on a Sunday night and stayed unit Tuesday morning. For what I paid it was a pretty good deal. Employees were very nice, the hotel room was a decent size, clean room and nice bathroom. But the biggest problem to me was the parking. When you 1st arrive you can pull up to the valet, drop off your bags and go check in. But the problem with this hotel compared to others is that the "self parking" garage is located in the mall, which is connected to the Planet Hollywood and the walk to and from the casino to the parking garage is maybe about a 1\/4 mile walk. So it can be very inconvenient when you have to park in the garage.  So you would think that parking in the complementary valet area would solve that problem and it does, however if and when the valet is full, you have to park in the "self parking" garage. Valet seemed not to be full during the day but if you drove off and returned closer to the evening expect to be taking a long walk back to your room.  The gaming area is okay, kind of small to other casinos and not a lot of variety with the slot machines. Food selection is not that great either but I highly recommend eating at Gordon Ramseys restaurant "Burgr". Excellent place to eat!! Other than that a decent stay but not something I want to go through again. I would recommend look else where unless your on a budget and can get this place at a low rate.

i have stayed this hotel for several times, besides self parking..... i love this resort, very easy to get anywhere...... i can get pink-hot dog and earl sandwich and especially a starbucks in loddy check in~ when i am gamble too much @ casino. order shopping is also very near ^^
but total reward program now charging resort fees, so my husband and i decided to go with M resort with comp weekend rooms and free seafood buffet and no resort fees. ^^

Rooms need updating but the casino was fun.  In addition I left my jacket in the closet and called their lost and found when I got home that night.  The room had been cleaned and re-occupied and my jacket was no where to be found.  The casino floor was nice, but that's it.

This hotel and casino is one of the worst hotels that I've stayed at in Las Vegas, which is sad because I've stayed at more than half of the hotels altogether.

Now, about the hotel: during check in, the line started getting long (about 20 or so couples\/families). That's when 1 of the 2 employees at the check in desks decided to disappear. It took us 45 minutes to check in and we were 2nd in line. The elevators were extremely scuffed up to the point that it just looked broken and unsafe because the ceiling was tilted and visibly shaking. Our room door wouldn't close all the way unless you pulled on the handle using the force of your whole body. The window in the room looked like a prison window because it was only maybe 4x4. We had paid for the resort package, which includes free internet on 2 devices. Not once did the "internet"work for us anywhere on the premises, and they charged us for a mysterious 3rd device that showed up in our room. Half the towels in the bathroom had weird brown stains on them and they looked like they had never been washed and just folded and placed back in the bathroom. 

Now, onto the casino. Some of the dealers were incredibly rude. For example, when checking my ID, they would throw it back towards me instead of just handing it back or placing it on the table like normal people. When trying to make small talk to make everyone's time a little more interesting, a few of the female dealers just glared back with a "why are you talking to me" look on their faces. If they hate working there that much and hate people, don't work in a job that requires you to make human interactions. Some dealers even glared at those at the table who did not tip them when they hadn't even won anything or a significant amount. Lastly, many of the tables were definitely and very obviously rigged. I understand that gambling is about chance but there are some strategies to it. When the strats never work and every consistently go against it, you know that it's rigged, which is what happened here. Not saying this because I lost a lot or anything, because I didn't. Just saying that because it was so obvious and they were eating money for no reason. I have had no problems like these at treasure island, aria, bellagio, or the Venetian. Be fair to your patrons. 

Overall, just don't stay here. You'll be wasting your time and money and can get a much better experience at another hotel\/casino.

Love to visit but first time to stay as a guest was not family friendly or guest friendly for that matter. Parking is very far. Used platinum line to check in and it took longer than regular. Check in guy was rude already setting the tone for the trip.

The worst hotel I've been in vegas, the rooms are dirty! The service is awfullllll!!!!! 
The front desk are so not nice and doing for you things with angry face ( and it not 1 person its 3 that we came in different time) the valet guy told us that the parking is full and after my friend told him i will give u tip he took the car, so now parking is not full!?!?! The worst experience i had in vegas!!!! Don't go there!

Meh.  It took forever for us to get our drinks here while we gambled, and dammit, I'm rating casinos on how fast I get my drank.  It was overly crowded considering this "recession" we're in so, I'm wondering what the draw is.  The mile shops were cool tho, so I'd give those a higher rating.  If you have a chance hit those up.  Gotta love being able to drink and shop in vegas.  This needs to happen elsewhere :)

This was a fun hotel to stay in because:

Location: Couldn't be better. In the middle of the strip and connected to the Miracle Mile shops.

Facilities: We arrived at 1:00am, and music was blasting in the lobby - definitely got us in the mood for a good time. The whole place smelled very strongly of a variety of perfumes - some of them weren't very appealing. The hotel and casino were very clean. There is a chapel inside the hotel! The pool area isn't very glamorous - it almost looked like an afterthought. Our room was very clean, and the bathroom was quite spacious. The carpeting and wallpaper throughout the hotel was a little bizarre.

Services: Nothing special at the front desk. At the spa, a friend got charged twice for a service that was provided 90 minutes late because the masseuse didn't show up.

Price: Not bad at $150\/night! Very, very overpriced spa services.

Casino: There are some unattractive female dancers in the casino in the evening and at night. The casino isn't one I would hit while gambling - not a very exciting atmosphere and not as nice-looking as other casinos.

where to start? check in was super easy and fast, we arrived at 630am but check in was at 3pm, we were given early check in and upgraded to a fountain view room for an additional $100 a night, which im now seeing was a rip-off; the normal rate is $20-50\/night. Im not gonna lie the view was great......... if the windows were not covered in spots! One of the lamps didn't work because the cord was completely cut. Went to take a nap and the pillows reeked of mildew, like they had been left in the washer for WAY too long. Called housekeeping to get them replaced, they said it would be a few mins then the head of housekeeping came to our room to tell us there was a delay but it wouldnt be more than 30 mins, 2 hours later called housekeeping again and they had completely forgotten. We eventually got new pillows but I shouldnt have to call that many times. I went to take a shower and it was completely clogged and started filling with water immediately. The location is great though!! Ohhhh I almost forgot, they are eco-friendly so if you want new linen everyday you must specifically request it. I expected more. oh ya no fridge, so bring a cooler if you wanna keep your drinks cold, we used the trashcan lol

After checking out of the biggest nightmare of my life ( The QUAD which is NOT renovated). We checked in to Planet Hollywood which was amazing as always. So clean, the beds are so conformable , the service is great. They have us a late check out for free because of our horrible experience at the other hotel.The casino is great and the location is great. Take advantage of the PF Changs happy hr specials its defiantly worth it. The room service was  great and they have the late night option you can order anytime of the day or night. 

I highly recommend it!
Walk through review: Really small casino, really trashy feeling and a lot of smoke. The best thing about this place, Gordon Ramsay's BurGr.

3.5 stars is probably the right rating.  

Came here for a show\/conference this past week.  I was kind of excited to stay here because I didn't want to stay in Paris or Bally's.  I thought this should be nicer since they showed it a couple of times in movies.  Anyway the hotel feels old.  The hallways, the carpets, the bathroom.  The bedroom was better than Paris and Bally's but the bathroom in there could have used some better lighting although you would then see the broken parts in the toilet, the stain in the shower stall.  The carpet in the hallways and the rooms just felt old and dirty.  The elevators took longer than usual.  I'm fine with it if we're traveling for work but if I'm vacationing I'll choose Aria or Wynn.  

I can't complain about the casino though because it has a great atmosphere.  From the pleasure pits to the hip hop music they play, the place is happening all night long.  

I'll come back to play but not to stay unless it's for work.

Nauseous room design, on hold for 20 minutes for room\/maid services 3x we tried to call.

Is it HOLLYWOOD because the tables are glass mirrors? *snort snort* LOL

My gfs have always been fans of PH. I myself never been but whatever reason was going on that weekend, rooms at Venetian were $400 for standard room on a Sat night! We opted for PH at $300 and man oh man. This place sucks.

The room we had was at an angle. It was like a parallelogram and so if you wanted to watch tv, you had to turn your neck. It was nauseauting! Imagine what its like after some shots and lines! UGH. Lighting in the room was terrible too... definietly gotta do your makeup in the restroom.

There were NO blackout drapes either. Just some folded up single piece blind. My gf was so drunk in the morning, she kept trying to turn off the lamp and we told her the lamp wasn't even on! LOL

The only great thing was the rest room, huge with 2 sinks on each side, a private toilet so you don't have to worry about someone taking up the entire restroom when you need to get ready. The tub was huge (great for pouring ice in and stashing your alky).  Shower pressure was shitty too.

NOTHING great about this place at all!

This is a pretty standard hotel to stay at in Vegas if you're trying to stick with the "younger" crowd.

Things that you might like about staying here includes the perks of having okay array of food choices, and definitely the Miracle Mile Shops that is right there at your feet. So if you're like me and always forgets to either pack things, or just need to do quick shopping then you would love PH!

Prices are okay, and reasonable. Service here is either a hit or miss.

Final verdict? I would prefer to stay at Vdara over PH, Vdara has comparable prices, and I like their rooms a lot better.

You know how in real estate they say, bathrooms and kitchens sell houses. Well, Planet Hollywood -I wasn't privy to a kitchen but damn, update your bathrooms man. Mentally you know that (hopefully) the cleaning service do bleach or sanitize the bathroom properly, but just the thought of that grime and oowey goowey sticky icky surrounding the fixtures is at least not a health hazard. The room was clean, but if the fixtures in the bathrooms were updated id probably stay here all the time. Til then, thank you for the one night stay - moving to The Cosmopolitan.

We have stayed at PH 7-10 times in the last 10 years and this is our last.  

Our room is clean and new but the bathroom smells like cigarettes 100% of the time and people have been hot boxing 75% most of the time, which might have been fine 10years ago but not anymore.  They should reserve that for the smoking rooms\/floors.  We asked he front desk and they said all they could do was spray the room because the ventilation is shared and it's hard to find out where it comes from.  We asked hem to leave the bottle so we could spray every few hours and apparently they can't because a kid may drink the liquid.  We don't have kids in our room.  

The wifi in our room has full bars but every 3-5minutes it stops working even though you still have full bars and haven't physically moved, requiring you to dis\/reconnect or navigate to a URL you have never visited to trick it to authenticate again.  3-5 minutes from now you will need to do the same thing, and pick a different\/new URL.  The front desk sent us to their wifi team to manually connect which we sat on hold for a while and then decided to move on with life.  

If we had reasonable cell service wifi wouldn't have been important but Even Verizon only had 1 bar of basically unusable lte (sometimes 4 bars of 3G).

The hotel is dirty and run down.  The hotel was overbooked and could not accomodate our request for 2 beds despite having 3 people in the room and were in no way apologetic.  The front desk staff was unhelpful and very snotty. No fridge.  Not even a coffee maker in the room.  The casino seemed much smokier than all the others. Would not stay here again

Besides the view that the room gave us, the dining options and the Miracle Shops, I would probably never stay here again.  They put us in a dirty room!  My kids ALWAYS look under the beds and the found a dirty sock and I said to just leave it there, thinking that was the only thing.  Went out shopping, ate and came back.  My boys wanted to take a bath so I went to draw it for them.  UGH!! SO DISGUSTING. There was still hair in the bathtub, and nasty yellow stains near the hand rail that I had to take a towel and wipe it off.  And of course, while doing that,  I find a pubic hair!!!  EWWWW!!  I don't know why I didn't take a picture of that or called down to complain for that matter.  I wiped it up with the towel and threw it in the corner of the bathroom floor.  We got in bed at about 11PM, and my oldest son yells,"Mommy, what's that on your blanket?!"  I took one look and said it's at the bottom of my feet.  I'm fine.  But I DID take a picture of that!  So NEVER staying here again ever!  And to anyone that wants to stay here in the future, fully inspect your room before you unpack and get comfortable.

First off, I am giving this 4 stars because it fits my demographic perfectly. If you are twenty Something or early thirties, On a budget- yet have enough money for shopping and trip to Vegas, this may be for you. Seriously, I felt like I was in a sea of people all my own age! A refreshing change from the 40 and 50 year old gambling crowd that you get at many casinos- though of course there is some of that here too- but certainly still a younger crowd.

This hotel features trendy decor in the rooms with Hollywood themes (mine was the movie Aliens and Bill Paxton was inside my coffee table!). Convienence is also key because PH is almost smack in the middle of the strip, affording opportunities to explore on foot (especially the exciting new city center, which has two awesome clubs so far, Haze and Eve). 

I didn't take note of any fine dining opportunities as the group I was with wanted to go to PF Chang's China Bistro, however, I got the feeling that this hotel was not built for fine dining compared to say, The Wynn, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay or MGM... It is much smaller than other Vegas resorts and consequently does not house a major theatrical production on the scale of Cirque Du Soliel. This is a great place to spend a weekend in Vegas if you want easy access to the clubs, a place to crash, and perhaps meet an attractive someone in the Casino.

I stayed at Planet Hollywood in Vegas for my 26th birthday and I had an amazing stay. The rooms were amazingly affordable. We even upgraded for $20\/ night for a room with a view, and we were very happy that we did. We stayed on the 50th floor of the 51 floor building. The view was outstanding, you could see the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio water show, and an amazing view of the strip.The accommodations were nice and clean and very comfortable. 

It's so nice having a mall underneath you. On the first day I stopped to get my hair done immediately after checking in, because unfortunately the one thing I had forgot to pack was my hair straightener and I wanted to look good for a night on the town. Luckily there was a salon in the mall. It was so convenient having what I needed right downstairs.

Another plus is that it's in a good location from everything else on the strip. Everything's in pretty much walking distance.

My only complaint is no free wifi for guests, but you can always stop downstairs at the Starbucks for it if you like.

I will have to say that I had a great experience for my first time in Las Vegas thanks in part to my stay at the Planet Hollywood.

This was my first experience staying at Planet Hollywood hotel, and it will be my last.

Pros:
- Visually, the theme, hotel and casino as a whole look nice.
- If you smoke, you'll have no problems with the rooms.

Cons:
- We had reservations for a non-smoking room. When we checked in, they had absolutely no smoke-free rooms left even though we made reservations for a non-smoking room months in advance. So we were stuck with a disgusting\/stinky room. Although the room had Brad Pitt photos all over the walls, it wasn't enough to make up for the smoke saturated room and smoke filtering in from the rooms next door. 

The next morning we went to the front desk and I insisted we get switched to a non-smoking room, and possibly get comped for having such a horrible 1st night. The guy at the desk avoided me the whole time, but did change our room, without any comps.

- The bath tub had pubes and weird pink residue in it.

Oh Planet Hollywood, this was a one and last time for me. I was expecting glitz and glamour, but it seems somebody just slapped the Planet Hollywood name on this building and said "who cares, I just want a paycheck". 
Out of the 10ish properties I've stayed at in Las Vegas, you have the last spot! The rooms are not impressive- poorly decorated, linens starchy, scratchy, and low quality.  Even the pillows sucked. I did not have a restful sleep here. I told my friend as we were lounging at the pool in the flimsy and old lounge chairs...."I feel like we are at a community pool in a bad suburb". There is ZERO attention to detail at this hotel, and it has only one pro- LOCATION! If you are being nostalgic for the Aladdin, just visit the below average spa here. The spa has not been updated at all and still has the Aladdin theme. Time for a bulldozer here.

Stayed for a BSB concert.  Maybe we were lucky, but we drove up to Valet \/ Luggage, walked indoors and straight to check in, elevators were 100 feet away, just past a Starbucks, we were on the 16th floor, just around the bend from the elevators...Room was beautiful with view of pool, AND!!!!! an empty refrigerator, devoid of $20 cans of Coke, so we had room to store and cool our on drinks!!!

Had a great experience here. Slept at this hotel in the North tower and the rooms were very clean and updates. A few months ago I stayed in the south tower and it was not as nice so make sure you ask for the north towers! (The side of the Starbucks)

Okay I'm going to make this as short and simple as possible because I'm one of those people that don't read those long @$$ reviews...

SERVICE: I'm VERY disappointed with the service I received here. For the price that I paid, I expected way more. We booked a room that had 2 beds (2 months in advance for my friends 21st bi-day) because there was 4 people staying in the room, when we got there they gave us a room with one bed because they were "sold out" of the 2 bed rooms. So, they expected me to cramp 4 people into one bed, and be satisfied with that! I called 3 times to make sure I was given that room! These people kept telling me yes! After I got back, and tell them that it's BS they gave me a room with 2 beds (magically opened up) with no fridge. I didn't care at this point, just wanted my room with two beds. 

PARKING: is too far from the casino. Had heavy luggage and ended up with a back pain. 

INTERNET: You have to pay for it -another disappointment, even Circus Circus has free Wi-FI (wtf)

The only nice thing is the location, but i've stayed in Paris before and their service is EXCELLENT. Stay at Paris instead (neighbor hotels), Planet Hollywood is going to stress you out instead of making you feel like on vacation.

I stayed here for a bachelorette party the past weekend. We had 3 rooms and we couldn't get the near each other, but they did at least put us all on the same floor. 

Beware that Planet Hollywood is the old Aladdin and not all the rooms are complete yet (ours included).

The bathroom is a good size for a group of girls sharing a room for sure. They are pretty short on outlets in the room though.

I'd be interested in what it's like after the remodeling is completed.

The mall attached is a nice plus especially for a HOT summer day!

This is rapidly becoming one of my favorite places to go when we go to the Strip.  Here's why:

- The vibe.  The place attracts a younger crowd that has a lot of energy.

- Bars & Lounges.  They have a wide variety of bars and lounges.  On a recent visit we spent some time at the Heart Bar....a DJ was playing and the drinks were reasonable....$8 for a glass of Wine.

- Miracle Mile Shopping mall.  This mall is pretty cool with some unique shops and dining options.  The Earl of Sandwich is at the South end of the mall.....one of my favorite Sandwich shops in town.

- Restaurants.  From cheap, food court type food to nice sit-down restaurants, there is something for everyone here.  One of the highlights is Pink's from Los Angeles which is known for their Hot Dogs.

- Easy access to the Strip.  The distance between the property and the Strip is short, making it easy to get to\/from the Strip.

There are a few negatives to the place......the parking situation sucks.  The parking garage is at the rear of the property and the walk to the casino is pretty far.  Valet parking is underground and is also a big pain the ass.  This is a function of very poor design which has plagued this hotel since they opened.  The layout of the casino floor is very confusing....it's difficult to figure out where you are located and how to get around.  The mall is a little confusing as well.

Will I return?  You can count on it.

I've stayed here a couple of time before and not had any issues in fact enjoyed my time at PH but recently it seems like that have gone way downhill.

The past weekend my Fiancé and I stayed at PH (Sat-Mon). We did the online check in which was nice and we didn't have to wait in the line we just picked up our keys and went up to the room. 

The room was basic, a little on the small side but the bathroom was large so that made up for it. We settled in and I hopped in the shower. As soon as I got out there was an overwhelming smell of pot in the bathroom. It smelled like somebody was smoking it IN THE ROOM. We debated for a moment and decided that the smell was too much to deal with. I called concierge and nobody picked up, so I called the front desk who transferred me to security. Unfortunately I don't remember the gentleman's name but he told me that it was a "pretty common thing" and there was "nothing they could do". He wouldn't even come up and walk the floor! He did tell me that if it was really bothering me I could call the front desk and they might be able to move me if the hotel isn't booked.

Now I don't expect security to come up and bang on every door to see who was smoking the pot (on a non-smoking floor by the way). But was it too much to ask the walk the floor a little and make your presence known? We ended up not moving rooms as we had already unpacked and settled into this room and were only staying 2 nights. We did open the vent and keep the bathroom door closed (the smell was only coming from the bathroom vents). The smell stayed at varying degrees until Sunday evening. 

Because of how security handled my concerns I will no longer be staying the PH. I am having my wedding in Vegas in March and will be encouraging all of our wedding guests to stay elsewhere. This is super unfortunate to know that this hotel used to be a great place to stay but has turned into this.

First time staying at this hotel recently. A few reasons, decent room rate (bought a few weeks early), central location on the strip (across the street from City Center LV), gambling at Pleasure Pit, some really good eats and drinks located inside the resort\/casino and the Miracle Mile shops.

Checked-in with ease and our 2 bed suite was in the south tower. It was nice and comfortable size, bathroom with a walk-in shower and separate deep bathtub. LCD Tv and movie memorabilia decor. Some noticeable repairs in a few areas of the room that weren't too attractive. Overall, a good stay. 

Current Favorites..

Eats:
-Spice Market Buffet
-Earl of Sandwich
-Pinks

Libations:
-Fat Tuesdays - if you're into crazy flavors and sizes of daiquiris
-Halo Bar

Be sure to get a Total Rewards card for added benefits!

I would definitely come back.

I stopped by this Casino after my City Center and Belliago visit since it's across the street from the Belliago and i actually like this Casino, first thing i walked in went to the Total Rewards center to ask if my Harrah's card was still valid here the guy asked me for it and stupid me i left the card in my bag at the room ok so he said no problem i gave him my id and he verified everything and printed me a new card simple and easy thumbs up to that. So i played a bit then walked around and walked around the shopping area i also give thumbs up to the shops lots to see. Next time i'll need to try some of the food places lol.

We used to love this place, now it's on our "do-not-visit"-list. They used to advertise not charging resort fees. They sure do now.
The pool used to be fun. Now it's all charge a whole bunch extra if you want to be near the pool or walk half a mile to your seat in the shades for most of the day. (And I mean a whole bunch).
The rooms were nice back in the day. The rooms were nice once, now they are just old. You can see that the carpet should have been replaced years ago.
The floor is just loud. There is nowhere you can go to sit and drink or eat without having to yell at each other.

No need to say this was our last visit. We used to recommend this place, we will now tell people to stay away.

Rooms were nice size, there were two pools, and a wave machine ($20 for 30 mins to ride small waves). Price for 2 nights was $200, which is decent. Staff was friendly as well. One thing i cannot get over was that they didn't have complimentary tooth brushes. I don't know if it's a vegas thing but i haven't been to a hotel in which they didn't give this. So, nothing special about this place, unless you really like britney spears (shes playing there until 2015 sometime)
they did a great job converting the Aladdin hotel in the PH, it is so much nicer inside and out. nice place to hang out on the strip.

Let me start by saying I've come to and played at PH before but never stayed as guest. From the outside looking in I liked the vibe and the dealers at night at the Pleasure Pit. The sports book has multiple tvs and the bar is right behind it so that's convenient.

However, the experience is different when staying here. Checking in was a breeze via online so I'll give it +1 star for that. The rooms try to look nice with movie props like a Hard Rock Cafe so it gets +1 more star.

Now for the cons. Whoever designed the buildings made it so that you can hear the water pipes when another room turns them on. This gave a rude awakening multiple times while sleeping in during the morning. Once awaken it was hard to fall back asleep!
Next, the lighting in the cabinets didn't work. Without lighting, it was impossible to see inside the closet to hang clothes. The room as it is has little lighting except for one ceiling light and 3 standing lamps.

The TV gets over 60 channels but only 4 related to sports. The rest are a mix of advertisement, basic cable, and foreign channels. 

Our bathroom had a broken toilet seat cover, pretty embarrassing. The rooms also don't have a fridge so forget bringing back perishable foods or drinks that need to be chilled.

Here is the part that made me the most mad. Twice the dealers almost screwed our party out of money. When buying in the dealer spread the hundreds on the table and counted wrong. I knew because I counted prior to heading to the casino ow much I would buy in. I had to correct her before she realized or I would have lost money already. Then when my buddy cashed out, the dealer stacked the chips and shorted him 100. Clearly the stacks of black chips were not even and 100 more protruded out. What is worse is the floor stood right behind her and said nothing as she handed out the pink chips. We had to call her out on the missing 100. Mistakes like this shouldn't be made when it comes to counting, coloring, and dispensing chips. 

Unless the room is complementary, Planet Hollywood is Planet Mediocre. Beware your chips as well

My husband and I stayed at PH over Memorial Day weekend. We had a fine time, the room was nice, good location, and I'll up the ranking of this review if I ever get my issue resolved. When I got home I realized that I had left an outfit in our room. I called the hotel and got the number for Lost and Found.  I spoke to Anthony, who asked me what room number and what I left.  I described the outfit to him and he put me on hold, came back, and said he found one skirt, one top, and "a pair of dirty panties". First of all - was that really necessary????  I was so taken aback.  A pair of underwear would have been sufficient.  Anyway, whatever.  I was glad they had my stuff and asked him to please send the items back to me.  Because the room was under my husbands name he had to send an email to Lost & Found to release the outfit.  I waiting several days and never heard anything so I called Anthony again and he said I should get an email with the articles listed and I would pay a $20 shipping charge.  Exorbitant price, in my opinion, but again...whatever.  I just wanted my outfit back.  I waited for about 2 weeks and never got anything in the mail.  I finally pulled up the email and found a tracking number and when I tracked the package it said that a label had been created but the package had never been shipped.  Thus began another 2 weeks of me calling and emailing Anthony to find out what was going on. He rarely responded to my emails and never to my phone calls.  He said that his boss, Jamie, would take over from here.  I still to this day have never received a phone call or email from Jamie. Finally I asked for their supervisors.  For the past 3 weeks I've been dealing with Officer Brian Kramer.  I had to give a report of the articles of clothing to Badge #714 in Risk Management, was told to call back in one week for a resolution.  I left 4 voice messages at Risk Management and no one EVER returned my call. I then called Officer Kramer again last Thursday and told him this has been going on for too long and they needed to find my outfit or reimburse me.  He said he was busy with another issue and would call me back the following day (Friday). Today is Tuesday and no one has called.  Brian is off work today and no one else will respond to me.  Did creepy Anthony take my outfit and "dirty panties"??  I just want my stuff back or they need to reimburse me for the cost of the outfit since they apparently "lost" it.  Poor customer service at it's worst.

Why I removed my 5 star review of PH! 

A while ago I had a very bad experience at PH - room not ready, told type of room paid for not available so bait-and-switch to lower class room, room in bad repair, etc. This was during a holiday when the regular folks who run the Diamond Desk were likely off. Manager eventually made things better - mysteriously found that an upgraded room was "now available" - gave one free night (out of 6) for the "misunderstanding"  - etc. I said thanks and the management including the sales dept assured me to expect better things next time. 

WELL NEXT TIME HAPPENED and guess what? For the 2nd time in a row I was not provided a free upgrade (I am a meeting planner and co-sponsored a major convention there along with separate meeting plus doubled my credit line). OK so I do not spend much time in my room so big deal? Not when wall paper is peeling from the walls, dust is literally building up in the corners of the furniture, everything is banged up, light bulbs are out, etc. At the very least -0 no matter qhat hotel it is - I STILL WANT A CLEAN ROOM IN GOOD REPAIR!

Further more no one takes their Total Rewards card anymore - no points to be given or taken - no discounts - not even their gift shop or own restaurant (Planet Dailies - BARF AVOID AT ALL COSTS - EVERYONE IN MY GROUP HAD TUMMY ISSUES AFTER EATING THERE AND SOME ARE STILL SICK). I spent ZERO in the casino because of these issues and we are very seriously looking at one of the MGM properties for our convention \/ meetings next time (Aria is GREAT BTW). 

I have stayed at a Caesar's owned property 10 times out of the last 12 times in Vegas (over the last 8 years or so) - brought 9 major events \/ meetings \/ conferences there. And this will be the very last time for now (they are planning a reorganization - chapter 11 so perhaps after PH is sold it might improve - who knows). My advice - stay \/ meet \/ play at one of MGM's new or recently remodeled properties.

4 Stars only cause they had a major flood this week while we were there. A good portion of the casino, many restaurants, the buffet and one whole side of elevators and escalators were all inaccessible for 2 days as a result of the flood.

However I do understand it was out of their control and besides some of the staff being a little short-tempered with us, most  tried to help and when we went to take it up with the hotel management staff they took care of us and made us feel like when we were getting something back for our inconvenience and investment we made in the hotel this week.

The casino in very nice and moderately spread out in range  so there is a little for all, many good restaurants we did not have any issues with the food everything we tried was outstanding. The entrance to the mall is a huge plus, many many stores and cool it in there as it was 120 degrees this week we did spend a lot of time inside.

The pool area was a little  undesirable, the 21 and over pool only had 28 chairs available and there was well over 100 people out there, most people were forced to sit or lay down far away from the pool area and another section or rent an expensive Cabana.

The Family Pool was okay but also was short on chairs and a lot of people and children were concentrated in that area as a result of not being able to sit in the other pool area so it was a little more crowded than we'd prefer but overall it would be good for kids.

We really enjoyed our stay! We stayed here for 3 nights, we booked a fountian view room- when we first checked in I requested a floor as high up as possible,  and was told that nothing was ready at the moment. The gentleman said he had a Resort view room for $20 more  a night- I asked him if he thought it was a nice room-he said it was the best room on the 22nd floor-He was right, when we entered the room what a view! 4 windows and a great view of the Bellagio and Paris hotels. It was Big- the bathroom was huge with a big tub overlooking the strip and a flatscreen over the tub-I've never watched a good movie in a tub before. 

If you need wi-fi they charge $14 so downstairs in the hotel is a starbucks for your free wi-fi!

The casino was very manageable, on the small side which we liked, it's not like some of the hotels where you get lost just trying to find a bathroom or the exit. An added bonus was the tables area where pole dancers in skimpy outfits entertain you while you are losing your money!  
    
Inside the hotel there are a decent number of places to eat from fancy Strip Steak  to Earl of Sandwich-which we ate a few times-tasty! we also ate at P. F Changs for happy hour (3-6pm) what a good deal (it not our favorite chinese) but you can't go wrong with their happy hour, we each had 2 drinks, 4 small plates including tip $40 and the service was quick and friendly.   To sum it up- great room, great location on the strip, great price for a room that was better than at the Palazzo or the Venetian.

Nice, neat and quiet. Served its purpose as a decent place to sleep while we tried to conquer the Strip. I wasn't really happy with housekeeping and felt that not a lot of care or thought went into cleaning this room. We were upgraded to a room with a better view but this wasn't anything too special.

Do not stay at this hotel! Our elevator stopped and dropped a couple feet twice while we were on it with 8 other people. We pressed the emergency call button and nothing. Finally the doors opened to the 6th floor which we had no idea how we got to. We reported it and then went down to the front desk to make sure it was being taken care of.  We were told by two people the elevator had been fixed. Really? In 5 minutes? No way. We asked the manager Vicki, who had ZERO compassion. After getting nowhere with her we requested to be moved to a room where we could walk up the stairs to as we did not feel safe in the elevators.  4 hours later we get a call after attending our work event and she said they were fixing the elevators and would move us to our new rooms. We were then escorted to our rooms. The security guard, Mr. Angelo was very nice and told us where the nearest exit was to walk down the stairs. After they left, we went down two stairwells and were trapped with no exit.  We then waited 18 minutes for security. We have still not received any information on what happened to elevator and were only comped one night stay for our troubles. In light of resent events, I would not deem this a safe hotel and the utter disregard for our safety and what we experienced was atrocious. I travel to Vegas a lot and will never return to this hotel.

It's hard to give a good rating when your check in experience didnt go well. I'm unsure of the point of coming early, being told to return at 4pm when check in is, only to be told you still have to wait 20 minutes because the room is being clean YET folks are walking up to the regular check in line and get a room key and go to their room.

First and last visit here....

Where do I begin? First it took us almost 45 minutes to check in, only to find their computers were down and they couldn't give me the room that I paid extra for.
Although the room was clean it was hot as hell and the AC was set at 60 degrees just blowing hot air. 
We were starving when we got here so we hit the spice Buffet and I can't give it one star. For the tasteless food and the boring ambience $35 a plate wasn't worth it. Food was cold... and dry as hell.
Did I mention the casino itself was riddled with used drink glasses and overflowing ashtrays?
There's better venues in a vegas for your money, go elsewhere

I love this hotel this will be my third visit to Planet Hollywood I think it has something for the new The Young and the old I love that it is centrally located across the street from the Bellagio right next door to the Paris across from Caesars Palace affordable pricing remodel accommodations several activities going on in the hotel on long with decent pool attached to a mall 100 restaurants vendors shops Britney Spears Spears is in the building hello I'm not really a big Gambler so I don't know about the casino part say also do the $20 trick to get your room upgraded I would do another updated Post in a couple weeks when I will be back

This was my first trip to Vegas, and therefor the first hotel I've stayed in there. Overall it was a great experience. We had a room on the top floor of one of the "wings" (these sections go up to floor 23) with an awesome view of the strip and the mountain in the distance. Like other people have said, the rooms are kind of dark, but it wasn't the end of the world. The bathroom was HUGE and well lit. There was a shower, large tub, and plenty of counter space. There was also a huge mirror on the wall outside of the bathroom, which was great for getting ready to go out. Beds were comfy and I didn't have any trouble sleeping. We were on a pretty quiet floor, so noise wasn't an issue, and the only traffic you could hear was the occasional siren or horn. 

Of all the hotels\/casinos we went in, the Plant Hollywood was my favorite. The casino ceilings are high, so it didn't have the claustrophobic feeling I got in other places. The music is loud and upbeat, which I love, but get how that can be annoying to some people. The whole place was super young and fun, which is exactly what we were hoping for. 

The location is awesome, right in the middle of the strip. It's attached to the Miracle Mile shops, which were fun to walk around in, and it's right across from the Bellagio so you're in prime position to watch the fountains. The pool deck (6th floor) has an awesome view of the Eiffel Tower next door. 

We ate at the Earl of Sandwich quite a bit because the food was good and it was cheap in terms of Vegas. Drinks at Heart Bar were pretty pricey (we spent $23 for two drinks here, and $18 for the same thing at Hard Rock). Par for the course, but still painful. Never made it up to the club here, despite being handed wrist bands three different times. Maybe next trip. 

Overall it was a really great hotel experience. The staff was very nice and accommodating, rooms were great, atmosphere was great and location was great. Would totally stay here again.

The feel of this place is better than some of the other places around town.  it seems to be a bit more lively with people dancing around the stage.  Also, their slots were easier because, well duh, i won $ here

Stayed here for first time and loved the suites!!! Very clean and spacious!!! We really enjoyed our two nfht stayed and lived it that we were accommodated to have our group on the same floor will come back

Not great but not horrible. 

I was deciding between PH or MGM to stay for my birthday week celebration and reading reviews as well as considering location, I went with PH (plus the price was a bit cheaper than MGM). 

Upon arrival, the valet helped us right away with our car & luggage. We waited in line for about 10 minutes for registration. We got a woman, named Lorena I believe, who was helpful. We were though hoping for an upgrade because my boyfriend and I were both celebrating our birthdays but unfortunately she couldn't help us. She got our room ready and informed us we should wait until 3pm for no early check in fees, so we waited & hit up chipotlé in the miracle mile. 

It got to be about 10 to 3p so we headed back to the registration desk. A man, named Joel, helped us get our keys and was the sweetest man you'll meet there. He was very helpful and even upgraded us when the other woman couldn't. We were so grateful and ready to begin our birthday trip! 

We arrived at our room (Resort Room 2070) and I was pleasantly surprised it was by the elevator, glad I didn't have to walk to far for our room! We enter and there's a semi large entrance, large bathroom included 2 sinks, 2 vanities, a large shower, enclosed toilet area, and soaking tub. We had a view of the fountain in a mediocre room. Nothing too special about it; again it wasn't nice but wasn't horrible. 

PROS:
Location, mall downstairs was helpful, taxi service was quick, & 2 different starbucks locations in the hotel. 

CONS:
The table that displayed out rooms theme was unfortunately was broken, the soaking tub handle was broken, the toilet paper holder was broken, one of the lamps next to the bed wasn't plugged in, there were 2 phones and only one worked, services such as bellhop, pillows did have a weird smell to them, housekeeping, & front desk took multiple calls for someone to actually attend to you. 

Everything in my cons list, I had read before in previous posts but I didn't take them too seriously. If you really don't mind those things then it's a great place to stay. Its right in the middle of everything. When I was able to interact with the staff they were friendly and eager to help. 

Overall my opinion would be stay there if you won't be in the room enough to care about the imperfections but if you are someone like me who cares, than stay elsewhere.

Location was great...but room horribly lacked cleanliness and information. No dining menu, dried splatters of what looked like soda on the picture in the room and the lampshade, dried up toothpaste not cleaned off the faucet...we alerted the front desk immediately...none of the above ever addressed. Would have complained further...but the button on the phone for the front desk didn't actually lead to a person.

On a recent stay for work, my room looked quite run down and showed alot of wear: scuff marks on walls and cabinets, old 70's style shower stall in which the grout was BLACK, strange white stains on the headboards, dirty carpet. In addition to the wear and tear, it was clear that cleanliness was not a priority. When I checked in there were still handprints on all the mirrors and in addition to that, I found pubic hair on one of the hand towels.
