Apparently there is some kind of industrial complex above the 38th floor and it literally shook the walls of the room and made the loudest rumbling scraping noises every 15-20 seconds. We couldn't even sleep. 
When we checked out we mentioned how terrible the room was and asked what was on the 39th floor. The check-out person told us "Well if you're a light sleeper you should have told us." So apparently they know that the 38th floor has noise issues but they put guests there anyway and if you don't complain then you're SOL. 
Also, the glasses in the room had lip marks on them, so we had to hand wash them with a rag and soap in order to drink from them.
Would not recommend.

Great place to stay because my 2 friends and I got a great deal - $260 for 3 nights! 
It also has a great location - right in the middle of the strip and across the street from the Cosmopolitan and Bellagio. 

Check-ins and outs are very quick and the rooms are extremely spacious. Bathrooms are huge as well, with a standing shower and a fancy schmancy bathtub. 

Most of all, there's a mile of shops attached, so it's also great for shopping! :)

Customer service???? Ph does not know the how to treat their guests! If u have the option...do not stay here! Pay the extra amount for another hotel.....how is this place still running is my question? Brent is an ass...not very accommodating...the manager for the night is just the same...her name is lupe....we booked through another website n then called ph to get our rate matched n then...they do not even know what they r talking about here.....dumb people that work here.....they messed up n do not even give a discount or care that they gave away our 2 queen rooms...like I said do not stay here give money to another place!!! Stay away!

Other than amazing hotel services the casino itself is crap dealers are snobs and cocktail service is crap as well if you want good and respectful gambling I recommend Monte Carlo it's well worth the walk or taxi drive

Maybe this place is about movie stars but definitely not about my Yelp stars... 

It all began on a Friday afternoon when we arrived to Planet Hollywood Hotel & Casino.  First thing that bothered me was that there was only 3 or 4 guys working the hotel's valet.  Hmm... isn't Friday the busiest arrival day in Vegas?   The Valet was full and since there's a mall next to the hotel, the self-parking lot was packed! I forgot to mention, it was also Black Friday.  When you drive to Las Vegas from LA you know your ass is tired. I just wanted to get off the car and check in.  Do you know how anxious a person gets when they get to Las Vegas?  All that road trip through the desert to see that beam of light from Luxor can get a person pretty excited.  On top of that, you will most likely find traffic on the strip when getting to this hotel so the last thing I wanted was to self-park or find a full valet.  Finally we managed to convince the valet guys to let us squeeze one more car so they got their tip for that.

The Room:  Pretty decent beds and furniture, nothing special.  Wait a minute!  No mini fridge?  In a double Queen Suite???  Why do I see Rambo's grenades or Terminator's sunglasses displayed on the coffee table like a museum but I don't get a mini fridge?  Dear Planet Hollywood: Did you know your hotel is in Las Vegas and people need to store alcohol in a cold place?  Geez, what am I going to do with Rambo's grenades when I need a cold beer?  Also,  I hate how there's no locks on bathroom doors.  I understand this is Planet Hollywood and retards probably come here to pretend they are movie stars and party like them which may result in over doses that could result in hospitals which could lead to deaths and therefore no locks are safe and all that safety babble... But I'm not a retard and I definitely don't want to act like a Hollywood star!  I want to take my shower privately so that house keeping can't surprise me in the shower!  There should be an option for people that want locks on bathroom doors that wont act like retards.

They also charge a fee if you call for towels or even cups.  Ridiculous.  People tip the employees that bring stuff to the room so why take away their money with your fees Planet Hollywood?  Bad business etiquette.

The Casino:  It's a Las Vegas Casino, nothing special.  Prices average just like anywhere on the strip but I did like $15 minimum bets on Saturday nights compared to $20 in other casinos on the strip.  The free beveragesskimped out on alcohol though.  I'm spending money here so please give me a real drink!  My gin and tonic tasted like 7up and Zima... I'm ordering beer bottles next time.  There was this one dealer at the roulette table that ignored us for a long time.  We dropped the money on the table like we're supposed to waiting for chips and since he gave us no attention we had to speak up and shake the bills in the air "hey! I need chips!" .  The guy got mad saying we need to leave the money on the table.  No shiz, dickhead!  It was there for almost 5 minutes and your lazy ass never noticed.  First roll came through and a zero hits the roulette when we were playing numbered rows only.... This guy was just bad luck.   We moved to another table where Koko, the Korean dealer, took care of us.  We had some luck up in that table!  Up $570 thanks to Koko.  I'll gamble with her for sure next time.  We found this table with only one person and turned it into 8 - 10 people throwing their money there.

To conclude my stay, I liked the proximity to the mall, the strip and specially to Earl of Sandwich (must have, read my review) but the hotel and the casino was pretty Meh...  I don't think I'll be booking my stay in this place again but I'll definitely come play roulette with Koko.

Stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend. Been staying here 5+ times and each time, I had a great time. 

Everything you need is here, from gambling to shopping.

My favorite is the ABC Store. Reasonable prices and sell bottles of booze. Do what I did, buy a bottle and chug it on the strip. I'm a cheap date.

Rooms were great, stayed at the resort room with HD flat screen TV. Beds were comfy and the front desk are nice. I will stay here without a doubt again.

There is a resort free which includes a newspaper and two bottles of water a day. Rip off, but be nice to the front desk and they might waive it. I asked and they did and saved me $5 a day.

After deciding on running the Rock 'n' Roll Half Marathon, we needed a place to stay to cater 10 people.  Yes I said 10.  Out of the 10 only 4 were registered runners and 1 was a bandit runner (Good job!).

We got a free bottle of liquor per room per night and was able to accommodate all the people in our rooms. It was nice and spacious and can't complain with the price we got the rooms for. Also the location's pretty prime as it's in the center of the strip next to the Miracle Mile shops and all the prime hotels. 

I would highly recommend Plant Hollywood and would stay there in a heartbeat if the price was right!

First impression of the hotel online was decent. I had never stayed here before so my friends and I wanted to try a new hotel. The rooms looked nice for a decent price, so we figured we'd give it a try. 

No problems with staff, although we didn't need much so it was very minimal communication. We needed a connecting room and the front desk was able to accommodate us. 

Great location on the strip with many shopping and food options within the hotel, as well as easy access to other hotels near by.

Now for the rooms...we stayed on the 24th floor. Off hand the rooms look okay. Truly nothing fancy or special. Beds are fitted with plain white comforters and pillows, and room is decorated with with movie themed items. Ours was Jurassic Park. The furniture was very outdated. A lot of scratches and dings that were pretty obvious. The display for the movie poster seemed pointless. It took up a lot of unnecessary space and held no closet room. 

Beds...horrible. They sink in and squeak! I've never stayed in a hotel with beds this bad!! The bathroom was...okay. But the shower...gross. The floor of the shower had mildew stains as the drain was rusted. The shower itself is really small and our door happened to be coming off the rubber that secured it to the wall. And the towels had a weird smell on one of the days of ur stay :( 

Overall the room just seems old and dirty. Dust in places and cleanliness was disappointing. If you're looking for a decently priced hotel, and nothing too fancy, this might be of interest to you. BUT I have stayed at another hotel, even cheaper, located in a very good place on the strip...that was definitely much cleaner and well kept. 

So no, I probably would not stay here again.

Planet Hollywood is located on central of the strip. It's same spot from Aladdin Las Vegas.

Planet Hollywood is designed to make ordinary people feel like stars and the hotel rooms are no exception. 

Be honest, I found the restaurants in PH are more causal and affordable than other hotels.

We just recently stayed in this hotel and I am
Impressed of their service. There is no line in checking in as they have several kiosk for that so no need to go to reservation desk. The room is neat and clean, they do housekeeping every day religiously so we always come to a clean room after a tiring walk in the strip and roaming around every day. This hotel is adjacent to Miracle shop which has a variety of restaurants and stores to choose from including souvenir store so no need to go anywhere. We left photos in this hotel and all I need to do is submit a report to their lost and found department, they found my photo and theyre mailing it back to me quick. Definitely a good place to stay when in Vegas, very strategic location.

Great stay from start to finish! Beautiful hotel, great upgrade to a room with the BEST view of the Bellagio fountains! Thanks To Jameson who was very friendly and helpful at the front desk. Awesome staff! Not to mention the shopping mall attached was awesome!

I haven't stayed here so cannot comment on the rooms. However the gaming floor is one of the most fun places on the strip. They cater to a crowd that is there to have a good time, playing music, affordable drinks for Vegas, and dealers with a sense of humor. We have been coming to Vegas for 10+ years and this is always a place we hit up for some fun on the tables. Btw, the ABC mart also sells booze if you want to pre party in the room.

Stayed here last week for my friend's birthday. The rooms are not spectacular, but nice clean and comfortable. It is cool that each room is decorated with decor from a movie. That's different from other hotels. The location of the hotel is very central, smack dab in the middle of the strip! The buffet here is also really good and with the buffets of buffets, it's a pretty unbeatable deal! The biggest complaint, the walk from self parking to the lobby is a pretty far walk!

A BIG positive:
I would like to say Thank you so much to the security guy that was working Wed night August 29 or more correctly Thurs morning August 30 around 4 or 5 am. I stayed at Planet Hollywood and had decided to go downstairs for some late night gambling. These creepy young guys were following me around the casino floor trying to talk to me. I tried to ignore them and kept walking around and around until I thought they had finally left me alone. When I thought I was in the clear, I sat down at a machine and had barely begun to play when another creeper came up and started trying to talk to me. I kept ignoring him and looking the other way and he didn't seem to get it. Out of nowhere, the security guy came and asked for the guy's ID and told him he was to leave since he did not have his ID on him. I turned to the security guy and mouthed "Thank you" to him. I had no idea but he came back shortly and told me that he had personally escorted that guy out of the casino! I thanked him again and I wanted to give him a hug (but I didn't- wasn't sure how appropriate that was) for being so attentive and responsive to the situation that I was not sure how to get out of, and all without me even having to tell him!! He was my hero for the night! Thank you for making me feel so safe!!
Moving it up to 4 because the service that I received on my last trip was awesome!  Really like staying here and I tipped the front desk clerk my last trip and got a awesome upgrade!

I originally thought PH was great, and one of the only casinos\/hotels in Vegas where I felt comfortable. Then I stayed there for several days and discovered that the staff is almost uniformly rude, the taxi line and valet are invariably backed up forever, and they charge for everything -- including $25\/day to use the GYM! And on the weekends, their pools become the domain of college fratty meatheads who play football in the water to attracted the attention of all the trixies around them. Boob tattoos positively required. Yuck.

STAY AWAY. 

We drove up to have the valet take our car to be screamed at by the valet - literally yelling at us.  A few mins later another valet turned toward me to spit in a trash can at the entrance.  WTF?  First impressions last PH.

This place is dated, furniture is uncomfortable, chipped and in serious need of updating.  Windows were so dirty we couldn't see the supposed "amazing" view of the strip that we paid for - yeah the window was 1.5 yards long at best and you could only see the strip from a weird angle.  One armchair in the King Hip Rooms that is so uncomfortable I couldn't even sit in it.

No minibar.  No robes.  No cell coverage.  Wireless wasn't working - for the ONE device they allowed you to connect to. 

Then there was housekeeping barging into our room @ 9am Christmas morning.  I mean really?  

All that and not to mention the $22.48 we were charged for the resort fee - INSANE.

As for the casino - trashy is the best word for it.  Whoever does the wardrobe for the dancers should re-think it.  If they are going for trashy and cheap, they nailed it.  If edgy was the desired effect they FAILED.  I mean I get it's Vegas but really ... trashy dump is all that springs to mind.  The overall styling.  Ick.  I mean come on, style with girls in mind - let them keep their self-respect at least rather have them look like trashy skanks falling out of their tops and several not-so-toned and bloated tummys on display for all to see.

We normally stay at The Hotel @ Mandalay Bay, will definitely NOT make the mistake of going to PH again.  Seriously, check out Mandalay Bay, SO MUCH BETTER.  There we get greeted by valet staff, concierges and everyone is nice.  Hotel and Casino are stylish and overall awesome.  Not sure why I bothered trying PH now I think about it.

Its very challenging finding the right hotel on the Las Vegas strip. You have to factor in price, convenience (if you're attending a certain show, nightclub, pool party, etc.), amenities, restaurants, style, and ambiance. Now I've stayed at my share of Vegas hotels; at least two dozen different hotels off and on the strip ever since first coming to Sin City back in the 1990's. However, this was my first time ever staying at "Planet Hollywood".

Out of all the hotels on the strip, I would have to say that Planet Hollywood (formerly the Aladdin from 1966-2007) is an average and middle-of-the-road hotel. Meaning that it is not a bare bones\/no-frills place nor is it an over-the-top elaborate type of place. My lady and I booked a weekend stay here from Thursday 9\/28\/17 to Sunday 10\/1\/17. The primary reason we stayed here is because we bought tickets for Calvin Harris (at nearby Caesars Palace) for Friday night and tickets for Jennifer Lopez (who performs below at the Axis @ Planet Hollywood) for Saturday night. 

The prices here can vary greatly depending on when you book and which website\/travel agent company you do business with. We got a fairly good deal and the entire check-in process was very painless. Since we rented a car and drove into Las Vegas, the valet service was very quick and attentive. We both decided to take our carry-on luggage without the hotel staff's help. Upon entering, we checked-in through the touchscreen computers and our key cards were distributed through the computer.

The room we got (which was on the 18th floor) was non-smoking and had a comfy California King sized bed. There was a 40" flat screen TV with just a few channels, mini refrigerator, study area, and an excellent view of the Las Vegas strip. The bathroom itself offered a walk-in shower as well as a whirlpool tub. Since I didn't smell or see anything out of the ordinary, we were both pleasantly surprised with our hotel experience. However, one gripe I have is their Wi-Fi. When you pay quite a bit of money for the hotel itself + resort fees + taxes, this should at least be included. Not at Planet Hollywood! They charge almost $15 for high speed internet.

A few things outside of the hotel room are ice machines on each floor (which surprisingly worked good), the "Pleasure Pool" (located on the 6th floor) that is open from 9am-7pm, a gym, a wedding chapel, conference\/meeting rooms, and a fairly generous casino area. Planet Hollywood also offers the "Miracle Mile" shops that include a huge variety of popular retailers. There is also a ton of excellent dining options including "Gordon Ramsay Burger", "Koi", "P.F. Chang's", "Spice Market Buffet", and "Strip House Steakhouse". And finally, "AXIS" is the auditorium that has amazing musicians such as Jennifer Lopez, Lionel Richie, and Britney Spears.

Overall, "Planet Hollywood" is the place where you can get the Los Angeles type of vibe. That is mainly what it focuses on. As every hotel on the Las Vegas strip has their own uniqueness to it, you definitely get a lot of options here. The crowd here is definitely younger since it has more of a hip feel to it. But when you factor in the cleanliness of the rooms, accessibility, price, and food options, Planet Hollywood is definitely worth checking out.

As I mentioned, my lady and I had an amazing view of the strip. As wonderful as our trip and stay were, we checked out of our hotel just hours before the massacre that occurred on the evening of 10\/1\/17. With that said and done, I wanted to express my deepest condolences to all 58 people that tragically lost their lives during this senseless attack on innocent concertgoers. Even though this was a very horrific event, it will not stop me from visiting Las Vegas.

I stayed at this place back when it was the Aladdin and I can say that it's much nicer with the new changes.  We stayed here for 2 nights in a suite for SEMA.  The rooms are pretty nice and spacious.  The lobby is decorated very modern with bright lights and geometric designs.  The elevators are colored differently and we took pictures in each one, lolz.  It's a located at a convenient spot in the middle of the strip.  

The desert shops are closeby so you can indulge in shopping without having to go far.  The minimum blackjack table is $10.  I ended up losing money :(  I should know better than to gamble when I'm drunk, hehe.  It's always a wait though when you valet your car cuz they park them really far away.

WORST exprience I've ever encountered as a guest at any hotel. 

1) Two words: BED BUGS

First off let me say that I've worked in the hospitality industry as a guest service agent, so I understand what its like to be on the other side.

The management team needs to be trained on how to deal with circumstances like bed bugs, which can easily start infesting new locations if they aren't eradicated correctly. 

My friend did call the "Risk Management" number that was given to her after we filed a complain. She was reimbursed $200, which is better than nothing, I guess.

2) ANOTHER issue that my friends and I had was the amount of different channels we had to go through for just a simple Lost and Found question.  

We went to the Spice Market buffet for brunch and my friend left her sunglasses at our table.  She called directly to the buffet and asked if anyone turned in a pair of sunglasses and whoever answered quickly transferred her over to the lost and found office for the WHOLE hotel AND she was put on hold for about 10 minutes only to get an answering machine.

Next day, after our bed bug scare we decided to go back to Spice Market and check if my friend's glasses were at the cash register. LO-and-BEHOLD in like 5 seconds they bring out her sunglasses. Seriously guys...

Maybe it's because their a big hotel..I don't know, but I was not impressed with my stay here.
 ________
UPDATE        11\/13\/12

Its been about  2 weeks since I stayed there. BUT the weekend after I started to get these itchy bumps. At first I thought they were from fleas that my dog might've had. I've researched and even gone to a clinic to get the bites checked out. I'm now 100% positive that I got bit by bed bugs.

2 weeks and still have bite marks, NEVER going to another hotel w\/out checking the room and bed EVER again.

Planet Hollywood is for the younger crowd. The rooms are modern and clean. Their casino features the Pleasure Pit which is a group of gambling tables featuring scantily clad dealers and go-go dancers. In the mornings though, the Pleasure Pit is staffed by old and not-hot dealers - lol. Best thing about PH is their location on the strip and being connected to the Miracle Mile.

Lacy and Richard down in the casino are absolutely amazing. Their customer service and expertise made our whole trip for us!! Highly recommend. If you stop by here please see Richard and Lacy! You will not regret it

I love this hotel. I got a great rate for ultra resort room. The room was spacious, clean, and super comfortable. The bathroom was huge - 2 sinks, 1 shower, 1 tub. The housekeeping staff was nice and accommodating. The iron board was broke and they quickly replace it. The location is center strip with a lot of actions, restaurants, and mall. The only con was I had a horrible view but I been to vegas many times so it didn't bother me. But if view is important then either book a room with a view or ask at front desk. I did online check in and I love it because I don't have to wait in line to get my keys. I will definitely stay at Planet Hollywood again.

I went to PHRC in January to attend Otakon Vegas. My overall experience was really good. The room was great and the food was excellent. The Spice Market buffet had a great selection of food. The location is smack down in the center of Las Vegas and is close to other sites and stores. The Walgreens is next door and well within walking distance. The people at hotel checking, valet, and baggage assistance were very nice and polite.

The only things that I had an issue were

- A\/C on max settings is not strong
- Parking is on other side of the building and you have to walk through the mall to get to the casino

I have been to Las Vegas 30 times in the last 8 years.  I have stayed up and down the strip but I usually end up  across the street at Bellagio.  A friend of mine had a good time at planet hollywood and I decided to contact a casino host and book a trip.  

The positives:

-By far the hottest girls on the strip and not just the patrons but also the dealers and waitresses.  On par with the palms and hard rock except its smack in the middle of the strip.  The talent is definitely here!

-location, location, location.

-The sportsbook is not grand and rather limited but the director and staff were great and extremely accomodating.  I would recommend this place to any horse player as they really know how to take care of us.  

-Great vibe.  The place pumps the best music all day and the atmosphere  is vibrant and festive.  

Okay, the no so good:

-Restaurants are not good and striphouse is very bad.  Go across the street and eat at bellagio.  I dont know how you can screw up a buffet but they managed to as this is very bad.

-Pool is terrible.  Its like swimming in jail if prison had a pool.  

-Bathrooms.  Showers look like leftovers from alladin days.  Rooms are average.

-layout-  I got lost every day.  Again, not their fault as they are doing the best they can from Alladin days.

Bottom line?  If you want luxury and pampering with all of the finest amenities and creature comforts, go to wynn or bellagio.  This place isnt even in the same realm and it would be like comparing apples to oranges.  But if you really don't care about those things and you are looking for an upbeat atmosphere with lots of hot, young beautifful people, then this is a good place for you.

Rooms are outdated but clean. I couldn't find a mini bar or bottle of water in my room. 
The atmosphere downstairs is very much a party. Plenty choices of food and things to do. 
Rooms are a good size and there is a bath tub. 
This is my first time in Vegas, next time I'll try another resort.
Pretty good hotel and lots of stores and restaurants.  The nearby mall is very large and attracts a lot of people, as does the hotel too.

The casino and location are one of my favs. After numerous trips I choose to stay here seeing as again, location and casino are outstanding . 
HOWEVER- so many issues with the actual room I won't be staying here again. 

1) did the online check in. Email stated I could check my bags and wait for an email\/call saying my room was ready. After many hours of not getting a call, I had to go to the lobby, stand in line and wait. I was told when I gift p a clerk my room was ready and they don't know why I had never received an email. So much for the connivence they promised me 

2) got to the room and it was 80+ degrees. Cranked the A\/C way down - left the room for a few hours l, got back and still warm. Didn't get the room to cool down till the next morning

3) beds were comfortable but the pillows were lumpy and hard in places.

4) the rooms are extremely dated and the furniture is in rough shape, looks like they got it at a flea market

5) tvs were horrible 

6) one ply toilet paper?!??? Really?

7) bathrooms remind me of my local gym
Having said this- views were outstanding

This place reminded me of going to spring break in college and having to get a cheap room at a motel 6 or something. If places like these exist on the strip I can't imagine what's off the strip 

So disappointed due to having high hopes because of the shows\/atmosphere\/location of this place

Fantastic Hotel.  Great rooms.  Cleanliness.  Was in the newer updated rooms.  Had a fantastic Chicken and Waffles down in one of their 24 hour breakfast restaurants.  Upon arrival, fast check in and tentative.

The Service is Wonderful, the Theme is Great! The Restaurants are great Too. What sucks is that FAMOUS $25\/per day RESORT FEE they seek in on you when you check out. If you are going to fu*k me, I like it from the front...

Let's see, where do I even begin? I've been coming to Vegas since I was 12 (apparently my parents are comedians) and always enjoyed the atmosphere and environment. We've always spent our stays in Planet Hollywood. For my sister's 21st it was a big deal to go and stay with our family and friends (there were at least 19 of us). After our stay back in July for said occasion, we're no longer making Planet Hollywood part of that. Customer service is non existent. From the looks of other reviews it's apparent. 

Long story short, accidents happen but how a business moves forward, shows how they care and keep guest continuity. A pipe burst during our stay on 7\/8 - 7\/10, flooding the lobby and casino levels. My guests and I were in the North Tower where the elevators were shut off prompting 35- an hour wait time to go up and down elevators in the South Tower. We were on a quick schedule and because of the waits we were forced to attempt to maneuver the stairs up twenty flights when the flooding first started to make it to a 7:30 birthday reservation. My friend is claustrophobic and there is no air ventilation in the stair well and it is also tightly enclosed. My friend had a panic attack halfway up. We missed my sister's bday reservation. We were behind schedule for our whole two day stay. There was no communication on what was happening. Just flooding and that the South Tower elevators were only operational. This was also my significant other's first time in Vegas and this was his experience: unorganized, unprofessional and more work than a vacation. I am in customer service myself and tried not to let the whole experience way down on me; until I wrote them after coming home (since talking to any hotel personnel while the flooding happened was not possible because so many people were upset and I didn't want to further that). So I emailed them after with a detailed letter of what happened and hoping for some sort of solace, refund or future credit to make up for this incident. To my dismay, I was only responded with a generic response of how the engineer department worked very hard (which no one said they didn't), and thanks for letting them know. Nothing to rectify the inconvenience AND guilting the guests for how hard the engineer department worked while neglecting their hospitality skills. Of course the engineer department worked hard! Thank goodness for them! I wasn't writing the engineer department, I was writing the guest services and hotel billing for paying for services that were not in service. 

Any way, that response prompted me to send the same letter to get a refund from the billing department cause honestly when you pick to stay at a hotel, it's for its services, amenities, etc. No service was being done for me and more than half the amenities weren't accessible. I sent that second email to billing the same day I got the generic response back on 7\/17 and still have not heard anything back nor have I been refunded. 

Guess this was not a long story so short but mostly the gist of everything. I suppose it's time to check out other hotels since our loyal patronage has been abandoned.

I get comps here and they give me the Ultra Hip Room which is actually quite nice.
We even had a direct view of the strip and pool, which is always a plus!
The rooms were quiet too. 
Free self parking, but they charge for valet.
The parking is very far from the hotel and it spits you out into the shopping mall. Go figure.

So I'm not sure which rooms the crappy reviewers are getting, so get the Ultra Hip Room...and get it as high as possible.I don't think it's even their best type of room b\/c it's normally not all that expensive...anywhere from $65+ midweek.

My family and I stayed here for New Year's and I have to say that I was not impressed at all. 

The service is below average, the rooms are nice but there are some things that are off. E.G- they charge you $2 for boiling water! We got a suite and the bathroom doors don't have locks. 

We also had trouble with the room key many times and they were forced to comp us another night, but that is not even the reason for my bad review. Take my advice: Go somewhere else unless PH is much cheaper.

Our room was still dirty upon check in.  Housekeeping apparently doesn't move furniture to clean; we found used q-tips under the chair.  Our room was very dark; 2 light bulbs were burnt out and we were missing a lamp.  Maintenance came about 45 minutes after our call to repair it.  Even the bathroom wasn't too clean.  Interesting that the room wasn't too clean, but the housekeeping service was always prompt.  They would be knocking at your door as early at 8AM to clean your room.  The room wasn't too big or impressive.  You also can't do express check out from the room; the tv didn't work or didn't have that option.  We had to fill out a paper to check out in the lobby.  The pool area wasn't great either.   The only nice things in this hotel:  The Location, Gordon Ramsay Burgr, Mall, and the Pleasure Pit. 

PARKING Beware: If you arrive past noon, Valet is usually full.  You will need to self park and walk through the entire mall with your luggage.

Sorry but this was not good. From the outside you might expect nice rooms. Well just about everything in the room is falling apart. TV didn't work, half the lights were out, blinds to the windows were broken and the decor was just odd. - My room had a low quality picture of Air Bud printed out ?? - The faucets are mislabeled for hot and cold. Housekeeping decided to start knocking on my door 2.5 hours before checkout as well. Unless your room is free, there are way better places to stay.

Honestly, this hotel was no better than a motel! [At least the rooms weren't]. I was so disappointed when I arrived here! And I dont complain much.

From the minute we walked in, our rooms were not even ready [Granted, we checked in early], but they told us we can have a handicap room or smoking. After reading reviews, I didnt want either of these rooms because I had heard complaints. So instead we decided to go eat breakfast and come back to see if the room is ready. When we came back about 2 hrs later, still no room. So we opted for smoking.

Once we arrived to the room, it looked dirty. But I didnt complain. When you sit on the edge of the bed, the whole mattress goes up! The pillowy tile decor on the walls were peeling off! The bathroom smelled funny. The TV had no HBO or anything of substance [Not that we went there to watch TV, its just the principle]. No mini bar. No robe. Practically NO LIGHTING. Room was very dark and dim. And 2 lights didnt even work! The front desk rarely answered the phone.

I had to pay $159 for a late check out! For only 4 hrs extra! At the Bellagio, I only paid $80!!!   They would not negotiate on this at all, regardless that our maid broke an antique mirror I had brought with me. 

Pros: 
     -Location [On strip, Miracle Mile shops]
     -Pink's, Earl of Sandwich, Planet Dailies
Cons:
     -Dirty room
     -Not the friendliest staff
     -Buffet was horrible!
     -Casino setup was confusing 
     -If ur taking a cab, it will cost you extra bc the setup from the hotels taxi valet whips you all the way around the hotel just to get to and from the strip
     -$13.99 just for WiFi!!! Most other places it is free!

I could go on and on and on... but I feel as though I rather not waste any more time on Planet Hollywood.

I would like to start off my review about this place by saying "NEVER AGAIN!!". This place should be called Planet Terror, not Planet Hollywood. 
My boyfriend and I needed a place to stay for the night while we were in town. This place had pretty good rates and there was no resort fee, so it seemed like a no-brainer. Well, if we only knew! We get to the hotel, find parking and get completely confused trying to find the actual resort from the parking structure. We had to walk through the miracle mile shops and navigate our way to, then through the casino and to the front desk.
When we got our key and made it to our room it was a total nightmare. They put us in the BackDraft room, on the 22nd floor!! What genius thought of that?! I don't know about you but I don't want to think about a movie involving fires 22 floors up. The furniture was dark and oppressive, the window shade was broken and the shower was dirty. Thankfully I had my handy bottle of Lysol ready. The mattress was dirty and did not have a mattress cover, just a sheet folded over it. Needless to say, we slept on top of the covers. When I turned on the heater, a burnt smell came out of it and it started blowing cold air. I made a call to the front desk and a maintenance guy promptly came to the door to check it out. He said the thermostats are new, so to keep it running for 30 mins or so and it should heat up and he would be back to check. Well, he never came back and that damn thing stayed on all night blowing out cold air. You can bet we were up early and checked out with bells on. If that heater is on, I'm sure it still hasn't warmed up. Stay here if you like, but you have been warned! Just make sure you bring extra blankets and Lysol!

As I plan what has become my yearly Vegas trip, I realize this review is way, way overdue so I'll keep it brief and keep it to the basics. 

I like Planet Hollywood for the location on the strip and the fact that it's connected to a mall with shopping, shows, and restaurants. They also seem to cater to a younger crowd and they have good acts here- uh Britney, obvi! The front entrance and parts of the hotel have allot of pow and pizzazz, making it feel very Vegas-y.

But for the price of my stay, I thought my room could've been cleaner and better kept - I'm pretty sure the vacuum had never seen the underside of the desk. The carpeting throughout the hotel was dingy and rolling up as well; it was pretty tacky actually. Also, the rooms could've had a little more punch to the decor. Between the rooms here and rooms at the Hard Rock, who also does a rock-n-roll\/celebrity artifacts type of theme, Hard Rock was way better done. I also liked the casino in The Hard Rock better than PH. Oh, and basically any place has a pool better than Planet Hollywood. Like my neighbor here in Michigan has a nicer pool in his backyard than this place. PH's pool is like a concrete wasteland. There weren't even plants around the pool to liven it up.  They sort-of made up for it by having a second rate Pauly D DJ and after a few (overpriced) drinks, it wasn't too bad of an afternoon. 

I probably wouldn't stay here again but I suppose it's not the absolute worst either. So if you are coming for the shows and a basic pool set-up meets your needs, you'll be ok.

I didn't stay at their hotel so this review is for the casino. As far as casinos go, Planet Hollywoods one is okay. It's clean looking and dealers are fairly friendly. Not sure if this is a plus or a minus, but out of all the casinos I visited, this was the only casino where all the dealers were dressed slutty, in bustiers and thigh highs. Other casinos has some dealers dressed in that way but not all. That didn't really give off a good impression upon me. I lose money at this casino...but my first win in vegas was here..too bad it wasn't a great win haha. 

I love how Earl's Sandwiches was 24\/7 and they also had Miracle Miles shops connected so it's super convenient.

Just don't bother with this over rated hotel.
Aside from the ego boost you might get from the underworked "working girls" the poker room was unfriendly and and the slots don't pay enough to let you dream that you might win enough to cover the free beer you just tipped for. 
The pool was freezing!!!!
$37 for a resort fee. This includes 2 devices for wifi and $14 each additionsl device. We being a family of 4 had to draw straws for device privileges.  There were no amenities to use however because we were determined to use the pool we went back down at 7pm to find out they close the pool early if no one is in it.....
Hmmmm..... Guessing they close early every day. Not sure why you want to close early when you can charge $17 per cocktail. 
The room was not dirty dirty but not exactly clean. 
Although centrally located you can find 100's of better options. Our strip view room I paid extra for existed of the side walls of the hotel and a small glimpse of a nice hotel across the street. 
2 coffees and a kids hot chocolate was $16. 
To Planet Hollywood and all your non workin "working girls" you will never get another cent out of me!!!
Nice casino with huge mall attached! Casino has latest slots. Didn't pay much -that happens.! Lots of restaurants. Tons of designer stores.
First time staying here and have no complaints. Rooms are nice and the staff is friendly. Plenty of places to shop too. My family enjoyed the pool the most.

There are almost 300 reviews--I'm betting that the chances you'll read this are pretty slim.  So I'll keep this short:  hospitality is off the charts.  Clean, accommodating, tons of shops and dining.  Nice rooms.  (I don't gamble but I go to Vegas for other reasons.)  This place is great.

As much as I really wanted to like this place, I just don't. I know not to judge a casino by your wins and losses but dang, I spent A LOT of money in their machines and did not win anything. We stayed here 2 suites for 4 days for my 21st birthday. As I was playing on the slots and ordered drinks, the waitresses would just stand behind you waiting for a tip and if you didn't tip they would scoff, like out loud, so obvious! So rude I was so turned off by the customer service at the front desk the bars the waitresses it killed my birthday. :( Sorry I couldn't tip I just put all my money into your casino!! The customer service was horrible, I would never stay again.

So another year and the same shit.  You can't valet here unless you are staying.  It's a Sunday night during off season and there are several valets just hanging around. Not even the ultra high end Cosmopolitan shoos away their gamblers and eaters !! Hate it and I will never stay here because of it!

Planet Hollywood no more!  bye bye.  After coming here for the past several years we no longer will spend our holiday vacation here any more.  

I stayed here the end of December and encountered a slew of problems!  some much more major than others.  Stayed 3 days and had 2 rooms booked.  Upon arrival and check-in, one of the rooms were not cleaned.  Called front desk which told us to talk to housekeeping.  Housekeeping said that they would not clean the room because it was past a certain time...the room did not get cleaned till 5 hours later...Had to call several times and get the run around!  

Another issue MAJOR issue occurred was that there was not any hot water!  Halfway through my shower it went from hot to cold!  luckily we had another room to use and there was hot water.  This happened 2 of the 3 days there...  

Some smaller issues.  Busted toilet!  Ended up having a toilet that kept running\/flushing.  We told housekeeping and nothing was done.  3 days running water.  The hotel asks patrons to conserve energy and water and doesn't do anything to wasting water.  The tv in one of the other rooms had poor quality and the picture was over extended.  you could not tell what channel you were on because it was not properly displayed.  also the volume on the tv was just loud! one room was fine.  

Explained all the issues to the front desk when checking out and only the resort fees were comped...i even mentioned that due to these problems that i would not be coming back.  the guy was ok letting me go.  

skip the gym.  limited hours and super small.  not what i was expecting at all

I absolutely love PH, and try to stay there every time I go to Vegas. Great prices, AWESOME service, clean rooms, and the beds are SO COMFORTABLE. new linens and down bedding. The rooms are big, and they are all themed after a different hollywood movie. Ask for the strip view (preferably above the 6th floor) to get a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the Paris tower. The pools are a bit small, but one pool is adults only which is great. On the adult side you have to pay to use the daybeds\/cabanas, but its worth it if you can spring the extra bucks. But there is free lounging in between the pool areas. The dealers are super friendly, the passion pit rocks, Gordan Ramsay has a burger joint in there, $10 blackjack tables. The location on the strip is perfect, not too far from anything. VALET IS FREE!!! That was a great bonus after a day of traveling (the self park is a million miles away). top notch.

This was my first time back to the Alladin after they imploded it and made it into PH. Disappointed this is not a high end casino on the strip, but if you take it at face value, a kind of normal mall with good range of stores, H and M, BeBe, Betsey Johnson and some surprises, like Betty Paige, then it's fine. 

As a tourist, I didn't like that this was a normal shopping mall with a magic show and other show entrances in it, I'd really rather be somewhere else, but my friend wanted me to see the renovations. Looking at it as a local, it is a perfectly fine place to do some errands in a well designed space that looks like the updated version of the other malls on the strip, the usual, the painted sky, but the ceilings were high which made the shopping experience more comfortable, not so much flourescent lighting....score!

Great service!!! We had 2 little problems, no fridge ( breast pumping mama)and water ran out due to construction being done. But other then that, I recommend this hotel! They were nice enough to let my fiance and I have lunch at their buffet for free due to the inconvenience. I would definitely stay there again :))

Check in:  horrible experience.  Despite having checked in online and being told to proceed to the "key pickup" line, it took over 20 minutes to get that key and a room assignment.  There were no agents manning the pre-checked line, but every once in a while one of the agents at the other line would wave the front of our line over.
Room:  nice size, nice bathroom and amenities, decent bed, but...  while getting ready to go out to dinner, the water went out (completely).  Despite being told on the phone three time over the course of an hour that it would be back up "in 5-10 minutes", it took well over that hour's time to resume, but too late for us to make our dinner reservation.  NO concern from the guest relations, no adjustment to our bill, and guess what?  NO repeat business from us in the future.
The adjacent\/connecting shopping mall does have some nice shops and restaurants, and the casino was OK.  
Self-parking seems even farther from the hotel at this property than the typical Las Vegas resort, and was our only option, because "Valet parking FULL" sign was up during our entire stay.

I love this hotel, plain and simple! I have stayed here few times and twice within the past few months. 
 
Starting with the rooms: They are decent size rooms, although I have only stayed in the ones with the king beds, they are very comfortable and spacious. The bathrooms are large with their own shower stall, separate jacuzzi tub, and toilet also separate. There is also a large counter and sink, perfect for multiple people to get ready. If you're lucky enough to get the rooms facing the strip, they scenery is awesome. The Bellagio is right across the street, so you don't even have to leave the room to watch the fountain show or fight for a good spot! The rooms are themed from famous actors or singers and they have some cool memorabilia for show.

Casino: I really like that the decorations are vibrant pink hue colors and crystals all over the lighting, it is very appealing to me being a very feminine lady. Over the one section of the blackjack tables is called the Pleasure Pit, all it is are go go dancers in pink costumes dancing. Sometimes they look like they're having fun and into it, and some girls look like they want a new job (liven up, ladies!) other than that, your typical updated, run of the mill casino. The cocktail waitresses are going downhill a bit. I could understand if the washed up older ladies worked the day shift, but there were quite a bit of those in the later evening, not to mention quite rude as well.

Just like a typical Vegas trip, I was not really in the hotel much, so I did not  have the chance to check out the other facilities.

The manager brought my boyfriend and I a complimentary bottle of champagne, which was so sweet and much appreciated.

This is the third hotel I've stayed at in Vegas and was certainly my favourite out of the three.  

It was myself and my best friend in one room and her parents and sister in another and it worked out great. We upgraded for a small fee to the deluxe type rooms and had a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains and the pool area at PH.  Our room was huge and had a jet tub, double sinks and a nice shower.  It was the largest hotel bathroom I've ever been inside!

The staff were good but we seemed to have very little interaction with too many staff members.  

One incident that prevented me from giving this resort five stars was that there elevators were on the fritz one evening and no one could even find the stairs from the casino level to their rooms so some of us waited forever.  I just went back to the slots and wasted hundreds and hundreds more (pennies).

The restaurants at the resort were pretty good but the shopping mall on the main level was extremely handy.  

This place doesn't look like much from the strip because the casino and pool sort of prevent any sort of stunning entrance like the neighbours across the street or down the street but inside PH is quite nice.

The best part is that the place was catered for my age group and there were very few kids or tour groups.

Stayed here for three nights. The location of the hotel was very convenient. All you have to do is walk downstairs if you want to shop, there are also several restaurants in the lobby\/casino area. If you want to stay at a place with lots of traffic this is the perfect hotel for you. But then again, why go to Vegas if you want quiet and boring. 

What I mean by traffic, is lots of people going in and out of the casino area. Even though it is busy downstairs, the noise does not carry up to your room. 

TIP: don't do a walk in to check out a room. I don't remember the exact amount but I had to put a $200-$300 deposit. No big deal, I got it all back, but still.

I'm a big fan of Planet Hollywood! It's probably my go to place to book a room. I'm absolutely in love with their tower Elara which has spacious suites! I've stayed in a one bedroom suite and a two bedroom suite, both amazing, spacious, comfortable, modern and most importantly affordable!! The living areas and kitchens are just awesome added bonuses. I've also stayed in Planet Hollywoods standard rooms. Their two queen size bedroom is perfect for a group of 4-5 feeling still spacious and comfortable!

Planet Hollywood has a miracle mile filled with lots of shops, Fat Tuesday (a must have when your in Vegas), and an Earl of Sandwich opened 24\/7! What more can you ask for?

Best part of Planet Hollywood is LOCATION! It's right across the street from the Cosmopolitan, and walking distance to Paris and other great hotel and casinos. 

Looking to book a big trip? Split a room in their suites and I guarantee you won't be sorry!

I like the Planet Hollywood alot, its very young and hip. I love the Miracle Mile shops and it's across from the Cosmopolitan and Paris hotel which has great restaurants. I stayed in the PH Tower suite, 2 bedroom, 2 bath, kitchen, living --- a really great suite.

What I didn't like was the front desk service and the pool bar service. Front desk was really slow, and the lady that helped us check in spoke really low, and would not bring up her volume after I told her that I couldn't hear her. 

The pool service was ok, it took us 45 minutes to get our food. I've stayed at several different hotels and it usually takes 25 minutes. I wasn't pleased with the wait and had to check on the food twice. And then when it came out 2 of our hot wing orders were really cold. By the time I realized it, the guy who brought it out was already gone.  

If you don't care about those two things, then you'll be fine staying here.

Here's the thing. The hotel is older. And very confusing for their casino floor. It's not organized where u know where ur going. I have to continuously walk around to find where I'm going. There are better casinos now that are more organized and fun. The women dance on the games at night. I've seen a kid pull out his phone and started video taping the girl dancing. The food is ok but expensive.

We stayed at the the Planet Hollywood for the July 4th weekend, the rooms were not bad, the bathroom was huge. The casino is pretty decent, they have gogo dancers at the BlackJack tables, and from 9pm till midnight there was really awesome cover band playing at the bar. The Spice Market buffet was really good. Also the hotel is walking distance from Caesars, Bellagio, Aria , Paris and other great Casinos and attractions. Great location and the rooms rates were reasonable. 

But that is not the reason this hotel gets a 2 star from me. Our room was on the 7th floor, on the 2nd night we woke up to the sound of fire alarms at 3AM. We rushed out to the corridor and we ran into a lot of sleepy confused people in the hallway, some people were trying to take the elevator to the ground floor... bad idea... we tried to stop them.. but they went anyway. Almost the entire floor rushed down the fire exits to the safety. We  then walked to the checkin counter and alerted the casino staff that the fire alarm just went off... they seemed oblivious to the fact, they did not even know that their hotel fire alarm just went off. We found out the fire alarm was set on the 7th and 8th floor, so there were hotel customers from both floor trying to tell the hotel staff that they need to check it out for fire. The hotel staff at the checkin did not seem to be worried about it. Few people claimed that they saw smoke on the 8th floor, finally one of the cleaning ladies said it might be a false alarm. The hotel staff still did not want to even acknowledge that the alarm was tripped much less there is possibility of a fire! After a while some of us got tired of waiting around for the hotel staff to respond  to our requests and we went back to our rooms. The fire alarm had stopped by the time we got to 7th floor. I think the staff responded in the most irresponsible and negligent manner. I am never going to stay at the hotel again, they have no concern for their customer's safety.

I had my wallet taken during my stay and was in a state of panic this morning when I only had $1 to my name and 2 hrs til my flight. To the awesome gentleman working at the luggage check out front: I didn't catch your name, but the $5 you pulled out of your own pocket changed the course of my luck...right after you gave ne the money, I ran into a couple people taking the same flight home, and all I needed to get to the airport was exactly $5 since we split the cab fare. You saved me from missing my flight. Thank you - it was refreshing to be touched with a stranger's kindness, and I will make sure to find you when I'm back next month.  I've always liked this hotel, but you've officially made me a lifelong fan. Thanks again!

I think whoever got it rated 4 1\/2 stars was smoking crack. We drove in Friday night (Saturday @ 3am). The valet and registration staff was extremely unprofessional. After a long drive, I wanted a pleasant greeting from the valet (he was a dick). The registration staff is also poorly trained. If I wanted a non-smoking room and you can't, then at least listen to what I'm saying and be nice about saying no. They really could care less about you. In some ways, you can't really blame the staff but more the property. I'd be rude and unprofessional too if you had to listen to dance music at full blast for 8 hours a day. I don't know what PH is thinking. Needlessly to say, my experience with most of the staff was negative and they are not definitely 4 1\/2 stars. These clowns need to go visit the Wynn or Palazzo for a lesson in customer service. Planet Hollywood deserve any loss in business for poor service. I will NEVER book with them again.

No valet parking left for hotel guests this night. 
Bathroom floor, sink, comforter mirrors..... all dirty.
Hallway carpeting is dirty and wrinkling.
Bummer.

Do not expect to get what you pay for. We had paid for a King non-smoking room in the newly renovated area. Upon check-in we were notified that we would be getting a King smoking room. We told the lady at the front desk that being in a smoking room would not work so she left us with two options, to stay in another room at an up-charge of +$100 or downgrade to an "non renovated" without any reimbursement. We were told, "just because we reserve a room, doesn't mean that that is the room we will be getting". It's impossible to go elsewhere and expect reasonable rates the day of so you end up being stuck with whatever they say.

The room we were put in was a completely run down. It was obvious that they took furniture from other rooms a left it our room. Holes in the walls, an extra telephone that wasn't connected and a cabinet that was the size of a mini fridge but without a mini fridge. Even bathroom fixtures were falling apart.

I go to Vegas twice a year for work and put all my coworkers in Planet Hollywood but not anymore. Who knows what room they're going to try to stick me in next time. I'd rather pay out the extra money and stay somewhere with better customer service.

Review of 3 night stay in November 2016. Check in was super easy and quick. Our rooms theme was the movie "Mimic". It was cozy and the bed was comfy. No complaints...our room was far enough from the elevator that hallway noise was a non issue. The casino was fun. Starbucks on site...also, planet dailies is great for a quick meal 24\/7.  Will definitely stay here again

The worst experience ever. My friend booked this hotel for her birthday weekend. We arrive, with a reservation of two queen beds and we received one. They holed us up in a ADA room. Basically refused to do anything about it or even apologize for the change. 

No mini fridge
Took over an hour to get a cot
Lots of attitude from the staff and managers
Water wouldn't drain in the tub, so you end up showering in a few inches of water by the time you are done. 

Do not stay here! For what we paid, you should get top notch service and the room you reserved? Right?

I am kind of getting tired of of this place. The casino itself is still pretty great, but the hotel seems to be getting worse and worse. The entertainment center in the rooms have chips, rug coming up and places, wallpaper peeling some, just to list a few things. I'm not really too picky when it comes to stuff like this but it just seems like laziness. I love the location of the hotel because it is pretty central, but the room quality seems to get worse each time I come. 

On the positive side though we stayed in suite with a fountain view and the view was spectacular. The suite is also a lot better then a regular room, very nice tub, the vanities with windows over looking the strip. So it's really too bad, I may look around at other options next time I come because of the decreasing quality.

I've been to Vegas a few times, but never stopped by Planet Hollywood. We had a great time at the shops and I played 3-card poker for a while in the casino. Both of the dealers I had were great and the cocktail service was prompt as well. I would definitely come back!

I am going to start with the good. The hotel room we had was really very nice. The bathtub was beautiful and I enjoyed the cleanliness and plentiful room in the standard double. (I think its called the Hit Room) I was a little confused by the lack of fitted sheets, but the bed was comfortable. 

The bad: I booked this room through the convention and just paid the prices listed without doing any kind of comparison. I have attended several other conventions organized by this company and we have always received the best rates - even in New Orleans and Savannah. It came to our attention that the entire convention was being bowled over and the attendees were being it told a variety of information on why the hotel was so expensive. Whatever. The bottom line is this: if you are planning a convention DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL. There was another convention at the same chain (Caesars) but several other hotels. They were paying $30 - $120 (depending on the day of the week) our convention rates were $140-$189. This is crazy. If this hotel plans on being competitive and retaining guests - this is NOT the way to do it. My next trip will certainly be with another chain in Vegas. 

The convention area is severely outdated and I kept expecting the Red Hat society to pop up at any minute. Did they fund this color scheme??? 

Check in was insane. I pre-checked in since I was coming in so late and was in a hurry. Yet, the key-pickup line was not being attended. The ladies waiting were obviously being ignored, so I just waited in the regular check-in line with everyone else. The attendant didn't explain anything about the hotel, their services, or the casino. No one ever mentioned the Total Rewards program and discounts it provides - so thank you for that hotel staff. Nor did anyone mention Jeff Dunham. (And yes I know he was on the keys and all that - but the days he plays or prices were not brought up) You would think they would be trying to sell the tickets to the show, but apparently not or maybe the clerk did not have the ability to multi-task. 

To sum it up - I would not book this hotel if returning.

Planet Hollywood as a hotel is pretty 3-star average, but compared to some of the other average hotels like Treasure Island, I think PH has a slight edge. The rooms themselves are pretty standard. They're clean and nothing fancy, but personally I don't need anything more than a decent place to sleep when I'm in Vegas.

+ Centrally located
+ Affordable rooms
+ EARLS SANDWICHES
+ Lots of other good food options like Lobster Me and Burgr
+ Miracle Mile shops
+\/- Spice Market buffet is just okay

Las Vegas... I've lost count on how many times I have been here. I usually visit every other month, and I am by no means a "high roller".  I do use the casino's "players card" when I do gamble and get plenty of free stuff.  For this visit, I was invited to stay for the weekend at Planet Hollywood, and also got a $150 shopping credit at Gucci.  How can I pass that up?

I've stayed at most of the other Caesar's Entertainment properties except for Planet Hollywood and the Cromwell.  Now, I can check that off my list.  The parking entrance is located off Harmon, not off Las Vegas Boulevard. From there, you can select parking for the Miracle Mile, self parking or the valet. Parking is no longer free, unless you are a platinum card holder or higher.  Fortunately I am platinum, and I get help by using the Total Rewards credit card to qualify.

My free room was originally on the 7th floor, overlooking the pool.  I asked to be placed in a higher floor due to the pool noise, and thankfully I was moved. Even on the 22nd floor, the noise of the thumpa-thumpa music reached up to my room. The room was nicer than I anticipated, quite spacious and had a desk area, a table, and a chaise lounge. Unfortunately, there's no mini bar but they do give you an empty fridge to store whatever drinks you want from downstairs.  They also provide a coffee maker and an ice bucket.

The bathroom was nice and spacious, and even reminded me of the Cosmopolitan. We had a deep sunken bathtub, a walk in shower, and 2 sinks... not side by side but across from each other, giving us plenty of personal space.

The view wasn't bad, and overlooked the pools from our hotel and I could also see the Cosmopolitan hotel's pool.  Not bad for "free".  I can't find anything really bad to say about this stay at Planet Hollywood.  On Saturday, the valet was slammed and I had to wait to drop off my car, but that's not their fault. Overall, a great stay and I would stay here again.

In Vegas where your room should only be utilized to sleep and get ready. There isn't an official center of the strip but this hotel is near all the action. No need to get far to get into some shenanigans. Clean, HUGE rooms for a great price. We had a view looking at suburban Las Vegas but, like I said, the room shouldn't be frequented much. The walk from the parking lot to the room was a little long as we have to walk through the shopping area. Overall great experience.

I visited Vegas with a friend for a quick two-night trip to see Eddie Vedder at the Pearl (cancelled, boooo!), and decided on Planet Hollywood because of its placement on the Strip, affordability through an Expedia package, and lack of ridiculous additional fees. 

When we arrived, I pulled the $20 routine and mentioned that I was celebrating my birthday, and the clerk very generously upgraded us to a beautiful suite. High floor, fountain view, air hockey table, wet bar, tub that fit two people...yeah. Quite a way to start the trip! Throughout our stay, we encountered nothing but friendly staff. 

Unfortunately the weather took a turn for the cold, so we didn't spend much time by the pool. From what I could see, there weren't too many children running around, which is always a bonus. Neither of us are betting women, so I can't comment on the casino itself (except that I missed Chicago's smoking ban), but we enjoyed Spice Market and Yolo's. 

We had a very "basic" stay at PH, so take from this review what you will. Based on what I experienced, I would absolutely give it a second visit, especially on a moderate budget.

Didn't get a chance to stay here, only gambled.

It looks like PH, is trying to be the "Palms" on the strip.  I was here not too long ago when it was the Aladdin and it sucked, big time.

Now, PH is a hip and trendy place with great vibes.  The entire casino floor looks like a trendy club.  Looks like the rooms are half done.  If you can help it, ask for a renovated PH room because the old Aladdin room....SUCKED.  

At least stop by and walk thru the casino floor.  Just a great place to chill and deposit your money into the city's expansion fund.

Moderately priced room and it's location is in the center of all the activities in Vegas, which is usually the reason why I come here. 

Wi-fi and fitness center is all part of the "resort tax" thing you get charged with when you check-in. 

My room was pretty huge, bathroom pretty decent with a big tv too. My room had the Batman theme so it had a lot of the Batman movie paraphernalia.

Non smoking hotel room reeked of smoking.
Cars weren't allowed to go and were blocked from driving to valet parking unless paid extra as diamond guests. We had to carry out bags to the room all across from the free parking to the mall to the casino to the registration to the rooms. This was around 2 miles. 

The room doesn't have a coffee machine or a fridge. A completely shit hotel. There were no drinking glasses in the room so I ordered a pair of glasses. They didn't send us any. I cancelled it. The air conditioning vents were sending cigarette smoke to the room.

Good points : mall, right on the strip, room had a spectacular view of the strip. Everything is close by.

Decent casino hotel that's smack dab in the middle of all the Vegas strip action. It's right between MGM and Bally's\/Paris, across from Bellagio, and short walking distance to Caesar's and New York New York.  It used to be the Aladdin but had its named changed to Planet Hollywood about 1 month ago.

Have not been inside the Aladdin in years since it was such a HO HUM and BORING casino and mall but I like the changes they have done to the place since it became Planet Hollywood (PH). PH is now a lot more happening, has more of a hip vibe and sound, and seems to be attracting more young people.

Good points: 
- got a free upgrade to one of their suite rooms - was too low to get a good view of the Strip but got a good view of the pool. Had a bathtub overlooking the pool with tv in the bathroom too along with a regular shower. Two sinks.
- conveniently attached to the mall with a lot of stores and restaurants
- now a Starwood hotel so you can get points 
- service was extremely attentive: (a) when there was a long line to check out, a PH lady came by to take out names and rooms down and she said she'd handle the checkout for us, (b) I asked for help to check in online for me and the guy was super nice and did it for me
- main taxi entrance is towards the back\/side roads so easier to take the side roads to the airport and to the other casinos while avoiding Las Vegas Blvd traffic.
- prices seem a bit lower than other casinos right now due to the transition

Not so good points:
- pool area was very boring. Basically two rectugular pools on top of some of the PH buildings on the 6th floor. Decor was definitely lacking.
- the suite we were was big and pretty cool but strangely angular
- lots of construction happening all around PH as a part of its facelift and the new PH condos around it
- still a lot of remant middle eastern themed items\/decorations around at this point from the Aladdin days so they may seem out of place.

Bottom line: So glad they are giving the Aladdin a new face and attitude. The PH is a decent place to stay with friendly service. Lots of changes and construction happening but conveniently located. If a cool pool is important to you, this is not the place to go.
Pretty nice place and in my opinion it has one of the best poker room.

First the parking was really confusing and ridiculous. They MADE us pay for Internet even though we were not going to use it. And since when did rooms not come with a fridge?! I'll stay somewhere else next time!

Recently stayed here and really enjoyed it. We stayed in the bolevard suite and it was pimp. Pool table in the room, lots of tvs and couches for people to crash. One thing that was somewhat dissapointing though was that with as big a room as it is there was not that many windows or big windows so you could really appreciate the views. 

The room was clean and the cleanup crew did a great job, however we had a couple issues with the TV's. Apparently they were switching to HD recievers and some of the remotes did not work. We had to call down a number of times before someone finally came up and switched boxes out for us. 

I was very skeptical about the pool after reading some reviews but we hung out there all weekend and had a great time. The DJ at the 21 and over pool was legit, the bikini contest was hot and everyone there just wanted to have fun and party. Its not the best pool party around and there isnt much to the pool itself but if you have a solid group of people that want to have fun then you will. if you are looking for all this extra shit then maybe its not for you.  

Overall we had a great time, lots of young people looking to have a good time at this place, the suite was nice, the bars in the hotel (heartbar) were fun and the overall atmosphere was great.

Planet Hollywood is located in the perfect spot on the strip. Right in the middle. Many of the rooms have a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Rooms are all very nice and very clean. The casino floor is trendy and the layout is a little confusing at times, especially after a few drinks. But its always fun here, a little louder in here than other casinos. They have the "Pleasure Pit" with gogo dancers behind the dealers, huge distraction. Hard to take your eyes off them. Most of the dealers are a distraction also, dressed in revealing outfits. Its very nice to look at but for a weaker man it can be your path to destruction when gambling

You know, I'm not too picky about staying in nice fancy shmancy hotels cause I figure, I just need a place to sleep and get ready. I found a really good deal here, buy one get the second night half off.

So I came here for my birthday weekend and they bumped me up to a resort room from a standard without my asking. That gives it a star in itself. 

The bathroom in the room we stayed at was HELLA nasty and the shower was clogged. I. Was. Pissed. Let me tell you, the clogged shower flooded in our bathrooms and our straightner cords were plugged in. We called and told them to come in and hour and fix it, which they did. I later realized that our bathtub (my friend decided to take a "shower bath" because of our flooded bathroom) was also clogged. 

Enough with the rant. Also, my friend was drunk the night before and we were staying at The Jockey Club and I went over to the bartender to ask for some water, and he was really nice about it and told us they called for help. Which was very nice cause Craig (so cute, and he also got a star himself -- ha) helped my friend get to a cab.

Overall, it was a mediocre hotel, good location, comfy beds and comforter, lots of mirrors for us girls to get ready (however not enough plug outlets), and hip decorations.

I had made a reservation to stay at Planet Hollywood last year.  No charges were made to the room as I'm very careful about my spending.  I paid the normal fees at checkout.  89 days later I received charges to restaurants I have never visited and room service I have never ordered.  This amounted to over $300 on 6 different charges.  I made a phone call to Planet Hollywood and they said that they can charge me since it is within the 90 days and that I signed an agreement at checkout. Disputes were made through American Express but to no avail.  It is very curious that charges were made to me 1 day before the expiration.  In the future, I will stay away from Planet Hollywood or its other casinos.

Hmm, to be fair I'm not a big fan of the whole trendy Hollywood theme so given that I would have rather stayed at Paris or the Venetian but anyway, regardless, the hotel was okay.  The Miracle Mile shops were nearby which offered many restaurant options aside from the traditional cafe and the two upscale variety restaurants to eat at typical resorts so those options were good.  It was pretty clean, the beds were comfortable.  The rooms were a bit small but the bathrooms were bigger and you get a tub as well as a shower (for some odd reason).  All I can say is you like Hollywood-esque modern or you are looking for a decent price for a strip hotel, you could do worse.  It wasn't bad.

All in all this is just another HUGE Vegas hotel. It is nice because it is SPG and you earn points and all that good stuff. The staff is friendly and help full. I have been upgraded the 3 times I have stayed there so that's a plus as well. Its a great value and often has  great promotions

First time actually staying here ...

+1 for getting an upgrade to the panorama suite SO AWESOME - view of the strip and bellagio water show
+1 for the service being fairly nice -- except for one guy working at the platinum check-in desk. 
+1 for having a lively casino area -- music, dancers, young crowd
+\/-1 for the movie themes in each room. Kind of scary because they have the actual costumes that the actors wore in cases around the room. We had hamlet, moulin rouge, and grease. The hamlet one we had to cover with a bed sheet. 
-1 for the people who try to promote the club at ph "open bar till 4am for $20" --- yeah as long as you hold your pink cup. We didn't go but thanks to fellow yelpers we were saved from being tricked. 

Definitely stay here again. I've stayed at the Venetian in the past -- it's cool but this place is geared towards a younger demographic.

Planet Hollywood aka PH is a great location on the strip.

It's open, but still got a lot of work to do.

The lobby is beautiful, but understated... I'm a big fan of all the crystal chandeliers.

The renovation of the casino was well thought out.  Card tables, roulette, lounges, etc. gives a great vibe.  Color scheme is on the masculine side, but the bling bling really makes up for it.  (Hey, it's Vegas, what do you expect?)

The Spice Market Buffet... the reason why I'm yelping... is the epitome of Vegas buffets.  It's really priced well.  There's many selections to choose from.  Every item cooked to perfection.  Servers and staff are quick to respond.  My favorite entree was the cook-to-order crepes.  Because of this place, we'll always go to PH when we visit.  

Next time, we'll try to stay on property... hopefully the renovation is complete by then... and maybe the rating will be a 5???

We had a convention at the hotel and everyone was complaining (dark rooms, dirty rooms, bad layout, hard to get around etc ) but not me...stayed somewhere else!   I have been to a few conventions in Las Vegas - This isn't my favorite venue, nor in my Top 10 of hotels - It's OK. 3 Stars!

- Was able to get a package deal from NorthEast to Vegas across the street for $20 more than conv rate (Im glad I did)

Stayed here for three nights. One of the better rooms we've had on the strip. It's a well kept and nice hotel. The only drawback is the cable\/satellite cots in and out quite frequently which is annoying.

Didn't actually stay at this hotel for my most recent visit to Vegas but I found that I kept going back to visit it. There is so much to do inside of this hotel. Great places to eat, shop, drink and just hang out. There is a mixed crowd of people all over! The workers are super friendly and the hotel is just a great place to look at! I will be staying here next time!!

Christmas Weekend for a local resident who could choose any property to stay and this was our pick.  BAD CHOICE.  1.  45 minute wait to check in with only 3 working the desk.  No apology, just a sorry its busy and most of our help called in.  Like they didn't know how many reservations were on the books.  2.  Dropping $1500 in 36 hours on video poker, and didn't even get one 4 of a kind.   OMG.  3.  I left my $49 memory foam pillow and cell charger in the room.  Since I am local I could run down and pick it up.  I would know if I didn't take my pillow home with me.  After 15 minutes on hold I get to Lost and Found.  They don't have it.  They send me to housekeeping where I wait another 15 minutes on hold and they say why did they even transfer me there.  That Lost and Found should have offered a security report which they did not.  And I get offered to be transferred back.  After a long wait time I hung up.
5.  Long wait times for the buffet (1.5 hours quoted) for a $35.99 buffet.  6.  only 2 bath towels for 2 people, are you kidding?  7.  No exhaust fans in the bathroom?  8.  Shower so tiny with a shower head that is not movable.... cant escape the water to even shave your legs.  The little things that make a stay "uncomfortable".  

So slow service, huge costs, tightest machines on the strip, and the housekeeping keeps my forgotten items and it appears no one there really does care.  Why?  Cause another plane is landing with more out of town guests unaware they selected the wrong place!  Take it from a local, dont book here!

Now called Elara. 

I love this hotel by far. I been to probably all the other popular hotels on the strip and by far the best place to host a Vegas trip with 10+ people. 

You got to get the two bedroom suites. It's so spacious! Two queen beds, pull out bed, and chairs where you can sleep. It seriously can fit 10+ people comfortably. 

I love the projector they have and the big speaker we use to blast our music. 

Location is money as well. Easy cabbing\/limo access and close to every popular club. 

Parking is so close to hotel entrance and is free. 

I don't like how they strict on hotel keys, but they give out unlimited amounts anyways. Before they were not strict, but now it's one hotel key for a group of 4 people. 

I will definitely be back and probably booking this place for Halloween!

I recently stayed at Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino in Las Vegas. (April 2015)

The hotel is located in the heart of The Strip, so it's convenient and easy to get around and find things to do.

For the most part, i had a nice stay.  Housekeeping does a good job of cleaning everything.  I personally witnessed 2 women clean up a suite left behind by a group of young gents --- the mess was Gi-normous --- they went to work and after a couple of hours it looked like new.   

My one challenge with this hotel was the pool and it's surrounding areas.   The pool chairs were significantly old & dirty and the pool felt like a bucket of ice cold water that never got warm.  There was a sectioned off section of the pool deck with beautiful, brand new chairs but no one seemed to know how to get into that section.
